    for (const record_ind in queryResponse.records) {
      const record = queryResponse.records[record_ind];
      resultContainer.nodes.push(record.get(0));
    }
    return resultContainer;
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  }
}

export default {
  networkNodesQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/network/portfolio.js

// network/portfolio.js
//
// given a network ID, retrieve info about
// other properties which may be owned in full or in part by the same
// real-estate ownership networks.

// string representing a cyper query template.
//
// network_id should be passed in as a parameter
// 'network_id'.

const query = `

WITH $network_id AS network_id

// ---- get the related parcels in the network
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel:A_Parcel)
WHERE portfolio_parcel.network_id = network_id

// get the owner mailing address
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[:PARC_OWNER_ADDR_AT]-(mailing_addr:Address_Unit)

// get the parcel owners
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)--(owner:A_Parcel_Owner)
OPTIONAL MATCH (owner)-[:BE_LINKED_TO]-(be_owner)

// gather the owners
WITH DISTINCT portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owner, COLLECT({
    owner_name: owner.ownr_owner_name,
    linked_be: CASE WHEN be_owner IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
        __typename: LABELS(be_owner)[0],
        network_id: be_owner.network_id
    } END
}) AS owners

// gather the Ellis Act evictions to create an eviction count (based on units in the building)
// when there is a unit count on the property, use the # of units as the eviction count
// otherwise, assume a unit count of 1
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)--(eviction:RB_Eviction)
WHERE TOUPPER(eviction.type) = "ELLIS ACT WITHDRAWAL"
WITH DISTINCT portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, eviction, CASE WHEN portfolio_parcel.units IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.units) END AS ellis_unit_count
// since we have used an optional match, if no eviction was found then do not count
WITH DISTINCT portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, eviction, CASE WHEN eviction IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE ellis_unit_count END AS ellis_unit_count
WITH DISTINCT portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, SUM(ellis_unit_count) AS ellis_evicts

// gather the non-Ellis Act evictions to create an eviction count (based on # of filings)
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)--(eviction:RB_Eviction)
WHERE TOUPPER(eviction.type) <> "ELLIS ACT WITHDRAWAL"

// sum the unit-based Ellis eviction total and the filing-based non-Ellis eviction total
WITH DISTINCT portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, CASE WHEN eviction IS NULL THEN ellis_evicts ELSE COUNT(DISTINCT eviction) + ellis_evicts END AS num_evictions

// look up the main address to display 
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[{ source: "ASSESSOR"}]-(assess_addr:Parcel_Address) // first try to look up the parcel address from assessor
WITH DISTINCT portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, num_evictions, CASE WHEN NOT assess_addr IS NULL THEN assess_addr.addr ELSE NULL END AS assessor_addr 

OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[{ source: "EAS"}]-(alt_addr:Parcel_Address) // look up an alternate address in case there is none
WITH DISTINCT portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, num_evictions, assessor_addr, CASE WHEN NOT alt_addr IS NULL THEN COLLECT(alt_addr)[0].addr ELSE NULL END AS alt_addr 

// use assessor address if present, otherwise alternative address
WITH DISTINCT portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, num_evictions, CASE WHEN assessor_addr IS NULL THEN alt_addr ELSE assessor_addr END AS display_addr 

// compile everything together for the related parcels
RETURN CASE WHEN portfolio_parcel IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT({
    addr: display_addr,
    owner_mailing_addr: mailing_addr.addr_readable,
    block_lot: portfolio_parcel.block_lot,
    num_evictions: num_evictions,
    units: TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.units),
    lat: TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.lat),
    long: TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.long),
    neighborhood: portfolio_parcel.neighborhood,
    owners: owners
}) END`;

// the input parameter is the network_id for the network
export async function networkPortfolioQueryHandler(app, network_id) {
  if (!Number.isInteger(network_id) || (network_id <= 0)) {
    throw "network_id: bad name, expected integer > 0, got type: " +
        typeof network_id;
  }
    
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    const result = await session.run(query, { network_id: network_id });
    return (result.records[0] || []).get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  }
}

export default {
  networkPortfolioQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/network/relatedNetworks.js

// network/relatedNetworks.js

import adj_network_query from '../util_queries/adjNetwork';

const start_query = `
    WITH $network_id AS network_id
`;

const lp_start = `MATCH (this:SOS_LP)
WHERE this.name_norm = $be_name
WITH this, this.network_id AS network_id
`;

const parc_start = `MATCH (this:A_Parcel)
WHERE this.block_lot = $block_lot
WITH this, this.network_id AS network_id
`;

export async function networkRelatedNetworksQueryHandler(app, network_id) {
  if (!Number.isInteger(network_id) || (network_id <= 0)) {
    throw "network_id: bad name, expected integer > 0, got type: " +
        typeof network_id;
  }

  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    const result = await session.run(start_query + adj_network_query, { network_id });
    return result.records[0].get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

export default {
  networkRelatedNetworksQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/owner/details.js

// owner/details.js

const corp_query = `OPTIONAL MATCH (this:SOS_Corp)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string

OPTIONAL MATCH (this)--(addr:Address_Unit)

// create section for all office addresses listed for business
WITH this, CASE WHEN addr IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT(addr.addr_readable) END AS s_office_addresses

// create section for all fields either unique to corporations
// or whose values have a particular semantic meaning for corporations only
WITH this, s_office_addresses, {
          __typename: LABELS(this)[0],
          status: this.corporation_status,
          corporation_type: this.corporation_type,
          corporation_tax_base: this.corporation_tax_base,
          ftb_suspension_status: this.ftb_suspension_status,
          corporation_classification: this.corporation_classification,
          corporation_number: this.corporation_number
    } AS s_corp_details

RETURN {
    creation_date: this.incorporation_date,
    name: this.corporation_name,
    network_id: this.network_id,
    be_specific_details: s_corp_details,
    office_addresses: s_office_addresses
}
`;

const lp_query = `MATCH (this:SOS_LP)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string

OPTIONAL MATCH (this)--(addr:Address_Unit)

// create section for all office addresses listed for business
WITH this, CASE WHEN addr IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT(addr.addr_readable) END AS s_office_addresses

// create section for all fields either unique to LP/LLCs
// or whose values have a particular semantic meaning for LP/LLCs only
WITH this, s_office_addresses, {
        __typename: LABELS(this)[0],
        status: this.status,
        llc_management_code: this.llc_management_code,
        llc_type_of_business: this.llc_type_of_business,
        jurisdiction: this.jurisdiction
    } AS s_lp_details

RETURN {
    creation_date: this.file_date,
    name: this.name,
    network_id: this.network_id,
    be_specific_details: s_lp_details,
    office_addresses: s_office_addresses
}
`;

export async function ownerDetailsQueryHandler(app, be_type, search_string) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    let query;
    if (be_type === "corp") {
      query = corp_query;
    } else if (be_type === "lp") {
      query = lp_query;
    }

    const result = await session.run(query, { search_string: search_string});
    return result.records[0].get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

export default {
  ownerDetailsQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/owner/evictions.js

// owner/evictions.js

const corp_start = `MATCH (this:SOS_Corp)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string
`;

const lp_start = `MATCH (this:SOS_LP)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string
`;

// for each eviction matched to this business, need to:
//    - collect all other evictors that have been matched to eviction
//    - identify exactly one parcel we can display for the eviction, and the number of additional properties

const be_query = `
// identify the evictor from sales transfer data
OPTIONAL MATCH (be)-[:BE_LINKED_TO]-(evictor:RB_Evictor)-[rel_evictor:EVICTED_BY]-(eviction)
WHERE be.network_id = this.network_id AND rel_evictor.evictor_origin = "SALES_TRANSFER"

// identify additional evictors associated with eviction petition
OPTIONAL MATCH (extra_evictor:RB_Evictor)-[rel_extra_evictor:EVICTED_BY]-(eviction)
WHERE rel_extra_evictor.evictor_origin <> "SALES_TRANSFER"

WITH be, eviction, evictor, CASE WHEN extra_evictor IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT({
  evictor_name: extra_evictor.evictor,
  source: rel_extra_evictor.evictor_origin
}) END AS extra_evictors

// count all parcels linked to eviction and pick one to display
// Note: as of 3/31/21 DB, all evictions are guaranteed to have at least one parcel assigned,
// so num_other_parc will always be non-negative. Need to adjust this if that changes

OPTIONAL MATCH (eviction)-[:EVICTION_AT]-(parc:A_Parcel) // match for all parcels
WITH be, evictor, eviction, extra_evictors, COUNT(parc) - 1 AS num_other_parc, COLLECT(parc)[0] AS display_parc

OPTIONAL MATCH (eviction)-[rel_eviction:EVICTION_AT]-(display_parc) // get the relation for just the display parcel

// look up the main address to display 
OPTIONAL MATCH (display_parc)-[{ source: "ASSESSOR"}]-(assess_addr:Parcel_Address) // first try to look up the parcel address from assessor
WITH DISTINCT be, evictor, eviction, extra_evictors, num_other_parc, rel_eviction, display_parc, CASE WHEN NOT assess_addr IS NULL THEN assess_addr.addr ELSE NULL END AS assessor_addr 

OPTIONAL MATCH (display_parc)-[{ source: "EAS"}]-(alt_addr:Parcel_Address) // look up an alternate address in case there is none
WITH DISTINCT be, evictor, eviction, extra_evictors, num_other_parc, rel_eviction, display_parc, assessor_addr, CASE WHEN NOT alt_addr IS NULL THEN COLLECT(alt_addr)[0].addr ELSE NULL END AS alt_addr 

// use assessor address if present, otherwise alternative address
WITH DISTINCT be, evictor, eviction, extra_evictors, num_other_parc, rel_eviction, display_parc, CASE WHEN assessor_addr IS NULL THEN alt_addr ELSE assessor_addr END AS display_addr 

RETURN CASE WHEN eviction IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT({
    evict_id: eviction.evict_id,
    evict_date: eviction.evict_date,
    evict_addr_orig: eviction.addr_orig,
    type: eviction.type,
    location: {
      units: TOFLOAT(display_parc.units),
      lat: TOFLOAT(display_parc.lat),
      long: TOFLOAT(display_parc.long),
      addr: display_addr,
      block_lot: display_parc.block_lot,
      neighborhood: display_parc.neighborhood,
      num_other_parc: num_other_parc      
    },
    match_quality: {
      did_subdivision_occur: rel_eviction.eviction_type,
      addr_match_method: rel_eviction.addr_match_type
    },
    primary_evictor: {
      name: evictor.evictor,
      linked_be: {
          __typename: LABELS(be)[0],
          network_id: be.network_id
      }
    },
    extra_evictors: extra_evictors
}) END`;


export async function ownerEvictionsQueryHandler(app, be_type, search_string) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    let query;
    if (be_type === "corp") {
      query = corp_start + be_query;
    } else if (be_type === "lp") {
      query = lp_start + be_query;
    }

    const result = await session.run(query, { search_string: search_string});
    return result.records[0].get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

export default {
  ownerEvictionsQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/owner/networkDetails.js

// owner/networkDetails.js

const corp_start = `MATCH (this:SOS_Corp)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string
`;

const lp_start = `MATCH (this:SOS_LP)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string
`;

const details_query = `
WITH this.network_id AS network_id

// get total BEs
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_LP) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS num_lp
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_Corp) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS num_corp, num_lp
WITH network_id, num_corp + num_lp AS total_bes

// get most connected BEs
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_LP) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, total_bes, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT(n) END AS be_list
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_Corp) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, total_bes, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN be_list ELSE COLLECT(n) + be_list END AS be_list

UNWIND (CASE be_list WHEN [] THEN [NULL] ELSE be_list END) AS n
WITH network_id, total_bes, n, SIZE(()--(n)) AS degree
WITH network_id, total_bes, n ORDER BY degree DESC LIMIT 1
WITH network_id, total_bes, COLLECT({name_norm: n.name_norm, __typename: LABELS(n)[0]})[0] AS top_be 

// get most connected owners
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_Owner) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, n, SIZE(()--(n)) AS degree
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, n ORDER BY degree DESC LIMIT 1
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS total_owners, COLLECT({name_norm: n.name_norm})[0] AS top_owner 

OPTIONAL MATCH (n:Address_Unit) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, total_owners, top_owner, n, SIZE(()--(n)) AS degree
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, total_owners, top_owner, n ORDER BY degree DESC LIMIT 1
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, total_owners, top_owner, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS total_addrs, COLLECT({
  addr_readable: n.addr_readable,
  is_business: CASE WHEN EXISTS((n)-[:LISTED_AT]-()) THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END,
  is_property_owner: CASE WHEN EXISTS((n)--(:A_Parcel)) THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END
})[0] AS top_addr

RETURN {
  total_bes: total_bes,
  total_addrs: total_addrs,
  total_owners: total_owners,
  top_be: CASE WHEN top_be.name_norm IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE top_be END,
  top_owner: CASE WHEN top_owner.name_norm IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE top_owner END,
  top_addr: CASE WHEN top_addr.addr_readable IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE top_addr END
}`;

export async function ownerNetworkDetailsQueryHandler(app, be_type, search_string) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();

  let query;
  if (be_type === "corp") {
    query = corp_start + details_query;
  } else if (be_type === "lp") {
    query = lp_start + details_query;
  }

  try {
    const result = await session.run(query, { be_type, search_string });
    return result.records[0].get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

export default {
  ownerNetworkDetailsQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/owner/portfolio.js

// owner/portfolio.js

const corp_start = `MATCH (this:SOS_Corp)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string
`;

const lp_start = `MATCH (this:SOS_LP)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string
`;

const be_query = `

// ------------- CREATE PROPERTY PORTFOLIO FOR BUSINESS NETWORK ----------------

// get the parcels directly owned
OPTIONAL MATCH (this)--(:A_Parcel_Owner)-[:PARC_OWNED_BY]-(owned_parcel)
// get the parcels that are part of the "network" or portfolio
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel:A_Parcel)
WHERE portfolio_parcel.network_id = this.network_id

// combine the directly owned and the network parcels
WITH this, COLLECT(owned_parcel) + COLLECT(portfolio_parcel) AS full_portfolio_parcels

// if we have found no parcels, use null value for parcel
WITH this, CASE WHEN SIZE(full_portfolio_parcels) = 0 THEN [NULL] ELSE full_portfolio_parcels END AS full_portfolio_parcels

UNWIND full_portfolio_parcels AS portfolio_parcel
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel

// gather the property owners for each property in portfolio
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[:PARC_OWNED_BY]-(owner)
OPTIONAL MATCH (owner)-[:BE_LINKED_TO]-(be_owner)

// look-up whether each owner is a business
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, COLLECT({
    owner_name: owner.ownr_owner_name,
    linked_be: CASE WHEN be_owner IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
        __typename: LABELS(be_owner)[0],
        network_id: be_owner.network_id
    } END
}) AS owners

// gather the Ellis Act evictions to create an eviction count (based on units in the building)
// when there is a unit count on the property, use the # of units as the eviction count
// otherwise, assume a unit count of 1
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)--(eviction:RB_Eviction)
WHERE TOUPPER(eviction.type) = "ELLIS ACT WITHDRAWAL"
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, owners, eviction, CASE WHEN portfolio_parcel.units IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.units) END AS ellis_unit_count
// since we have used an optional match, if no eviction was found then do not count
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, owners, eviction, CASE WHEN eviction IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE ellis_unit_count END AS ellis_unit_count
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, owners, SUM(ellis_unit_count) AS ellis_evicts

// gather the non-Ellis Act evictions to create an eviction count (based on # of filings)
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)--(eviction:RB_Eviction)
WHERE TOUPPER(eviction.type) <> "ELLIS ACT WITHDRAWAL"

// sum the unit-based Ellis eviction total and the filing-based non-Ellis eviction total
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, owners, CASE WHEN eviction IS NULL THEN ellis_evicts ELSE COUNT(DISTINCT eviction) + ellis_evicts END AS num_evictions

// get the property owner mailing address for the property
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[:PARC_OWNER_ADDR_AT]-(mailing_addr_unit)

// look up the main address to display 
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[{ source: "ASSESSOR"}]-(assess_addr:Parcel_Address) // first try to look up the parcel address from assessor
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, owners, num_evictions, mailing_addr_unit, CASE WHEN NOT assess_addr IS NULL THEN assess_addr.addr ELSE NULL END AS assessor_addr 

OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[{ source: "EAS"}]-(alt_addr:Parcel_Address) // look up an alternate address in case there is none
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, owners, num_evictions, mailing_addr_unit, assessor_addr, CASE WHEN NOT alt_addr IS NULL THEN COLLECT(alt_addr)[0].addr ELSE NULL END AS alt_addr 

// use assessor address if present, otherwise alternative address
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, owners, num_evictions, mailing_addr_unit, CASE WHEN assessor_addr IS NULL THEN alt_addr ELSE assessor_addr END AS display_addr 

// compile everything together for the related parcels
WITH DISTINCT this, CASE WHEN portfolio_parcel IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
    addr: display_addr,
    block_lot: portfolio_parcel.block_lot,
    num_evictions: num_evictions,
    units: TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.units),
    lat: TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.lat),
    long: TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.long),
    neighborhood: portfolio_parcel.neighborhood,
    owners: owners,
    mailing_address: mailing_addr_unit.addr_readable
} END AS parc_info
WITH DISTINCT this, COLLECT( parc_info) AS s_property_portfolio

RETURN {
    property_portfolio: s_property_portfolio
}`;


export async function ownerPortfolioQueryHandler(app, be_type, search_string) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    let query;
    if (be_type === "corp") {
      query = corp_start + be_query;
    } else if (be_type === "lp") {
      query = lp_start + be_query;
    }

    const result = await session.run(query, { search_string: search_string});
    return result.records[0].get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

export default {
  ownerPortfolioQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/owner/relatedNetworks.js

// owner/relatedNetworks.js

import adj_network_query from '../util_queries/adjNetwork';

const corp_start = `MATCH (this:SOS_Corp)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string
WITH this, this.network_id AS network_id
`;

const lp_start = `MATCH (this:SOS_LP)
WHERE this.name_norm = $search_string
WITH this, this.network_id AS network_id
`;

export async function ownerRelatedNetworksQueryHandler(app, be_type, search_string) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    let query;
    if (be_type === "corp") {
      query = corp_start + adj_network_query;
    } else if (be_type === "lp") {
      query = lp_start + adj_network_query;
    }

    const result = await session.run(query, { search_string: search_string});
    return result.records[0].get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

export default {
  ownerRelatedNetworksQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/parcel/details.js

// parcel/details.js
//
// primary-key lookup for basic info on a parcel.
//
// this query drives the 'api/parcel/<BLOCK_LOT>/details' route.

// string representing a cyper query template.
//
// block_lot (parcel primary key) should be passed in as a parameter
// 'search_string'.
//
// query result obj is parseable as a SFAssessorParcelDetailsQueryResult
// message. for context see proto/query/parcel.proto
const query = `

MATCH (this:A_Parcel)
WHERE this.block_lot = $search_string

OPTIONAL MATCH (this)-[{ source: "ASSESSOR"}]-(assess_addr:Parcel_Address) // first try to look up the parcel address from assessor
WITH DISTINCT this, CASE WHEN NOT assess_addr IS NULL THEN assess_addr ELSE NULL END AS display_addr 

OPTIONAL MATCH (this)-[{ source: "EAS"}]-(alt_addr:Parcel_Address) // look up an alternate address in case there is none
WITH DISTINCT this, CASE WHEN NOT alt_addr IS NULL THEN COLLECT(alt_addr)[0] ELSE display_addr END AS display_addr 

OPTIONAL MATCH (this)--(addr_var:Parcel_Address) // look up list of alternative addresses
WHERE ID(addr_var) <> ID(display_addr) OR display_addr IS NULL // to handle case when there's no address

WITH this, display_addr, COUNT(addr_var) AS tot_alt_addrs, COLLECT(addr_var.addr)[..$max_alt_addrs] AS alt_addr_list
WITH this, display_addr, alt_addr_list, tot_alt_addrs - SIZE(alt_addr_list) AS num_extra_addrs

RETURN {
    parcel_details: {
      yr_built: TOFLOAT(this.yr_built),
      addr_details: {
        main_addr: CASE WHEN display_addr IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE display_addr.addr END,
        addr_variations: alt_addr_list,
        num_extra_addr_variations: num_extra_addrs
      },
      block_lot: this.block_lot,
      lat: TOFLOAT(this.lat),
      long: TOFLOAT(this.long),
      neighborhood: this.neighborhood,
      rent_controlled: TOFLOAT(this.rent_controlled),
      prop_class_code: this.prop_class_code,
      zone: this.zone,
      stories: TOFLOAT(this.stories),
      units: TOFLOAT(this.units),
      rooms: TOFLOAT(this.rooms),
      beds: TOFLOAT(this.beds),
      assess_land_val: TOFLOAT(this.assess_land_val),
      assess_imp_val: TOFLOAT(this.assess_imp_val),
      assess_val_date: this.assess_val_date,
      update_date: this.update_date,
      curr_sales_price: TOFLOAT(this.curr_sales_price),
      curr_sales_date: this.curr_sales_date,
      network_id: this.network_id
    }
}`;

// caution!!!! this file started as a copy-paste from the main parcel query
// (which used to be in parcel.js, but is now in parcel/legacy.js). see
// comments in that file for background.
//
// IMPORTANT: if you make any changes to this file, make them in legacy.js as
// well! this will help us avoid difficult-to-track-down bugs.
//
// TODO: deprecate this file to remove duplicate code.
//
// the input parameters are:
//     - the parcel's block_lot, which serves as a primary key
//       for sf parcel nodes in the datastore. must be a string.
//     - the maximum number of address variations to display (defaults to 5)

// TODO: decide whether to add max_alt_addrs as a route parameter

export async function parcelDetailsQueryHandler(app, block_lot, max_alt_addrs = 5) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    const result = await session.run(query, { search_string: block_lot, max_alt_addrs: max_alt_addrs });
    return (result.records[0] || []).get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  }
}

export default {
  parcelDetailsQueryHandler
};

server/rest/handlers/query/parcel/evictions.js

// parcel/evictions.js
//
// given a primary key for a parcel, retreive info about evictions which have
// occurred at the property on this parcel.
//
// this query drives the 'api/parcel/<BLOCK_LOT>/evictions' route.

// string representing a cyper query template.
//
// block_lot (parcel primary key) should be passed in as a parameter
// 'search_string'.
//
// query result obj is parseable as a SFAssessorParcelEvictionsQueryResult
// message. see type_definitions/proto/query/parcel.proto for context.

// for each eviction matched to this parcel, need to:
//    - identify the evictor associated through sales transfer
//    - all additional evictors that have been matched to eviction
//    - handle case when there is no associated evictor
//    - identify the number of additional properties this eviction was matched to

// TODO: handle case when no name from sales transfer is available, but petition has name(s)

const query = `
MATCH (this:A_Parcel)
WHERE this.block_lot = $search_string

OPTIONAL MATCH (eviction)-[rel_eviction:EVICTION_AT]-(this)

// identify the evictor from sales transfer data
OPTIONAL MATCH (evictor:RB_Evictor)-[rel_evictor:EVICTED_BY]-(eviction)
WHERE rel_evictor.evictor_origin = "SALES_TRANSFER"

// identify additional evictors associated with eviction petition
OPTIONAL MATCH (extra_evictor:RB_Evictor)-[rel_extra_evictor:EVICTED_BY]-(eviction)
WHERE rel_extra_evictor.evictor_origin <> "SALES_TRANSFER"

WITH eviction, rel_eviction, evictor, CASE WHEN extra_evictor IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT({
  evictor_name: extra_evictor.evictor,
  source: rel_extra_evictor.evictor_origin
}) END AS extra_evictors

// find how many properties this eviction has been linked to
// Note: as of 3/31/21 DB, all evictions are guaranteed to have at least one parcel assigned,
// so num_other_parc will always be non-negative. Need to adjust this if that changes

OPTIONAL MATCH (eviction)-[:EVICTION_AT]-(parc:A_Parcel)
WITH eviction, rel_eviction, extra_evictors, evictor, COUNT(parc) - 1 AS num_other_parc

// look-up whether the evictor is a business
OPTIONAL MATCH (evictor)-[:BE_LINKED_TO]-(be_evictor)

RETURN CASE WHEN eviction IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT({
    evict_id: eviction.evict_id,
    evict_date: eviction.evict_date,
    evict_addr_orig: eviction.addr_orig,
    type: eviction.type,
    num_other_parc: num_other_parc,
    extra_evictors: extra_evictors,
    primary_evictor: {
      name: evictor.evictor,
      linked_be: CASE WHEN be_evictor IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
          __typename: LABELS(be_evictor)[0],
          network_id: be_evictor.network_id
      } END
    },
    match_quality: {
      did_subdivision_occur: rel_eviction.eviction_type,
      addr_match_method: rel_eviction.addr_match_type
    }
}) END`;

// the input parameter is the parcel's block_lot, which serves as a primary key
// for sf parcel nodes in the datastore. it is *not* any information related to
// an eviction or evictor directly. must be a string.
export async function parcelEvictionsQueryHandler(app, block_lot) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    const result = await session.run(query, { search_string: block_lot });
    return (result.records[0] || []).get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  }
}

export default {
  parcelEvictionsQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/parcel/networkDetails.js

// parcel/networkDetails.js

const details_query = `
MATCH (search:A_Parcel)
WHERE search.block_lot = $parcel_id

WITH search.network_id AS network_id

// get total BEs
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_LP) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS num_lp
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_Corp) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS num_corp, num_lp
WITH network_id, num_corp + num_lp AS total_bes

// get most connected BEs
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_LP) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, total_bes, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT(n) END AS be_list
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_Corp) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, total_bes, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN be_list ELSE COLLECT(n) + be_list END AS be_list

UNWIND (CASE be_list WHEN [] THEN [NULL] ELSE be_list END) AS n
WITH network_id, total_bes, n, SIZE(()--(n)) AS degree
WITH network_id, total_bes, n ORDER BY degree DESC LIMIT 1
WITH network_id, total_bes, COLLECT({name_norm: n.name_norm, __typename: LABELS(n)[0]})[0] AS top_be 

// get most connected owners
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_Owner) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, n, SIZE(()--(n)) AS degree
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, n ORDER BY degree DESC LIMIT 1
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS total_owners, COLLECT({name_norm: n.name_norm})[0] AS top_owner 

OPTIONAL MATCH (n:Address_Unit) 
WHERE n.network_id = network_id
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, total_owners, top_owner, n, SIZE(()--(n)) AS degree
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, total_owners, top_owner, n ORDER BY degree DESC LIMIT 1
WITH network_id, total_bes, top_be, total_owners, top_owner, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS total_addrs, COLLECT({
  addr_readable: n.addr_readable,
  is_business: CASE WHEN EXISTS((n)-[:LISTED_AT]-()) THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END,
  is_property_owner: CASE WHEN EXISTS((n)--(:A_Parcel)) THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END
})[0] AS top_addr

RETURN {
  total_bes: total_bes,
  total_addrs: total_addrs,
  total_owners: total_owners,
  top_be: CASE WHEN top_be.name_norm IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE top_be END,
  top_owner: CASE WHEN top_owner.name_norm IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE top_owner END,
  top_addr: CASE WHEN top_addr.addr_readable IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE top_addr END
}`;

export async function parcelNetworkDetailsQueryHandler(app, parcel_id) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();

  try {
    const result = await session.run(details_query, { parcel_id });
    return result.records[0].get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

export default {
  parcelNetworkDetailsQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/parcel/owners.js

// parcel/owners.js
//
// given a parcel's block_lot (primary key), retrieve info about individuals,
// trusts, or businesses believed to be current owners of the parcel, in whole
// or in part.
//
// this query drives the 'api/parcel/<BLOCK_LOT>/owners' route.

// string representing a cyper query template.
//
// block_lot (parcel primary key) should be passed in as a parameter
// 'search_string'.
//
// query result obj is parseable as a SFAssessorParcelOwnersQueryResult message.
// see proto/queries/parcel.proto for context.
const query = `

MATCH (this:A_Parcel)
WHERE this.block_lot = $search_string

// find what other properties are owned by the property's owner
OPTIONAL MATCH (parcel:A_Parcel)-[:PARC_OWNED_BY]-(owner)-[:PARC_OWNED_BY]-(this)

WITH DISTINCT this, COUNT(parcel) as s_parcels

OPTIONAL MATCH (ma:Address_Unit)--(this)
OPTIONAL MATCH (this)-[rel_owner]-(owner:A_Parcel_Owner)
OPTIONAL MATCH (owner)-[:BE_LINKED_TO]-(be_owner)

WITH DISTINCT this, s_parcels, COLLECT({
    mailing_address: ma.addr_readable,
    record_date: rel_owner.ownr_record_date,
    perc_owner: TOFLOAT(rel_owner.ownr_perc_owner),
    owner_name: owner.ownr_owner_name,
    linked_be: CASE WHEN be_owner IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
        __typename: LABELS(be_owner)[0],
        network_id: be_owner.network_id,
        name_norm: be_owner.name_norm
    } END
}) AS s_parc_owners

RETURN {
  owners: s_parc_owners, 
  parcels: sum(s_parcels),
  subdivided: CASE WHEN this.subdivided = "True" THEN True ELSE False END,
  multiple_owners: CASE WHEN this.multiple_owners = "True" THEN True ELSE False END
}
`;

// caution!!!! this file started as a copy-paste from the main parcel query
// (which used to be in parcel.js, but is now in parcel/legacy.js). see
// comments in that file for background.
//
// IMPORTANT: if you make any changes to this file, make them in legacy.js as
// well! this will help us avoid difficult-to-track-down bugs.
//
// TODO: deprecate this file to remove duplicate code.
//
// NOTE: the input parameter is the block_lot of the parcel, *NOT* any
// information related to the parcel's owner. must be a string.
export async function parcelOwnersQueryHandler(app, block_lot) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    const result = await session.run(query, { search_string: block_lot });
    return (result.records[0] || []).get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  }
}

export default {
  parcelOwnersQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/parcel/portfolio.js

// parcel/portfolio.js
//
// given a parcel's block_lot (primary key), retrieve info about
// other properties which may be owned in full or in part by the same
// real-estate ownership networks.

// string representing a cyper query template.
//
// block_lot (parcel primary key) should be passed in as a parameter
// 'search_string'.
//
// query result obj is parseable as a SFAssessorParcelNetworksQueryResult
// message. see proto/query/parcel.proto for context.
const query = `

MATCH (this:A_Parcel)
WHERE this.block_lot = $search_string

// ---- get the related parcels in the network (that are not the searched parcel)
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel:A_Parcel)
WHERE portfolio_parcel.network_id = this.network_id AND ID(portfolio_parcel) <> ID(this)

// get the owner mailing address
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[:PARC_OWNER_ADDR_AT]-(mailing_addr:Address_Unit)

// get the parcel owners
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)--(owner:A_Parcel_Owner)
OPTIONAL MATCH (owner)-[:BE_LINKED_TO]-(be_owner)

// gather the owners
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owner, COLLECT({
    owner_name: owner.ownr_owner_name,
    linked_be: CASE WHEN be_owner IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
        __typename: LABELS(be_owner)[0],
        network_id: be_owner.network_id
    } END
}) AS owners

// gather the Ellis Act evictions to create an eviction count (based on units in the building)
// when there is a unit count on the property, use the # of units as the eviction count
// otherwise, assume a unit count of 1
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)--(eviction:RB_Eviction)
WHERE TOUPPER(eviction.type) = "ELLIS ACT WITHDRAWAL"
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, eviction, CASE WHEN portfolio_parcel.units IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.units) END AS ellis_unit_count
// since we have used an optional match, if no eviction was found then do not count
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, eviction, CASE WHEN eviction IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE ellis_unit_count END AS ellis_unit_count
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, SUM(ellis_unit_count) AS ellis_evicts

// gather the non-Ellis Act evictions to create an eviction count (based on # of filings)
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)--(eviction:RB_Eviction)
WHERE TOUPPER(eviction.type) <> "ELLIS ACT WITHDRAWAL"

// sum the unit-based Ellis eviction total and the filing-based non-Ellis eviction total
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, CASE WHEN eviction IS NULL THEN ellis_evicts ELSE COUNT(DISTINCT eviction) + ellis_evicts END AS num_evictions

// look up the main address to display 
OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[{ source: "ASSESSOR"}]-(assess_addr:Parcel_Address) // first try to look up the parcel address from assessor
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, num_evictions, CASE WHEN NOT assess_addr IS NULL THEN assess_addr.addr ELSE NULL END AS assessor_addr 

OPTIONAL MATCH (portfolio_parcel)-[{ source: "EAS"}]-(alt_addr:Parcel_Address) // look up an alternate address in case there is none
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, num_evictions, assessor_addr, CASE WHEN NOT alt_addr IS NULL THEN COLLECT(alt_addr)[0].addr ELSE NULL END AS alt_addr 

// use assessor address if present, otherwise alternative address
WITH DISTINCT this, portfolio_parcel, mailing_addr, owners, num_evictions, CASE WHEN assessor_addr IS NULL THEN alt_addr ELSE assessor_addr END AS display_addr 

// compile everything together for the related parcels
RETURN CASE WHEN portfolio_parcel IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT({
    addr: display_addr,
    owner_mailing_addr: mailing_addr.addr_readable,
    block_lot: portfolio_parcel.block_lot,
    num_evictions: num_evictions,
    units: TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.units),
    lat: TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.lat),
    long: TOFLOAT(portfolio_parcel.long),
    neighborhood: portfolio_parcel.neighborhood,
    owners: owners
}) END`;

// the input parameter is the block_lot of the parcel, *NOT* any information
// about to business networks this parcel is connected to. must be a string.
export async function parcelPortfolioQueryHandler(app, block_lot) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    const result = await session.run(query, { search_string: block_lot });
    return (result.records[0] || []).get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  }
}

export default {
  parcelPortfolioQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/parcel/relatedNetworks.js

// parcel/relatedNetworks.js

import adj_network_query from '../util_queries/adjNetwork';

const parcel_start = `MATCH (this:A_Parcel)
WHERE this.block_lot = $search_string
WITH this, this.network_id AS network_id
`;

export async function parcelRelatedNetworksQueryHandler(app, search_string) {
  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();
  try {
    const result = await session.run(parcel_start + adj_network_query, { search_string: search_string});
    return result.records[0].get(0);
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

export default {
  parcelRelatedNetworksQueryHandler
}

server/rest/handlers/query/search/search.js

// search.js
//
// contains query handlers for 2.0 full-text search queries.
import statusUtils from '../../../../framework/statusUtils';

// Query fragments:
const query_start = `
WITH [] as result_list
`;

const parcel_lookup = `

CALL db.index.fulltext.queryNodes(
'parcelAddrIndex', $search) 
YIELD node AS address, score 
WHERE score > $score_threshold
WITH result_list, address, score

// for each address, look up the parcel(s) associated with it
MATCH (address)--(parc:A_Parcel)

// count the number of properties in the network
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:A_Parcel)
WHERE n.network_id = parc.network_id
WITH result_list, score, address, parc, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS network_size

// sort by the score, and pick the top address for each parcel to display
WITH result_list, score, address, parc, network_size ORDER BY score DESC
WITH result_list, parc, network_size, COLLECT(address)[0] AS display_addr, COLLECT(score)[0] AS display_addr_score

// get all of the other addresses for the parcel (if they exist)
OPTIONAL MATCH (parc)--(alt_addrs:Parcel_Address)
WHERE ID(alt_addrs) <> ID(display_addr)

// select some of the alt addrs, count the number of extras
WITH result_list, parc, network_size, display_addr, display_addr_score, COUNT(alt_addrs) AS tot_alt_addrs, COLLECT(DISTINCT alt_addrs.addr)[..$max_alt_addrs] AS alt_addr_list
WITH result_list, parc, network_size, display_addr, display_addr_score, alt_addr_list, tot_alt_addrs - SIZE(alt_addr_list) AS num_extra_addrs ORDER BY display_addr_score DESC
WITH result_list + COLLECT({
  score: display_addr_score,            // the full text index score of the match
  network_size: network_size,           // the number of properties in the property's network  
  result_name: display_addr.addr,       // street address of the matched parcel
  result_type: LABELS(display_addr)[0], // "Parcel_Address"
  result_id: parc.block_lot             // block lot of matched parcel
}) AS result_list
`;

const business_lookup = `
// now search for all of the businesses
CALL db.index.fulltext.queryNodes(
'businessEntityNameIndex', $search) 
YIELD node AS business, score AS be_score
WHERE be_score > $score_threshold

// count the number of properties in the network
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:A_Parcel)
WHERE n.network_id = business.network_id
WITH result_list, business, be_score, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE COUNT(n) END AS network_size

// group together the results for the businesses, combine with list for parcels
WITH result_list + COLLECT({
  score: be_score,                      // the full text index score of the match
  network_size: network_size,           // the number of properties in the business's network
  result_name: business.name_norm,      // normalized name of matched business
  result_type: LABELS(business)[0],     // "SOS_LP" or "SOS_Corp"
  result_id: business.name_norm         // normalized name of matched business 
}) AS result_list
`;

const query_sort_and_return = `
// unwind list and re-sort (to interleave parcels and businesses)
UNWIND result_list AS result
WITH result ORDER BY result.score DESC

RETURN result
`;

function createLuceneSearchTerm(search) {
  let luceneSearch = search.replace(/[+\-!(){}[\]\^"~*?:\\/]/g, '\\$&') // escape all single-character Lucene special characters
  luceneSearch = luceneSearch.replace(/&&/g, '\\&&') // escape all "&&"
  luceneSearch = luceneSearch.replace(/\|\|/g, '\\\|\|') // escape all "||"

  // comment back in to implement fuzzy searching
  // luceneSearch = luceneSearch.replace(/(?<=^|\s)\S+(?=\s|$)/g, '$&~') // add "fuzzy search" operator to end of each search term
  // note cannot use \b for word boundaries because we want to include all special characters as the search terms

  return luceneSearch
}

export async function searchQueryHandler(
    app, search, include_parcels = true, include_businesses = true,
    score_threshold = 1.0, max_alt_addrs = 10) {
  if (!include_parcels && !include_businesses) {
    throw "v2 search: nothing to search for. at least one of include_parcels and include_businesses should be set true.";
  }
  // Assemble query based on the indexes we're searching through.
  let query = query_start;
  if (include_parcels) {
    query = query + parcel_lookup;
  }
  if (include_businesses) {
    query = query + business_lookup;
  }
  query = query + query_sort_and_return;

  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();

  const lucene_search = createLuceneSearchTerm(search);

  try {
    // Uses FullText search to look up businesses and properties. For properties,
    // finds top parcel address variations 
    // most similar to search term. Then finds the parcels associated
    // with those addresses, and finds all of the different address
    // variations for those parcels.

    // TODO: ensure that search term is properly escaped for special characters 
    // TODO: turn limit into a parameter from route so this can be used for general purposes.
    const result = await session.run(
      query,
      {
        search: lucene_search,
        score_threshold: score_threshold,
        max_alt_addrs: max_alt_addrs
      }
    );
    let results = [];
    for (const record_ind in result.records) {
      const record = result.records[record_ind];

      results.push(record.get(0));
    }
    return results;
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

// Wrapper around the queryHandler to satisfy service interface.
export async function handleSearchMethod(app, request_data, response_data) {
  // Support for selective filtering of categories. If a filter list is
  // present, then allow only the categories that are enumerated in the list.
  // Otherwise, allow all categories.
  let include_parcels = true;
  let include_businesses = true;

  if (Array.isArray(request_data.category_filter)
      && request_data.category_filter.length > 0) {
    // String keys here are the enum names from Category in
    // type_definitions/proto/search/search.proto
    include_parcels = request_data.category_filter.includes("PARCEL");
    include_businesses = request_data.category_filter.includes("BUSINESS_ENTITY");
  }

  // queryHandler returns a list of result objs. in order to satisfy the
  // service method interface, wrap this list in an object so it has a
  // meaningful property name.
  const queryHandlerResult = await searchQueryHandler(
    app, request_data.query, include_parcels, include_businesses);

  response_data.records = queryHandlerResult;

  return statusUtils.okStatus();
}

export default {
  searchQueryHandler: searchQueryHandler,
  handleSearchMethod: handleSearchMethod
};

server/rest/handlers/query/serviceHandler.js

// ebookDataSFService/index.js
//
// Constructs and exports a local service handler for SF query abstraction layer.
//
// As of 2021/05/11, handles only the 'search' call. This is to allow that call
// to be used seamlessly in the 'unified search' api, which combines the
// database's search results with in-memory neighborhood lookup.

import serviceUtils from '../../../framework/serviceUtils.js';
import { handleSearchMethod } from './search/search.js';

const queryHandler = serviceUtils.buildServiceHandler("EvictorbookQueryService");

// Note: Registering service handler in 'schema-less' mode, as V2 Data calls
// are still in flux.
queryHandler.registerCallback("DatabaseSearch", handleSearchMethod);

export default queryHandler;

server/rest/handlers/query/util_queries/adjNetwork.js

const adj_network_query = `

// note lack of OPTIONAL MATCH here (will return [] if no related networks)
MATCH (n:Network)-[r]-(adj_network:Network)
WHERE n.network_id = network_id

WITH r, adj_network.network_id AS adj_network_id

// get the number of parcels in the network
OPTIONAL MATCH (parc:A_Parcel)
WHERE parc.network_id = adj_network_id
WITH r, adj_network_id, COUNT(parc) AS num_parcels, SUM(TOINTEGER(parc.units)) AS num_units // handles NULL unit counts as 0

WHERE num_parcels > 0 // only show related networks with properties in portfolio

// get the most connected business
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_LP) 
WHERE n.network_id = adj_network_id
WITH r, adj_network_id, num_parcels, num_units, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN [] ELSE COLLECT(n) END AS be_list
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_Corp) 
WHERE n.network_id = adj_network_id
WITH r, adj_network_id, num_parcels, num_units, CASE WHEN n IS NULL THEN be_list ELSE COLLECT(n) + be_list END AS be_list

UNWIND (CASE be_list WHEN [] THEN [NULL] ELSE be_list END) AS n
// TODO -- specify only to use LISTED_AT and ENTITY_OWNED_BY relationships to calculate degree 
// (or add rel_be_degree to all businesses in network)
WITH r, adj_network_id, num_parcels, num_units, n, SIZE(()--(n)) AS degree ORDER BY degree DESC
WITH r, adj_network_id, num_parcels, num_units, CASE WHEN COUNT(n) > 0 THEN COLLECT(n)[0] ELSE [NULL] END AS top_be_list

UNWIND top_be_list AS top_be

// get the most connected business owner
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:SOS_Owner) 
WHERE n.network_id = adj_network_id
WITH r, adj_network_id, num_parcels, num_units, top_be, n ORDER BY n.rel_be_degree // note this uses a different metric from the above
WITH r, adj_network_id, num_parcels, num_units, top_be, CASE WHEN COUNT(n) > 0 THEN COLLECT(n)[0] ELSE [NULL] END AS top_owner_list

UNWIND top_owner_list AS top_owner

// get the most connected address
OPTIONAL MATCH (n:Address_Unit) 
WHERE n.network_id = adj_network_id
WITH r, adj_network_id, num_parcels, num_units, top_be, top_owner, n ORDER BY n.rel_be_degree // note this uses a different metric from the above
WITH r, adj_network_id, num_parcels, num_units, top_be, top_owner, CASE WHEN COUNT(n) > 0 THEN COLLECT(n)[0] ELSE [NULL] END AS top_addr_list

UNWIND top_addr_list AS top_addr

WITH adj_network_id, {
  network_description: {
    network_id: adj_network_id,
    num_parcels: num_parcels,
    num_units: num_units, 
    top_be: top_be.name_norm,
    top_owner: top_owner.name_norm,
    top_addr: top_addr.addr_readable
  },
  match_explanation: {
    businesses_listed_at_addrs: CASE WHEN r.addr_be_match IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
      num_addrs: r.addr_be_match[0],
      num_businesses: r.addr_be_match[1]
    } END,
    related_to_excluded: CASE WHEN r.excluded_match IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
      num_related_to_excluded: r.excluded_match[0] + r.excluded_match[1]
    } END,
    businesses_owning_parcels: CASE WHEN r.po_be_match IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
      num_businesses: r.po_be_match[0],
      num_parcels: r.po_be_match[1]
    } END,
    parcels_owned_by_same_non_business_owner: CASE WHEN r.non_be_prop_owner_match IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
      num_parcels: r.non_be_prop_owner_match[0] + r.non_be_prop_owner_match[1]
    } END,
    similar_addresses: CASE WHEN r.addr_match IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE {
      highest_similarity: r.addr_match
    } END    
  }
} AS adj_network_desc ORDER BY num_parcels DESC, num_units DESC // sort by first # of parcels and then units

WITH COLLECT(DISTINCT adj_network_desc) AS adj_list

RETURN adj_list
`;

export default adj_network_query;

server/rest/handlers/queryTest/index.js

// 'Test' query handlers.
import { sampleTestHandler } from './sample';

// assemble queryHandler callbacks in a map to be stored in app.locals.
// this allows us to inject mock queryHandler functions as dependencies in unit
// tests.

// add additional test handlers here (search for "Adding Test Queries" in the code 
// base to see other main places code should be added)

const queryTestHandlers = {
  "sample": sampleTestHandler
};

export default queryTestHandlers;

server/rest/handlers/queryTest/sample.js

// sample.js

// boilerplate test query handler, currently returns nothing
// use as example for creating additional test handlers

// (search for "Adding Test Queries" in the code 
// base to see other main places code should be added)

const query = 'RETURN NULL';

export async function sampleTestHandler(app, query_param) {
  // note this queries against the Test neo4j instance,
  // rather than the default 
  
  // to use the default neo4j instance, use 
  // const session = app.locals.neo4jDriver.session();

  const session = app.locals.neo4jDriverTest.session();
  try {
    const result = await session.run(
      query,
      { query_param: query_param}
    );
    let results = [];
    for (const record_ind in result.records) {
      const record = result.records[record_ind];
      results.push(record.get(0));
    }
    return results;
  } finally {
    await session.close();
  } 
}

export default {
  sampleTestHandler,
};

server/rest/handlers/queryTest/serviceHandler.js

// ebookDataSFTestService/index.js
//
// Constructs and exports a local service handler for test SF query abstraction layer.

import serviceUtils from '../../../framework/serviceUtils.js';
import { sampleTestHandler } from './sample.js';

const queryTestHandler = serviceUtils.buildServiceHandler("EvictorbookQueryTestService");

// Note: Registering service handler in 'schema-less' mode, as V2 Data calls
// are still in flux.
queryTestHandler.registerCallback("SampleTest", sampleTestHandler);

export default queryTestHandler;

server/rest/handlers/unifiedSearch/search.js

// search.js

// libraries and utilities included from source:
import { checkProto } from '../../../framework/protoUtils';
import serviceUtils from '../../../framework/serviceUtils';
import statusUtils from '../../../framework/statusUtils';
import { capsToTitleCase } from '../../../utils/gnarly/stringUtils';
import NeighborhoodConfigData from '../../../configData/neighborhoods';

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
// Handler for:
// EbookSearchService (Unified search API)
// as defined in type_definitions/proto/search/search.proto
//
//   rest api route: GET '/api/search?q=<query>'
//     where <query> is a url-safe search string.
//   rpc Search(SearchRequest) returns (SearchResponse);
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

// Arbitrary score thresholds to assign to matching neighborhoods.
// These will be compared with raw scored from the graph db's index search.
// Those scores aren't normalized, but are monotonically increasing and tend
// place the top results at approx 5.0.
const MAX_NEIGHBORHOOD_SCORE = 6.0;
const MIN_MATCHING_NEIGHBORHOOD_SCORE = 4.0;

// Limit on how many neighborhoods should appear in search results.
const MAX_NEIGHBORHOOD_RESULTS = 3;

const categoryToLabelMap = {
  "PARCEL": "Address",
  "NEIGHBORHOOD_SUMMARY": "Neighborhood",
  "BUSINESS_ENTITY": "Owner"
}

// helper function:
//
// convert a single business entity query result to a SearchResult obj.
// expects qresult to match proto schema query.BusinessEntityIndexRecord, or to
// the search result schema returned by /api/v2/search.
const processBusinessQueryResult = function(qresult) {
  var search_result = {};

  // businesss name is name_norm in V1 query schema, result_name when
  // returned via /api/v2/search.
  const businessName = qresult.name_norm || qresult.result_name || null;
  // graph node's type is __typename in V1 query schema, result_type when
  // returned via /api/v2/search.
  const nodeType = qresult.__typename || qresult.result_type || null;
  if (!businessName || !nodeType) {
    // info from this query result is not actionable.
    // IMPORTANT: caught within the loop, so we continue to the next item.
    throw "probably bug: missing info in be-search qresult. " + JSON.stringify(qresult);
  }

  // Use string value for enums, see note in search proto.
  // TODO: Write tests to ensure this string is one of the legal enum values.
  // Longer term, remove this hack.
  search_result.category = "BUSINESS_ENTITY";
  search_result.category_label = categoryToLabelMap["BUSINESS_ENTITY"];

  // extract info from the business entity's typename:
  let beTypeUriParam;   // 'corp' or 'lp', for building uri.
  let beTypeEnumLabel;  // string value of enum, see note above.
  switch (nodeType) {
    case "SOS_Corp":
      beTypeUriParam = "corp";
      beTypeEnumLabel = "CALIF_SOS_CORP";
      break;
    case "SOS_LP":
      beTypeUriParam = "lp";
      beTypeEnumLabel = "CALIF_SOS_LP";
      break;
    default:
      // IMPORTANT: caught within the loop, will continue to next item.
      throw "unrecognized be typename: " + nodeType +
        " ind: " + ind + " qresult: " + JSON.stringify(qresult);
  }

  // category-specific payload:
  const payload = {};  // proto schema: search.BusinessSearchPayload
  payload.db_node_type = nodeType;
  payload.business_type = beTypeEnumLabel;
  payload.canonical_name = businessName;
  payload.canonical_name_safe = encodeURIComponent(payload.canonical_name);
  payload.display_name = capsToTitleCase(payload.canonical_name).trim();

  // add completed payload to result:
  search_result.business_data = payload;

  // finally, main result fields:
  search_result.label = payload.display_name;

  // TODO: Update these to be dynamic for V1/V2 api and React routes.
  search_result.details_url =
    '/owner?search=' + payload.canonical_name_safe + '&be=' + beTypeUriParam;
  search_result.api_url =
    '/api/' + beTypeUriParam + '/' + payload.canonical_name_safe;

  // Only populated for v2 database search results:
  if (qresult.score) {
    search_result.ranking_info = { raw_score: qresult.score };
  }

  return search_result;
};



// helper function:
//
// convert a single parcel query result to a SearchResult obj.
// expects qresult to match proto schema query.ParcelIndexRecord or the
// response schema of results returned by /api/v2/search query handler.
const processParcelQueryResult = function(qresult) {
  var search_result = {};

  // Address is addr in the V1 query layer, result_name in /api/v2/search.
  const rawAddress = qresult.addr || qresult.result_name || null;
  // Parcel keys are block_lot in V1 query layer, result_id in /api/v2/search.
  const blockLot = qresult.block_lot || qresult.result_id || null;
  if (!rawAddress || !blockLot) {
    // info from this query result is not actionable.
    // IMPORTANT: caught within the loop, will continue to next item.
    throw "probably bug: missing info in parcel-search qresult. " + JSON.stringify(qresult);
  }

  // Use string value for enums, see note in search proto.
  // TODO: Write tests to ensure this string is one of the legal enum values.
  // Longer term, remove this hack.
  search_result.category = "PARCEL";
  search_result.category_label = categoryToLabelMap["PARCEL"];

  // category-specific payload:
  const payload = {};  // proto schema: search.ParcelSearchPayload
  payload.block_lot = blockLot;
  payload.block_lot_safe = encodeURIComponent(payload.block_lot);
  payload.addr = rawAddress;
  payload.display_addr = capsToTitleCase(payload.addr).trim();

  // add completed payload to result:
  search_result.parcel_data = payload;

  // finally, main result fields:
  search_result.label = payload.display_addr;

  // TODO: Update these to be dynamic for V1/V2 api and React routes.
  search_result.details_url = '/parcel?bl=' + payload.block_lot_safe;
  search_result.api_url =
    '/api/parcel/' + payload.block_lot_safe + '/details';

  if (qresult.score) {
    search_result.ranking_info = { raw_score: qresult.score };
  }

  return search_result;
};

// helper function:
//
// search neighborhoods by name, return a list of matching neighborhood config
// data (which can be directly loaded into a neighborhood search result
// payload.)
//
// adapted from 'searchUtils.js' from production branch's ui directory.
const searchNeighborhoods = function(query_string) {
  const resultList = NeighborhoodConfigData.neighborhoods.map(
      configEntry => {
        const nameUpper = configEntry.canonical_name;
        const searchTermUpper = query_string.toUpperCase();
        if (nameUpper.indexOf(searchTermUpper) > -1) {
          const scoredEntry = { ...configEntry };  // shallow copy.
          // Quick hack: linear interpolation, score neighborhood results
          // higher when the query string matches more of the name.
          let minScore = MIN_MATCHING_NEIGHBORHOOD_SCORE;
          let maxScore = MAX_NEIGHBORHOOD_SCORE;
          if (searchTermUpper.length <= 2) {
            // For very short terms, it doesn't make sense to rank highly.
            minScore = minScore - 2.0;
          }
          const scoreRange = maxScore - minScore;

          const substringLenRatio = (searchTermUpper.length / nameUpper.length);
          const prefixModifier =
            (nameUpper.indexOf(searchTermUpper) === 0) ? 2.0 : -0.5;

          scoredEntry.score = (
            minScore +
            prefixModifier +
            ((substringLenRatio) * (scoreRange)));
          return scoredEntry;
        }
        return null;
      }).filter(
        configEntry => configEntry !== null
      );

  return resultList;
};

// helper function:
//
// assemble neighborhood config payload into search result.
const processNeighborhoodResult = function(raw_neighborhood_result) {
  // if we're here, the neighborhood search fn returned a valid payload.
  // assemble the search result:
  const search_result = {};

  // Use string value for enums, see note in search proto.
  // TODO: Write tests to ensure this string is one of the legal enum values.
  // Longer term, remove this hack.
  search_result.category = "NEIGHBORHOOD_SUMMARY";
  search_result.category_label = categoryToLabelMap["NEIGHBORHOOD_SUMMARY"];

  const payload = {
    canonical_name: raw_neighborhood_result.canonical_name,
    canonical_name_safe: raw_neighborhood_result.canonical_name_safe,
    display_name: raw_neighborhood_result.display_name,
    id: raw_neighborhood_result.id
  };

  search_result.neighborhood_data = payload;

  // finally, main result fields:
  search_result.label = payload.display_name;

  // TODO: Update these to be dynamic for V1/V2 api and React routes.
  search_result.details_url =
    '/neighborhood?search=' + payload.canonical_name_safe;
  search_result.api_url =
    '/api/neighborhood/' + payload.canonical_name_safe;

  if (raw_neighborhood_result.score) {
    search_result.ranking_info = { raw_score: raw_neighborhood_result.score };
  }

  return search_result;
};

// helper function:
//
// Given a populted response_data, apply re-ranking / post-processing to the
// result list. This could include post-filtering results by some criteria,
// re-scoring to accomodate relevance information that's not captured in the
// graph, and/or interleaving to provide a coherent result set across several
// document types.
const postrankAndFilterSearchResults = function(response_data) {
  if (!Array.isArray(response_data.results)) return;

  // Sort by raw-score.
  //
  // TODO: This would be a good place to apply a fudge-factor for
  // raising or lowering certain businesses in result rankings.
  response_data.results.sort(function(first,second) {
    const safeGetScore = function(result) {
      if (!result || !result.ranking_info || !result.ranking_info.raw_score) {
        return 0.0;
      }
      return result.ranking_info.raw_score;
    };

    // We want high-scoring results to appear earlier, so second-first gives
    // the correct ordering.
    return safeGetScore(second) - safeGetScore(first);
  });

  // Count neighborhood results and prune if there are too many.
  // !!! HACK ALERT: This is extremely gross. !!!
  let neighborhoodsSeen = 0;
  for (let ind = 0; ind < response_data.results.length; ind++) {
    if (response_data.results[ind].category === "NEIGHBORHOOD_SUMMARY") {
      neighborhoodsSeen++;
      if (neighborhoodsSeen > MAX_NEIGHBORHOOD_RESULTS) {
        // sentinel value. replace the entry to mark for deletion, then delete
        // in a second pass.
        response_data.results[ind] = "DELETE_ME";
      }
    }
  }
  // Remove the elements that were soft-deleted above. (Keep elements that
  // aren't equal to the sentinel value.)
  response_data.results = response_data.results.filter(function(elem) {
    return elem !== "DELETE_ME";
  });
  // !!! End of HACK ALERT !!!
};

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
// Actual handler for EbookSearchService.Search rpc:
//
//   rest api route: GET '/api/search?q=<query>'
//     where <query> is a url-safe search string.
//   rpc Search(SearchRequest) returns (SearchResponse);
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

// app: express 'app' handle, as passed to an express route via 'req'.
// request_data: plain obj that matches proto schema: search.SearchRequest
// response_data: plain obj that matches proto schema: search.SearchResponse
export async function handleSearch(app, request_data, response_data) {
  // ======================================================================
  // Collect parcel and neighborhood search results by calling their query
  // listeners, then populate the values into response obj.
  // ======================================================================

  // Rather than calling 'await' on the handler results directly, start both
  // queries and allow them to run simultaneously, then 'await' the promises.
  let beQueryPromise;
  let parcelQueryPromise;

  beQueryPromise = app.locals.services.queryHandler.invoke(
    app, "DatabaseSearch",
    { query: request_data.query_string, category_filter: ["BUSINESS_ENTITY"] });

  parcelQueryPromise = app.locals.services.queryHandler.invoke(
    app, "DatabaseSearch",
    { query: request_data.query_string, category_filter: ["PARCEL"] });

  // Business and parcel handlers both return a wrapper obj with 'records' list.
  //
  // Await the results here and check for errors.
  const beQueryResponseOrError = await beQueryPromise;
  if (!serviceUtils.isResultOk(beQueryResponseOrError)) {
    // Log and continue, since we can still give partial results.
    console.error("Unified Search: probably bug - BE search query returned error. " +
          " query_string: " + request_data.query_string + "; " +
          " error response: " + JSON.stringify(beQueryResponseOrError));
  }

  const parcelQueryResponseOrError = await parcelQueryPromise;
  if (!serviceUtils.isResultOk(parcelQueryResponseOrError)) {
    // Log and continue, since we can still give partial results.
    console.error("Unified Search: probably bug - parcel search query returned error. " +
          " query_string: " + request_data.query_string + "; " +
          " error response: " + JSON.stringify(parcelQueryResponseOrError));
  }

  // for each query, extract a list of records from the method's response data.
  const be_qresults = beQueryResponseOrError.records || [];
  const parcel_qresults = parcelQueryResponseOrError.records || [];

  // Retrieve neighborhood results from local helper function:
  const neighborhood_results = searchNeighborhoods(request_data.query_string) || [];


  // ==================
  // populate results:
  // ==================

  response_data.results = [];

  // First, we aggregate the results into a single list. Then, we'll re-rank
  // and post filter to interleave results of various categories.

  // add the neighborhood results first:
  for (const ind in neighborhood_results) {
    try {
      // as retrieved from server/configData/neighborhoods.js
      // (same schema as SearchProto.NeighborhoodSearchPayload, for now).
      const neighborhood_config = neighborhood_results[ind];

      if (!neighborhood_config.canonical_name) {
        throw "probably bug: missing info in neighborhood result. " +
          " query_string: " + request_data.query_string +
          " ind: " + i + " qresult: " + JSON.stringify(qresult);
      }

      const search_result = processNeighborhoodResult(neighborhood_config);

      // add the response-format result to the main response_data.
      response_data.results.push(search_result);
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('neighborhood search_result error, continuing: ', err);
      continue;
    }
  }

  // then business results:
  for (const ind in be_qresults) {
    try {
      // proto schema: query.BusinessEntityIndexRecord
      const qresult = be_qresults[ind];

      // build a SearchResult data obj from the query result.
      // if this throws an error, we catch and continue to the next item.
      // proto schema: search.SearchResult:
      const search_result = processBusinessQueryResult(qresult);

      // add populated result to the main response_data.
      response_data.results.push(search_result);
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('business entity search_result error, continuing: ', err);
      continue;
    }
  }

  // now the parcel results:
  for (const ind in parcel_qresults) {
    try {
      // proto schema: query.ParcelIndexRecord
      const qresult = parcel_qresults[ind];

      // build a SearchResult data obj from the query result.
      // if this throws an error, we catch and continue to the next item.
      // proto schema: search.SearchResult:
      const search_result = processParcelQueryResult(qresult);

      // add the response-format result to the main response_data.
      response_data.results.push(search_result);
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('parcel search_result error, continuing: ', err);
      continue;
    }
  }

  // If we're here, response_data obj is populated with all result types.
  // Re-rank the search results to apply a single coherent ranking.
  postrankAndFilterSearchResults(response_data);

  // Now, the response_data obj is populated and it has the final
  // ranking/sorting. We can return without issue, since the service calling
  // framework will type-check the contents of response_data.
  return statusUtils.okStatus();
}

export default {
  handleSearch
};

server/rest/handlers/unifiedSearch/serviceHandler.js

// ebookSearchService/index.js
//
// constructs and exports a local service handler for EbookSearchService.

import Ajv from 'ajv';
import serviceUtils from '../../../framework/serviceUtils.js';
import { handleSearch } from './search';

// Schema definitions to be used with Ajv json-schema validator:
import searchRequestSchema from '../../../schemas/src/unifiedSearch/search_request';
import searchResponseSchema from '../../../schemas/src/unifiedSearch/search_response';

const ajv = new Ajv();

const unifiedSearchHandler = serviceUtils.buildServiceHandler("EbookSearchService");

unifiedSearchHandler.registerCallback(
  "Search", handleSearch,
    ajv.compile(searchRequestSchema), ajv.compile(searchResponseSchema));

export default unifiedSearchHandler;

server/rest/routes/conversionHelpers.js

// conversionHelpers.js
//
// utilities for converting from one format to another in the rest api
// listeners, ex: converting between different proto messages.
//
// in the case of ebook's rest listeners, some api 1.0 objects are not possible
// to represent directly as proto. this file contains helpers for dealing with
// those cases.

// convert a 'network_subgraph' as it appears in the actual neo4j-driver query
// result to a format that's compatible with proto type-checking. see
// type_definitions/proto/query/graph_util.proto
//
// safety: the input object is unchanged, and the output object contains no
// references to its constituent objects.
//
// input: list of relations as expressed in the 'network_subgraph' property of
//   the neo4j-driver response for Network queries (see
//   server/rest/handlers/network.js)
// output: list of obj's matching GraphRelation protos, where 'properties' map
//   is replaced with 'properties_json.'
//
// NOTE: as of 2021/03/23, RestProto.GraphRelation and QueryProto.GraphRelation
// are semantically identical, so it doesn't matter which one we use.
// TODO: update this conversion fn when/if the two protos diverge.
export function driverToProtoSubgraph(driver_subgraph) {
  var relation_proto_list = [];  // list of GraphRelation protos.

  for (let ind = 0; ind < driver_subgraph.length; ind++) {
    const driver_relation = driver_subgraph[ind];

    const start_proto = {
      identity: driver_relation.start.identity,      // number. value copy.
      labels: [ ... driver_relation.start.labels ],  // shallow copy (strings).
      properties_json: JSON.stringify(driver_relation.start.properties)
    };

    const end_proto = {
      identity: driver_relation.end.identity,      // number. value copy.
      labels: [ ... driver_relation.end.labels ],  // shallow copy (strings).
      properties_json: JSON.stringify(driver_relation.end.properties)
    };

    const relation_proto = {
      type: driver_relation.type,  // string. value copy (strings are immutable)
      start: start_proto,
      end: end_proto,
    };
    relation_proto_list.push(relation_proto);
  }

  return relation_proto_list;
}

// reverse of the above conversion fn. convert a 'network_subgraph' from
// proto-compatible format to neo4j-driver result format. see above.
//
// safety: the input object is unchanged, and the output object contains no
// references to its constituent objects.
//
// input: list of obj's matching GraphRelation protos, where node properties
//   are expressed as 'properties_json'.
// output: list of relations matching neo4j-driver output schema, where node
//   'properties' is a non-type-safe map of properties (values may be strings,
//   numbers, etc.)
//
// NOTE: as of 2021/03/23, RestProto.GraphRelation and QueryProto.GraphRelation
// are semantically identical, so it doesn't matter which one we use.
// TODO: update this conversion fn when/if the two protos diverge.
export function protoToDriverSubgraph(relation_proto_list) {
  var driver_subgraph = [];  // list of neo4j-driver relation obj's.

  for (let ind = 0; ind < relation_proto_list.length; ind++) {
    const relation_proto = relation_proto_list[ind];

    const start_proto = relation_proto.start;
    const start_obj = {
      identity: start_proto.identity,      // number. value copy.
      labels: [ ... start_proto.labels ],  // shallow copy (strings).
      properties: JSON.parse(start_proto.properties_json)
    };

    const end_proto = relation_proto.end;
    const end_obj = {
      identity: end_proto.identity,      // number. value copy.
      labels: [ ... end_proto.labels ],  // shallow copy (strings).
      properties: JSON.parse(end_proto.properties_json)
    };

    const driver_relation = {
      type: relation_proto.type,  // string. value copy (strings are immutable)
      start: start_obj,
      end: end_obj,
    };
    driver_subgraph.push(driver_relation);
  }

  return driver_subgraph;
}

// helper function:
// convert the return value of a queryHandlers["network"] call into
// proto-compatible format for type-checking.
//
// see driverToProtoSubgraph above.
export function driverToProtoNetworkResult(driver_result) {
  var out_proto = { ... driver_result };  // shallow copy

  out_proto.network_subgraph =
    driverToProtoSubgraph(driver_result.network_subgraph);

  return out_proto;
}

// helper function:
// convert a proto-compatible 'network' query response to neo4j-driver
// compatible format, for direct comparison to queryHandlers["network"] result
// and compatibility with api 1.0
//
// accepts input obj conforming to any of the following protos:
//   QueryProto.NetworkParcelQueryResult
//   QueryProto.NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult
//   RestProto.GetNetworkParcelResponse
//   RestProto.GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse
//
// see protoToDriverSubgraph above.
export function protoToDriverNetworkResult(input_proto) {
  var out_obj = { ... input_proto };  // shallow copy.

  out_obj.network_subgraph =
    protoToDriverSubgraph(input_proto.network_subgraph);

  return out_obj;
}

export default {
  driverToProtoSubgraph,
  protoToDriverSubgraph,
  driverToProtoNetworkResult,
  protoToDriverNetworkResult
};

server/rest/routes/dbRouteListeners.js

// dbRouteListeners.js
//
// Contains request listeners for the REST api endpoints.
//
// Based on the original server/rest/routes/dbRoutes.js with business logic
// authored by dpsgit, as seen in the 'production' branch. See commits:
// 67ce41aa, 28ab2d3b, and others.
//
// These functions can be invoked by registering as express 'app' callbacks (see
// dbRouteSetup.js), or invoked directly in unit tests.
//
// In either case, this file's listener function access data through
// queryHandler callback functions, stored in the app context.
//
// In production, query handler functions will invoke the neo4j db driver and
// issue a query to the database. In unit tests, these callbacks are mock
// functions which return injected test data.
//
// Example usage:
//    const search_string = req.params.block_lot;
//    const queryResult = await
//        req.app.locals.queryHandlers["parcelEvictions"](req.app, search_string);
//
// These query handler callback functions must be async, by definition.
// See setup code in dbRouteSetup.js for the canonical list of keys.

import Ajv from 'ajv';

import { businessPostProcessing, relatedNetworkPostProcessing, networkNodePostProcessing } from './dbRoutePostProcessing.js';

// generate validator fns:
const ajv = new Ajv();

// TODO: Move the validation calls to the handlers themselves so they're stored
// alongside the actual database lookups.
const relatedNetworkListValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/common_related_network_response'));
const portfolioListValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/common_portfolio_response'));
const databaseSearchResultListValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/search_response'));
const neighborhoodEvictionsValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/neighborhood_evictions_response'));
const networkDetailsValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/network_details_response'));
const networkGraphValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/network_graph_response'));
const networkNodesValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/network_nodes_response'));
const ownerDetailsValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/owner_business_details_response'));
const ownerEvictionsValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/owner_evictions_response'));
const ownerPortfolioValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/owner_portfolio_response'));
const parcelDetailsValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/parcel_details_response'));
const parcelEvictionsValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/parcel_evictions_response'));
const parcelOwnersValidatorFn = ajv.compile(require('../../schemas/src/query/responses/parcel_owners_response'));


// =======================================================
// =======================================================
// 
// REST LISTENERS FOR V2.0 DATABASE
// 
// =======================================================
// =======================================================


// =======================================
//  REST listener for GetParcelDetails
//  uri: '/api/parcel/:parcel_id/details'
// =======================================
export async function getParcelDetails(req, res) {
  try {
    // todo: validate the request.

    // assemble and execute query:
    const search_string = req.params.parcel_id;
    const queryResult = await
      req.app.locals.queryHandlers["parcelDetails"](req.app, search_string);

    if (!queryResult.parcel_details) {
      // if there's no parcel details expected, either something went wrong
      // with the database or the db returned an empty result. since we need a
      // little optimism, and because it lets usidentify this error case
      // easily, we'll return 404 here.
      res.status(404).send("not found");
      return;
    }

    if (req.app.locals.dbRouteFlags.validate_query_responses &&
          !parcelDetailsValidatorFn(queryResult.parcel_details)) {
      console.error(parcelDetailsValidatorFn.errors);
      console.error("data: " + JSON.stringify(queryResult.parcel_details));
      throw "Query result didn't pass validation!";
    }

    // post-processing:
    // We rely on the fact that there's currently no transformation logic for
    // parcel/details. When/if we do add this logic (for example, to convert
    // addresses to friendly format), this will need to be validated
    // separately.
    const responseBody = {
      parcel_details: queryResult.parcel_details
    };

    // write to response:
    res.json(responseBody);
  } catch (err) {
    console.error('getParcelDetails error: ', err);
    res.status(500).send("internal error");
  }
}

// =========================================
//  REST listener for GetParcelEvictions
//  uri: '/api/parcel/:parcel_id/evictions'
// =========================================
export async function getParcelEvictions(req, res) {
  try {
    // todo: validate the request.

    // assemble and execute query:
    const search_string = req.params.parcel_id;
    const queryResult = await
      req.app.locals.queryHandlers["parcelEvictions"](req.app, search_string);

    if (req.app.locals.dbRouteFlags.validate_query_responses &&
          !parcelEvictionsValidatorFn(queryResult)) {
      throw "Query result didn't pass validation!";
    }

    // write to response:
    res.json(queryResult);
  } catch (err) {
    console.error('getParcelEvictions error: ', err);
    res.status(500).send("internal error");
  }
}

// ========================================
//  REST listener for GetParcelNetworks
