    - [ParcOwnedByRelationData](#graph.ParcOwnedByRelationData)
    - [ParcelOwnerAtAddressRelationData](#graph.ParcelOwnerAtAddressRelationData)
    - [RelationDetails](#graph.RelationDetails)
    - [UnitAtRelationData](#graph.UnitAtRelationData)



<a name="graph.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## graph.proto



<a name="graph.Graph"></a>

### Graph
Represents the complete contents of the evictorbook serving graph.

TODO: Introduce a &#39;metadata&#39; sub-message.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| node_collection | [Graph.NodeCollection](#graph.Graph.NodeCollection) |  | Decribes the set of nodes in the graph, identified by unique string key. |
| relation_collection | [Graph.RelationCollection](#graph.Graph.RelationCollection) |  | Describes the set of relations (aka edges) among nodes in the graph. |






<a name="graph.Graph.NodeCollection"></a>

### Graph.NodeCollection
Container message for nodes in the graph.

We present a wrapper message to have room to add additional fields which
are strongly associated with the node list (metadata, flags, etc).


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| nodes | list< [NodeDetails](#graph.NodeDetails) > |  | list of nodes in the graph. |






<a name="graph.Graph.RelationCollection"></a>

### Graph.RelationCollection
Container message for relations in the graph.

As with NodeCollection above, we present a wrapper message to reserve
space for add additional fields that are strongly associated with the
relation list (metadata, flags, etc).


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| relations | list< [RelationDetails](#graph.RelationDetails) > |  | list of relations in the graph, identified by the unique string keys of the source and destination nodes. |





 

 

 

 



<a name="nodes.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## nodes.proto
notes.proto

This file contains message definitions representing the nodes in the
evictorbook graph.



<a name="graph.NodeType"></a>

### NodeType
Types of entities that appear as nodes in the evictorbook-sf graph.

Names of these values correspond directly to the strings used for tags in
the evictorbook serving database, so they&#39;re terse and require some
explanation.

These names are &#39;namespaced&#39; with prefixes depending on their source:
 
```
  prefix  |  source
 -------------------------------------------
  A       |  San Francisco Assessor&#39;s office
  SOS     |  California Sec. of State business index
  RB      |  SF Rent Board
```

&#34;Address&#34; nodes have no namespace, and are generated when parsing
documents from any source. In other words, the types which begin with
&#34;ADDRESS&#34; have no implied data source.

Below, you&#39;ll find message descriptions for the data payloads of each of
these types. See those descriptions for more details.

| Name | Number | Description |
| ---- | ------ | ----------- |
| NODE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED | 0 | Default value. Treat as unset. |
| A_PARCEL | 1 | Corresponds to node type &#34;A_Parcel&#34;.  Represents a physical parcel, as it&#39;s described in records from the SF Assessor&#39;s office. Contains fields for the parcel&#39;s location and physical characteristics. |
| A_PARCEL_OWNER | 2 | Corresponds to node type &#34;A_Parcel_Owner&#34;. |
| SOS_LP | 3 | Corresponds to node type &#34;SOS_LP&#34;.  A limited partnership or an LLC, as it&#39;s represented in the California Secretary of State business entity index. |
| SOS_CORP | 4 | Corresponds to node type &#34;SOS_Corp&#34;.  A for-profit corporation, as it&#39;s represented in the California Secretary of State business entity index. |
| SOS_OWNER | 5 | Corresponds to node type &#34;SOS_Owner&#34;.  A person or business-entity which has an ownership interest in another business-entity, as described in the California Secretary of State business entity index. |
| RB_EVICTION | 6 | Corresponds to node type &#34;RB_Eviction&#34;.  A record of an eviction which occurred in San Francisco, as represented in SF Rent Board records. |
| RB_EVICTOR | 7 | Corresponds to node type &#34;RB_Evictor&#34;.  Represents a person or entity who instigated an eviction, according to information from eviction records and/or sales transfer records. |
| ADDRESS_MAIN | 8 | Corresponds to node type &#34;Address_Main&#34;.  Full address, without unit. May represent the address of a parcel&#39;s owner, or an address associated with a business entity or one of its officers.  The idea is to provide a single node that acts as a building or lot&#39;s conceptual &#34;anchor&#34; node, while ADDRESS_UNIT nodes represent individual units that can be resolved at that address. |
| ADDRESS_UNIT | 9 | Corresponds to node type &#34;Address_Unit&#34;.  Full address, including a unit number if applicable. May represent the address of a parcel&#39;s owner, or an address associated with a business entity or one of its officers.  Address_Unit graph nodes are analysed with connected component analysis, and the network_id of the address&#39;s component is stored in this node. |



<a name="graph.NodeDetails"></a>

### NodeDetails
Represents a single node in the graph.

Contains graph metadata (id, labels, type) as well as type-safe descriptions of the node's payload (key-value properties). set only one of the 'data' fields below, as appropriate for the node's type.

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| identity | [int64](#int64) |  | internal graph db id for this node. |
| labels | list< [string](#string) > |  | the node types that this node has. in our graph, nodes always have a single type, as of 2021/03/12, but this may change in the future. |
| type | [NodeType](#graph.NodeType) |  | the semantic type of the node, as an enum. |
| unique_string_key | [string](#string) |  | a string key which uniquely identifies this node (among other nodes of its type). each node type has a field which is designated as the unique key. see definitions inline.  TODO: annotate key fields in a machine-readable way. |
| sf_assessor_parcel_data | [SFAssessorParcelData](#graph.SFAssessorParcelData) |  |  |
| sf_assessor_parcel_owner_data | [SFAssessorParcelOwnerData](#graph.SFAssessorParcelOwnerData) |  |  |
| cal_sos_limited_business_data | [CalSOSLPData](#graph.CalSOSLPData) |  |  |
| cal_sos_corporation_data | [CalSOSCorpData](#graph.CalSOSCorpData) |  |  |
| cal_sos_business_owner_data | [CalSOSOwnerData](#graph.CalSOSOwnerData) |  |  |
| sfrb_eviction_data | [SFRentBoardEvictionData](#graph.SFRentBoardEvictionData) |  |  |
| sfrb_evictor_data | [SFRentBoardEvictorData](#graph.SFRentBoardEvictorData) |  |  |
| address_main_data | [AddressMainData](#graph.AddressMainData) |  |  |
| address_unit_data | [AddressUnitData](#graph.AddressUnitData) |  |  |



<a name="graph.AddressMainData"></a>

### AddressMainData
Node type: Address_Main

Full address, without unit. May represent the address of a parcel&#39;s owner,
or an address associated with a business entity or one of its officers.

&#39;Address_Main&#39; represents a conceptual &#39;anchor&#39; or entry point for all
possible units at a given top-level street address. In contrast, its
counterpart &#39;Address_Unit&#39; represents a &#39;resolved&#39; address that can
actually be contacted, with unit number if applicable. See details in
Address_Unit description below.

TODO: Consider a structured representation of the address for more robust
comparisons.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | The address, represented as a single string.  TODO: Describe format guidelines -- does this need a city and zip, for example?  TODO: Describe whether and how this string was normalized. |






<a name="graph.AddressUnitData"></a>

### AddressUnitData
Node type: Address_Unit

Represents a resolved address, with unit number if necessary, which can be
contacted by mail or visited in person. May represent the address of a
parcel&#39;s owner, or an address associated with a business entity or one of
its officers.

This node exists even for addresses which contain only a single unit. See
description of Address_Main above. Single-unit addresses are considered to
be a special case, where the conceptual &#39;main&#39; address happens to
correspond to the &#39;resolved&#39; (unit-level) address.

Address_Unit graph nodes are analysed with connected component analysis,
and the network_id of the address&#39;s component is stored in this node.

TODO: Consider a structured representation for more robust comparisons, as
with Address_Main above.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | The address, represented as a single string.  TODO: Describe format guidelines -- does this need a city and zip, for example?  TODO: Describe whether and how this string was normalized. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | Network component id of the business-network component which is primarily associated with this unit-level address.  These network component id&#39;s are assigned during component analysis in the evictorbook data pipeline.  For more info about network component id&#39;s assigned in the evictorbook graph, see documentation on &#39;c_id&#39; and &#39;network_id&#39; in CalSOSLPData and CalSOSCorpData messages.  See the developer guide for a detailed description of the evictorbook&#39;s network connection methodology in the section &#34;Network Connection Method - Detailed &gt; During DB Creation&#34;. As of 2020/09/09, network_id assignment is described in step &#39;III&#39;. of that section. |






<a name="graph.CalSOSCorpData"></a>

### CalSOSCorpData
Node type: SOS_Corp

A corporation, as described in the Calif. Sec. of State business entity
index.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| name_norm | [string](#string) |  | Normalized name of the business, derived from the name in Calif. Sec. of State business records.  TODO: Describe or link specifics of the string normalization. |
| transaction_date | [string](#string) |  | Transaction date of the document which established this corporation, according to the California Secretary of State business registry.  Date is represented as a string with format &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39;. |
| corporation_number | [string](#string) |  | An 8 digit Corporate Identification Number, from the California Secretary of State business registry. |
| incorporation_date | [string](#string) |  | Date on which this corporation was incorporated, according to the California Secretary of State business registry.  Date is represented as a string with format &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39;. |
| corporation_status | [string](#string) |  | Status of the corporation, as a string containing a code from Calif. Sec. of State business entity records. The values are described as follows in the database schema documentation:  1 = Active 2 = Suspended 3 = Canceled 4 = Surrendered 5 = Term expired 6 = Dissolved 7 = Forfeited 8 = Deleted 9 = Inactive C = Merged Out E = State to Federal Bank Conversion F = Conditionally dissolved (No tax clearance) Not sure about code = Converted Out  In the 05/2020 production database, the codes which appear are: &#34;0&#34;-&#34;9&#34;, &#34;C&#34; |
| corporation_type | [string](#string) |  | Description of the legal process used to establish this corporation, according to Calif. Sec. of state records. The allowed values and their meanings are listed below.  ARTS = Articles of Incorporation S&amp;DC = Statement &amp; Designation By Foreign Corporation S&amp;DA = Statement &amp; Designation By Foreign Association FNRE = Foreign Name Registration  present in 05/2020 production database: &#34;ARTS&#34;, &#34;S&amp;DC&#34;. |
| corporation_tax_base | [string](#string) |  | Description of the tax-base of the corporation, according to calif. sec. of state records. this indicates whether a corporation is for-profit or non-profit.  S = Stock N = Non-Stock (Nonprofit) |
| corporation_classification | [string](#string) |  | Additional corporate classifications which may convey special status, such as &#39;religious&#39; or &#39;agricultural cooperative&#39; according to calif. sec. of state business entity records.  AG = Agricultural Cooperative CR = Credit Union MU = Mutual Benefit OC = Other Cooperative PB = Public Benefit RE = Religious SL = Corporation Sole UN = Unclassified |
| term_expiration_date | [string](#string) |  | Limited Term expiration date. Format = CCYYMMDD |
| ftb_suspension_status | [string](#string) |  | Describes whether this corporation is in good standing with the california franchise tax board (ftb).  &#39;&#39; = Not Suspended (In Good Standing) (empty string) F = Forfeited S = Suspended |
| ftb_suspension_date | [string](#string) |  | If this corporation has been subject to action by the franchise tax board as described in &#39;ftb_suspension_status&#34;, then this field contains a string representation of the date of that action.  Date is represented as a string with format &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39;. |
| so_file_number | [string](#string) |  | Statement of information file number, per calif sec of state records. |
| so_file_date | [string](#string) |  | Last complete statement (of information?) file date.  Date is represented as a string with format &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39;. |
| corporation_name | [string](#string) |  | Name of corporation, directly from calif. sec. of state records without normalization. |
| co_name | [string](#string) |  | &#39;Care of&#39; Name, meaning the &#39;c/o&#39; addressee which should be included on mail intended for the corporation. |
| agent_name | [string](#string) |  | Name and contact info of Agent for Service of Process  !!! CAUTION !!! Different naming conventions from SOS_LP fields with similar info! |
| agent_address_line_1 | [string](#string) |  |  |
| agent_address_line_2 | [string](#string) |  |  |
| agent_address_city | [string](#string) |  |  |
| agent_address_state_county | [string](#string) |  | The state component of the agent-for-service addr.  NOTE: These are not cleaned! Most corps have value &#34;CA&#34;, but some have suffixes (intended to indicate county code?)  examples of odd entries in 05/2020 production db: &#34;CA 9&#34;, &#34;CA 5126&#34;, &#34;CAA&#34;, &#34;A&#34;. |
| agent_address_zip_code | [string](#string) |  | Sometimes these are 5-digit codes, sometimes these are 9-digit. TODO: cleanup. |
| state_or_foreign_country | [string](#string) |  | TODO: Describe this field; there&#39;s no description in the schema document.  As of 2020/09/09, working understanding is that if the corporation is not &#39;domestic&#39; (internal to calif.), then this field describes a u.s. state other than california, or a country outside the u.s., where this corporation originated. |
| c_id | [int64](#int64) |  | Business entity component id, generated by the evictorbook data pipeline via connected component analysis.  Each SOS_Corp and SOS_LP graph node in the graph is assigned a &#39;c_id&#39;.  Two SOS_Corp and/or SOS_LP graph nodes share a c_id if there exists a path connecting those graph nodes in the subgraph of {SOS_Corp|SOS_LP} graph nodes and {OFFICER_FOR} edges.  See the developer guide for a detailed description of the evictorbook&#39;s network connection methodology in the section &#34;Network Connection Method - Detailed &gt; During DB Creation&#34;. As of 2020/09/09, c_id assignment is described in step &#39;I&#39; of that section. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | Parcel ownership network component id, generated by the evictorbook data pipeline via connected component analysis.  SOS_Corp, SOS_LP, and SOS_Owner graph nodes are required to have a network_id, and Address_Unit graph nodes may optionally have a network_id.   Two graph nodes share a network_id if there is a path connecting those graph nodes in the subgraph of {SOS_Corp|SOS_LP|SOS_Owner|Address_Unit} graph nodes and { OFFICER_FOR | ENTITY_OWNED BY | LISTED_AT } edges.  &#39;network_id&#39; components are aggregations of one or more &#39;c_id&#39; components, connected by a path in the subgraph described above.  So, graph nodes that share a &#39;c_id&#39; also share a &#39;network_id&#39;, but graph nodes that share a &#39;network_id&#39; do NOT NECESSARILY share a &#39;c_id&#39;.  See the developer guide for a detailed description of the evictorbook&#39;s network connection methodology in the section &#34;Network Connection Method - Detailed &gt; During DB Creation&#34;. As of 2020/09/09, network_id assignment is described in step &#39;III&#39;. of that section. |






<a name="graph.CalSOSLPData"></a>

### CalSOSLPData
Node type: SOS_LP

A limited partnership or an LLC, as decribed in the Calif. Sec. of State
business entity index.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| name_norm | [string](#string) |  | Normalized name of the partnership or llc, derived from the name used in Calif Sec. of State business records. TODO: Describe or link specifics of the string normalization. |
| jurisdiction_llc | [string](#string) |  | LLC only: state or county for formation of foreign llc. |
| llc_management_code | [string](#string) |  | LLC only: management structure. 1 = One Manager M = More Than One Manager A = All Members are Managers LLC ONLY |
| llc_type_of_business | [string](#string) |  | LLC only: type of business. |
| file_number | [string](#string) |  | Format is CCYYJJJN9999 CCYY = Century and Year. JJJ = Julian day of year. N = Record Type 0 = LP Record 1 = LLC Record 9999 = Sequence Number |
| file_date | [string](#string) |  | Date of initial filing, represented as CCYYMMDD |
| status | [string](#string) |  | Identifies current status of LP/LLC A = Active B = Dishonored Check C = Canceled D = Dissolved P = Pending Cancellation F = Franchise Tax Board (FTB) Suspended/Forfeited M = Merged out O = Converted out S = Secretary of State (SOS) Suspended/Forfeited 2 = SOS/FTB Suspended/Forfeited |
| filing_type | [string](#string) |  | Filing type: foreign &#34;F&#34; or domestic &#34;D&#34;. |
| name | [string](#string) |  | California Limited Partnership or LLC Name, non-normalized. |
| jurisdiction | [string](#string) |  | State or country of formation for foreign limited partnerships. |
| agent_name | [string](#string) |  | Agent of service contact info.  !! CAUTION !! These fields follow a different naming convention than their conterparts in SOS_Corp. |
| agent_address_1 | [string](#string) |  |  |
| agent_address_2 | [string](#string) |  |  |
| agent_city | [string](#string) |  |  |
| agent_state | [string](#string) |  |  |
| agent_zip | [string](#string) |  |  |
| term | [string](#string) |  | Date or cause of termination.  This is a free-form text field and can follow many formats, depending on context. Examples of typical contents:   - date in &#34;MM/DD/YY&#34; format. some records allow &#39;00&#39; for month or date. - date in &#34;MM/DD/YY&#34; format with qualifying suffix. examples: &#34;01/01/15 OR EVENT&#34;, &#34;01/15/40 OR PER AGMT&#34;, &#34;02/15/33\*&#34; - date in &#34;MMDDYY&#34; format - date in &#34;MM/DD/YYYY&#34; format (for some 90&#39;s records).  In general, if you&#39;re looking at this, expect it to be difficult to parse.  TODO: document exhaustively and/or apply cleanup in pipeline. |
| c_id | [int64](#int64) |  | Business entity component id, generated by the evictorbook data pipeline via connected component analysis.  Each SOS_Corp and SOS_LP graph node in the graph is assigned a &#39;c_id&#39;.  Two SOS_Corp and/or SOS_LP graph nodes share a c_id if there exists a path connecting those graph nodes in the subgraph of {SOS_Corp|SOS_LP} graph nodes and {OFFICER_FOR} edges.  See the developer guide for a detailed description of the evictorbook&#39;s network connection methodology in the section &#34;Network Connection Method - Detailed &gt; During DB Creation&#34;. As of 2020/09/09, c_id assignment is described in step &#39;I&#39; of that section. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | Network component id of the connected component this owner belongs to. This uniquely specifies the ownership network this owner belongs to, according to connected component analysis in the evictorbook data pipeline.  &#39;network_id&#39; components are aggregations of one or more &#39;c_id&#39; components, connected by a path in the subgraph described above.  So, graph nodes that share a &#39;c_id&#39; also share a &#39;network_id&#39;, but graph nodes that share a &#39;network_id&#39; do NOT NECESSARILY share a &#39;c_id&#39;.  See the developer guide for a detailed description of the evictorbook&#39;s network connection methodology in the section &#34;Network Connection Method - Detailed &gt; During DB Creation&#34;. As of 2020/09/09, network_id assignment is described in step &#39;III&#39;. of that section. |






<a name="graph.CalSOSOwnerData"></a>

### CalSOSOwnerData
Node type: SOS_Owner

A person or business-entity which has an ownership interest in another
business-entity.

NOTE: Need clarification on how this related to &#39;ENTITY_OWNED_BY&#39; -- it
seems as though if both nodes in the ENTITY_OWNED_BY relationship are
business-entities, then would be difficult to tell which entity owns the
other. Might be missing something here. -dee 10/2020


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| name_norm | [string](#string) |  | Normalized name of the person or entity who&#39;s a stakeholder in a corporation or limited partnership.  TODO: Describe or link specifics of the string normalization. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | Network component id of the connected component this owner belongs to. This uniquely specifies the ownership network this owner belongs to, according to connected component analysis in the evictorbook data pipeline.  For more info about network component id&#39;s assigned in the evictorbook graph, see documentation on &#39;c_id&#39; and &#39;network_id&#39; in CalSOSLPData and CalSOSCorpData.  See the developer guide for a detailed description of the evictorbook&#39;s network connection methodology in the section &#34;Network Connection Method - Detailed &gt; During DB Creation&#34;. As of 2020/09/09, network_id assignment is described in step &#39;III&#39;. of that section. |







<a name="graph.SFAssessorParcelData"></a>

### SFAssessorParcelData
Node type: A_Parcel

Represents a physical parcel, as it&#39;s described in records from the SF
Assessor&#39;s office. Contains fields for the parcel&#39;s location and physical
characteristics.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | Block lot string, which uniquely specifies a parcel in SF city and county assessor records. This is a unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database. |
| prop_class_code | [string](#string) |  | Property class code according to the SF assessor&#39;s office. For values and their definitions see: https://data.sfgov.org/Housing-and-Buildings/Reference-Assessor-Recorder-Property-Class-Codes/pa56-ek2h/data |
| neighborhood_code | [string](#string) |  | TODO Confirm semantics. Full neighborhood name is stored as &#39;neighborhood&#39;, below. |
| zone | [string](#string) |  | Identifier for the zoning district this parcel occupies. San Francisco zoning district identifiers can be found here: https://sfplanninggis.org/pim/map.html?layers=Zoning%20Districts |
| stories | [string](#string) |  | Height of the buildings in this parcel, in stories.  TODO: investigate behavior for multi-building parcels. |
| units | [string](#string) |  | Number of units that occupy this real-estate parcel. |
| rooms | [string](#string) |  | Number of rooms in the property on this parcel. |
| beds | [string](#string) |  | Number of bedrooms in the property on this parcel. |
| yr_built | [string](#string) |  | Calendar year in which the buildings on this real-estate parcel were first constructed. TODO: confirm behavior for multi-unit parcels. |
| parc_start_no | [string](#string) |  | If the parcel occupies a single street number, this field contains that street number. Otherwise, it contains the lowest street number in the range of street numbers that this parcel occupies. |
| parc_end_no | [string](#string) |  | If this parcel occupies multiple street numbers, this field contains the highest street number in the range of occupied street numbers.  TODO: Clarify behavior for single-street-number parcels. |
| parc_street_name | [string](#string) |  | The name of the street of this parcel&#39;s address, as it appears in county assessor records. |
| parc_street_type | [string](#string) |  | Suffix of the street part of this parcel&#39;s address, as it appears in county assessor records. |
| parc_unit_no | [string](#string) |  | Unit number component of this parcel&#39;s address, as it appears in county assessor records.  TODO Clarify behavior when the parcel has no subunits. |
| parc_zip | [string](#string) |  | The zip code of this parcel&#39;s address, as it appears in county assessor records. |
| update_date | [string](#string) |  | Date on which this parcel&#39;s address was last updated, according to records from the assessor&#39;s office. Format: CCYYMMDD |
| assess_land_val | [string](#string) |  | Monetary value of the land this real-estate parcel occupies, according to the most recent assessment on file, in US dollars. |
| assess_imp_val | [string](#string) |  | Monetary value of structures built on the land this parcel occupies, according to the most recent assessment on file, in US collars. |
| assess_val_date | [string](#string) |  | Date on which the parcel&#39;s value was last assessed. Format: CCYYMMDD |
| curr_sales_price | [string](#string) |  | TODO clarify the semantics here. Units are in US dollars. |
| curr_sales_date | [string](#string) |  | TODO clarify the semantics here. Units are in US dollars. |
| rent_controlled | [string](#string) |  | Assessment of the rent-control status of this parcel: 0 (default) if data unavailable to determine rent controlled status, 1 if likely rent controlled, 2 if doubtful that this is rent controlled |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | A string representing the parcel&#39;s street address, including street number, street name and suffix, and unit number. The parcel is assumed to be within SF city/county limits.  Notes from schema definition sheet: Full address in the format of &#34;ST_START_NO-ST_END_NO ST_NAME ST_TYPE (Unit UNIT)&#34; (w/o end no if no address range, w/o parentheses if no unit) |
| long | [string](#string) |  | Longitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries. string representing a floating-point number. |
| lat | [string](#string) |  | Latitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries. string representing a floating-point number. |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | Name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. As of 2020/09/26, it&#39;s assumed that all parcels are within SF city and county, so these are San Francisco neighborhoods.  Neighborhoods are assigned using SF polygons.  Values correspond to names of the neighborhood polygons described at: https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4 |






<a name="graph.SFAssessorParcelOwnerData"></a>

### SFAssessorParcelOwnerData
Node type: A_Parcel_Owner

Describes an individual or entity that&#39;s directly listed, by name, as an
owner of a parcel in SF Assessor records.

NOTE: In the current schema, owners are uniquely identified by name, which
introduces potential for false positives. This is a property of the schema
that we should revisit for future revisions.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| owner_name | [string](#string) |  | Name of owner listed on parcel.

TODO Briefly describe how/whether this data was normalized. |






<a name="graph.SFRentBoardEvictionData"></a>

### SFRentBoardEvictionData
Node type: RB_Eviction

A record of an eviction which occurred in San Francisco, as represented in
SF Rent Board records.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| evict_id | [string](#string) |  | Eviction ID, unique in aemp&#39;s records.  IMPORTANT: This is derived from the petition ID of the eviction in rent board records, but in some cases it&#39;s appended with a suffix. Therefore, it *cannot* safely be used for direct string comparison with RB records.  TODO: Document the specifics of the eviction ID suffixes.  TODO: Mitigate the impact of the ID shift by preserving the raw petition id in this node. |
| evict_date | [string](#string) |  | Format: CCYYMMDD |
| amount | [string](#string) |  | Buyout amount in USD, if applicable. |
| units | [string](#string) |  | Number of units whose occupants were evicted, if known. |
| type | [string](#string) |  | Type of eviction, for example &#34;Buyout Declaration&#34; or &#34;Ellis Act Withdrawal&#34;.  TODO: Enumerate all legal values here. Eventually, consider replacing this with an enum. |
| ellis_evictor | [string](#string) |  | Attributed evictors according to ellis act withdrawal records. Only populated for evictions of type &#34;Ellis Act Withdrawal&#34;.  TODO Verify semantics. Ad-hoc testing on EB Web shows a list of multiple ellis evictors, which appear to be derived from interpreting a string as a comma-separated list. As of 2020/09/09, the relationship between this string and the EB Web api is not well documented. |






<a name="graph.SFRentBoardEvictorData"></a>

### SFRentBoardEvictorData
Node type: RB_Evictor 

Represents a person or entity who instigated an eviction, according to
information from sales transfer records.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| evictor | [string](#string) |  | Name of the entity that instigated the eviction, as it appears in documents relating to the eviction. This may be an individual or a business.  TODO Describe whether and how this string was normalized. |






 

 

 



<a name="relations.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## relations.proto
relations.proto

This file contains message definitions that conceptually represent the
relations (edges) connecting nodes in the evictorbook graph database.

<a name="graph.RelationType"></a>

### RelationType
RelationType

Type enum for the potential connections between nodes in the ebook graph.
For more details see comments on the &#39;RelationData&#39; messages below.

| Name | Number | Description |
| ---- | ------ | ----------- |
| RELATION_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED | 0 | Default value. Treat as unset. |
| EVICTED_BY | 1 | Relation type: EVICTED_BY  Represents a hypothesis attributing an individual for being responsible in insigating an eviction.  See EvictedByRelationData description for details. |
| EVICTION_AT | 2 | Relation type: EVICTION_AT  Associates an SF Rent Board eviction record with the dwelling from which one or more tenants were evicted.  See EvictionAtRelationData description for details. |
| LISTED_AT | 3 | Relation type: LISTED_AT  Describes an address associated with a business entity in Secretary of state records.  See ListedAtRelationData description for details. |
| ENTITY_OWNED_BY | 4 | Relation type: ENTITY_OWNED_BY  Indicates that an SOS_Owner has a stake in a SOS business entity (the target entity may be either a limited business (LP) or a corporation (Corp)).  See EntityOwnedByRelationData description for details. |
| OFFICER_FOR | 5 | Relation type: OFFICER_FOR  Indicates that one business entity is an officer for another business entity (which seems pretty weird).  See OfficerForRelationData description for details. |
| BE_LINKED_TO | 6 | Relation type: BE_LINKED_TO Connects a business node (SOS_Corp or SOS_LP) to a parcel-owner or attributed evictor (A_Parcel_Owner or RB_Evictor). The A_Parcel_Owner or RB_Evictor is considered to *be* the business. That is, this means we believe the business is the same entity as the reported owner or evictor. This is based on string matching the names of the recorded owner/attributed evictor with the names of businesses from california sec. of state business data. |
| PARC_OWNED_BY | 7 | Relation type: PARC_OWNED_BY  Describes a direct owner relationship between a parcel and an individual/entity that&#39;s listed as an owner via assessor property tax records.  See ParcelOwnedByRelationData description for details. |
| UNIT_AT | 8 | Relation type: UNIT_AT  Indicates that an Address_Unit node correponds to the main parcel address at Address_Main.  See UnitAtRelationData description for details. |
| PARC_OWNER_ADDR_AT | 9 | Relation type: PARC_OWNER_ADDR_AT  Indicates that a parcel owner can be reached at this mailing address. TODO: Clarify, does this mean the address is listed as owner occupied? Or is this derived from some other signal?  See ParcelOwnerAtAddressRelationData description for details. |





<a name="graph.RelationDetails"></a>

### RelationDetails
Represents a single relation (edge) in the graph.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| type | [string](#string) |  | string containing the type of the relation. |
| start_identity | [int64](#int64) |  | internal neo4j id for the start node. |
| end_identity | [int64](#int64) |  | internal neo4j id for the end node. |
| relation_type | [RelationType](#graph.RelationType) |  | type, as an enum specific to eb graph semantics. the value names of this enum correspond to the string values used for &#39;type&#39;. |
| start_string_key | [string](#string) |  | semantic unique key for start node. |
| end_string_key | [string](#string) |  | semantic unique string key for end node (destination). |
| evicted_by_relation_data | [EvictedByRelationData](#graph.EvictedByRelationData) |  |  |
| eviction_located_at_relation_data | [EvictionAtRelationData](#graph.EvictionAtRelationData) |  |  |
| business_listed_at_relation_data | [ListedAtRelationData](#graph.ListedAtRelationData) |  |  |
| business_entity_owned_by_relation_data | [EntityOwnedByRelationData](#graph.EntityOwnedByRelationData) |  |  |
| business_officer_for_relation_data | [OfficerForRelationData](#graph.OfficerForRelationData) |  |  |
| owner_or_evictor_linked_to_business_relation_data | [BELinkedToRelationData](#graph.BELinkedToRelationData) |  |  |
| parcel_owned_by_relation_data | [ParcOwnedByRelationData](#graph.ParcOwnedByRelationData) |  |  |
| unit_at_relation_data | [UnitAtRelationData](#graph.UnitAtRelationData) |  |  |
| parcel_owner_at_address_relation_data | [ParcelOwnerAtAddressRelationData](#graph.ParcelOwnerAtAddressRelationData) |  |  |




<a name="graph.BELinkedToRelationData"></a>

### BELinkedToRelationData
Relation type: BE_LINKED_TO

Connects a business node (SOS_Corp or SOS_LP) to a parcel-owner or attributed evictor (A_Parcel_Owner or RB_Evictor).
The A_Parcel_Owner or RB_Evictor is considered to *be* the business. That is, this means we believe the business is the same entity as the reported owner or evictor. This is based on string matching the names of the recorded owner/attributed evictor with the names of businesses from california sec. of state business data.

Start node: RB_Evictor or A_Parcel_Owner node, identifying an agent believed to have instigated an eviction from SF Rent Board records, or a property-holding entity described in SF Assessor data.

End node: SOS_LP or SOS_Corp node representing a business entity in California Sec of State index, which is believed to be acting in the role of parcel owner or attributed evictor.





<a name="graph.EntityOwnedByRelationData"></a>

### EntityOwnedByRelationData
Relation type: ENTITY_OWNED_BY

Indicates that an SOS_Owner has a stake in a SOS business entity (the
target entity may be either a limited business (LP) or a corporation
(Corp)).

Start node: SOS_Corp or SOS_LP node, identified by its unique normalized
business name in the California Sec. of State business registry.

End node: SOS_Owner node, identified by the normalized name of that
owner in the California Sec. of State business registry.

NOTE: This collapsing of all identically-named owners in the business
registry is the likely the source of over-connections in our graph
methodology, and is on the list of items to revisit as we revise the
pipeline.

Empty as of 2020/12/29, as the relation carries no data payload other than
the fact of its own presence.






<a name="graph.EvictedByRelationData"></a>

### EvictedByRelationData
Relation type: EVICTED_BY

Represents a hypothesis attributing an individual for being responsible in
insigating an eviction.

Start node: RB_Eviction node describing SF Rent Board eviction record,
keyed by unique id. Note that evictorbook graph unique ID&#39;s for evictions
may differ from id&#39;s in other databases because a one-character suffix is
sometimes appended. TODO: Describe details.

End node: RB_Evictor node describing an individual believed to be
responsible for instigating the eviction.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| multiple_sales_matches | [bool](#bool) |  | todo clarify semantics. |






<a name="graph.EvictionAtRelationData"></a>

### EvictionAtRelationData
Relation type: EVICTION_AT

Associates an SF Rent Board eviction record with the dwelling from which
one or more tenants were evicted.

Start node: RB_Eviction node describing SF Rent Board eviction record,
keyed by unique id. See caveat on eviction id&#39;s in comments for
EvictedByRelationData, above.

End node: A_Parcel node, describing a parcel from SF Assessor
records, keyed by the parcel&#39;s unique &#34;block lot&#34;.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| multiple_addr_matches | [bool](#bool) |  | todo clarify semantics. |






<a name="graph.ListedAtRelationData"></a>

### ListedAtRelationData
Relation type: LISTED_AT

Describes an address associated with a business entity in Secretary of
state records.

TODO: Clarify the semantic meaning of this address; I believe it&#39;s a
mailing address but need to confirm.

Start node: SOS_Corp or SOS_LP node, identified by its unique normalized
business name in the California Sec. of State business registry.

End node: Address_Unit describing a unit-level address at which
this business entity can be contacted.

Empty as of 2020/12/29, as the relation carries no data payload other than
the fact of its own presence.






<a name="graph.OfficerForRelationData"></a>

### OfficerForRelationData
Relation type: OFFICER_FOR

Indicates that one business entity is an officer for another business
entity (which seems pretty weird).

Start node: The &#39;serving&#39; SOS_LP or SOS_Corp node, identified by its
unique business name in the California Sec. of State business index.

End: The &#39;served at&#39; SOS_LP or SOS_Corp node, identified by the
same means as the start node.

Empty as of 2020/12/29, as the relation carries no data payload other than
the fact of its own presence.






<a name="graph.ParcOwnedByRelationData"></a>

### ParcOwnedByRelationData
Relation type: PARC_OWNED_BY

Describes a direct owner relationship between a parcel and an
individual/entity that&#39;s listed as an owner via assessor property tax
records.

Start node: A_Parcel node from SF Assessor records, identified by &#39;block
lot&#39;.

End node: A_Parcel_Owner node from SF Assessor records, identified
by name directly in the documentation for the start node&#39;s real-estate
parcel.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| perc_owner | [int32](#int32) |  | Ownership percentage documented in SF Assessor records, expressed as an integer between 0 and 100, inclusive. |
| record_date | [string](#string) |  | Date in CCYYMMDD of the documents in SF Assessor records which demonstrate this ownership. |






<a name="graph.ParcelOwnerAtAddressRelationData"></a>

### ParcelOwnerAtAddressRelationData
Relation type: PARC_OWNER_ADDR_AT

Indicates that a parcel owner can be reached at this mailing address.

TODO: Clarify whether this indicates the address was listed as
owner-occupied, as this may be relevant information.

Start node: A_Parcel_Owner node, describing a property owner identified by
name in SF Assessor records.

End node: Address_Unit node representing a resolved street address, with
unit number if applicable. SF Assessor records indicate that the owner can
be contacted by mail at this address.

Empty as of 2020/12/29, as the relation carries no data payload other than
the fact of its own presence.






<a name="graph.UnitAtRelationData"></a>

### UnitAtRelationData
Relation type: UNIT_AT

Indicates that an Address_Unit node correponds to the main parcel address
at Address_Main.

This edge exists even for addresses which contain only a single unit. The
reason is that &#39;Address_Main&#39; nodes conceptually represent the entire set
of possible units at that street address, whereas &#39;Address_Unit&#39; nodes
represent a resolved address that can actually be contacted. Single-unit
addresses are considered to be a special case where there happens to be a
one-to-one correspondence between the two.

Start node: Address_Unit node representing a definite, contactable address
complete with unit number. TODO: Describe formatting of that node&#39;s key.

End node: Address_Main node, identified by an address with the unit
information scrubbed, which represents all potential units at that street
address. TODO: Describe formatting of that node&#39;s key.

Empty as of 2020/12/29, as the relation carries no data payload other than
the fact of its own presence.

server/schemas/legacy/md-generated/query/docs.md

# Evictorbook Query Abstraction Layer Documentation
<a name="top"></a>

### Note for readers

The documentation featured below was originally written in a format called 'proto', and then converted to Markdown. proto is a schema definition language that's intended to be both machine-readable and developer-readable. The motivation is to declare the machine-readable schema directly alongside human-readable comments, in the same file, so the canonical documentation always matches the schema enforced in code. The disadvantage is that .proto syntax requires some getting used to.

In order to produce a more user-friendly and widely readable documentation, we use an automated tool to convert the 'proto' files into Markdown. The text descriptions here are imported directly from the comments in the 'proto' files. This introduces some quirks in formatting (for example, multi-line comments are compressed into a single line in order to fit into the Markdown tables below). Let us know how we did; the Markdown formatting is a work in progress, so let us know if you have suggestions to improve this formatting or make it more readable.

That's the disclaimer. Read on for the documentation.

## Table of Contents

- [query.proto](#query.proto)
    - [EvictorbookQueriesAsService](#query.EvictorbookQueriesAsService)

    - [BusinessEntityIndexRecord](#query.BusinessEntityIndexRecord)

    - [CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryResult](#query.CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryResult)
    - [EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryParams](#query.EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryParams)
    - [EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryResult](#query.EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryResult)
    - [NetworkBusinessEntityQueryParams](#query.NetworkBusinessEntityQueryParams)
    - [NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult](#query.NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult)

    - [NetworkParcelQueryResult](#query.NetworkParcelQueryResult)

<a name="query.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## query.proto
query.proto

proto messages describing the neo4j CYPHER queries used at runtime by the
ebook node server. these definitions serve as a query abstraction layer.

this serves dual purposes:

first, they offer a clear reference point for developers seeking to
understand the runtime queries.

second, they offer a clear point of integration so the server&#39;s js business
logic can be written and tested independently of the live database. see
usage in server/rest/routes/dbRouteListeners.js.

this strategy is effective for building resilience into systems that rely on
interpreted query languages.



<a name="query.EvictorbookQueriesAsService"></a>

### EvictorbookQueriesAsService
description of ebook&#39;s query abstraction layer.

don&#39;t worry about the &#39;service&#39; and &#39;rpc&#39; syntax. all we&#39;re doing here is
conceptualizing the eb node server&#39;s query interface with the neo4j database.

we won&#39;t actually be invoking these queries with the proto library&#39;s &#34;service&#34; functionality, though if we wanted to, we could implement a wrapper to do just that. this is just a helpful framework for collecting together a list of &#39;param&#39; and &#39;result&#39; messages.

this is also very useful for documenting REST apis, as we can apply the proto type definitions to type-checking the request and response payloads, whatever format they&#39;re written in (json, etc.).

corp / lp / business queries:

| Method Name | Request Type | Response Type | Description |
| ----------- | ------------ | ------------- | ------------|
| CalSOSCorporationQuery | [CalSOSCorporationQueryParams](#query.CalSOSCorporationQueryParams) | [CalSOSCorporationQueryResult](#query.CalSOSCorporationQueryResult) | query corporation info by normalized business name. |
| CalSOSLimitedBusinessQuery | [CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryParams](#query.CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryParams) | [CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryResult](#query.CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryResult) | query limited partnership / llc info by normalized business name.  TODO: combine this with the &#39;corporation&#39; query to make a single query which could handle both cases. alternatively, it may be simpler to implement that at the web service level in the node runtime. |
| EvictionsByNeighborhoodQuery | [EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryParams](#query.EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryParams) | [EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryResult](#query.EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryResult) | query details for individual evictions, filtered by neighborhood.  TODO: extend or replace with a query that allows for other filters. |
| SFParcelLegacyQuery | [SFParcelLegacyQueryParams](#query.SFParcelLegacyQueryParams) | [SFParcelLegacyQueryResult](#query.SFParcelLegacyQueryResult) | DEPRECATED. prefer more specific parcel queries below.  get details about a parcel from sf assessor records, keyed by the parcel&#39;s block lot identifier, as well as info about evictions at the property, suspected owners, etc.  rest api route: &#39;api/parcel/&lt;BLOCK_LOT&gt;&#39; query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/legacy.js |
| SFParcelDetailsQuery | [SFParcelDetailsQueryParams](#query.SFParcelDetailsQueryParams) | [SFParcelDetailsQueryResult](#query.SFParcelDetailsQueryResult) | get details about a parcel from sf assessor records, keyed by block_lot.  rest api route: &#39;api/parcel/&lt;BLOCK_LOT&gt;/details&#39; query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/details.js |
| SFParcelEvictionsQuery | [SFParcelEvictionsQueryParams](#query.SFParcelEvictionsQueryParams) | [SFParcelEvictionsQueryResult](#query.SFParcelEvictionsQueryResult) | get details about evictions which occurred at a given parcel, keyed by block_lot.  rest api route: &#39;api/parcel/&lt;BLOCK_LOT&gt;/evictions&#39; query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/evictions.js |
| SFParcelOwnersQuery | [SFParcelOwnersQueryParams](#query.SFParcelOwnersQueryParams) | [SFParcelOwnersQueryResult](#query.SFParcelOwnersQueryResult) | get info about individuals, businesses, and/or trusts believed to own the parcel in full or in part.  rest api route: &#39;api/parcel/&lt;BLOCK_LOT&gt;/owners&#39; query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/owners.js |
| SFParcelNetworksQuery | [SFParcelNetworksQueryParams](#query.SFParcelNetworksQueryParams) | [SFParcelNetworksQueryResult](#query.SFParcelNetworksQueryResult) | get info about real-estate business networks believed to have a stake in this parcel, as well as other parcels which those networks may have a vested interest in.  NOTE: performance bottleneck, invoke with caution.  rest api route: &#39;api/parcel/&lt;BLOCK_LOT&gt;/networks&#39; query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/networks.js |
| NetworkBusinessEntityQuery | [NetworkBusinessEntityQueryParams](#query.NetworkBusinessEntityQueryParams) | [NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult](#query.NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult) | given a network_id and a business entity which belongs to that network, return a local view of the network centered around that business. |
| NetworkParcelQuery | [NetworkParcelQueryParams](#query.NetworkParcelQueryParams) | [NetworkParcelQueryResult](#query.NetworkParcelQueryResult) | given a network_id and a parcel block_lot which is under that network&#39;s influence, return a view of the network centered around that parcel. |
| BusinessEntityIndexSearch | [BusinessEntityIndexSearchParams](#query.BusinessEntityIndexSearchParams) | [BusinessEntityIndexSearchResult](#query.BusinessEntityIndexSearchResult) | used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based index lookup on business entities (both &#39;corp&#39; and &#39;lp&#39;) by normalized name.  TODO: extend or replace with more robust/flexible search algorithm. |
| ParcelIndexSearch | [ParcelIndexSearchParams](#query.ParcelIndexSearchParams) | [ParcelIndexSearchResult](#query.ParcelIndexSearchResult) | used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based lookup on sf assessor parcel records on lot-level address strings.  TODO: extend or replace with more robust/flexible search algorithm. |

<a name="query.BusinessEntityIndexRecord"></a>

### BusinessEntityIndexRecord
a single business entity search result.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| \_\_typename | [string](#string) |  | the type name of the ebook graph node representing this business, &#34;SOS_Corp&#34; or &#34;SOS_LP&#34;.  included explicitly, so that the calling code can distinguish between corporation and limited-business nodes. |
| name_norm | [string](#string) |  | the business entity&#39;s name, after normalization. this name can be used as a query parameter for retrieving information about a corporation or limited-business.  todo: document the normalization scheme. |






<a name="query.BusinessEntityIndexSearchParams"></a>

### BusinessEntityIndexSearchParams
business entity search. queries are interpreted as a prefix-tree search on
the normalized set of business entity names.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| query | [string](#string) |  |  |






<a name="query.BusinessEntityIndexSearchResult"></a>

### BusinessEntityIndexSearchResult
aggregation of matching search records. this would be a good place to add
pagination tokens or other metadata about the results.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| records | list< [BusinessEntityIndexRecord](#query.BusinessEntityIndexRecord) > |  | list of individual matching records. |






<a name="query.CalSOSCorporationQueryParams"></a>

### CalSOSCorporationQueryParams
parameters for cal sos corporation query.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| search_string | [string](#string) |  | normalized name of the business, derived from the name found in california sec. of state business records. must be an exact string match. |






<a name="query.CalSOSCorporationQueryResult"></a>

### CalSOSCorporationQueryResult
query result:


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| be_details | [CalSOSCorporationDetails](#query.CalSOSCorporationDetails) |  | details about the business (founding date, filing number, mailing address, officers, etc.) |
| parcels_owned | list< [BusinessOwnedParcelInfo](#query.BusinessOwnedParcelInfo) > |  | details about parcels which are directly owned by this business. |
| evictions | list< [SFRBEvictionMetadata](#query.SFRBEvictionMetadata) > |  | evictions via sf rent board that may have been instigated by this business (alone or w/ other agents). includes id numbers for further lookup.  ellis act withdrawal evictions include names of plaintiffs. |
| network_parcels | list< [NetworkedParcelInfo](#query.NetworkedParcelInfo) > |  | parcels which this corporation may have a financial interest in, via business connections. corporate networks are inferred by ebook graph analysis. |






<a name="query.CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryParams"></a>

### CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryParams
Corresponds to the query defined in server/rest/handlers/lp.js

given the normalized name of a limited business (limited partnership or
limited liability corporation) from calif sec. of state business registry,
get detailed info about that business and its observed real-estate
holdings in sf.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| search_string | [string](#string) |  | Normalized name of the business, derived from the name found in California Sec. of State business records. |






<a name="query.CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryResult"></a>

### CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryResult
Query result:


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| be_details | [CalSOSLimitedBusinessDetails](#query.CalSOSLimitedBusinessDetails) |  | Details about the limited partnership or llc in question. |
| parcels_owned | list< [BusinessOwnedParcelInfo](#query.BusinessOwnedParcelInfo) > |  | Details about parcels which are directly owned by this business entity. |
| evictions | list< [SFRBEvictionMetadata](#query.SFRBEvictionMetadata) > |  | Brief description of evictions from the SF Rent Board which this business entity may have instigated (alone or with other agents). Includes id numbers for further lookup, and in the case of an Ellis Act Withdrawal includes the names of the plaintiff(s). |
| network_parcels | list< [NetworkedParcelInfo](#query.NetworkedParcelInfo) > |  | Descriptions of parcels which, though not directly owned by this business entity, may be owned by another entity that it&#39;s related to through a real-estate holding network. The networks are identified by the evictorbook pipeline via connected component analysis. |






<a name="query.EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryParams"></a>

### EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryParams
corresponds to query in server/rest/handlers/neighborhood.js

given the name of a neighborhood in san francisco, retrieves detailed
information about all the evictions from evictorbook datastore which occured
within that neighborhood&#39;s boundaries.

TODO: explore alternate pagination api&#39;s (continuation token?)

query parameters:


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | neighorhood name. must be exact match. |
| page | [int32](#int32) |  | pagination. if set nonzero, show the nth page of results. if zero or unset, query will return the first page. |
| size | [int32](#int32) |  | pagination. if set nonzero, result pages are have this many entries. must be set &gt;= 1 if pages is set. |






<a name="query.EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryResult"></a>

### EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryResult
query result:


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| evictions | list< [SFRBEvictionMetadata](#query.SFRBEvictionMetadata) > |  | details about evictions which occurred on a property in this neighborhood. includes info derived during ebook data analysis, plus info about the parcel where the eviction occurred. |






<a name="query.NetworkBusinessEntityQueryParams"></a>

### NetworkBusinessEntityQueryParams
params in server/rest/handlers/network.js &#39;business&#39; query.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| be_name | [string](#string) |  | normalized name of the business, derived from the name found in california sec. of state business records. |
| input_type | [string](#string) |  | &#34;corp&#34; or &#34;lp&#34;, depending on whether the business is a corporation or limited-partnership/llc. |






<a name="query.NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult"></a>

### NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult
result of server/rest/handlers/network.js &#39;business&#39; query.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| name_norm | [string](#string) |  | normalized name of the business, matching be_name parameter from input. |
| network_subgraph | list< [GraphRelation](#query.GraphRelation) > |  | list of graph relations (edges) which make up a connected subgraph of the ebook graph, representing the business network and its elements.  each item here contains full descriptions of the relation&#39;s source and destination node, so the caller can reconstruct the subgraph.  COMPATIBILITY NOTE: this proto message differs from neo4j driver object schemas, so conversion is required. see comments on GraphRelation definition. |
| total_bes | [int32](#int32) |  | total count of business entities which appear in this network (including both corporations and limited-partnerships/llc&#39;s). |
| top_bes | list< [NormalizedName](#query.NormalizedName) > |  | normalized names of most-connected business in the network. (SOS_Corp or SOS_LP nodes with highest degree).  optional field \_\_typename is set, so caller can disambiguate between business types. returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12. |
| top_owners | list< [NormalizedName](#query.NormalizedName) > |  | normalized names of owners-of-businesses most connected in the graph (SOS_Owner nodes with matching network_id, with highest degree). these owners can be individuals, or other businesses. returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12. optional field &#39;\_\_typename&#39; is NOT set.  see SOS_Owner node / CalSOSOwnerData in graph/nodes.proto. |
| top_addrs | list< [ReadableAddress](#query.ReadableAddress) > |  | readable addresses which are the most well-connected in the graph. (Address_Unit nodes with matching network_id with highest degree). returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12.  TODO: describe what causes these addresses to be considered for inclusion. clarify if they&#39;re physical addresses of component businesses/owners of the network, or real-estate properties held by the network. see Address_Unit node / AddressUnitData in graph/nodes.proto. |






<a name="query.NetworkParcelQueryParams"></a>

### NetworkParcelQueryParams
params in server/rest/handlers/network.js &#39;parcel&#39; query.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | the block_lot of a parcel, which uniquely identifies it in the ebook graph and in sf assessor records. required. |






<a name="query.NetworkParcelQueryResult"></a>

### NetworkParcelQueryResult
result of server/rest/handlers/network.js &#39;parcel&#39; query.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | string representing the parcel&#39;s street address, including street number, street name and suffix, and unit number. The parcel is assumed to be within SF city/county limits.  See &#39;addr&#39; in A_Parcel node as described by SFAssessorParcelData in graph/nodes.proto. |
| network_subgraph | list< [GraphRelation](#query.GraphRelation) > |  | list of graph relations (edges) which make up a connected subgraph of the ebook graph, representing the business network and its elements.  each item here contains full descriptions of the relation&#39;s source and destination node, so the caller can reconstruct the subgraph.  COMPATIBILITY NOTE: this proto message differs from neo4j driver object schemas, so conversion is required. see comments on GraphRelation definition. |
| total_bes | [int32](#int32) |  | total count of business entities which appear in this network (including both corporations and limited-partnerships/llc&#39;s). |
| top_bes | list< [NormalizedName](#query.NormalizedName) > |  | see comment in NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult above. |
| top_owners | list< [NormalizedName](#query.NormalizedName) > |  | see comment in NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult above. |
| top_addrs | list< [ReadableAddress](#query.ReadableAddress) > |  | see comment in NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult above. |






<a name="query.ParcelIndexRecord"></a>

### ParcelIndexRecord
an individual parcel search result.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | the street address component of this parcel&#39;s physical address.  todo: clarify whether this is lot-level address or unit-level. |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | the parcel&#39;s block lot number, which uniquely identifies a parcel in the sf assessor&#39;s data. |






<a name="query.ParcelIndexSearchParams"></a>

### ParcelIndexSearchParams
parcel search. query is implemented as a prefix-tree search on the parcels&#39;
lot-level address strings.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| query | [string](#string) |  | prefix string for an sf assessor parcel&#39;s lot-level address, as it appears in normalized form in the ebook dataset.

todo: clarify formatting and the role of unit number. |






<a name="query.ParcelIndexSearchResult"></a>

### ParcelIndexSearchResult
aggregation of parcel search results.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| records | list< [ParcelIndexRecord](#query.ParcelIndexRecord) > |  | list of individual matching records. |

| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| search_string | [string](#string) |  | block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records. exact string match only. |






<a name="query.SFParcelLegacyQueryResult"></a>

### SFParcelLegacyQueryResult
result in server/rest/handlers/parcel/legacy.js


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| parcel_details | [SFAssessorParcelDetails](#query.SFAssessorParcelDetails) |  | detailed info about the parcel (location, physical properties, etc.). |
| owners | list< [SFAssessorParcelOwner](#query.SFAssessorParcelOwner) > |  | individuals, businesses, trusts, etc., which are believed to own the parcel in full or in part. |
| evictions | list< [SFRBEvictionMetadata](#query.SFRBEvictionMetadata) > |  | info about evictions believed to have occurred on the propert(y/ies) on this parcel. |
| network_parcels | list< [NetworkedParcelInfo](#query.NetworkedParcelInfo) > |  | brief decsriptions of parcels which may be related through business relations among parcel owners. |
| possible_networks | list< [NetworkLocationInfo](#query.NetworkLocationInfo) > |  | identifiers for real-estate business networks which the parcel may be associated with. |

| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| search_string | [string](#string) |  | block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records. exact string match only. |






<a name="query.SFParcelNetworksQueryResult"></a>

### SFParcelNetworksQueryResult
result in server/rest/handlers/parcel/networks.js


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| owners | list< [SFAssessorParcelOwner](#query.SFAssessorParcelOwner) > |  | individuals or businesses believed to own the parcel, in full or in part.

owner info is required for interpreting best network_id&#39;s downstream. |
| network_parcels | list< [NetworkedParcelInfo](#query.NetworkedParcelInfo) > |  | brief decsriptions of parcels which may be related through business relations among parcel owners. |
| possible_networks | list< [NetworkLocationInfo](#query.NetworkLocationInfo) > |  | identifiers for real-estate business networks which the parcel may be associated with. |






<a name="query.SFParcelOwnersQueryParams"></a>

| Field | Type | Label | Description |

<a name="query.SFParcelOwnersQueryResult"></a>

### SFParcelOwnersQueryResult
result in server/rest/handlers/parcel/owners.js


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |

<a name="business.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## business.proto
query/business.proto

contains messages related to corporations and other businesses from the
calif sec. of state business registry, as they appear in ebook&#39;s query
abstraction layer.


<a name="query.CalSOSCorporationDetails"></a>

### CalSOSCorporationDetails
fields in this message correspond to fields of the same name in SOS_Corp
vertices in the neo4j schema. proto messages describing that schema are
found in the graph/ directory.

as of 2020/09/26, this is a direct clone of the graph node schema, with one
exception: this message is missing the normalized corporation name
&#39;name_norm&#39;, which serves as a unique key. although the two are currently
very similar, we prefer to define two separate messages to allow for the
schema and the query abstraction to evolve independently.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| transaction_date | [string](#string) |  | transaction date of the document which established this corporation, according to the california secretary of state business registry.  format: &#39;CCMMYYDD&#39;. |
| corporation_number | [string](#string) |  | an 8 digit corporate identification number, from the california secretary of state business registry. |
| incorporation_date | [string](#string) |  | date on which this corporation was incorporated, according to the california secretary of state business registry. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| corporation_status | [string](#string) |  | status of the corporation, as a string containing a code from calif. sec. of state business entity records. The values are described as follows in the database schema documentation:  1 = Active 2 = Suspended 3 = Canceled 4 = Surrendered 5 = Term expired 6 = Dissolved 7 = Forfeited 8 = Deleted 9 = Inactive C = Merged Out E = State to Federal Bank Conversion F = Conditionally dissolved (No tax clearance) Not sure about code = Converted Out |
| corporation_type | [string](#string) |  | description of the legal process used to establish this corporation, according to Calif. Sec. of state records. The allowed values and their meanings are listed below.  ARTS = Articles of Incorporation S&amp;DC = Statement &amp; Designation By Foreign Corporation S&amp;DA = Statement &amp; Designation By Foreign Association FNRE = Foreign Name Registration |
| corporation_tax_base | [string](#string) |  | description of the tax-base of the corporation, according to calif. sec. of state records. this indicates whether a corporation is for-profit or non-profit.  S = Stock N = Non-Stock (Nonprofit) |
| corporation_classification | [string](#string) |  | additional corporate classifications which may convey special status, such as &#39;religious&#39; or &#39;agricultural cooperative&#39; according to calif. sec. of state business entity records.  G = Agricultural Cooperative CR = Credit Union MU = Mutual Benefit OC = Other Cooperative PB = Public Benefit RE = Religious SL = Corporation Sole UN = Unclassified |
| term_expiration_date | [string](#string) |  | limited term expiration date. TODO: describe what this means. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| ftb_suspension_status | [string](#string) |  | describes whether this corporation is in good standing with the california franchise tax board (ftb).  â€˜ â€˜ (Blank) = Not Suspended (In Good Standing) F = Forfeited S = Suspended |
| ftb_suspension_date | [string](#string) |  | if this corporation has been subject to action by the franchise tax board as described in &#39;ftb_suspension_status&#39;, then this field contains a string representation of the date of that action.  format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| so_file_number | [string](#string) |  | statement of information file number, per calif sec of state records. |
| so_file_date | [string](#string) |  | last complete statement (of information?) file date. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| corporation_name | [string](#string) |  | name of corporation, directly from calif. sec. of state records without normalization. |
| co_name | [string](#string) |  | &#39;care of&#39; name, meaning the &#39;c/o&#39; addressee which should be included on mail intended for the corporation. |
| agent_name | [string](#string) |  | name of agent of process, as it appears on mailing address. |
| agent_address_line_1 | [string](#string) |  | mailing address for agent of process, line 1. |
| agent_address_line_2 | [string](#string) |  | mailing address for agent of process, line 2. |
| agent_address_city | [string](#string) |  | city component of agent of process&#39;s mailing address. |
| agent_address_state_county | [string](#string) |  | todo: clarify what this means. is it state or county? or both???? |
| agent_address_zip_code | [string](#string) |  | todo: clarify whether these are 5-digit or 9-digit postal codes. |
| state_or_foreign_country | [string](#string) |  | if the corporation is not &#39;domestic&#39; (internal to calif.), then this field specified a u.s. state other than california, or a country outside the u.s., where this corporation originated. |
| c_id | [int64](#int64) |  | business entity component id, generated by the evictorbook data pipeline via connected component analysis.  See comments inline in BusinessNetworkIdentifier from network.proto for a detailed explanation. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | parcel ownership network component id, generated by the evictorbook data pipeline via connected component analysis.  SOS_Corp, SOS_LP, and SOS_Owner vertices are required to have a network_id, and Address_Unit vertices may optionally have a network_id.   See comments inline in BusinessNetworkIdentifier from network.proto for a detailed explanation. |






<a name="query.CalSOSLimitedBusinessDetails"></a>

### CalSOSLimitedBusinessDetails
closely follows CalSOSLimitedBusinessData in the graph proto defintion.
we define a message here, to allow for the graph schema and the query
abstraction to evolve separately.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| jurisdiction_llc | [string](#string) |  | llc only: state or county for formation of foreign llc.  TODO: confirm/deny that this is unset for messages representing limited partnerships. |
| llc_management_code | [string](#string) |  | llc only: management structure.  1 = One Manager M = More Than One Manager A = All Members are Managers  todo: confirm/deny that this is unset for messages representing limited partnerships. |
| llc_type_of_business | [string](#string) |  | llc only: type of business. todo: provide examples. todo: confirm/deny that this is unset for messages representing limited partnerships. |
| file_number | [string](#string) |  | the filing number of the business entity, which is derived from the date on which its filing paperwork was filed. the number is presented as a string, with the format described below:  format: &#39;CCYYJJJN9999&#39; CCYY = century and year JJJ = julian day of year N = record type: 0 = lp record 1 = llc record 9999 = sequence number |
| file_date | [string](#string) |  | date of original filing for this business. represents the same calendar date as the date component of file_number, but follows a different format. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| status | [string](#string) |  | identifies current status of lp/llc, as represented in calif. sec. of state business entity records.   A : active B : dishonored check C : canceled D : dissolved P : pending cancellation F : franchise tax board (ftb) suspended/forfeited M : merged out O : converted out S : secretary of state (sos) suspended/forfeited 2 : sos/ftb suspended/forfeited |
| filing_type | [string](#string) |  | filing type (foreign or domestic) of this lp or llc, as represented in calif. sec. of state business entity registry.   todo: clarify behavior for partnerships that originate from other u.s. states. todo: clarify the precise values that can be returned by the database. |
| name | [string](#string) |  | the raw, non-normalized name of this calif. limited partnership or llc, as represented in calif. sec. of state business entity registry. |
| jurisdiction | [string](#string) |  | state or country of formation for foreign limited partnerships. |
| agent_name | [string](#string) |  | name of agent of process, as it appears on mailing address. |
| agent_address_1 | [string](#string) |  | mailing address for agent of process, line 1.  CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| agent_address_2 | [string](#string) |  | mailing address for agent of process, line 2.  CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| agent_city | [string](#string) |  | city component of agent of process&#39;s mailing address.  CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| agent_state | [string](#string) |  | component of agent of process&#39;s mailing address.  CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| agent_zip | [string](#string) |  | todo: clarify whether these are 5-digit or 9-digit postal codes.  CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| term | [string](#string) |  | cause of termination, if this lp/llc has been terminated. todo: add examples. |
| c_id | [int64](#int64) |  | business entity component id, generated by the evictorbook data pipeline via connected component analysis.  see comments inline in BusinessNetworkIdentifier from network.proto for a detailed explanation. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | parcel ownership network component id, generated by the evictorbook data pipeline via connected component analysis.  SOS_Corp, SOS_LP, and SOS_Owner nodes are required to have a network_id, and Address_Unit nodes may optionally have a network_id. 

see comments inline in BusinessNetworkIdentifier from network.proto for a detailed explanation. |





 

 

 

 



<a name="eviction.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## eviction.proto
query/eviction.proto

contains messages related to eviction records as they appear in the
query-layer abstraction of ebook&#39;s serving js.


<a name="query.SFRBEvictionMetadata"></a>

### SFRBEvictionMetadata
consolidated info about an eviction in sf rent board records. 

as of 2020/09/26, there are two flavors of eviction structs in ebook
queries. this message describes the union of those structs, and is used to
represent both.

eviction details in location-based query results (neighborhood.js) include
info about the attributed evictor and their business network.

that info is not present in business-based query results (corp.js, et al),
so those fields are left unset. see comments inline.

////////////////////////////////////////////////////
fields describing the eviction record itself:
////////////////////////////////////////////////////


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| evict_id | [string](#string) |  | unique id for RB_Eviction nodes in ebook dataset.  this is typically derived from sf rent board&#39;s petition id, but is *NOT* equivalent. DO NOT USE THIS FOR DIRECT COMPARISON TO SFRB RECORDS. |
| evict_date | [string](#string) |  | date on which this eviction took effect, according to public records. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39;. |
| type | [string](#string) |  | type of eviction, for example &#34;Buyout Declaration&#34; or &#34;Ellis Act Withdrawal&#34;. todo: document supported values for this field. |
| ellis_evictor | [string](#string) |  | attributed evictors according to ellis act withdrawal records. only populated for evictions of type &#34;Ellis Act Withdrawal&#34;  todo verify semantics. ad-hoc testing on april 2020 dataset shows a list of multiple ellis evictors, which appear to be derived from interpreting a string as a comma-separated list. As of 2020/09/26, the relationship between this string and the ebook is not well documented. |
| multiple_sales_matches | [bool](#bool) |  | a property of the EVICTED_BY relation connecting an SOS_Corp node with this eviction&#39;s RB_Eviction node.  todo: document what this field means. |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | block_lot of the parcel where this eviction tool place. uniquely specifies a parcel in sf assessor records. unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database. |
| units | [double](#double) |  | num. units at the parcel where this eviction took place (via assessor records). |
| lat | [double](#double) |  | latitude (in degrees) of a point within the boundaries of the parcel where this eviction took place. |
| long | [double](#double) |  | longitude (in degrees) of a point within the boundaries of the parcel where this eviction took place. |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | street address of the parcel where this eviction took place (via assessor records). see &#39;addr&#39; field of DirectlyOwnedParcelInfo. |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | name of the neighorhood that encompasses the parcel where this eviction took place (via assessor records). see &#39;neighborhood&#39; field of DirectlyOwnedParcelInfo. |
| multiple_addr_matches | [bool](#bool) |  | a property of the EVICTION_AT relation connecting this eviction to a parcel record in the ebook dataset. todo: document what this field means. |
| name | [string](#string) |  | only set when this eviction is part of a location-based query (ex: neighborhood lookup). when set, contains the name of an attributed evictor, or &#34;Unknown&#34; if there are no attributed evictors.  when this message is part of a business-info query result, name is unset. |
| linked_be | [BusinessNetworkIdentifier](#query.BusinessNetworkIdentifier) |  | contains id&#39;s used to refer to a business holding network. only set when eviction message is part of a location-based query (ex: lookup by neighborhood). unset when this message appears in a business-info query result. |





 

 

 

 



<a name="graph_util.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## graph_util.proto
query/graph_util.proto

contains helper messages for describing neo4j graphs.


<a name="query.GraphNode"></a>

### GraphNode
representation of a node in the graph, including internal details
particular to the graph&#39;s instantiation.

based on the json schema of neo4j data driver&#39;s query results.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| identity | [int64](#int64) |  | internal graph db id for this node. |
| labels | list< [string](#string) > |  | the node types that this node has. in our graph, nodes always have a single type, as of 2021/03/12, but this may change in the future. |
| properties_json | [string](#string) |  | a json string representing a map of this node&#39;s properties, where the keys are the property names and the values are strings, numbers, or objects.
