NOTE: this field does not appear in the response objects returned by neo4j-driver.  in the neo4j driver&#39;s response, &#39;properties&#39; is a plain object. this is convenient for the programming api, but it means that the driver&#39;s query response can never be fully-type-safely specified as proto.  this is because the schema of &#39;properties&#39; is unpredictable (determined by the contents of the db). you could choose to represent it as a map of strings/bytes/Any/etc., but the native json representation of the proto wouldn&#39;t match the actual neo4j driver&#39;s response.  since we can&#39;t acheive perfect compatibility, the simplest strategy is to encode the &#39;properties&#39; object as json. callers should &#39;JSON.parse&#39; the value of &#39;properties_json&#39; into &#39;properties&#39; to achieve compatibility with the neo4j driver api.  similarly, callers should &#39;JSON.stringify&#39; the &#39;properties&#39; value of a neo4j driver response into &#39;properties_json&#39; to allow encoding as proto. |
| properties | [bytes](#bytes) |  | **Deprecated.** see above. the neo4j-driver object equivalent uses the name &#39;properties&#39;; to make conversion code clearer, don&#39;t reuse that name. |






<a name="query.GraphRelation"></a>

### GraphRelation
representation of a relation (edge) in the graph, including internal details
particular to the graph&#39;s instantiation. based on the js obj schema of
neo4j-driver&#39;s query results.

NOTE: a GraphRelation as described here contains the complete set of info
for both nodes that it connects! that means that storing a graph as a list
of these GraphRelation objects is inefficient, because the same node may be
described many times (once for each connecting edge).


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| start | [GraphNode](#query.GraphNode) |  | origin node of the relation. |
| end | [GraphNode](#query.GraphNode) |  | destination node of the relation. NOTE: as of 2021/03/12, edges are treated as though they bidirectional in ebook graph analysis. |
| type | [string](#string) |  | the relation/edge&#39;s type in the graph (&#34;ENTITY_OWNED_BY&#34;, etc.). |





 

 

 

 



<a name="network.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## network.proto
query/network.proto

type definitions for network analysis of businesses, property-holders, and
evictors in ebook serving query abstraction layer.


<a name="query.BusinessNetworkIdentifier"></a>

### BusinessNetworkIdentifier
id&#39;s used to refer to a real-estate holding network, as modeled by
analysis of the calif. sec. of state business registry.

see the developer guide for a detailed description of the evictorbook&#39;s
network connection methodology in the section &#34;Network Connection Method -
Detailed &gt; During DB Creation&#34;.

c_id assignment is described in step &#39;I&#39; of that section and network_id
assignment is described in step &#39;III&#39;.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| \_\_typename | [string](#string) |  | type of business record in ebook datastore (&#34;SOS_LP&#34;, &#34;SOS_Corp&#34;) from which this business information was extracted. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | business network id of this business in ebook datastore, as inferred by graph analysis. see graph schema documentation for details. |
| c_id | [int64](#int64) |  | connected component id of this business in ebook datastore, as inferred by graph analysis. all businesses with the same c_id must also have the same network_id, though two businesses with the same network_id may have different c_id&#39;s. see graph documentation and developer guide for details. |






<a name="query.NetworkLocationInfo"></a>

### NetworkLocationInfo
id and location characteristics of a real-estate business network.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr_readable | [string](#string) |  | an address in the ebook datastore where the central owning entity of a real-estate business network is believed to be located. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | network id of the real-estate business network believed to be headquartered at addr_readable. |





 

 

 

 



<a name="parcel.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## parcel.proto
query/parcel.proto

describes the CYPHER queries invoked at serving-time to retrieve
parcel-related information from the ebook datastore.


<a name="query.BusinessOwnedParcelInfo"></a>

### BusinessOwnedParcelInfo
consolidated info about a parcel, as presented from the context of the
business entity that owns the parcel.

as of 2020/09/26, this message mirrors the subquery in js commented with
&#34;get the parcels directly owned&#34;.

except for num_evictions, these fields correspond one-to-one to fields of
the same name in A_Parcel nodes. defining another message here instead of
attempting to reuse, so we can allow the schema and query interface boundary
to evolve independently.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | block lot string, which uniquely specifies a parcel in sf city and county assessor records. this is a unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database. |
| record_date | [string](#string) |  | date listed on the documents which record this corporation&#39;s ownership of the parcel, as recorded in the &#39;PARC_OWNED_BY&#39; relation that connects the A_Parcel node with the SOS_Corp node.  format: CCYYMMDD |
| perc_owner | [double](#double) |  | ownership percentage, as documented in the &#39;PARC_OWNED_BY&#39; relation connecting the A_Parcel node with the SOS_Corp node.  ownership percentage is expressed as an integer between 0 and 100, but returned as a floating point number. |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | a string representing the parcel&#39;s street address, including street number, street name and suffix, and unit number. the parcel is assumed to be within sf city/county limits. |
| num_evictions | [int32](#int32) |  | number of RB_Eviction nodes with an EVICTION_AT relationship to this parcel&#39;s A_Parcel node. |
| units | [double](#double) |  | number of units that this parcel consists of, according to sf city and county assessor records. |
| lat | [double](#double) |  | latitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries.  todo: formally specify bounds. |
| long | [double](#double) |  | longitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries.  todo: formally specify bounds. |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. as of 2020/09/26, it&#39;s assumed that all parcels are within sf city and county, so these are san francisco neighborhoods.  values correspond to names of the neighborhood polygons described at: https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4 |






<a name="query.NetworkedParcelInfo"></a>

### NetworkedParcelInfo
brief description of a parcel which is not directly owned by the corporation
being searched for, but which may be connected through real-estate holding
network of business entities and owners.

derived from the subquery commented &#34;// compile everything together for the
related parcels&#34; in server/rest/handlers/corp.js, as of 2020/09/26.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | address of the networked parcel, as derived from sf assessor records. |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | the block_lot of the parcel, primary key in ebook datastore and sf assessor records. |
| num_evictions | [int32](#int32) |  | total amount of evictions believed to have occurred at the networked property, which appear in ebook&#39;s datastore. no bounds on eviction date. |
| units | [int32](#int32) |  | number of units on the networked property (for multi-building properties, this is the sum total of units on the property). |
| lat | [double](#double) |  | latitude (in degrees) of a point within the networked property. |
| long | [double](#double) |  | longitude (in degrees) of a point within the networked property. |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. see SFAssessorParcelDetails for description of valid neighborhood names. |
| possible_networks | list< [NetworkLocationInfo](#query.NetworkLocationInfo) > |  | identifiers for real-estate business networks which the networked parcel may be associated with. in other words, these are networks with a second-degree relatinship to the original parcel. |
| owners | list< [NetworkedParcelOwner](#query.NetworkedParcelOwner) > |  | individuals, businesses, or other legal entities believed to own the networked parcel in whole or in part. |






<a name="query.NetworkedParcelOwner"></a>

### NetworkedParcelOwner
brief description of an individual, business, or trust, etc., which may own
a parcel associated with a real-estate business network.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| owner_name | [string](#string) |  | owner of the networked parcel, as it appears in that parcel&#39;s assessor records. |
| linked_be | [BusinessNetworkIdentifier](#query.BusinessNetworkIdentifier) |  | set when owner of the networked parcel is believed to be linked to a business entity/network. |
| ma_network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | set when mailing_address is believed to also be the cental mailing address of a real-estate business network central business&#39;s hq. in that case, it&#39;s the network id of the business network headquartered at that address. |
| mailing_address | [string](#string) |  | physical mailing address where the owner can be contacted, according to assessor records. |






<a name="query.SFAssessorParcelDetails"></a>

### SFAssessorParcelDetails
detailed info about a real-estate parcel from the sf assessor&#39;s office.

corresponds to the object returned by parcel/details.js.
originally derived from parcel_details subquery in parcel.js (deprecated).


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| yr_built | [int32](#int32) |  | year in which the buildings on this real-estate parcel were first constructed. TODO: describe behavior for multi-building parcels. |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | string containing parcel&#39;s street address, including street number, street name and suffix, and unit number. parcel is assumed to be within sf city/county limits.  notes from schema definition sheet: full address in the format of &#34;ST_START_NO-ST_END_NO ST_NAME ST_TYPE (Unit UNIT)&#34; (w/o end no if no address range, w/o parentheses if no unit) |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | &#39;block_lot&#39; identifier. unique key for a parcel in sf assessor records, and uniqye key for A_Parcel nodes in the database. |
| lat | [double](#double) |  | latitude in degrees of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries.  TODO: specify bounds. |
| long | [double](#double) |  | longitude in degrees of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries.  TODO: specify bounds. |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. as of 2020/09/26, it&#39;s assumed that all parcels are within sf city and county, so these are san francisco neighborhoods.  neighborhoods assigned using sf polygons.  names and polygon boundaries: https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4 |
| rent_controlled | [int32](#int32) |  | rough assessment of this parcel&#39;s rent-control status.  0 (default) if data unavailable to determine rent controlled status, 1 if likely rent controlled, 2 if doubtful that this is rent controlled |
| prop_class_code | [string](#string) |  | property class code, via sf assessor&#39;s office. definitons: https://data.sfgov.org/Housing-and-Buildings/Reference-Assessor-Recorder-Property-Class-Codes/pa56-ek2h/data |
| zone | [string](#string) |  | i.d. for the zoning district this parcel occupies. sf zoning district definitions: https://sfplanninggis.org/pim/map.html?layers=Zoning%20Districts |
| stories | [int32](#int32) |  | how tall is the building on this parcel, in stories. TODO: behavior for multi-building parcels? |
| units | [int32](#int32) |  | number of physical units within this logical real-estate parcel. |
| rooms | [int32](#int32) |  | number of total rooms within buildings on this parcel (for multi-unit parcels, this is the sum of rooms among all units.) |
| beds | [int32](#int32) |  | number of total bedrooms on this parcel (for multi-unit parcels, this is the sum of bedrooms among all units.) |
| assess_land_val | [int32](#int32) |  | assessor valuation of the &#39;land&#39; base value, i.e. the parcel&#39;s theoretical value if it had no buildings on it. |
| assess_imp_val | [int32](#int32) |  | assessor valuation of the &#39;improvement&#39; done to the land via development, as of most recent assessment. units in u.s. dollars. |
| assess_val_date | [string](#string) |  | date when the parcel&#39;s value was last assessed. format: CCYYMMDD |
| update_date | [string](#string) |  | date on which this parcel&#39;s address was last updated, via assessor records. format: CCYYMMDD |
| curr_sales_price | [int32](#int32) |  | units in u.s. dollars. TODO: document when and how this gets populated. |
| curr_sales_date | [string](#string) |  | format: CCYYMMDD TODO: document when and how this gets populated. |
| parc_start_no | [int32](#int32) |  | if the logical parcel occupies more than one street number, then this field contains the lowest street number in that range.  if the logical parcel occupies only one street number, then this field contains that number.  TODO: why no parc_end_no field? |
| parc_street_name | [string](#string) |  | main name part of the street/route name of the parcel&#39;s address. (ex: &#34;geary&#34;, &#34;first&#34;, &#34;taylor&#34;, etc.)  TODO: describe capitalization, stylization, etc. |
| parc_street_type | [string](#string) |  | street suffix (ex: &#34;st&#34;, &#34;ln&#34;) of the parcel&#39;s address.  TODO: describe capitalization, stylization, etc. |
| parc_unit_no | [string](#string) |  | unit or subpremise identifier. just the number or letter. |
| parc_zip | [int32](#int32) |  | five-digit u.s. postal code of the parcel&#39;s address, as an integer. |






<a name="query.SFAssessorParcelOwner"></a>

### SFAssessorParcelOwner
an owner, as seen in server/rest/handlers/parcel/owners.js.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| mailing_address | [string](#string) |  | physical mailing address where this owner can be reached, according to assessor parcel records. |
| record_date | [string](#string) |  | date this ownership was documented, as it appears in the PARC_OWNED_BY (ParcelOwnedBy) relation connecting the parcel node with an A_Parcel_Owner vertex.  format: CCYYMMDD |
| perc_owner | [int32](#int32) |  | ownership percentage, as a number between 0 and 100, as it appears in the PARC_OWNED_BY (ParcelOwnedBy) relation connecting the parcel node with an A_Parcel_Owner vertex. |
| owner_name | [string](#string) |  | name of owner listed on parcel records from SF assessor&#39;s office.  todo briefly describe how/whether this data was normalized. |
| linked_be | [BusinessNetworkIdentifier](#query.BusinessNetworkIdentifier) |  | id&#39;s used to refer to a real-estate holding network, as modeled by analysis of the calif. sec. of state business registry.  if &#39;linked_be&#39; is set to a non-empty message, then these id&#39;s describe the real-estate business network which our data indicates this owner is affiliated with. |





 

 

 

 






<a name="util.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## util.proto
query/util.proto

contains helper messages which are useful in the query abstraction layer
proto definitons.


<a name="query.NormalizedName"></a>

### NormalizedName
convience wrapper for normalized names.
semantically neutral, used in a variety of contexts.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| name_norm | [string](#string) |  | a normalized name, as it appears in the graph. |
| \_\_typename | [string](#string) |  | optional. node type of the graph node where this name_norm was found. typically set for names of business entities, where there is a need to differentiate between SOS_Corp and SOS_LP. |






<a name="query.ReadableAddress"></a>

### ReadableAddress
convenience wrapper for human-readable addresses.
TODO: describe normalization, etc.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr_readable | [string](#string) |  | readable/friendly representation of an address. normalization and internal structure may vary based on where this; check the containing message for details. |

server/schemas/legacy/md-generated/rest/docs.md

# Evictorbook Rest API 1.0 Documentation
<a name="top"></a>

### Note for readers

The documentation featured below was originally written in a format called 'proto', and then converted to Markdown. proto is a schema definition language that's intended to be both machine-readable and developer-readable. The motivation is to declare the machine-readable schema directly alongside human-readable comments, in the same file, so the canonical documentation always matches the schema enforced in code. The disadvantage is that .proto syntax requires some getting used to.

In order to produce a more user-friendly and widely readable documentation, we use an automated tool to convert the 'proto' files into Markdown. The text descriptions here are imported directly from the comments in the 'proto' files. This introduces some quirks in formatting (for example, multi-line comments are compressed into a single line in order to fit into the Markdown tables below). Let us know how we did; the Markdown formatting is a work in progress, so let us know if you have suggestions to improve this formatting or make it more readable.

That's the disclaimer. Read on for the documentation.

## Table of Contents

- [rest.proto](#rest.proto)
    - [EvictorbookRestService](#rest.EvictorbookRestService)

    - [BusinessEntitySearchRequest](#rest.BusinessEntitySearchRequest)
    - [BusinessEntitySearchResponse](#rest.BusinessEntitySearchResponse)
    - [GetCorpRequest](#rest.GetCorpRequest)
    - [GetCorpResponse](#rest.GetCorpResponse)
    - [GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodRequest](#rest.GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodRequest)
    - [GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodResponse](#rest.GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodResponse)
    - [GetLPRequest](#rest.GetLPRequest)
    - [GetLPResponse](#rest.GetLPResponse)
    - [GetNetworkBusinessEntityRequest](#rest.GetNetworkBusinessEntityRequest)
    - [GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse](#rest.GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse)
    - [GetNetworkParcelRequest](#rest.GetNetworkParcelRequest)
    - [GetNetworkParcelResponse](#rest.GetNetworkParcelResponse)
    - [GetParcelDetailsRequest](#rest.GetParcelDetailsRequest)
    - [GetParcelDetailsResponse](#rest.GetParcelDetailsResponse)
    - [GetParcelEvictionsRequest](#rest.GetParcelEvictionsRequest)
    - [GetParcelEvictionsResponse](#rest.GetParcelEvictionsResponse)
    - [GetParcelNetworksRequest](#rest.GetParcelNetworksRequest)
    - [GetParcelNetworksResponse](#rest.GetParcelNetworksResponse)
    - [GetParcelOwnersRequest](#rest.GetParcelOwnersRequest)
    - [GetParcelOwnersResponse](#rest.GetParcelOwnersResponse)
    - [GetParcelRequest](#rest.GetParcelRequest)
    - [GetParcelResponse](#rest.GetParcelResponse)
    - [ParcelSearchRequest](#rest.ParcelSearchRequest)
    - [ParcelSearchResponse](#rest.ParcelSearchResponse)
    - [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext)
  
- [business.proto](#business.proto)
    - [CorporationDetails](#rest.CorporationDetails)
    - [LimitedBusinessDetails](#rest.LimitedBusinessDetails)
  
- [eviction.proto](#eviction.proto)
    - [EvictionMetadata](#rest.EvictionMetadata)
  
- [graph_util.proto](#graph_util.proto)
    - [GraphNode](#rest.GraphNode)
    - [GraphRelation](#rest.GraphRelation)
  
- [network.proto](#network.proto)
    - [NetworkSummary](#rest.NetworkSummary)
  
- [network_ids.proto](#network_ids.proto)
    - [BusinessNetworkIdentifier](#rest.BusinessNetworkIdentifier)
    - [NetworkLocationInfo](#rest.NetworkLocationInfo)
  
- [parcel.proto](#parcel.proto)
    - [NetworkedParcelSummary](#rest.NetworkedParcelSummary)
    - [NetworkedParcelSummary.NetworkedParcelOwner](#rest.NetworkedParcelSummary.NetworkedParcelOwner)
    - [ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo](#rest.ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo)
    - [ParcelDetails](#rest.ParcelDetails)
    - [ParcelOwner](#rest.ParcelOwner)
  
- [util.proto](#util.proto)
    - [NormalizedName](#rest.NormalizedName)
    - [ReadableAddress](#rest.ReadableAddress)
    - [StringVector](#rest.StringVector)
  
- [Scalar Value Types](#scalar-value-types)

<a name="rest.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## rest.proto
rest.proto

top-level description of ebook rest api. describes the rest routes (rpc&#39;s),
and their request/response formats.

<a name="rest.EvictorbookRestService"></a>

### EvictorbookRestService


| Method Name | Request Type | Response Type | Description |
| ----------- | ------------ | ------------- | ------------|
| GetParcel | [GetParcelRequest](#rest.GetParcelRequest) | [GetParcelResponse](#rest.GetParcelResponse) | deprecated -- legacy endpoint, prefer more specific parcel calls below. rest api v1 route: &#39;api/parcel/:block_lot&#39; |
| GetParcelDetails | [GetParcelDetailsRequest](#rest.GetParcelDetailsRequest) | [GetParcelDetailsResponse](#rest.GetParcelDetailsResponse) | get details about a parcel from sf assessor records, keyed by block_lot. rest api v1 route: &#39;api/parcel/:block_lot/details&#39; |
| GetParcelEvictions | [GetParcelEvictionsRequest](#rest.GetParcelEvictionsRequest) | [GetParcelEvictionsResponse](#rest.GetParcelEvictionsResponse) | get details about evictions which occurred at a given parcel, keyed by block_lot. rest api v1 route: &#39;api/parcel/:block_lot/evictions&#39; |
| GetParcelNetworks | [GetParcelNetworksRequest](#rest.GetParcelNetworksRequest) | [GetParcelNetworksResponse](#rest.GetParcelNetworksResponse) | get info about real-estate business networks believed to have a stake in this parcel, as well as other parcels which those networks may have a vested interest in. NOTE: performance bottleneck, invoke with caution. rest api v1 route: &#39;api/parcel/:block_lot/networks&#39; |
| GetParcelOwners | [GetParcelOwnersRequest](#rest.GetParcelOwnersRequest) | [GetParcelOwnersResponse](#rest.GetParcelOwnersResponse) | get info about individuals, businesses, and/or trusts believed to own the parcel in full or in part. rest api v1 route: &#39;api/parcel/:block_lot/owners&#39; |
| GetCorp | [GetCorpRequest](#rest.GetCorpRequest) | [GetCorpResponse](#rest.GetCorpResponse) | get info about a corporation, which may be part of a real-estate-owning business network. rest api v1 route: &#39;/api/corp/:name&#39; |
| GetLP | [GetLPRequest](#rest.GetLPRequest) | [GetLPResponse](#rest.GetLPResponse) | get info about a limited partnership or llc, which may be part of a real-estate-owning business network. rest api v1 route: &#39;/api/lp/:name&#39; |
| GetNetworkParcel | [GetNetworkParcelRequest](#rest.GetNetworkParcelRequest) | [GetNetworkParcelResponse](#rest.GetNetworkParcelResponse) | given a network_id and a parcel block_lot which is under that network&#39;s influence, return a view of the network centered around that parcel. rest api v1 route: &#39;/api/network/parcel/:network_id/:search_string&#39; |
| GetNetworkBusinessEntity | [GetNetworkBusinessEntityRequest](#rest.GetNetworkBusinessEntityRequest) | [GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse](#rest.GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse) | given a network_id and a business entity which belongs to that network, return a local view of the network centered around that business. rest api v1 route: &#39;/api/network/:input_type/:search_string&#39; |
| GetEvictionsByNeighborhood | [GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodRequest](#rest.GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodRequest) | [GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodResponse](#rest.GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodResponse) | given the name of a neighborhood in san francisco, return eviction records from the eb datastore which occurred in that neighborhood. rest api v1 route: &#39;/api/neighborhood/:neighborhood&#39; and &#39;/api/neighborhood/:neighborhood/:page&#39; |
| ParcelSearch | [ParcelSearchRequest](#rest.ParcelSearchRequest) | [ParcelSearchResponse](#rest.ParcelSearchResponse) | used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based index lookup on business entities (both &#39;corp&#39; and &#39;lp&#39;) by normalized name. rest api v1 route: &#39;/api/parcel-search/:search&#39; |
| BusinessEntitySearch | [BusinessEntitySearchRequest](#rest.BusinessEntitySearchRequest) | [BusinessEntitySearchResponse](#rest.BusinessEntitySearchResponse) | used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based lookup on business entities (both &#39;corp&#39; and &#39;lp&#39;) by normalized name. rest api v1 route: &#39;/api/be-search/:search&#39; |

 


<a name="rest.BusinessEntitySearchRequest"></a>

### BusinessEntitySearchRequest

used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based index lookup
on business entities (both 'corp' and 'lp') by normalized name.

rest api v1 route: '/api/be-search/:search'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| search | [string](#string) |  | query string, to be interpreted as a business-entity name prefix. todo: describe constraints, normalization, etc. |






<a name="rest.BusinessEntitySearchResponse"></a>

### BusinessEntitySearchResponse

used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based index lookup
on business entities (both 'corp' and 'lp') by normalized name.

rest api v1 route: '/api/be-search/:search'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| \_\_typename | [string](#string) |  | represents the type of business entity, but only in an obscure way. context: it&#39;s the node-type of the business&#39;s record in the eb database. TODO: deprecate and replace with enum.  values: &#34;SOS_Corp&#34; if the business is a corporation. &#34;SOS_LP&#34; if the business is a limited partnership or llc. |
| name | [string](#string) |  | canonical name of the business entity, as it appears in the california secretary of state business registry. |






<a name="rest.GetCorpRequest"></a>

### GetCorpRequest


get info about a corporation, which may be part of a real-estate-owning
business network.

rest api v1 route: '/api/corp/:name'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| name | [string](#string) |  | name of a corporation to look up, as it appears in the California Secretary of State business registry. todo: describe constraints on normalization, etc. |






<a name="rest.GetCorpResponse"></a>

### GetCorpResponse


get info about a corporation, which may be part of a real-estate-owning
business network.

rest api v1 route: '/api/corp/:name'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| be_details | [CorporationDetails](#rest.CorporationDetails) |  | details about this business. note: compared to equivalent query proto, several string fields are remapped short keys to human-readable friendly labels: corporation_status, corporation_type, corporation_tax_base, ftb_suspension_status, corporation_classification. |
| parcels_owned | list< [ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo](#rest.ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo) > |  | brief descriptions of the parcels believed to be owned by this business, in whole or in part. |
| evictions | list< [EvictionMetadata](#rest.EvictionMetadata) > |  | info about evictions we attribute to this business entity. |
| networks | list< [NetworkedParcelSummary](#rest.NetworkedParcelSummary) > |  | despite the name, this is a list of *parcels*, which may be owned by the network associated with this business. COMPATIBILITY NOTE: contains a multimap field, which requires some additional conversion to move from proto-compatibile to existing rest json response. see NetworkParcelSummary.possible_networks for details. |






<a name="rest.GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodRequest"></a>

### GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodRequest


given the name of a neighborhood in san francisco, return eviction 
records from the eb datastore which occurred in that neighborhood.

rest api v1 route: '/api/neighborhood/:neighborhood'
               and '/api/neighborhood/:neighborhood/:page'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | name of a neighborhood in sf. geographical filter for eviction records. names should correspond to the neighborhood polygons described at: https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4 |
| page | [int32](#int32) |  | pagination. if page is set &gt; 0, rpc returns the &lt;page&gt;th page of &lt;size&gt; results. if page is unset or set &lt;= 0, rpc returns the first page. |
| size | [int32](#int32) |  | pagination. the number of results to store on a single page. defaults to 100. if unset or set &lt;= 0, rpc uses the default page size. in production, size cannot be increased beyond the default. for development, larger page sizes may be enabled with debug flags. todo: establish a continuation token or some other signal for the caller to know if there are more results beyond the current page. |






<a name="rest.GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodResponse"></a>

### GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodResponse


given the name of a neighborhood in san francisco, return eviction 
records from the eb datastore which occurred in that neighborhood.

rest api v1 route: '/api/neighborhood/:neighborhood'
               and '/api/neighborhood/:neighborhood/:page'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| evictions | list< [EvictionMetadata](#rest.EvictionMetadata) > |  | info about evictions in the ebook datastore which occurred within the requested neighborhood&#39;s boundaries. NOTE FOR COMPATIBLITY: rest api v1 response json represents a list of evicton objects directly, rather than an object with a list property. in order to achieve compatibility with rest api v1 wire protocol, extract and JSON.stringify this list. |






<a name="rest.GetLPRequest"></a>

### GetLPRequest


get info about a limited partnership or llc, which may be part of a
real-estate-owning business network.

rest api v1 route: '/api/lp/:name'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| name | [string](#string) |  | name of a limited partnership or llc to look up, as it appears in the California Secretary of State business registry. todo: describe constraints on normalization, etc. |






<a name="rest.GetLPResponse"></a>

### GetLPResponse


get info about a limited partnership or llc, which may be part of a
real-estate-owning business network.

rest api v1 route: '/api/lp/:name'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| be_details | [LimitedBusinessDetails](#rest.LimitedBusinessDetails) |  | details about this business. note: compared to equivalent query proto, several string fields are remapped short keys to human-readable friendly labels: status, filing type, llc_management_code. |
| parcels_owned | list< [ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo](#rest.ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo) > |  | brief descriptions of the parcels believed to be owned by this business, in whole or in part. |
| evictions | list< [EvictionMetadata](#rest.EvictionMetadata) > |  | info about evictions we attribute to this business entity. |
| networks | list< [NetworkedParcelSummary](#rest.NetworkedParcelSummary) > |  | despite the name, this is a list of *parcels*, which may be owned by the network associated with this business. COMPATIBILITY NOTE: contains a multimap field, which requires some additional conversion to move from proto-compatibile to existing rest json response. see NetworkParcelSummary.possible_networks for details. |






<a name="rest.GetNetworkBusinessEntityRequest"></a>

### GetNetworkBusinessEntityRequest

given a business entity which belongs to a network, return a local view of
the network centered around that business.

rest api v1 route: '/api/network/:input_type/:search_string'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| input_type | [string](#string) |  | &#34;corp&#34; or &#34;lp&#34;, depending on whether the business to query is a corporation or a limited-partnership/llc. |
| search_string | [string](#string) |  | normalized name of a business, derived from the name found in california sec. of state business records. |






<a name="rest.GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse"></a>

### GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse

given a business entity which belongs to a network, return a local view of
the network centered around that business.

rest api v1 route: '/api/network/:input_type/:search_string'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| name_norm | [string](#string) |  | normalized name of the business, matching be_name parameter from input. |
| network_subgraph | list< [GraphRelation](#rest.GraphRelation) > |  | list of graph relations (edges) which make up a connected subgraph of the ebook graph, representing the business network and its elements. each item here contains full descriptions of the relation&#39;s source and destination node, so the caller can reconstruct the subgraph. COMPATIBILITY NOTE: this proto message differs slightly from neo4j driver object schemas, so some conversion is required. see comments on GraphRelation definition. |
| total_bes | [int32](#int32) |  | total count of business entities which appear in this network (including both corporations and limited-partnerships/llc&#39;s). |
| top_bes | list< [NormalizedName](#rest.NormalizedName) > |  | normalized names of most-connected business in the network. (SOS_Corp or SOS_LP nodes with highest degree). optional field \_\_typename is set, so caller can disambiguate between business types. returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12. |
| top_owners | list< [NormalizedName](#rest.NormalizedName) > |  | normalized names of owners-of-businesses most connected in the graph. (SOS_Owner nodes with matching network_id, with highest degree). optional field \_\_typename is NOT set. note: these owners can be individuals, or other businesses. returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12. see SOS_Owner node / CalSOSOwnerData in graph/nodes.proto. |
| top_addrs | list< [ReadableAddress](#rest.ReadableAddress) > |  | readable addresses which are the most well-connected in the graph. (Address_Unit nodes with matching network_id with highest degree). TODO: describe what causes these addresses to be considered for inclusion. clarify if they&#39;re physical addresses of component businesses/owners of the network, or real-estate properties held by the network. returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12. see Address_Unit node / AddressUnitData in graph/nodes.proto. |






<a name="rest.GetNetworkParcelRequest"></a>

### GetNetworkParcelRequest


given a network_id and a parcel block_lot which is under that network's
influence, return a view of the network centered around that parcel.

rest api v1 route: '/api/network/parcel/:network_id/:search_string'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | the network_id of the business network we want to retreieve. See BusinessNetworkIdentifier for semantics. required. |
| search_string | [string](#string) |  | the block_lot (unique key) of a parcel which is associated with this network. |






<a name="rest.GetNetworkParcelResponse"></a>

### GetNetworkParcelResponse

given a network_id and a parcel block_lot which is under that network's
influence, return a view of the network centered around that parcel.

rest api v1 route: '/api/network/parcel/:network_id/:search_string'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | string representing the parcel&#39;s street address, including street number, street name and suffix, and unit number. The parcel is assumed to be within SF city/county limits. See &#39;addr&#39; in A_Parcel node as described by SFAssessorParcelData in graph/nodes.proto. |
| network_subgraph | list< [GraphRelation](#rest.GraphRelation) > |  | list of graph relations (edges) which make up a connected subgraph of the ebook graph, representing the business network and its elements. each item here contains full descriptions of the relation&#39;s source and destination node, so the caller can reconstruct the subgraph. COMPATIBILITY NOTE: this proto message differs slightly from neo4j driver object schemas, so some conversion is required. see comments on GraphRelation definition. |
| total_bes | [int32](#int32) |  | total count of business entities which appear in this network (including both corporations and limited-partnerships/llc&#39;s). |
| top_bes | list< [NormalizedName](#rest.NormalizedName) > |  | see GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse above. |
| top_owners | list< [NormalizedName](#rest.NormalizedName) > |  | see GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse above. |
| top_addrs | list< [ReadableAddress](#rest.ReadableAddress) > |  | see GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse above. |






<a name="rest.GetParcelDetailsRequest"></a>

### GetParcelDetailsRequest

get details about a parcel from sf assessor records, keyed by block_lot.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/details'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records. exact string match only. |






<a name="rest.GetParcelDetailsResponse"></a>

### GetParcelDetailsResponse

get details about a parcel from sf assessor records, keyed by block_lot.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/details'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| parcel_details | [ParcelDetails](#rest.ParcelDetails) |  | detailed info about the parcel with the requested block_lot (location, physical properties, etc.). |






<a name="rest.GetParcelEvictionsRequest"></a>

### GetParcelEvictionsRequest

get details about evictions which occurred at a given parcel, keyed by
block_lot.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/evictions'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records. exact string match only. |






<a name="rest.GetParcelEvictionsResponse"></a>

### GetParcelEvictionsResponse

get details about evictions which occurred at a given parcel, keyed by
block_lot.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/evictions'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| evictions | list< [EvictionMetadata](#rest.EvictionMetadata) > |  | info about evictions believed to have occurred on the propert(y/ies) on the parcel with the requested block_lot. |






<a name="rest.GetParcelNetworksRequest"></a>

### GetParcelNetworksRequest


get info about real-estate business networks believed to have a stake in
this parcel, as well as other parcels which those networks may have a
vested interest in.
NOTE: performance bottleneck, invoke with caution.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/networks'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records. exact string match only. |






<a name="rest.GetParcelNetworksResponse"></a>

### GetParcelNetworksResponse

get info about real-estate business networks believed to have a stake in
this parcel, as well as other parcels which those networks may have a
vested interest in.
NOTE: performance bottleneck, invoke with caution.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/networks'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| networks | map< string, [NetworkSummary](#rest.NetworkSummary) > |  | info about real-estate business networks which may have a financial interest in this parcel. keys: network_id&#39;s, as they appear in BusinessNetworkIdentifier messages. |






<a name="rest.GetParcelOwnersRequest"></a>

### GetParcelOwnersRequest


get info about individuals, businesses, and/or trusts believed to own the
parcel in full or in part.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/owners'

| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records. exact string match only. |






<a name="rest.GetParcelOwnersResponse"></a>

### GetParcelOwnersResponse

get info about individuals, businesses, and/or trusts believed to own the
parcel in full or in part.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/owners'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| owners | list< [ParcelOwner](#rest.ParcelOwner) > |  | individuals, businesses, trusts, etc., which are believed to own the requested parcel in full or in part. |






<a name="rest.GetParcelRequest"></a>

### GetParcelRequest

deprecated -- legacy endpoint, prefer more specific parcel calls below.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records. exact string match only. |






<a name="rest.GetParcelResponse"></a>

### GetParcelResponse

deprecated -- legacy endpoint, prefer more specific parcel calls below.

rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| parcel_details | [ParcelDetails](#rest.ParcelDetails) |  | detailed info about the parcel (location, physical properties, etc.). |
| owners | list< [ParcelOwner](#rest.ParcelOwner) > |  | individuals, businesses, trusts, etc., which are believed to own the parcel in full or in part. |
| evictions | list< [EvictionMetadata](#rest.EvictionMetadata) > |  | info about evictions believed to have occurred on the propert(y/ies) on this parcel. |
| networks | map< string, [NetworkSummary](#rest.NetworkSummary) > |  | info about real-estate business networks which may have a financial interest in this parcel. keys: network_id&#39;s, as they appear in BusinessNetworkIdentifier messages. |









<a name="rest.ParcelSearchRequest"></a>

### ParcelSearchRequest

used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based lookup on sf
assessor parcel records on lot-level address strings.

rest api v1 route: '/api/parcel-search/:search'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| context | [RequestContext](#rest.RequestContext) |  | request context, see above. |
| search | [string](#string) |  | query string, to be interpreted as an address prefix. todo: describe constraints, normalization, etc. |






<a name="rest.ParcelSearchResponse"></a>

### ParcelSearchResponse

used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based lookup on sf
assessor parcel records on lot-level address strings.

rest api v1 route: '/api/parcel-search/:search'


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | the block_lot of this parcel in sf assessor records. unique key in ebook rest api. |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | human-readable address of the real-estate parcel in sf assessor records. TODO: describe normalization, etc. |






<a name="rest.RequestContext"></a>

### RequestContext
placeholder for info about the incoming request (session id, request_id,
permissions, etc.)

todo: populate with relevant fields.





 

 

 





<a name="business.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## business.proto
rest/business.proto

message definitions for business entities (corporations and
limited-partnerships/llc&#39;s) as they appear in the ebook api.


<a name="rest.CorporationDetails"></a>

### CorporationDetails



| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| transaction_date | [string](#string) |  | transaction date of the document which established this corporation, according to the california secretary of state business registry. format: &#39;CCMMYYDD&#39;. |
| corporation_number | [string](#string) |  | an 8 digit corporate identification number, from the california secretary of state business registry. |
| incorporation_date | [string](#string) |  | date on which this corporation was incorporated, according to the california secretary of state business registry. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| corporation_status | [string](#string) |  | status of the corporation, via calif. sec of state business records. NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field. TODO: list the labels here. TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation. |
| corporation_type | [string](#string) |  | describes the legal process used to establish this business, according to calif. sec of state business records. NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field. TODO: list the labels here. TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation. |
| corporation_tax_base | [string](#string) |  | tax base trype of the corporate, according to calif. sec of state records. NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field. TODO: list the labels here. TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation. |
| corporation_classification | [string](#string) |  | additional corporate classifications which may convey special status, such as &#39;religious&#39; or &#39;agricultural cooperative&#39; according to calif. sec. of state business entity records. NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field. TODO: list the labels here. TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation. |
| term_expiration_date | [string](#string) |  | limited term expiration date. TODO: explain what this means. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| ftb_suspension_status | [string](#string) |  | describes whether this corporation is in good standing with the california franchise tax board (ftb). NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field. TODO: list the labels here. TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation. |
| ftb_suspension_date | [string](#string) |  | if this corporation has been subject to action by the franchise tax board as described in &#39;ftb_suspension_status&#39;, then this field contains a string representation of the date of that action. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| so_file_number | [string](#string) |  | statement of information file number, per calif sec of state records. |
| so_file_date | [string](#string) |  | last complete statement (of information?) file date. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| corporation_name | [string](#string) |  | name of corporation, directly from calif. sec. of state records without normalization. |
| co_name | [string](#string) |  | &#39;care of&#39; name, meaning the &#39;c/o&#39; addressee which should be included on mail intended for the corporation. |
| agent_name | [string](#string) |  | name of agent of process, as it appears on mailing address. |
| agent_address_line_1 | [string](#string) |  | mailing address for agent of process, line 1. |
| agent_address_line_2 | [string](#string) |  | mailing address for agent of process, line 2. |
| agent_address_city | [string](#string) |  | city component of agent of process&#39;s mailing address. |
| agent_address_state_county | [string](#string) |  | TODO: clarify what this means. is it state or county? or both???? |
| agent_address_zip_code | [string](#string) |  | TODO: clarify whether these are 5-digit or 9-digit postal codes. |
| state_or_foreign_country | [string](#string) |  | if the corporation is not &#39;domestic&#39; (internal to calif.), then this field specified a u.s. state other than california, or a country outside the u.s., where this corporation originated. |
| c_id | [int64](#int64) |  | business entity component id, generated by the ebook data pipeline via connected component analysis. see BusinessNetworkIdentifier in network_ids.proto for details. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | parcel ownership network component id, generated by the ebook data pipeline via connected component analysis. see BusinessNetworkIdentifier in network_ids.proto for details. |






<a name="rest.LimitedBusinessDetails"></a>

### LimitedBusinessDetails



| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| jurisdiction_llc | [string](#string) |  | llc only: state or county for formation of foreign llc. |
| llc_management_code | [string](#string) |  | llc only: management structure. NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field. TODO: list the labels here. TODO: this approach lends itself poorly to localization and is cumbersome to use in the client. replace with a more flexible and informative representation. |
| llc_type_of_business | [string](#string) |  | llc only: type of business. TODO: provide examples. |
| file_number | [string](#string) |  | the filing number of the business entity, which is derived from the date on which its filing paperwork was filed. the number is presented as a string, with the format described below: format: &#39;CCYYJJJN9999&#39; CCYY = century and year JJJ = julian day of year N = record type: 0 = lp record 1 = llc record 9999 = sequence number |
| file_date | [string](#string) |  | date of original filing for this business. represents the same calendar date as the date component of file_number, but follows a different format. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39; |
| status | [string](#string) |  | identifies current status of lp/llc, as represented in calif. sec. of state business entity records. NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field. TODO: list the labels here. TODO: this approach lends itself poorly to localization and is cumbersome to use in the client. replace with a more flexible and informative representation. |
| filing_type | [string](#string) |  | filing type (foreign or domestic) of this lp or llc, as represented in calif. sec. of state business entity registry. NOTE: these are human-readable labels, in contrast to the equivalent query-proto field&#39;s abbreviations. TODO: this approach lends itself poorly to localization and is cumbersome to use in the client. replace with a more flexible and informative representation. TODO: list the labels here. |
| name | [string](#string) |  | the raw, non-normalized name of this calif. limited partnership or llc, as represented in calif. sec. of state business entity registry. |
| jurisdiction | [string](#string) |  | state or country of formation for foreign limited partnerships. |
| agent_name | [string](#string) |  | name of agent of process, as it appears on mailing address. |
| agent_address_1 | [string](#string) |  | mailing address for agent of process, line 1. CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| agent_address_2 | [string](#string) |  | mailing address for agent of process, line 2. CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| agent_city | [string](#string) |  | city component of agent of process&#39;s mailing address. CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| agent_state | [string](#string) |  | component of agent of process&#39;s mailing address. CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| agent_zip | [string](#string) |  | todo: clarify whether these are 5-digit or 9-digit postal codes. CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details. |
| term | [string](#string) |  | cause of termination, if this lp/llc has been terminated. TODO: add examples. |
| c_id | [int64](#int64) |  | business entity component id, generated by the ebook data pipeline via connected component analysis. see BusinessNetworkIdentifier in network_ids.proto for details. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | parcel ownership network component id, generated by the ebook data pipeline via connected component analysis. see BusinessNetworkIdentifier in network_ids.proto for details. |





 

 

 

 



<a name="eviction.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## eviction.proto
rest/eviction.proto

messages representing evictions and related metadata in ebook api.


<a name="rest.EvictionMetadata"></a>

### EvictionMetadata
fields describing the eviction itself:


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| evict_id | [string](#string) |  | unique id for the eviction in ebook api. this is typically derived from sf rent board&#39;s petition id, but is *NOT* equivalent. DO NOT USE THIS FOR DIRECT COMPARISON TO SFRB RECORDS. TODO: replace this with a less confusing opaque id, and add a field which accurately presents the eviction&#39;s sf rent board petition id (primary key in rent board records). |
| evict_date | [string](#string) |  | date on which this eviction took effect, according to public records. format: &#39;CCYYMMDD&#39;. |
| type | [string](#string) |  | type of eviction, for example &#34;Buyout Declaration&#34; or &#34;Ellis Act Withdrawal&#34;. todo: document supported values for this field. |
| ellis_evictor | [string](#string) |  | attributed evictors according to ellis act withdrawal records. only populated for evictions of type &#34;Ellis Act Withdrawal&#34; TODO: deprecate this, replace with a well-structured repeated field. this is a vestige of v1 data pipeline, and it contains a comma-separated list of names that&#39;s really not worth parsing. |
| multiple_sales_matches | [bool](#bool) |  | no one knows what this field means. TODO: deprecate and remove. |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | block_lot of the parcel where this eviction tool place. uniquely specifies a parcel in sf assessor records. unique key for parcel in ebook api. |
| units | [double](#double) |  | num. units at the parcel where this eviction took place (via assessor records). |
| lat | [double](#double) |  | latitude (in degrees) of a point within the boundaries of the parcel where this eviction took place. |
| long | [double](#double) |  | longitude (in degrees) of a point within the boundaries of the parcel where this eviction took place. |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | street address of the parcel where this eviction took place (via assessor records). see &#39;addr&#39; details in parcel.proto |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | name of the neighorhood that encompasses the parcel where this eviction took place (via assessor records). see details in parcel.proto |
| multiple_addr_matches | [bool](#bool) |  | no one knows what this means. TODO: deprecate and remove. |
| name | [string](#string) |  | only set when this eviction is part of a location-based query (ex: neighborhood lookup). when set, contains the name of an attributed evictor, or &#34;Unknown&#34; if there are no attributed evictors. when this message is part of a business-info query result, name is unset. TODO: deprecate and remove this, it&#39;s not helpful and the name is seriously confusing. |
| linked_be | [BusinessNetworkIdentifier](#rest.BusinessNetworkIdentifier) |  | contains id&#39;s used to refer to a business holding network. only set when eviction message is part of a location-based query (ex: lookup by neighborhood). unset when this message appears in a Corporation / Limited Business result. TODO: either standardize this or remove it. |





 

 

 

 



<a name="graph_util.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## graph_util.proto
rest/graph_util.proto

contains helper messages for describing neo4j graphs.


<a name="rest.GraphNode"></a>

### GraphNode
representation of a node in the graph, including internal details
particular to the graph&#39;s instantiation.

based on the json schema of neo4j data driver&#39;s query results.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| identity | [int64](#int64) |  | internal graph db id for this node. |
| labels | list< [string](#string) > |  | the node types that this node has. in our graph, nodes always have a single type, as of 2021/03/12, but this may change in the future. |
| properties_json | [string](#string) |  | a json string representing a map of this node&#39;s properties, where the keys are the property names and the values are strings, numbers, or objects. NOTE: this field does not appear in the response objects returned by neo4j-driver. in the neo4j driver&#39;s response, &#39;properties&#39; is a plain object. this is convenient for the programming api, but it means that the driver&#39;s query response can never be fully-type-safely specified as proto. this is because the schema of &#39;properties&#39; is unpredictable (determined by the contents of the db). you could choose to represent it as a map of strings/bytes/Any/etc., but the native json representation of the proto wouldn&#39;t match the actual neo4j driver&#39;s response. since we can&#39;t acheive perfect compatibility, the simplest strategy is to encode the &#39;properties&#39; object as json. callers should &#39;JSON.parse&#39; the value of &#39;properties_json&#39; into &#39;properties&#39; to achieve compatibility with the neo4j driver api. similarly, callers should &#39;JSON.stringify&#39; the &#39;properties&#39; value of a neo4j driver response into &#39;properties_json&#39; to allow encoding as proto. |
| properties | [bytes](#bytes) |  | **Deprecated.** see above. the neo4j-driver object equivalent uses the name &#39;properties&#39;; to make conversion code clearer, don&#39;t reuse that name. |






<a name="rest.GraphRelation"></a>

### GraphRelation
representation of a relation (edge) in the graph, including internal details
particular to the graph&#39;s instantiation. based on the js obj schema of
neo4j-driver&#39;s query results.

NOTE: a GraphRelation as described here contains the complete set of info
for both nodes that it connects! that means that storing a graph as a list
of these GraphRelation objects is inefficient, because the same node may be
described many times (once for each connecting edge).


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| start | [GraphNode](#rest.GraphNode) |  | origin node of the relation. |
| end | [GraphNode](#rest.GraphNode) |  | destination node of the relation. NOTE: as of 2021/03/12, edges are treated as though they bidirectional in ebook graph analysis. |
| type | [string](#string) |  | the relation/edge&#39;s type in the graph (&#34;ENTITY_OWNED_BY&#34;, etc.). |





 

 

 

 



<a name="network.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## network.proto
rest/network.proto

messages representing real-estate business networks and their holdings in
the ebook api.


<a name="rest.NetworkSummary"></a>

### NetworkSummary
top-level overview of a real-estate network. this is the network view used
in the &#39;parcel&#39; rest endpoints.

TODO: add a network_id field for easy identification in client.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| searched_mail_address | list< [string](#string) > |  | mailing addresses which may identify this network. this is *NOT* an exhaustive list of addresses within the network. |
| related_parcels | list< [NetworkedParcelSummary](#rest.NetworkedParcelSummary) > |  | info about parcels which may be related via both being financial interests of this real-estate business network. TODO: remove this, replace with just the id&#39;s and perhaps address. the client can retrieve parcel details if needed. &#39;possible_networks&#39; may be a field we need to expose through other means. |





 

 

 

 



<a name="network_ids.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## network_ids.proto
rest/network_ids.proto

messages representing network id&#39;s and other identifier structs used in
ebook api.


<a name="rest.BusinessNetworkIdentifier"></a>

### BusinessNetworkIdentifier
id&#39;s used to refer to a real-estate holding network, as modeled by
analysis of the calif. sec. of state business registry.

see the developer guide for a detailed description of the evictorbook&#39;s
network connection methodology in the section &#34;Network Connection Method -
Detailed &gt; During DB Creation&#34;.

c_id assignment is described in step &#39;I&#39; of that section and network_id
assignment is described in step &#39;III&#39;.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| \_\_typename | [string](#string) |  | type of business record in ebook datastore (&#34;SOS\_LP&#34;, &#34;SOS\_Corp&#34;) from which this business information was extracted. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | business network id of this business in ebook datastore, as inferred by graph analysis. see graph schema documentation for details. |
| c_id | [int64](#int64) |  | connected component id of this business in ebook datastore, as inferred by graph analysis. all businesses with the same c_id must also have the same network_id, though two businesses with the same network_id may have different c_id&#39;s. see graph documentation and developer guide for details. |






<a name="rest.NetworkLocationInfo"></a>

### NetworkLocationInfo
id and location characteristics of a real-estate business network.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr_readable | [string](#string) |  | an address in the ebook datastore where the central owning entity of a real-estate business network is believed to be located. |
| network_id | [int64](#int64) |  | network id of the real-estate business network believed to be headquartered at addr_readable. |





 

 

 

 



<a name="parcel.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## parcel.proto
rest/parcel.proto

parcel-related messages as they appear in ebook api v1 responses.


<a name="rest.NetworkedParcelSummary"></a>

### NetworkedParcelSummary
contextual info about a parcel, in relation to a particular real-estate
business network. see NetworkSummary in rest/network.proto for usage.

///////////////////////////
 metadata about parcel:
///////////////////////////


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | block_lot of the parcel in assessor records. primary key in ebook api. |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | address of the parcel, as derived from sf assessor records. |
| num_evictions | [int32](#int32) |  | total amount of evictions believed to have occurred at the networked property, which appear in ebook&#39;s datastore. no bounds on eviction date. |
| units | [int32](#int32) |  | number of units that the relevant parcel consists of, according to sf city and county assessor records. for multi-building properties, this is the sum of all units among buildings on the property. |
| lat | [double](#double) |  | latitude (in degrees) of a point within the networked property. |
| long | [double](#double) |  | longitude (in degrees) of a point within the networked property. |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. see parcel.proto for description of valid neighborhood names. |
| owners | list< [NetworkedParcelSummary.NetworkedParcelOwner](#rest.NetworkedParcelSummary.NetworkedParcelOwner) > |  |  |
| possible_networks | map< string, [StringVector](#rest.StringVector) > |  | contains metadata about networks which this parcel may belong to. keys are network_id&#39;s, as they appear in BusinessNetworkIdentifier msg&#39;s. values are a list of strings representing mailing addresses which may identify a business in this network. !!! This is *NOT* an exhaustive list of addresses within the network. !!! COMPATIBILITY NOTE: in api 1.0 json representation, possible_networks is a json multimap. multimaps are not suported natively in proto, so we define a StringVector message to use as a replacement. NOTE: until clients are migrated away from json multimap, will support configuration flags to return json with original multimaps. see config flags in /server/rest/routes/dbRouteSetup.js. |
| connection_type | [string](#string) |  | optional. when present, describes the provenance of the information in possible_networks. &#34;NETWORK_EXACT&#34;: possible_networks contains a single network, identified by mailing address info from the parcel&#39;s recorded owner. &#34;NETWORK_NONEXACT&#34;: possible_networks contains one or more networks, considered &#39;possible&#39; matches based on indirect connections. &#34;NON_NETWORK&#34;: no network_id found, map contains placeholder network with key &#34;NON_NETWORK&#34; and single mailing address copied from parcel owner records. TODO: deprecate and replace with an enum. |






<a name="rest.NetworkedParcelSummary.NetworkedParcelOwner"></a>

### NetworkedParcelSummary.NetworkedParcelOwner
individuals, businesses, or other legal entities believed to own the
networked parcel in whole or in part.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| owner_name | [string](#string) |  | owner of the networked parcel, as it appears in that parcel&#39;s assessor records. |
| linked_be | [BusinessNetworkIdentifier](#rest.BusinessNetworkIdentifier) |  | set only when this owner of the networked parcel is believed to be linked to a business entity/network. contains id&#39;s for that linked business network. |
| ma_network_id | [string](#string) |  | set when mailing_address is believed to also be the cental mailing address of a real-estate business network central business&#39;s hq. in that case, it&#39;s the network id of the business network headquartered at that address. |
| mailing_address | [string](#string) |  | physical mailing address where the owner can be contacted, according to assessor records. |








<a name="rest.ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo"></a>

### ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo
Summary of parcel info, with less information than ParcelDetails. Used in
business lookup calls to describe parcels owned by that business.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | &#39;block_lot&#39; identifier. unique key for a parcel in sf assessor records, and unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database. |
| record_date | [string](#string) |  | date listed on the documents recording ownership of the parcel. todo: describe behavior for parcels with multiple owners. format: CCYYMMDD |
| perc_owner | [double](#double) |  | ownership percentage, of the assigned owner, expressed as an integer between 0 and 100, returned as a floating point number. |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | a string representing the parcel&#39;s street address, including street number, street name and suffix, and unit number. the parcel is assumed to be within sf city/county limits. |
| num_evictions | [int32](#int32) |  | number of recorded evictions associated with this parcel in the ebook graph. |
| units | [double](#double) |  | number of units that this parcel consists of, according to sf city and county assessor records. |
| lat | [double](#double) |  | latitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries. |
| long | [double](#double) |  | longitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries. |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. as of 2021/03/11, it&#39;s assumed that all parcels are within sf city and county, so these are sf neighborhoods. values correspond to names of the neighborhood polygons described at: https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4 |






<a name="rest.ParcelDetails"></a>

### ParcelDetails
detailed info about a real-estate parcel from the sf assessor&#39;s office.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| yr_built | [int32](#int32) |  | year in which the buildings on this real-estate parcel were first constructed. TODO: describe behavior for multi-building parcels. |
| addr | [string](#string) |  | string containing parcel&#39;s street address, including street number, street name and suffix, and unit number. parcel is assumed to be within sf city/county limits. notes from schema definition sheet: full address in the format of &#34;ST_START_NO-ST_END_NO ST_NAME ST_TYPE (Unit UNIT)&#34; (w/o end no if no address range, w/o parentheses if no unit) |
| block_lot | [string](#string) |  | &#39;block_lot&#39; identifier. unique key for a parcel in sf assessor records, and unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database. |
| lat | [double](#double) |  | latitude in degrees of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries. TODO: specify bounds. |
| long | [double](#double) |  | longitude in degrees of a point within this parcel&#39;s boundaries. TODO: specify bounds. |
| neighborhood | [string](#string) |  | name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. as of 2020/09/26, it&#39;s assumed that all parcels are within sf city and county, so these are san francisco neighborhoods. neighborhoods assigned using sf polygons. names and polygon boundaries: https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4 TODO: deprecate this field in favor of a NeighborhoodInfo struct or canonical neighborhood_id. |
| rent_controlled | [int32](#int32) |  | rough assessment of this parcel&#39;s rent-control status. 0 (default) if data unavailable to determine rent controlled status, 1 if likely rent controlled, 2 if doubtful that this is rent controlled TODO: replace with an enum. |
| prop_class_code | [string](#string) |  | property class code, via sf assessor&#39;s office. definitons: https://data.sfgov.org/Housing-and-Buildings/Reference-Assessor-Recorder-Property-Class-Codes/pa56-ek2h/data TODO: replace with an enum. |
| zone | [string](#string) |  | i.d. for the zoning district this parcel occupies. sf zoning district definitions: https://sfplanninggis.org/pim/map.html?layers=Zoning%20Districts TODO: replace with an enum. |
| stories | [int32](#int32) |  | how tall is the building on this parcel, in stories. TODO: behavior for multi-building parcels? |
| units | [int32](#int32) |  | number of physical units within this logical real-estate parcel. |
| rooms | [int32](#int32) |  | number of total rooms within buildings on this parcel (for multi-unit parcels, this is the sum of rooms among all units.) |
| beds | [int32](#int32) |  | number of total bedrooms on this parcel (for multi-unit parcels, this is the sum of bedrooms among all units.) |
| assess_land_val | [int32](#int32) |  | assessor valuation of the &#39;land&#39; base value, i.e. the parcel&#39;s theoretical value if it had no buildings on it. |
| assess_imp_val | [int32](#int32) |  | assessor valuation of the &#39;improvement&#39; done to the land via development, as of most recent assessment. units in u.s. dollars. |
| assess_val_date | [string](#string) |  | date when the parcel&#39;s value was last assessed. format: CCYYMMDD |
| update_date | [string](#string) |  | date on which this parcel&#39;s address was last updated, via assessor records. format: CCYYMMDD |
| curr_sales_price | [int32](#int32) |  | TODO: document the provenance of this information, and when it is set. units in u.s. dollars. |
| curr_sales_date | [string](#string) |  | TODO: document the provenance of this information, and when it is set. format: CCYYMMDD |
| parc_start_no | [int32](#int32) |  | if the logical parcel occupies more than one street number, then this field contains the lowest street number in that range. if the logical parcel occupies only one street number, then this field contains that number. TODO: why no parc_end_no field? TODO: replace with a well-defined address message. |
| parc_street_name | [string](#string) |  | main name part of the street/route name of the parcel&#39;s address. (ex: &#34;geary&#34;, &#34;first&#34;, &#34;taylor&#34;, etc.) TODO: describe capitalization, stylization, etc. TODO: replace with a well-defined address message. |
| parc_street_type | [string](#string) |  | street suffix (ex: &#34;st&#34;, &#34;ln&#34;) of the parcel&#39;s address. TODO: describe capitalization, stylization, etc. TODO: replace with a well-defined address message. |
| parc_unit_no | [string](#string) |  | unit or subpremise identifier. just the number or letter. TODO: replace with a well-defined address message. |
| parc_zip | [int32](#int32) |  | five-digit u.s. postal code of the parcel&#39;s address, as an integer. TODO: replace with a well-defined address message. |






<a name="rest.ParcelOwner"></a>

### ParcelOwner
info about an individual, business, trust, or other legal entity which owns
a real-estate parcel, in full or in part.

*NOT* to be confused with a property corporation.  this message contains
only information that is accessible from assessor records for the relevant
parcel.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| mailing_address | [string](#string) |  | physical mailing address where this owner can be reached, according to assessor parcel records. |
| record_date | [string](#string) |  | date on which this ownership was documented, according to assessor records. format: CCYYMMDD |
| perc_owner | [int32](#int32) |  | ownership percentage, as a number between 0 and 100, as it appears in assessor records. a value of &#39;100&#39; indicates full ownership. a lesser value indicates partial ownership. note that for some parcels, we may have information about some but not all owners. do *NOT* rely on the ownership percentages for recorded owners adding up to 100. |
| owner_name | [string](#string) |  | name of owner listed on parcel records from assessor&#39;s office. todo: briefly describe how/whether this data was normalized. |
| linked_be | [BusinessNetworkIdentifier](#rest.BusinessNetworkIdentifier) |  | id&#39;s used to refer to a real-estate holding network, as modeled by analysis of the calif. sec. of state business registry. if &#39;linked_be&#39; is set to a non-empty message, then these id&#39;s describe the real-estate business network which our data indicates this owner is affiliated with. |





 

 

 

 





<a name="util.proto"></a>
<p align="right"><a href="#top">Top</a></p>

## util.proto



<a name="rest.NormalizedName"></a>

### NormalizedName
convience wrapper for normalized names.
semantically neutral, used in a variety of contexts.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| name_norm | [string](#string) |  | a normalized name, as it appears in the graph. |
| \_\_typename | [string](#string) |  | optional. node type of the graph node where this name_norm was found. typically set for names of business entities, where there is a need to differentiate between SOS_Corp and SOS_LP. |






<a name="rest.ReadableAddress"></a>

### ReadableAddress
convenience wrapper for human-readable addresses.
TODO: describe normalization, etc.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| addr_readable | [string](#string) |  | readable/friendly representation of an address. normalization and internal structure may vary based on where this; check the containing message for details. |






<a name="rest.StringVector"></a>

### StringVector
a simple wrapper around repeated strings.

this is useful because doesn&#39;t natively support multimaps (maps of lists).
to accomodate, we instead create a map where values are StringVector
messages.

if you need a multimap of a different type, create another Vector message in this
file.


| Field | Type | Label | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |
| value | list< [string](#string) > |  | string values contained in this vector. |





 

 

 

 



## Scalar Value Types

| .proto Type | Notes | C++ | Java | Python | Go | C# | PHP | Ruby |
| ----------- | ----- | --- | ---- | ------ | -- | -- | --- | ---- |
| <a name="double" /> double |  | double | double | float | float64 | double | float | Float |
| <a name="float" /> float |  | float | float | float | float32 | float | float | Float |
| <a name="int32" /> int32 | Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers â€“ if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead. | int32 | int | int | int32 | int | integer | Bignum or Fixnum (as required) |
| <a name="int64" /> int64 | Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers â€“ if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead. | int64 | long | int/long | int64 | long | integer/string | Bignum |
| <a name="uint32" /> uint32 | Uses variable-length encoding. | uint32 | int | int/long | uint32 | uint | integer | Bignum or Fixnum (as required) |
| <a name="uint64" /> uint64 | Uses variable-length encoding. | uint64 | long | int/long | uint64 | ulong | integer/string | Bignum or Fixnum (as required) |
| <a name="sint32" /> sint32 | Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s. | int32 | int | int | int32 | int | integer | Bignum or Fixnum (as required) |
| <a name="sint64" /> sint64 | Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s. | int64 | long | int/long | int64 | long | integer/string | Bignum |
| <a name="fixed32" /> fixed32 | Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28. | uint32 | int | int | uint32 | uint | integer | Bignum or Fixnum (as required) |
| <a name="fixed64" /> fixed64 | Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56. | uint64 | long | int/long | uint64 | ulong | integer/string | Bignum |
