  // format: CCYYMMDD  TODO: document when and how this gets populated.
  string curr_sales_date = 19;

  // if the logical parcel occupies more than one street number, then this field
  // contains the lowest street number in that range.
  //
  // if the logical parcel occupies only one street number, then this field
  // contains that number.
  //
  // TODO: why no parc_end_no field? 
  int32 parc_start_no = 20;

  // main name part of the street/route name of the parcel's address.
  // (ex: "geary", "first", "taylor", etc.)
  //
  // TODO: describe capitalization, stylization, etc.
  string parc_street_name = 21;

  // street suffix (ex: "st", "ln") of the parcel's address.
  //
  // TODO: describe capitalization, stylization, etc.
  string parc_street_type = 22;

  // unit or subpremise identifier. just the number or letter. 
  string parc_unit_no = 23;

  // five-digit u.s. postal code of the parcel's address, as an integer.
  int32 parc_zip = 24;
}

/////////////////////////////
//  Parcel owner messages: 
/////////////////////////////

// an owner, as seen in server/rest/handlers/parcel/owners.js.
message SFAssessorParcelOwner {
  // physical mailing address where this owner can be reached, according to
  // assessor parcel records.
  string mailing_address = 1;

  // date this ownership was documented, as it appears in the PARC_OWNED_BY
  // (ParcelOwnedBy) relation connecting the parcel node with an A_Parcel_Owner
  // vertex.
  //
  // format: CCYYMMDD
  string record_date = 2;

  // ownership percentage, as a number between 0 and 100, as it appears in the
  // PARC_OWNED_BY (ParcelOwnedBy) relation connecting the parcel node with
  // an A_Parcel_Owner vertex.
  double perc_owner = 3;

  // name of owner listed on parcel records from SF assessor's office.
  //
  // todo briefly describe how/whether this data was normalized.
  string owner_name = 4;

  // optional.
  // this is populated if and only if we believe this owner is a business,
  // which we have identified with california sec. of state business records.
  // contains information about the owning business, and its inferred
  // real-estate business network connections.
  BusinessNetworkIdentifier linked_be = 5;
}

// consolidated info about a parcel, as presented from the context of the
// business entity that owns the parcel.
//
// as of 2020/09/26, this message mirrors the subquery in js commented with
// "get the parcels directly owned".
//
// except for num_evictions, these fields correspond one-to-one to fields of
// the same name in A_Parcel nodes. defining another message here instead of
// attempting to reuse, so we can allow the schema and query interface boundary
// to evolve independently.
message BusinessOwnedParcelInfo {
  // block lot string, which uniquely specifies a parcel in sf city and county
  // assessor records. this is a unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database.
  string block_lot = 1;

  // date listed on the documents which record this corporation's ownership of
  // the parcel, as recorded in the 'PARC_OWNED_BY' relation that connects the
  // A_Parcel node with the SOS_Corp node.
  //
  // format: CCYYMMDD
  string record_date = 2;

  // ownership percentage, as documented in the 'PARC_OWNED_BY' relation
  // connecting the A_Parcel node with the SOS_Corp node.
  //
  // ownership percentage is expressed as an integer between 0 and 100, but
  // returned as a floating point number.
  double perc_owner = 3;

  // a string representing the parcel's street address, including street
  // number, street name and suffix, and unit number. the parcel is assumed to
  // be within sf city/county limits.
  string addr = 4;

  // number of RB_Eviction nodes with an EVICTION_AT relationship to this
  // parcel's A_Parcel node.
   int32 num_evictions = 5;

  // number of units that this parcel consists of, according to sf city and
  // county assessor records.
  double units = 6;

  // latitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
  //
  // todo: formally specify bounds.
  double lat = 7;

  // longitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
  //
  // todo: formally specify bounds.
  double long = 8;

  // name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. as of 2020/09/26, it's
  // assumed that all parcels are within sf city and county, so these are san
  // francisco neighborhoods.
  //
  // values correspond to names of the neighborhood polygons
  // described at:
  // https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4
  string neighborhood = 9;
}

////////////////////////////////
//  Networked parcel messages: 
////////////////////////////////

// brief description of an individual, business, or trust, etc., which may own
// a parcel associated with a real-estate business network.
message NetworkedParcelOwner {
  // owner of the networked parcel, as it appears in that parcel's assessor
  // records.
  string owner_name = 1;

  // optional.
  // this is populated if and only if we believe this owner is a business,
  // which we have identified with california sec. of state business records.
  // contains information about the owning business, and its inferred
  // real-estate business network connections.
  BusinessNetworkIdentifier linked_be = 2;

  // set when mailing_address is believed to also be the cental mailing
  // address of a real-estate business network central business's hq. in
  // that case, it's the network id of the business network headquartered
  // at that address.
  int64 ma_network_id = 3;

  // physical mailing address where the owner can be contacted, according
  // to assessor records.
  string mailing_address = 4; 
}

// brief description of a parcel which is not directly owned by the corporation
// being searched for, but which may be connected through real-estate holding
// network of business entities and owners.
//
// derived from the subquery commented "// compile everything together for the
// related parcels" in server/rest/handlers/corp.js, as of 2020/09/26. 
message NetworkedParcelInfo {
  // address of the networked parcel, as derived from sf assessor records.
  string addr = 1;

  // the block_lot of the parcel, primary key in ebook datastore and sf
  // assessor records.
  string block_lot = 2;

  // total amount of evictions believed to have occurred at the networked
  // property, which appear in ebook's datastore. no bounds on eviction date.
  int32 num_evictions = 3;

  // number of units on the networked property (for multi-building
  // properties, this is the sum total of units on the property).
  int32 units = 4;

  // latitude (in degrees) of a point within the networked property.
  double lat = 5;

  // longitude (in degrees) of a point within the networked property.
  double long = 6;

  // name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies.
  // see SFAssessorParcelDetails for description of valid neighborhood names.
  string neighborhood = 7;

  // identifiers for real-estate business networks which the networked parcel
  // may be associated with. in other words, these are networks with a
  // second-degree relatinship to the original parcel.
  repeated NetworkLocationInfo possible_networks = 8; 

  // individuals, businesses, or other legal entities believed to own the
  // networked parcel in whole or in part.
  repeated NetworkedParcelOwner owners = 9;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/query/query.proto

// query.proto
//
// proto messages describing the neo4j CYPHER queries used at runtime by the
// ebook node server. these definitions serve as a query abstraction layer.
//
// this serves dual purposes:
//
// first, they offer a clear reference point for developers seeking to
// understand the runtime queries.
//
// second, they offer a clear point of integration so the server's js business
// logic can be written and tested independently of the live database. see
// usage in server/rest/routes/dbRouteListeners.js.
//
// this strategy is effective for building resilience into systems that rely on
// interpreted query languages.
syntax = "proto3";

import "business.proto";
import "eviction.proto";
import "graph_util.proto";
import "network.proto";
import "parcel.proto";
import "util.proto";

package query;

// description of ebook's query abstraction layer.
//
// exists to serve as a concrete and testable interface boundary between the
// modules that interact directly with the database via CYPHER, and the modules
// which are written in pure javascript.
service EvictorbookQueryServiceV1 {
  // corp / lp / business queries:

  // query corporation info by normalized business name.
  rpc CalSOSCorporationQuery(CalSOSCorporationQueryParams) returns
    (CalSOSCorporationQueryResult);

  // query limited partnership / llc info by normalized business name.
  //
  // TODO: combine this with the 'corporation' query to make a single query
  // which could handle both cases. alternatively, it may be simpler to
  // implement that at the web service level in the node runtime.
  rpc CalSOSLimitedBusinessQuery(CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryParams)
    returns (CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryResult);

  // eviction queries:

  // query details for individual evictions, filtered by neighborhood.
  //
  // TODO: extend or replace with a query that allows for other filters.
  rpc EvictionsByNeighborhoodQuery(EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryParams) returns
    (EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryResult);

  // parcel queries:

  // DEPRECATED. prefer more specific parcel queries below.
  //
  // get details about a parcel from sf assessor records, keyed by the parcel's
  // block lot identifier, as well as info about evictions at the property,
  // suspected owners, etc.
  // 
  // rest api route: 'api/parcel/<BLOCK_LOT>'
  // query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/legacy.js
  rpc SFParcelLegacyQuery(SFParcelLegacyQueryParams) returns
    (SFParcelLegacyQueryResult);

  // get details about a parcel from sf assessor records, keyed by block_lot.
  // 
  // rest api route: 'api/parcel/<BLOCK_LOT>/details'
  // query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/details.js
  rpc SFParcelDetailsQuery(SFParcelDetailsQueryParams) returns
    (SFParcelDetailsQueryResult);

  // get details about evictions which occurred at a given parcel, keyed by
  // block_lot.
  // 
  // rest api route: 'api/parcel/<BLOCK_LOT>/evictions'
  // query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/evictions.js
  rpc SFParcelEvictionsQuery(SFParcelEvictionsQueryParams) returns
    (SFParcelEvictionsQueryResult);

  // get info about individuals, businesses, and/or trusts believed to own the
  // parcel in full or in part.
  //
  // rest api route: 'api/parcel/<BLOCK_LOT>/owners'
  // query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/owners.js
  rpc SFParcelOwnersQuery(SFParcelOwnersQueryParams) returns
    (SFParcelOwnersQueryResult);

  // get info about real-estate business networks believed to have a stake in
  // this parcel, as well as other parcels which those networks may have a
  // vested interest in.
  //
  // NOTE: performance bottleneck, invoke with caution.
  //
  // rest api route: 'api/parcel/<BLOCK_LOT>/networks'
  // query js: server/rest/handlers/parcel/networks.js
  rpc SFParcelNetworksQuery(SFParcelNetworksQueryParams) returns
    (SFParcelNetworksQueryResult);

  // given a network_id and a business entity which belongs to that network,
  // return a local view of the network centered around that business.
  rpc NetworkBusinessEntityQuery(NetworkBusinessEntityQueryParams) returns
    (NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult);

  // given a network_id and a parcel block_lot which is under that network's
  // influence, return a view of the network centered around that parcel.
  rpc NetworkParcelQuery(NetworkParcelQueryParams) returns
    (NetworkParcelQueryResult);

  // search queries:

  // used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based index lookup
  // on business entities (both 'corp' and 'lp') by normalized name.
  //
  // TODO: extend or replace with more robust/flexible search algorithm.
  rpc BusinessEntityIndexSearch(BusinessEntityIndexSearchParams) returns
    (BusinessEntityIndexSearchResult);

  // used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based lookup on sf
  // assessor parcel records on lot-level address strings.
  //
  // TODO: extend or replace with more robust/flexible search algorithm.
  rpc ParcelIndexSearch(ParcelIndexSearchParams) returns
    (ParcelIndexSearchResult);
}

// top-level queries are defined here to avoid circular dependencies.

//////////////////////////////////////
//  Corp/LP/Business query messages
//////////////////////////////////////

// parameters for cal sos corporation query.
message CalSOSCorporationQueryParams {
  // normalized name of the business, derived from the name found in california
  // sec. of state business records. must be an exact string match.
  string search_string = 1;
}

// query result:
message CalSOSCorporationQueryResult {
  // details about the business (founding date, filing number, mailing address,
  // officers, etc.)
  CalSOSCorporationDetails be_details = 1;

  // details about parcels which are directly owned by this business.
  repeated BusinessOwnedParcelInfo parcels_owned = 2;
  
  // evictions via sf rent board that may have been instigated by this business
  // (alone or w/ other agents). includes id numbers for further lookup.
  //
  // ellis act withdrawal evictions include names of plaintiffs.
  repeated SFRBEvictionMetadata evictions = 3;

  // parcels which this corporation may have a financial interest in, via
  // business connections. corporate networks are inferred by ebook graph
  // analysis.
  repeated NetworkedParcelInfo network_parcels = 4;
}

// Corresponds to the query defined in server/rest/handlers/lp.js
//
// given the normalized name of a limited business (limited partnership or
// limited liability corporation) from calif sec. of state business registry,
// get detailed info about that business and its observed real-estate
// holdings in sf.
message CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryParams {
  // Normalized name of the business, derived from the name found in California
  // Sec. of State business records.
  string search_string = 1;
}

// Query result:
message CalSOSLimitedBusinessQueryResult {
  // Details about the limited partnership or llc in question.
  CalSOSLimitedBusinessDetails be_details = 1;

  // Details about parcels which are directly owned by this business entity.
  repeated BusinessOwnedParcelInfo parcels_owned = 2;
  
  // Brief description of evictions from the SF Rent Board which this business
  // entity may have instigated (alone or with other agents). Includes id
  // numbers for further lookup, and in the case of an Ellis Act Withdrawal
  // includes the names of the plaintiff(s).
  repeated SFRBEvictionMetadata evictions = 3;

  // Descriptions of parcels which, though not directly owned by this business
  // entity, may be owned by another entity that it's related to through a
  // real-estate holding network. The networks are identified by the
  // evictorbook pipeline via connected component analysis.
  repeated NetworkedParcelInfo network_parcels = 4;
}

///////////////////////////////
//  Eviction query messages
///////////////////////////////

// corresponds to query in server/rest/handlers/neighborhood.js
//
// given the name of a neighborhood in san francisco, retrieves detailed
// information about all the evictions from evictorbook datastore which occured
// within that neighborhood's boundaries.
//
// TODO: explore alternate pagination api's (continuation token?)
// 
// query parameters:
message EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryParams {
  // neighorhood name. must be exact match.
  string neighborhood = 1;

  // pagination. if set nonzero, show the nth page of results. 
  // warning: if zero or unset, query will return all results at once.
  int32 page = 2;

  // pagination. if set nonzero, result pages are have this many entries.
  // maximum 100. must be set >= 1 if pages is set.
  int32 size = 3;
}

// query result:
message EvictionsByNeighborhoodQueryResult {
  // details about evictions which occurred on a property in this neighborhood.
  // includes info derived during ebook data analysis, plus info about the
  // parcel where the eviction occurred.
  repeated SFRBEvictionMetadata evictions = 1;
}

////////////////////////////
// Parcel query messages
////////////////////////////

// query params in server/rest/handlers/parcel/legacy.js
message SFParcelLegacyQueryParams {
  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string search_string = 1;
}

// result in server/rest/handlers/parcel/legacy.js
message SFParcelLegacyQueryResult {
  // detailed info about the parcel (location, physical properties, etc.).
  SFAssessorParcelDetails parcel_details = 1;

  // individuals, businesses, trusts, etc., which are believed to own the
  // parcel in full or in part.
  repeated SFAssessorParcelOwner owners = 2;

  // info about evictions believed to have occurred on the propert(y/ies) on
  // this parcel.
  repeated SFRBEvictionMetadata evictions = 3;

  // brief decsriptions of parcels which may be related through business
  // relations among parcel owners.
  repeated NetworkedParcelInfo network_parcels = 4;
  
  // identifiers for real-estate business networks which the parcel may be
  // associated with.
  repeated NetworkLocationInfo possible_networks = 5;

  reserved 6;  // wire-compatibility with SFOwnersQueryResult, see below.
}

// params in server/rest/handlers/parcel/details.js
message SFParcelDetailsQueryParams {
  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string search_string = 1;
}

// result in server/rest/handlers/parcel/details.js
message SFParcelDetailsQueryResult {
  // detailed info about the parcel (location, physical properties, etc.).
  SFAssessorParcelDetails parcel_details = 1;
}

// params in server/rest/handlers/parcel/evictions.js
message SFParcelEvictionsQueryParams {
  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string search_string = 1;

  reserved 2, 3, 4, 5, 6;  // wire-compatibility with SFParcelLegacyQueryResult
}

// result in server/rest/handlers/parcel/evictions.js
message SFParcelEvictionsQueryResult {
  // info about evictions believed to have occurred on the propert(y/ies) on
  // this parcel.
  repeated SFRBEvictionMetadata evictions = 2;

  reserved 1, 3, 4, 5, 6;  // wire-compatibility with SFParcelLegacyQueryResult
}

// params in server/rest/handlers/parcel/networks.js
message SFParcelNetworksQueryParams {
  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string search_string = 1;
}

// result in server/rest/handlers/parcel/networks.js
message SFParcelNetworksQueryResult {
  // individuals or businesses believed to own the parcel, in full or in part.
  //
  // owner info is required for interpreting best network_id's downstream.
  repeated SFAssessorParcelOwner owners = 3;

  // brief decsriptions of parcels which may be related through business
  // relations among parcel owners.
  repeated NetworkedParcelInfo network_parcels = 4;
  
  // identifiers for real-estate business networks which the parcel may be
  // associated with.
  repeated NetworkLocationInfo possible_networks = 5;

  reserved 1, 2, 6;  // wire-compatibility with SFParcelLegacyQueryResult.
}

// params in server/rest/handlers/parcel/owners.js
message SFParcelOwnersQueryParams {
  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string search_string = 1;
}

// result in server/rest/handlers/parcel/owners.js
message SFParcelOwnersQueryResult {
  // individuals or businesses believed to own the parcel, in full or in part.
  repeated SFAssessorParcelOwner owners = 3;

  // total number of parcels believed to be owned by all the full and part
  // owners of the queried parcel.
  //
  // added in late 2020, not a part of the original may 2020 api.
  //
  // TODO: Verify that this is useful, and that it means what we think it does.
  int32 parcels = 6;

  reserved 1, 2, 4, 5;  // wire-compatibility with SFParcelLegacyQueryResult
}

// params in server/rest/handlers/network.js 'business' query.
message NetworkBusinessEntityQueryParams {
  // normalized name of the business, derived from the name found in california
  // sec. of state business records.
  string be_name = 1;

  // "corp" or "lp", depending on whether the business is a corporation or
  // limited-partnership/llc.
  string input_type = 2;
}

// result of server/rest/handlers/network.js 'business' query.
message NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult {
  // normalized name of the business, matching be_name parameter from input.
  string name_norm = 1;

  // list of graph relations (edges) which make up a connected subgraph of the
  // ebook graph, representing the business network and its elements.
  //
  // each item here contains full descriptions of the relation's source and
  // destination node, so the caller can reconstruct the subgraph.
  //
  // COMPATIBILITY NOTE: this proto message differs from neo4j driver object
  // schemas, so conversion is required. see comments on GraphRelation
  // definition.
  repeated GraphRelation network_subgraph = 2;
  
  // total count of business entities which appear in this network (including
  // both corporations and limited-partnerships/llc's).
  int32 total_bes = 3;

  // normalized names of most-connected business in the network.
  // (SOS_Corp or SOS_LP nodes with highest degree).
  //
  // optional field __typename is set, so caller can disambiguate between
  // business types. returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12.
  repeated NormalizedName top_bes = 4;

  // normalized names of owners-of-businesses most connected in the graph
  // (SOS_Owner nodes with matching network_id, with highest degree). these
  // owners can be individuals, or other businesses. returns 5 entries as of
  // 2021/03/12. optional field '__typename' is NOT set.
  // 
  // see SOS_Owner node / CalSOSOwnerData in graph/nodes.proto.
  repeated NormalizedName top_owners = 5;

  // readable addresses which are the most well-connected in the graph.
  // (Address_Unit nodes with matching network_id with highest degree). returns
  // 5 entries as of 2021/03/12.
  //
  // TODO: describe what causes these addresses to be considered for inclusion.
  // clarify if they're physical addresses of component businesses/owners of
  // the network, or real-estate properties held by the network.
  // see Address_Unit node / AddressUnitData in graph/nodes.proto.
  repeated ReadableAddress top_addrs = 6;
}

// params in server/rest/handlers/network.js 'parcel' query.
message NetworkParcelQueryParams {
  // the block_lot of a parcel, which uniquely identifies it in the ebook graph
  // and in sf assessor records. required.
  string block_lot = 1;

}

// result of server/rest/handlers/network.js 'parcel' query.
message NetworkParcelQueryResult {
  // string representing the parcel's street address, including street number,
  // street name and suffix, and unit number. The parcel is assumed to be
  // within SF city/county limits.
  // 
  // See 'addr' in A_Parcel node as described by SFAssessorParcelData in
  // graph/nodes.proto.
  string addr = 1;

  // list of graph relations (edges) which make up a connected subgraph of the
  // ebook graph, representing the business network and its elements.
  //
  // each item here contains full descriptions of the relation's source and
  // destination node, so the caller can reconstruct the subgraph.
  //
  // COMPATIBILITY NOTE: this proto message differs from neo4j driver object
  // schemas, so conversion is required. see comments on GraphRelation
  // definition.
  repeated GraphRelation network_subgraph = 2;

  // total count of business entities which appear in this network (including
  // both corporations and limited-partnerships/llc's).
  int32 total_bes = 3;

  // see comment in NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult above.
  repeated NormalizedName top_bes = 4;

  // see comment in NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult above.
  repeated NormalizedName top_owners = 5;

  // see comment in NetworkBusinessEntityQueryResult above.
  repeated ReadableAddress top_addrs = 6;
}

////////////////////////
//  Search messages: 
////////////////////////

// business entity and parcel string-based search are defined below.

// business entity search. queries are interpreted as a prefix-tree search on
// the normalized set of business entity names.
message BusinessEntityIndexSearchParams {
  string query = 1;
}

// aggregation of matching search records. this would be a good place to add
// pagination tokens or other metadata about the results.
message BusinessEntityIndexSearchResult {
  // list of individual matching records.
  repeated BusinessEntityIndexRecord records = 1; 
}

// a single business entity search result.
message BusinessEntityIndexRecord {
  // the type name of the ebook graph node representing this business,
  // "SOS_Corp" or "SOS_LP".
  //
  // included explicitly, so that the calling code can distinguish between
  // corporation and limited-business nodes.
  string __typename = 1;

  // the business entity's name, after normalization. this name can be used as
  // a query parameter for retrieving information about a corporation or
  // limited-business.
  //
  // todo: document the normalization scheme.
  string name_norm = 2;
}

// parcel search. query is implemented as a prefix-tree search on the parcels'
// lot-level address strings.
message ParcelIndexSearchParams {
  // prefix string for an sf assessor parcel's lot-level address, as it appears
  // in normalized form in the ebook dataset.
  //
  // todo: clarify formatting and the role of unit number. 
  string query = 1;
}

// aggregation of parcel search results.
message ParcelIndexSearchResult {
  // list of individual matching records.
  repeated ParcelIndexRecord records = 1;
}

// an individual parcel search result.
message ParcelIndexRecord {
  // the street address component of this parcel's physical address.
  //
  // todo: clarify whether this is lot-level address or unit-level.
  string addr = 1;

  // the parcel's block lot number, which uniquely identifies a parcel in the
  // sf assessor's data.
  string block_lot = 2;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/query/util.proto

// query/util.proto
//
// contains helper messages which are useful in the query abstraction layer
// proto definitons.
syntax = "proto3";

package query;

// convience wrapper for normalized names.
// semantically neutral, used in a variety of contexts.
message NormalizedName {
  // a normalized name, as it appears in the graph.
  string name_norm = 1;

  // optional. node type of the graph node where this name_norm was found.
  // typically set for names of business entities, where there is a need to
  // differentiate between SOS_Corp and SOS_LP.
  string __typename = 2;
}

// convenience wrapper for human-readable addresses.
// TODO: describe normalization, etc.
message ReadableAddress {
  // readable/friendly representation of an address. normalization and internal
  // structure may vary based on where this; check the containing message for
  // details.
  string addr_readable = 1;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/rest/business.proto

// rest/business.proto
//
// message definitions for business entities (corporations and
// limited-partnerships/llc's) as they appear in the ebook api.
syntax = "proto3";

package rest;

message CorporationDetails {
  // transaction date of the document which established this corporation,
  // according to the california secretary of state business registry.
  // 
  // format: 'CCMMYYDD'.
  string transaction_date = 1;

  // an 8 digit corporate identification number, from the california secretary
  // of state business registry.
  string corporation_number = 2;

  // date on which this corporation was incorporated, according to the
  // california secretary of state business registry.
  // format: 'CCYYMMDD'
  string incorporation_date = 3;

  // status of the corporation, via calif. sec of state business records.
  //
  // NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field.
  // TODO: list the labels here.
  // TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation.
  string corporation_status = 4;

  // describes the legal process used to establish this business, according to
  // calif. sec of state business records.
  //
  // NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field.
  // TODO: list the labels here.
  // TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation.
  string corporation_type = 5;

  // tax base trype of the corporate, according to calif. sec of state records.
  //
  // NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field.
  // TODO: list the labels here.
  // TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation.
  string corporation_tax_base = 6;

  // additional corporate classifications which may convey special status, such
  // as 'religious' or 'agricultural cooperative' according to calif. sec. of
  // state business entity records.
  //
  // NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field.
  // TODO: list the labels here.
  // TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation.
  string corporation_classification = 7;

  // limited term expiration date.
  // TODO: explain what this means.
  // format: 'CCYYMMDD'
  string term_expiration_date = 8;

  // describes whether this corporation is in good standing with the california
  // franchise tax board (ftb).
  //
  // NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field.
  // TODO: list the labels here.
  // TODO: replace with a more flexible and informative representation.
  string ftb_suspension_status = 9;

  // if this corporation has been subject to action by the franchise tax board
  // as described in 'ftb_suspension_status', then this field contains a string
  // representation of the date of that action.
  //
  // format: 'CCYYMMDD'
  string ftb_suspension_date = 10;

  // statement of information file number, per calif sec of state records.
  string so_file_number = 11;

  // last complete statement (of information?) file date.
  // format: 'CCYYMMDD'
  string so_file_date = 12;

  // name of corporation, directly from calif. sec. of state records without
  // normalization.
  string corporation_name = 13;

  // 'care of' name, meaning the 'c/o' addressee which should be included on
  // mail intended for the corporation.
  string co_name = 14;

  // name of agent of process, as it appears on mailing address.
  string agent_name = 15;

  // mailing address for agent of process, line 1.
  string agent_address_line_1 = 16;

  // mailing address for agent of process, line 2.
  string agent_address_line_2 = 17;

  // city component of agent of process's mailing address.
  string agent_address_city = 18;

  // TODO: clarify what this means. is it state or county? or both????
  string agent_address_state_county = 19;

  // TODO: clarify whether these are 5-digit or 9-digit postal codes.
  string agent_address_zip_code = 20;

  // if the corporation is not 'domestic' (internal to calif.), then this field
  // specified a u.s. state other than california, or a country outside the
  // u.s., where this corporation originated.
  string state_or_foreign_country = 23;

  // business entity component id, generated by the ebook data pipeline
  // via connected component analysis.
  //
  // see BusinessNetworkIdentifier in network_ids.proto for details.
  int64 c_id = 24;

  // parcel ownership network component id, generated by the ebook data
  // pipeline via connected component analysis.
  //
  // see BusinessNetworkIdentifier in network_ids.proto for details.
  int64 network_id = 25;
}

message LimitedBusinessDetails {
  // llc only: state or county for formation of foreign llc.
  string jurisdiction_llc = 1;
 
  // llc only: management structure.
  // NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field.
  //
  // TODO: list the labels here.
  // TODO: this approach lends itself poorly to localization and is cumbersome
  //   to use in the client. replace with a more flexible and informative
  //   representation.
  string llc_management_code = 2;

  // llc only: type of business.
  //
  // TODO: provide examples.
  string llc_type_of_business = 3;

  // the filing number of the business entity, which is derived from the date
  // on which its filing paperwork was filed. the number is presented as a
  // string, with the format described below:
  //
  // format: 'CCYYJJJN9999'
  //   CCYY = century and year
  //   JJJ = julian day of year
  //   N = record type:
  //       0 = lp record
  //       1 = llc record
  //   9999 = sequence number 
  string file_number = 4;

  // date of original filing for this business. represents the same calendar
  // date as the date component of file_number, but follows a different format.
  // format: 'CCYYMMDD'
  string file_date = 5;

  // identifies current status of lp/llc, as represented in calif. sec. of
  // state business entity records.
  //
  // NOTE: these are human-readable labels, unlike equivalent query-proto field.
  //
  // TODO: list the labels here.
  // TODO: this approach lends itself poorly to localization and is cumbersome
  //   to use in the client. replace with a more flexible and informative
  //   representation.
  string status = 6; 

  // filing type (foreign or domestic) of this lp or llc, as represented in
  // calif. sec. of state business entity registry. 
  //
  // NOTE: these are human-readable labels, in contrast to the equivalent
  // query-proto field's abbreviations.
  //
  // TODO: this approach lends itself poorly to localization and is cumbersome
  //   to use in the client. replace with a more flexible and informative
  //   representation.
  // TODO: list the labels here.
  string filing_type = 7;

  // the raw, non-normalized name of this calif. limited partnership or llc,
  // as represented in calif. sec. of state business entity registry.
  string name = 8;

  // state or country of formation for foreign limited partnerships.
  string jurisdiction = 9;

  // name of agent of process, as it appears on mailing address.
  string agent_name = 10;

  // mailing address for agent of process, line 1.
  //
  // CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details.
  string agent_address_1 = 11;

  // mailing address for agent of process, line 2.
  //
  // CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details.
  string agent_address_2 = 12;

  // city component of agent of process's mailing address.
  //
  // CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details.
  string agent_city = 13;

  // component of agent of process's mailing address.
  //
  // CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details.
  string agent_state = 14;

  // todo: clarify whether these are 5-digit or 9-digit postal codes.
  //
  // CAUTION: naming convention differs from similar field in corp details.
  string agent_zip = 15;

  // cause of termination, if this lp/llc has been terminated. 
  // TODO: add examples.
  string term = 16;

  // business entity component id, generated by the ebook data pipeline
  // via connected component analysis.
  //
  // see BusinessNetworkIdentifier in network_ids.proto for details.
  int64 c_id = 17;

  // parcel ownership network component id, generated by the ebook data
  // pipeline via connected component analysis.
  //
  // see BusinessNetworkIdentifier in network_ids.proto for details.
  int64 network_id = 18;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/rest/eviction.proto

// rest/eviction.proto
//
// messages representing evictions and related metadata in ebook api.
syntax = "proto3";

import "network_ids.proto";

package rest;

message EvictionMetadata {
  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
  // fields describing the eviction itself:
  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

  // unique id for the eviction in ebook api.
  //
  // this is typically derived from sf rent board's petition id, but is *NOT*
  // equivalent. DO NOT USE THIS FOR DIRECT COMPARISON TO SFRB RECORDS.
  //
  // TODO: replace this with a less confusing opaque id, and add a field which
  // accurately presents the eviction's sf rent board petition id (primary key
  // in rent board records).
  string evict_id = 1;

  // date on which this eviction took effect, according to public records.
  // format: 'CCYYMMDD'.
  string evict_date = 2;

  // type of eviction, for example "Buyout Declaration" or "Ellis Act
  // Withdrawal".  todo: document supported values for this field.
  string type = 3;

  // attributed evictors according to ellis act withdrawal records. only
  // populated for evictions of type "Ellis Act Withdrawal"
  //
  // TODO: deprecate this, replace with a well-structured repeated field. this
  // is a vestige of v1 data pipeline, and it contains a comma-separated list
  // of names that's really not worth parsing.
  string ellis_evictor = 4;

  // no one knows what this field means.
  // TODO: deprecate and remove.
  bool multiple_sales_matches = 5;

  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
  // fields representing the parcel where this eviction took place:
  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

  // TODO: move these to their own sub-message, or provide a just the block_lot
  // id so the client can retrieve those details in its own way.

  // block_lot of the parcel where this eviction tool place. uniquely specifies
  // a parcel in sf assessor records.
  //
  // unique key for parcel in ebook api.
  string block_lot = 6;

  // num. units at the parcel where this eviction took place (via assessor
  // records).
  double units = 7;

  // latitude (in degrees) of a point within the boundaries of the parcel where
  // this eviction took place.
  double lat = 8;

  // longitude (in degrees) of a point within the boundaries of the parcel where
  // this eviction took place.
  double long = 9;

  // street address of the parcel where this eviction took place (via assessor
  // records). see 'addr' details in parcel.proto
  string addr = 10;

  // name of the neighorhood that encompasses the parcel where this eviction
  // took place (via assessor records). see details in parcel.proto
  string neighborhood = 11; 

  // no one knows what this means.
  //
  // TODO: deprecate and remove.
  bool multiple_addr_matches = 12;

    
  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
  // fields describing attributed evictors:
  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

  // only set when this eviction is part of a location-based query (ex:
  // neighborhood lookup). when set, contains the name of an attributed
  // evictor, or "Unknown" if there are no attributed evictors.
  //
  // when this message is part of a business-info query result, name is unset.
  //
  // TODO: deprecate and remove this, it's not helpful and the name is
  // seriously confusing.
  string name = 13;

  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
  // fields describing attributed business networks:
  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

  // note: this is only populated if the eviction message is part of a
  // range-based query (such as EvictionsByNeighborhood). it's not populted
  // when the eviction appears in a parcel query.
  //
  // for range-based queries like EvictionsByNeighborhood, the following holds:
  //
  // this is populated if and only if we believe the parcel's owner is a
  // business, which we have identified with california sec. of state business
  // records. contains information about the owning business, and its inferred
  // real-estate business network connections.
  BusinessNetworkIdentifier linked_be = 14;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/rest/graph_util.proto

// rest/graph_util.proto
//
// contains helper messages for describing neo4j graphs.
syntax = "proto3";

package rest;

// NOTE:
// forked from ../query/graph_util.proto.
//
// context for notes below: the original ebook API rest responses for network
// graph visualization directly included graph representations from the
// neo4j-driver library. as such, the exact structure of the GraphNode rest
// obj's cannot accurately be encoded as proto.
//
// see notes on 'properties' below for more info and the workaround.
//   -ubuvoid

////////////////////////////////////
// actual definitions begin here:
////////////////////////////////////

// representation of a node in the graph, including internal details
// particular to the graph's instantiation.
//
// based on the json schema of neo4j data driver's query results.
message GraphNode {
  // internal graph db id for this node.
  int64 identity = 1;

  // the node types that this node has. in our graph, nodes always have a
  // single type, as of 2021/03/12, but this may change in the future.
  repeated string labels = 2;

  // a json string representing a map of this node's properties, where the keys
  // are the property names and the values are strings, numbers, or objects.
  //
  // NOTE: this field does not appear in the response objects returned by
  // neo4j-driver.
  //
  // in the neo4j driver's response, 'properties' is a plain object. this is
  // convenient for the programming api, but it means that the driver's query
  // response can never be fully-type-safely specified as proto.
  //
  // this is because the schema of 'properties' is unpredictable (determined by
  // the contents of the db). you could choose to represent it as a map of
  // strings/bytes/Any/etc., but the native json representation of the proto
  // wouldn't match the actual neo4j driver's response.
  //
  // since we can't acheive perfect compatibility, the simplest strategy is to
  // encode the 'properties' object as json. callers should 'JSON.parse' the
  // value of 'properties_json' into 'properties' to achieve compatibility with
  // the neo4j driver api.
  // 
  // similarly, callers should 'JSON.stringify' the 'properties' value of a
  // neo4j driver response into 'properties_json' to allow encoding as proto.
  string properties_json = 3;

  // see above. the neo4j-driver object equivalent uses the name 'properties';
  // to make conversion code clearer, don't reuse that name.
  bytes properties = 4 [deprecated = true];

  // TODO: add another representation of 'properties' that's more well-suited
  // to querying directly from proto.
  //
  // one suggestion: map<string, GraphProperty> properties_map = 5;
  // where GraphProperty contains oneof stringValue, intValue, etc.
}

// representation of a relation (edge) in the graph, including internal details
// particular to the graph's instantiation. based on the js obj schema of
// neo4j-driver's query results.
//
// NOTE: a GraphRelation as described here contains the complete set of info
// for both nodes that it connects! that means that storing a graph as a list
// of these GraphRelation objects is inefficient, because the same node may be
// described many times (once for each connecting edge).
message GraphRelation {
  // origin node of the relation.
  GraphNode start = 1;

  // destination node of the relation. NOTE: as of 2021/03/12, edges are
  // treated as though they bidirectional in ebook graph analysis.
  GraphNode end = 2;

  // the relation/edge's type in the graph ("ENTITY_OWNED_BY", etc.).
  string type = 3;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/rest/network.proto

// rest/network.proto
//
// messages representing real-estate business networks and their holdings in
// the ebook api.
syntax = "proto3";

import "parcel.proto";

package rest;

// top-level overview of a real-estate network. this is the network view used
// in the 'parcel' rest endpoints.
//
// TODO: add a network_id field for easy identification in client.
message NetworkSummary {
  // mailing addresses which may identify this network. this is *NOT* an
  // exhaustive list of addresses within the network.
  repeated string searched_mail_address = 1;

  // info about parcels which may be related via both being financial interests
  // of this real-estate business network.
  //
  // TODO: remove this, replace with just the id's and perhaps address. the
  // client can retrieve parcel details if needed. 'possible_networks' may be a
  // field we need to expose through other means.
  repeated NetworkedParcelSummary related_parcels = 2;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/rest/network_ids.proto

// rest/network_ids.proto
//
// messages representing network id's and other identifier structs used in
// ebook api.
syntax = "proto3";

package rest;

// id and location characteristics of a real-estate business network.
message NetworkLocationInfo {
  // an address in the ebook datastore where the central owning entity of a
  // real-estate business network is believed to be located.
  string addr_readable = 1;

  // network id of the real-estate business network believed to be
  // headquartered at addr_readable.
  int64 network_id = 2;
}

// id's used to refer to a real-estate holding network, as modeled by
// analysis of the calif. sec. of state business registry.
//
// see the developer guide for a detailed description of the evictorbook's
// network connection methodology in the section "Network Connection Method -
// Detailed > During DB Creation".
//
// c_id assignment is described in step 'I' of that section and network_id
// assignment is described in step 'III'.
//
// TODO: This message name is inaccurate; it really represents a Business, not
// a Network. Need to rename.
message BusinessNetworkIdentifier {
  // type of business record in ebook datastore ("SOS_LP", "SOS_Corp") from
  // which this business information was extracted.
  string __typename = 1;

  // business network id of this business in ebook datastore, as inferred
  // by graph analysis. see graph schema documentation for details.
  int64 network_id = 2;

  // connected component id of this business in ebook datastore, as
  // inferred by graph analysis. all businesses with the same c_id must
  // also have the same network_id, though two businesses with the same
  // network_id may have different c_id's. see graph documentation and
  // developer guide for details.
  int64 c_id = 3;

  // normalized name of the business in the ebook datastore (node type:
  // "SOS_LP" or "SOS_Corp") from which this network information was extracted.
  string name_norm = 4;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/rest/parcel.proto

// rest/parcel.proto
//
// parcel-related messages as they appear in ebook api v1 responses.
syntax = "proto3";

import "network_ids.proto";
import "util.proto";

package rest;

// detailed info about a real-estate parcel from the sf assessor's office.
message ParcelDetails {
  // year in which the buildings on this real-estate parcel were first constructed.
  // TODO: describe behavior for multi-building parcels.
  int32 yr_built = 1;

  // string containing parcel's street address, including street number, street
  // name and suffix, and unit number. parcel is assumed to be within sf
  // city/county limits.
  //
  // notes from schema definition sheet:
  // full address in the format of "ST_START_NO-ST_END_NO ST_NAME ST_TYPE (Unit
  // UNIT)" (w/o end no if no address range, w/o parentheses if no unit)
  string addr = 2;

  // 'block_lot' identifier. unique key for a parcel in sf assessor records,
  // and unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database.
  string block_lot = 3;

  // latitude in degrees of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
  //
  // TODO: specify bounds.
  double lat = 4;

  // longitude in degrees of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
  //
  // TODO: specify bounds.
  double long = 5;

  // name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. as of 2020/09/26, it's
  // assumed that all parcels are within sf city and county, so these are san
  // francisco neighborhoods.
  //
  // neighborhoods assigned using sf polygons.
  //
  // names and polygon boundaries:
  // https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4
  //
  // TODO: deprecate this field in favor of a NeighborhoodInfo struct or
  // canonical neighborhood_id.
  string neighborhood = 6;

  // rough assessment of this parcel's rent-control status.
  //
  // 0 (default) if data unavailable to determine rent controlled status, 
  // 1 if likely rent controlled,
  // 2 if doubtful that this is rent controlled
  //
  // TODO: replace with an enum.
  int32 rent_controlled = 7;

  // property class code, via sf assessor's office.
  // definitons:
  // https://data.sfgov.org/Housing-and-Buildings/Reference-Assessor-Recorder-Property-Class-Codes/pa56-ek2h/data
  //
  // TODO: replace with an enum.
  string prop_class_code = 8;

  // i.d. for the zoning district this parcel occupies.
  // sf zoning district definitions:
  // https://sfplanninggis.org/pim/map.html?layers=Zoning%20Districts
  //
  // TODO: replace with an enum.
  string zone = 9;

  // how tall is the building on this parcel, in stories.
  // TODO: behavior for multi-building parcels?
  int32 stories = 10;

  // number of physical units within this logical real-estate parcel.
  int32 units = 11;

  // number of total rooms within buildings on this parcel (for multi-unit
  // parcels, this is the sum of rooms among all units.)
  int32 rooms = 12;

  // number of total bedrooms on this parcel (for multi-unit parcels, this is
  // the sum of bedrooms among all units.)
  int32 beds = 13;

  // assessor valuation of the 'land' base value, i.e. the parcel's theoretical
  // value if it had no buildings on it.
  int32 assess_land_val = 14;

  // assessor valuation of the 'improvement' done to the land via development,
  // as of most recent assessment. units in u.s. dollars.
  int32 assess_imp_val = 15;

  // date when the parcel's value was last assessed.
  //
  // format: CCYYMMDD
  string assess_val_date = 16;

  // date on which this parcel's address was last updated, via assessor
  // records.
  //
  // format: CCYYMMDD
  string update_date = 17;

  // TODO: document the provenance of this information, and when it is set.
  //
  // units in u.s. dollars.
  int32 curr_sales_price = 18;

  // TODO: document the provenance of this information, and when it is set.
  //
  // format: CCYYMMDD
  string curr_sales_date = 19;

  // if the logical parcel occupies more than one street number, then this field
  // contains the lowest street number in that range.
  //
  // if the logical parcel occupies only one street number, then this field
  // contains that number.
  //
  // TODO: why no parc_end_no field?
  // TODO: replace with a well-defined address message.
  int32 parc_start_no = 20;

  // main name part of the street/route name of the parcel's address.
  // (ex: "geary", "first", "taylor", etc.)
  //
  // TODO: describe capitalization, stylization, etc.
  // TODO: replace with a well-defined address message.
  string parc_street_name = 21;

  // street suffix (ex: "st", "ln") of the parcel's address.
  //
  // TODO: describe capitalization, stylization, etc.
  // TODO: replace with a well-defined address message.
  string parc_street_type = 22;

  // unit or subpremise identifier. just the number or letter. 
  // TODO: replace with a well-defined address message.
  string parc_unit_no = 23;

  // five-digit u.s. postal code of the parcel's address, as an integer.
  // TODO: replace with a well-defined address message.
  int32 parc_zip = 24;
}

// Summary of parcel info, with less information than ParcelDetails. Used in
// business lookup calls to describe parcels owned by that business.
message ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo {
  // 'block_lot' identifier. unique key for a parcel in sf assessor records,
  // and unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database.
  string block_lot = 1;

  // date listed on the documents recording ownership of the parcel.
  // todo: describe behavior for parcels with multiple owners.
  //
  // format: CCYYMMDD
  string record_date = 2;

  // ownership percentage, of the assigned owner, expressed as an integer
  // between 0 and 100, returned as a floating point number.
  double perc_owner = 3;

  // a string representing the parcel's street address, including street
  // number, street name and suffix, and unit number. the parcel is assumed to
  // be within sf city/county limits.
  string addr = 4;

  // number of recorded evictions associated with this parcel in the ebook graph.
  int32 num_evictions = 5;

  // number of units that this parcel consists of, according to sf city and
  // county assessor records.
  double units = 6;

  // latitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
  double lat = 7;

  // longitude, in degrees, of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
  double long = 8;

  // name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. as of 2021/03/11, it's
  // assumed that all parcels are within sf city and county, so these are sf
  // neighborhoods.
  //
  // values correspond to names of the neighborhood polygons described at:
  // https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4
  string neighborhood = 9;
}

// info about an individual, business, trust, or other legal entity which owns
// a real-estate parcel, in full or in part.
//
// *NOT* to be confused with a property corporation.  this message contains
// only information that is accessible from assessor records for the relevant
// parcel.
message ParcelOwner {
  // physical mailing address where this owner can be reached, according to
  // assessor parcel records.
  string mailing_address = 1;

  // date on which this ownership was documented, according to assessor records.
  // format: CCYYMMDD
  string record_date = 2;

  // ownership percentage, as a number between 0 and 100, as it appears in
  // assessor records.
  //
  // a value of '100' indicates full ownership. a lesser value indicates
  // partial ownership. note that for some parcels, we may have information
  // about some but not all owners. do *NOT* rely on the ownership percentages
  // for recorded owners adding up to 100.
  double perc_owner = 3;

  // name of owner listed on parcel records from assessor's office.
  // todo: briefly describe how/whether this data was normalized.
  string owner_name = 4;

  // optional.
  // this is populated if and only if we believe this owner is a business,
  // which we have identified with california sec. of state business records.
  // contains information about the owning business, and its inferred
  // real-estate business network connections.
  BusinessNetworkIdentifier linked_be = 5;
}

// contextual info about a parcel, in relation to a particular real-estate
// business network. see NetworkSummary in rest/network.proto for usage.
message NetworkedParcelSummary {
  /////////////////////////////
  //  metadata about parcel:
  /////////////////////////////

  // block_lot of the parcel in assessor records. primary key in ebook api.
  string block_lot = 1;

  // address of the parcel, as derived from sf assessor records.
  string addr = 2;

  // total amount of evictions believed to have occurred at the networked
  // property, which appear in ebook's datastore. no bounds on eviction date.
  int32 num_evictions = 3;

  // number of units that the relevant parcel consists of, according to sf
  // city and county assessor records. for multi-building properties, this
  // is the sum of all units among buildings on the property.
  int32 units = 4;

  // latitude (in degrees) of a point within the networked property.
  double lat = 5;

  // longitude (in degrees) of a point within the networked property.
  double long = 6;

  // name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies.
  // see parcel.proto for description of valid neighborhood names.
  string neighborhood = 7;

  // individuals, businesses, or other legal entities believed to own the
  // networked parcel in whole or in part.
  message NetworkedParcelOwner {
    // owner of the networked parcel, as it appears in that parcel's assessor
    // records.
    string owner_name = 1;

    // optional.
    // this is populated if and only if we believe this owner is a business,
    // which we have identified with california sec. of state business records.
    // contains information about the owning business, and its inferred
    // real-estate business network connections.
    BusinessNetworkIdentifier linked_be = 2;

    // set when mailing_address is believed to also be the cental mailing
    // address of a real-estate business network central business's hq. in
    // that case, it's the network id of the business network headquartered
    // at that address.
    string ma_network_id = 3;

    // physical mailing address where the owner can be contacted, according
    // to assessor records.
    string mailing_address = 4; 
  }
  repeated NetworkedParcelOwner owners = 8;

  //////////////////////////////////////
  // fields about network connections:
  //////////////////////////////////////

  // contains metadata about networks which this parcel may belong to.
  // keys are network_id's, as they appear in BusinessNetworkIdentifier msg's.
  //
  // values are a list of strings representing mailing addresses which may
  // identify a business in this network.
  //
  // !!! This is *NOT* an exhaustive list of addresses within the network. !!!
  //
  // COMPATIBILITY NOTE: in api 1.0 json representation, possible_networks is a
  // json multimap. multimaps are not suported natively in proto, so we define
  // a StringVector message to use as a replacement.
  // 
  // NOTE: until clients are migrated away from json multimap, will support
  // configuration flags to return json with original multimaps. see config
  // flags in /server/rest/routes/dbRouteSetup.js.
  map<string, StringVector> possible_networks = 9;

  // optional. when present, describes the provenance of the information in
  // possible_networks.
  //
  // "NETWORK_EXACT": possible_networks contains a single network, identified
  //     by mailing address info from the parcel's recorded owner.
  // "NETWORK_NONEXACT": possible_networks contains one or more networks,
  //     considered 'possible' matches based on indirect connections.
  // "NON_NETWORK": no network_id found, map contains placeholder network
  //     with key "NON_NETWORK" and single mailing address copied from parcel
  //     owner records.
  //
  // TODO: deprecate and replace with an enum.
  string connection_type = 10;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/rest/rest.proto

// rest.proto
//
// top-level description of ebook rest api. describes the rest routes (rpc's),
// and their request/response formats.
syntax = "proto3";

import "business.proto";
import "graph_util.proto";
import "parcel.proto";
import "eviction.proto";
import "network.proto";
import "user_feedback_report.proto";
import "util.proto";

package rest;

/////////////////////////////////////////
// Top-level REST service definition:
/////////////////////////////////////////

service EvictorbookRestService {
  // deprecated -- legacy endpoint, prefer more specific parcel calls below.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot'
  rpc GetParcel(GetParcelRequest) returns (GetParcelResponse);

  // get details about a parcel from sf assessor records, keyed by block_lot.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/details'
  rpc GetParcelDetails(GetParcelDetailsRequest) returns
    (GetParcelDetailsResponse);

  // get details about evictions which occurred at a given parcel, keyed by
  // block_lot.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/evictions'
  rpc GetParcelEvictions(GetParcelEvictionsRequest) returns
    (GetParcelEvictionsResponse);

  // get info about real-estate business networks believed to have a stake in
  // this parcel, as well as other parcels which those networks may have a
  // vested interest in.
  // NOTE: performance bottleneck, invoke with caution.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/networks'
  rpc GetParcelNetworks(GetParcelNetworksRequest) returns
    (GetParcelNetworksResponse);

  // get info about individuals, businesses, and/or trusts believed to own the
  // parcel in full or in part.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: 'api/parcel/:block_lot/owners'
  rpc GetParcelOwners(GetParcelOwnersRequest) returns
    (GetParcelOwnersResponse);

  // get info about a corporation, which may be part of a real-estate-owning
  // business network.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: '/api/corp/:name'
  rpc GetCorp(GetCorpRequest) returns (GetCorpResponse);

  // get info about a limited partnership or llc, which may be part of a
  // real-estate-owning business network.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: '/api/lp/:name'
  rpc GetLP(GetLPRequest) returns (GetLPResponse);

  // given a network_id and a parcel block_lot which is under that network's
  // influence, return a view of the network centered around that parcel.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: '/api/network/parcel/:network_id/:search_string'
  rpc GetNetworkParcel(GetNetworkParcelRequest) returns
    (GetNetworkParcelResponse);

  // given a business entity which belongs to a network, return a local view of
  // the network centered around that business.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: '/api/network/:input_type/:search_string'
  rpc GetNetworkBusinessEntity(GetNetworkBusinessEntityRequest) returns
    (GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse);

  // given the name of a neighborhood in san francisco, return eviction 
  // records from the eb datastore which occurred in that neighborhood.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: '/api/neighborhood/:neighborhood'
  //                and '/api/neighborhood/:neighborhood/:page'
  rpc GetEvictionsByNeighborhood(GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodRequest) returns
    (GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodResponse);

  // used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based lookup on sf
  // assessor parcel records on lot-level address strings.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: '/api/parcel-search/:search'
  rpc ParcelSearch(ParcelSearchRequest) returns (ParcelSearchResponse);

  // used for search feature on front page. performs prefix-based index lookup
  // on business entities (both 'corp' and 'lp') by normalized name.
  //
  // rest api v1 route: '/api/be-search/:search'
  rpc BusinessEntitySearch(BusinessEntitySearchRequest) returns
   (BusinessEntitySearchResponse);
}

//////////////////////////
//  Context messages
//////////////////////////

// placeholder for info about the incoming request (session id, request_id,
// permissions, etc.)
message RequestContext {
  // todo: populate with relevant fields.
}

//////////////////////////////////
//  Request/response messages
//////////////////////////////////

////////////////////////
//  GetCorp messages
////////////////////////

message GetCorpRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // name of a corporation to look up, as it appears in the California
  // Secretary of State business registry.
  //
  // todo: describe constraints on normalization, etc.
  string name = 2;
}

message GetCorpResponse {
  // details about this business. 
  //  
  // note: compared to equivalent query proto, several string fields are
  // remapped short keys to human-readable friendly labels: corporation_status,
  // corporation_type, corporation_tax_base, ftb_suspension_status,
  // corporation_classification.
  CorporationDetails be_details = 1; 

  // brief descriptions of the parcels believed to be owned by this business,
  // in whole or in part.
  repeated ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo parcels_owned = 2;

  // info about evictions we attribute to this business entity.
  repeated EvictionMetadata evictions = 3;

  // despite the name, this is a list of *parcels*, which may be owned by the
  // network associated with this business.
  //
  // COMPATIBILITY NOTE: contains a multimap field, which requires some
  // additional conversion to move from proto-compatibile to existing rest json
  // response. see NetworkParcelSummary.possible_networks for details.
  repeated NetworkedParcelSummary networks = 4;
}

//////////////////////
//  GetLP messages
//////////////////////

message GetLPRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // name of a limited partnership or llc to look up, as it appears in the
  // California Secretary of State business registry.
  //
  // todo: describe constraints on normalization, etc.
  string name = 2;
}

message GetLPResponse {
  // details about this business. 
  //  
  // note: compared to equivalent query proto, several string fields are
  // remapped short keys to human-readable friendly labels: status, filing
  // type, llc_management_code.
  LimitedBusinessDetails be_details = 1;

  // brief descriptions of the parcels believed to be owned by this business,
  // in whole or in part.
  repeated ParcelBriefOwnershipInfo parcels_owned = 2;

  // info about evictions we attribute to this business entity.
  repeated EvictionMetadata evictions = 3;

  // despite the name, this is a list of *parcels*, which may be owned by the
  // network associated with this business.
  //
  // COMPATIBILITY NOTE: contains a multimap field, which requires some
  // additional conversion to move from proto-compatibile to existing rest json
  // response. see NetworkParcelSummary.possible_networks for details.
  repeated NetworkedParcelSummary networks = 4;
}

////////////////////////////////////////
//  GetNetworkBusinessEntity messages
////////////////////////////////////////

message GetNetworkBusinessEntityRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // "corp" or "lp", depending on whether the business to query is a
  // corporation or a limited-partnership/llc.
  string input_type = 2;

  // normalized name of a business, derived from the name found in california
  // sec. of state business records.
  string search_string = 3;
}

message GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse {
  // normalized name of the business, matching be_name parameter from input.
  string name_norm = 1;

  // list of graph relations (edges) which make up a connected subgraph of the
  // ebook graph, representing the business network and its elements.
  //
  // each item here contains full descriptions of the relation's source and
  // destination node, so the caller can reconstruct the subgraph.
  //
  // COMPATIBILITY NOTE: this proto message differs slightly from neo4j driver
  // object schemas, so some conversion is required. see comments on
  // GraphRelation definition.
  repeated GraphRelation network_subgraph = 2;
  
  // total count of business entities which appear in this network (including
  // both corporations and limited-partnerships/llc's).
  int32 total_bes = 3;

  // normalized names of most-connected business in the network.
  // (SOS_Corp or SOS_LP nodes with highest degree).
  //
  // optional field __typename is set, so caller can disambiguate between
  // business types. returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12.
  repeated NormalizedName top_bes = 4;

  // normalized names of owners-of-businesses most connected in the graph.
  // (SOS_Owner nodes with matching network_id, with highest degree).
  // optional field __typename is NOT set.
  //
  // note: these owners can be individuals, or other businesses.
  //
  // returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12.
  // see SOS_Owner node / CalSOSOwnerData in graph/nodes.proto.
  repeated NormalizedName top_owners = 5;

  // readable addresses which are the most well-connected in the graph.
  // (Address_Unit nodes with matching network_id with highest degree).
  //
  // TODO: describe what causes these addresses to be considered for inclusion.
  // clarify if they're physical addresses of component businesses/owners of
  // the network, or real-estate properties held by the network.
  //
  // returns 5 entries as of 2021/03/12.
  // see Address_Unit node / AddressUnitData in graph/nodes.proto.
  repeated ReadableAddress top_addrs = 6;
}

/////////////////////////////////
//  GetNetworkParcel messages
/////////////////////////////////

message GetNetworkParcelRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // the network_id of the business network we want to retreieve. See
  // BusinessNetworkIdentifier for semantics. required.
  int64 network_id = 2;

  // the block_lot (unique key) of a parcel which is associated with this
  // network.
  string search_string = 3;
}

message GetNetworkParcelResponse {
  // string representing the parcel's street address, including street number,
  // street name and suffix, and unit number. The parcel is assumed to be
  // within SF city/county limits.
  // 
  // See 'addr' in A_Parcel node as described by SFAssessorParcelData in
  // graph/nodes.proto.
  string addr = 1;

  // list of graph relations (edges) which make up a connected subgraph of the
  // ebook graph, representing the business network and its elements.
  //
  // each item here contains full descriptions of the relation's source and
  // destination node, so the caller can reconstruct the subgraph.
  //
  // COMPATIBILITY NOTE: this proto message differs slightly from neo4j driver
  // object schemas, so some conversion is required. see comments on
  // GraphRelation definition.
  repeated GraphRelation network_subgraph = 2;

  // total count of business entities which appear in this network (including
  // both corporations and limited-partnerships/llc's).
  int32 total_bes = 3;

  // see GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse above.
  repeated NormalizedName top_bes = 4;

  // see GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse above.
  repeated NormalizedName top_owners = 5;

  // see GetNetworkBusinessEntityResponse above.
  repeated ReadableAddress top_addrs = 6;
}

/////////////////////////////////////////
//  GetEvictionsByNeighborhood messages
/////////////////////////////////////////

message GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // name of a neighborhood in sf. geographical filter for eviction records.
  //
  // names should correspond to the neighborhood polygons described at:
  // https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4
  string neighborhood = 2;

  // pagination.
  // if page is set > 0, rpc returns the <page>th page of <size> results.
  // if page is unset or set <= 0, rpc returns the first page.
  int32 page = 3;

  // pagination.
  // the number of results to store on a single page. defaults to 100. 
  // if unset or set <= 0, rpc uses the default page size.
  //
  // in production, size cannot be increased beyond the default. for
  // development, larger page sizes may be enabled with debug flags.
  // 
  // todo: establish a continuation token or some other signal for the caller
  // to know if there are more results beyond the current page.
  int32 size = 4;
}

message GetEvictionsByNeighborhoodResponse {
  // info about evictions in the ebook datastore which occurred within the
  // requested neighborhood's boundaries.
  //
  // NOTE FOR COMPATIBLITY: rest api v1 response json represents a list of
  // evicton objects directly, rather than an object with a list property. in
  // order to achieve compatibility with rest api v1 wire protocol, extract and
  // JSON.stringify this list. 
  repeated EvictionMetadata evictions = 1;
}

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//  GetParcel messages
//
//   deprecated, prefer limited-scope requests below.
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

message GetParcelRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string block_lot = 2;
}

message GetParcelResponse {
  // detailed info about the parcel (location, physical properties, etc.).
  ParcelDetails parcel_details = 1;

  // individuals, businesses, trusts, etc., which are believed to own the
  // parcel in full or in part.
  repeated ParcelOwner owners = 2;

  // info about evictions believed to have occurred on the propert(y/ies) on
  // this parcel.
  repeated EvictionMetadata evictions = 3;

  // info about real-estate business networks which may have a financial
  // interest in this parcel.
  //
  // keys: network_id's, as they appear in BusinessNetworkIdentifier messages.
  map<string, NetworkSummary> networks = 4;
}

/////////////////////////////////
//  GetParcelDetails messages
/////////////////////////////////

message GetParcelDetailsRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string block_lot = 2;
}

message GetParcelDetailsResponse {
  // detailed info about the parcel with the requested block_lot (location,
  // physical properties, etc.).
  ParcelDetails parcel_details = 1;
}

////////////////////////////////////
//  GetParcelEvictions messages
////////////////////////////////////

message GetParcelEvictionsRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string block_lot = 2;
}

message GetParcelEvictionsResponse {
  // info about evictions believed to have occurred on the propert(y/ies) on
  // the parcel with the requested block_lot.
  repeated EvictionMetadata evictions = 1;
}

//////////////////////////////////
//  GetParcelNetworks messages
//////////////////////////////////

message GetParcelNetworksRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string block_lot = 2;
}

message GetParcelNetworksResponse {
  // info about real-estate business networks which may have a financial
  // interest in this parcel.
  //
  // keys: network_id's, as they appear in BusinessNetworkIdentifier messages.
  map<string, NetworkSummary> networks = 1;
}

///////////////////////////////
// GetParcelOwners messages
///////////////////////////////

message GetParcelOwnersRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // block lot identifier of a parcel, as is appears in sf assessor records.
  // exact string match only.
  string block_lot = 2;
}

message GetParcelOwnersResponse {
  // individuals, businesses, trusts, etc., which are believed to own the
  // requested parcel in full or in part.
  repeated ParcelOwner owners = 1;

  // intended to represent the total number of parcels beleived to be owned, by
  // all the full and part owners of the queried parcel.
  //
  // added in late 2020, not a part of the original may 2020 api.
  //
  // TODO: Verify that this is useful, and that it means what we think it does.
  int32 parcels = 2;
}

/////////////////////////////
//  ParcelSearch messages
/////////////////////////////

message ParcelSearchRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // query string, to be interpreted as an address prefix.
  // todo: describe constraints, normalization, etc.
  string search = 2;
}

message ParcelSearchResponse {
  // the block_lot of this parcel in sf assessor records. unique key in ebook
  // rest api.
  string block_lot = 1;

  // human-readable address of the real-estate parcel in sf assessor records.
  // TODO: describe normalization, etc.
  string addr = 2;
}

////////////////////////////////////
//  BusinessEntitySearch messages
////////////////////////////////////

message BusinessEntitySearchRequest {
  // request context, see above.
  RequestContext context = 1;

  // query string, to be interpreted as a business-entity name prefix.
  // todo: describe constraints, normalization, etc.
  string search = 2;
}

message BusinessEntitySearchResponse {
  // represents the type of business entity, but only in an obscure way.
  // context: it's the node-type of the business's record in the eb database.
  // TODO: deprecate and replace with enum.
  //
  //  values:
  //   "SOS_Corp" if the business is a corporation.
  //   "SOS_LP" if the business is a limited partnership or llc.
  string __typename = 1;

  // canonical name of the business entity, as it appears in the
  // california secretary of state business registry.
  string name = 2;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/rest/user_feedback_report.proto

// user_feedback_report.proto
//
// Describes the payload of the user feedback form which is accessible at the
// bottom of all pages on the ebook site.
//
// As of 2021/03/15, the form on the website is backed by a google form; this
// proto descibes both the user-submitted content (the actual feedback) and the
// relevant metadata (timestamp, author-supplied email, source page, etc.).
syntax = "proto3";

package rest;

// Description from project proposal:
// At the bottom of each page of Evictorbook, a user will have an option to
// give feedback.
//
// First they can choose between the three buttons: "I like this," "I don't
// like this," and, "I want to report a bug."
//
// Once a button is pressed, a short comment form appears, where the user can
// optionally add a comment, optionally enter their email address, and
// optionally check a box that says, "You may contact me about this feedback."
message UserFeedbackReport {
  // 64 bit integer key to be used as a unique primary key in a db.
  int64 report_id = 1;

  // the url the user is commenting from, auto-generated by React (the text is
  // pulled straight from the address bar of the page they're filling out the
  // form on).
  string page_id = 2;

  // Time and date when comment was submitted.
  // Generated by React client and sent to server
  // TODO: units. clarify: is this a unix-epoch timestamp?
  int64 time_stamp = 3; 

  // What type of message the author of the feedback intends to convey. The
  // feedback author will select from among these types, which can be expressed
  // in a UI element on the page (graphical buttons, drop-down menu, etc.). 
  enum FeedbackCategory {
    FEEDBACK_CATEGORY_UNSPECIFIED = 0;
    FEEDBACK_LIKE = 1;
    FEEDBACK_DISLIKE = 2;
    FEEDBACK_BUG_REPORT = 3;
  } 

  // The feedback category which was selected by the submitter.
  // Must be set to a value other than UNSPECIFIED, otherwise this will be
  // rejected by the server.
  FeedbackCategory feedback_category = 4;

  // The actual feedback text, from a textarea on the website, as typed by the
  // user.
  //
  // TODO: Specify whether any safety checking has been done to confirm that
  // there are no attempted injection attacks contained in the body of this
  // string.
  //
  // TODO: Specify whether this string has been encoded with URL encoding or
  // other encoding mechanisms.
  string feedback_text = 5;

  // The user's email, as supplied by the user on the form 
  // The browser checks that it contains an @ symbol; no other data validation
  // performed
  //
  // !!! NOTE: Personally identifiable information! Handle with care, and don't
  // store the contents of this field without a clear data retenion plan. !!!
