  string email = 6;

  // Describes whether the feedback submitter gives their consent to be
  // contacted with future updates. 
  //
  // This should be interpreted in the context of the field where it appears.
  enum ContactPermission {
    CONTACT_PERMISSION_UNSPECIFIED = 0;
    PERMISSION_GRANTED = 1;
    PERMISSION_DENIED = 2;
  }

  // Result of a yes/no checkbox, asking if user gives permission to be
  // contacted about their feedback.
  ContactPermission contact_permission = 7;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/rest/util.proto

// rest/util.proto
//
// reusable helper messages for ebook rest api.

syntax = "proto3";

package rest;

// a simple wrapper around repeated strings.
//
// this is useful because doesn't natively support multimaps (maps of lists).
// to accomodate, we instead create a map where values are StringVector
// messages.
//
// if you need a multimap of a different type, create another Vector message in this
// file.
message StringVector {
  // string values contained in this vector.
  repeated string value = 1;
}

// convience wrapper for normalized names.
// semantically neutral, used in a variety of contexts.
message NormalizedName {
  // a normalized name, as it appears in the graph.
  string name_norm = 1;

  // optional. node type of the graph node where this name_norm was found.
  // typically set for names of business entities, where there is a need to
  // differentiate between SOS_Corp and SOS_LP.
  string __typename = 2;
}

// convenience wrapper for human-readable addresses.
// TODO: describe normalization, etc.
message ReadableAddress {
  // readable/friendly representation of an address. normalization and internal
  // structure may vary based on where this; check the containing message for
  // details.
  string addr_readable = 1;
}

server/schemas/legacy/proto/search/search.proto

// search.proto
//
// descriptions of rest requests and responses used for unified search api.
// for legacy handlers (/api/parcel-search and /api/be-search), see
// ../rest/rest.proto .
syntax = "proto3";

package search;

// Work-in-progress definition for Unified Search api, as first expressed in frontend
// meeting notes here:
// https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EC6UQh9QaZ91rJDzPD3dwK7Sx6njpGEeqk_xDpFxnjs/edit#bookmark=id.bz8kuxmzfftm
//
// Implementation can be found at server/serviceHandlers/ebookSearchService

////////////////////////
// Service definition
////////////////////////

// proto expression of rest interface.
service EbookSearchService {
  // rest api route: GET '/api/search?q=<query>'
  //   where <query> is a url-safe search string.
  rpc Search(SearchRequest) returns (SearchResponse);
}


//////////////////////////////////////
// Search Request/Response protos:
//////////////////////////////////////

// since search is a GET request, there's no request body.

// instead this represents the info in an incoming GET request, serving as a
// conceptual model and also an object schema to load params into.
message SearchRequest {
  // the text of the query string we want to run a general-purpose search for.
  //   populated from the queryparam 'q', as in '/api/search?q=URBAN%20ORANGE'
  string query_string = 1;

  // determines which neo4j database server to use, if the server supports it.
  //  "v1" or "v2". If unset/empty string, assume "v1."
  string database_version = 2;

  // todo: add some params for sidechannels such as headers, and request
  // metadata (source ip, session id, etc.)
}

// representation of /api/search response json.
message SearchResponse {
  // a list of search results.
  //
  // callers should assume the results are returned in relevance order.
  repeated SearchResult results = 1;
}

// an individual search result item, and accompanying metadata.
message SearchResult {
  // main label for this search result. ex: name of company, address, etc.
  // obj with localizable strings, see below.
  string label = 1;

  // optional. (may be unset or null in response json)
  // if populated, this contains a short description of the item, for optional
  // display if layout permits.
  string description = 2;

  // url to link to. this is the public user-facing page (react route).
  string details_url = 3;

  // url for rest api request, to retrieve structured data about this item.
  string api_url = 4;

  // the type of entity this search result represents.
  enum Category {
    CATEGORY_UNSPECIFIED = 0;
    PARCEL = 1;
    BUSINESS_ENTITY = 2;
    NEIGHBORHOOD_SUMMARY = 3;
  }
  // Category category = 5;

  // HACK: Use a string rather than enum value to work around int/string enum
  // weirdness in json representation. TODO Establish a cleaner way of doing
  // this.
  // Values: "PARCEL", "BUSINESS_ENTITY", "NEIGHBORHOOD_SUMMARY". Required.  
  string category = 5;

  // Human-readable display for category enum. Required.
  // ex: "Address", "Owner", "Neighborhood".
  string category_label = 10;

  // potential search payloads. type-safe/queryable from proto.
  // TODO: add more payload messages as we add new categories.
  ParcelSearchPayload parcel_data = 6;
  BusinessSearchPayload business_data = 7;
  NeighborhoodSummaryPayload neighborhood_data = 8;

  // Details about result scoring/ranking.
  RankingInfo ranking_info = 9;
}

// Details about result scoring/ranking.
message RankingInfo {
  // Raw score, as retrieved from the database index's full text search.
  double raw_score = 1;
}

message ParcelSearchPayload {
  // the block_lot of this parcel in sf assessor records. unique key in ebook
  // rest api.
  string block_lot = 1;

  // value of block_lot, encoded to be uri-safe.
  string block_lot_safe = 2;

  // the address of the parcel, exactly as it appears in ebook database.
  // (see node types: Address_Main and Address_Unit.)
  //
  // IMPORTANT: this is not a human-readable address!
  //
  // these strings may be missing critical information such as street suffix or
  // zip code, and they may have arbitrary leading and trailing spaces. they
  // are extracted directly from the database without cleanup.
  //
  // preserving the current behavior for now to avoid breaking existing code.
  // (changing undocumented behavior without warning is dangerous.)
  //
  // TODO: migrate away from this.
  string addr = 3;

  // value of addr, reformatted to be human-readable. title case, leading and
  // trailing spaces trimmed. all the warnings above about the content of the
  // address still apply (missing components, etc.)
  string display_addr = 4;

  // TODO: expand. more metadata, etc.
}

message BusinessSearchPayload {
  // represents the type of business entity, but only in an obscure way.
  // context: it's the node-type of the business's record in the eb database.
  // TODO: deprecate and rely instead on enum.
  //
  //  values:
  //   "SOS_Corp" if the business is a corporation.
  //   "SOS_LP" if the business is a limited partnership or llc.
  string db_node_type = 1;

  // the business's type, as represented in calif. sec of state business
  // registry.
  enum BusinessType {
    BUSINESS_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED = 0;
    CALIF_SOS_CORP = 1;  // corporation.
    CALIF_SOS_LP = 2;    // limited partnership or llc.
  }
  // BusinessType business_type = 2;

  // HACK: Use a string rather than enum value to work around int/string enum
  // weirdness in json representation. TODO Establish a cleaner way of doing
  // this.
  // Values: "CALIF_SOS_CORP", "CALIF_SOS_LP". Required.
  string business_type = 2;

  // literal value of the business entity's canonical name in ebook db, where
  // it appears as 'name_norm'.
  //
  // derived from the name as it appears in the california secretary of state
  // business registry.
  string canonical_name = 3;

  // value of the business entity's name in db, encoded as a url-safe string.
  // useful when generating uri's for REST api calls.
  string canonical_name_safe = 4;

  // human-friendly formatting of business's name, as it appears in the
  // california secretary of state business registry.
  string display_name = 5;

  // TODO: unique id. leaving this out for now because it's not supported by
  // existing rest api.
  //   ex: string business_id = 6;

  // TODO: expand. more metadata, etc.
}

message NeighborhoodSummaryPayload {
  // non-url-safe version of canonical name, as expected in '/api/neighborhood'
  // requests. useful in server code, because express converts the url-safe
  // parameter back to an unsafe string.
  string canonical_name = 1;

  // url-safe version of the neighborhood's name expected in '/api/neighborhood'
  // requests. useful in client code for assembling REST uri's.
  string canonical_name_safe = 2;

  // human-friendly formatting of neighborhood name, suitable for display in a ui.
  string display_name = 3;

  // integer id uniquely identifying neighborhood in ebook api.
  int64 id = 4;
}

server/schemas/src/graph_util/graph_barbells.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "graph_barbells",
  description: "Representation of a subset of the evictorbook serving graph, so named because it consists of a list of 'NODE--relation--NODE' triples. This is space-inefficient because nodes are represented multiple times (once for each connecting edge), but it's convenient to retrieve via CYPHER query.",
  type: "array",
  items: require("./graph_relation_barbell")
}

server/schemas/src/graph_util/graph_node.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "graph_node",
  description: "Description of a node in the ebook graph database. Directly modeled on the node representation returned by the neo4j-driver in graph queries.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // The node's internal id within the database. Subject to change between database dumps.
    "identity": { type: "integer" },

    // Type labels assigned to this node in the ebook db, such as "SOS_Corp" or
    // "A_Parcel". As of 05/2021, all nodes have a single type. See the graph
    // schema for details about node types.
    "labels": { type: "array", items: { type: "string" } },

    // Map of the key-value properties this node contains.
    //
    // NOTE: In addition to these primitives, neo4j also has support for
    // certain complex property types including the spatial type 'Point' and
    // time/duration types such as 'DateTime'. If we add those to the graph,
    // we'll need to update the schema here to represent them.
    "properties": { 
      type: "object",
      additionalProperties: {
        anyOf: [
          { type: "number" },
          { type: "boolean" },
          { type: "string" }
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/graph_util/graph_node_lite.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "graph_node_lite",
  description: "Alternate representation of a graph node. Does not contain the full property map, nor the internal graph id.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // Identifying string retrieved from one of the node's properties. For
    // business nodes, this is 'name_norm'. For address nodes, it's
    // 'addr_readable'. TODO: Document how and why these properties were
    // selected.
    "name": { type: "string" },

    // Number of other nodes this node is connected to in the ebook database.
    // This is the metric used to determine the 'top' business entities,
    // owners, etc., in the graph.
    "degree": { type: "integer" },

    // Type of node in the graph database. This is the value of the sole entry
    // in the 'label' list from the canonical 'graph_node' representation.
    "type": { type: "string" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/graph_util/graph_relation_barbell.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "graph_relation_barbell",
  description: "Representation of a connecting edge in the ebook graph db, plus the full representation of the two nodes it connects. Ebook represents graph components on the wire as arrays of these 'barbells' because it's convenient to retrieve them from the graph db via CYPHER query. However, it's inefficient, because nodes with multiple connecting edges are represented multiple times (once for each connecting edge.)",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // The name of this relation's type in the ebook db, such as 'LISTED_AT'.
    // See the graph schema for details about relation types.
    "type" : { type: "string" },

    // Full description of the origin node.
    "start": require("./graph_node"),
    
    // Full description of the destination node.
    "end": require("./graph_node")
  }
}

server/schemas/src/pages/parcel_page.js

// Example schema to demonstrate how query responses can be aggregated into
// 'page' data routes. These reflect 'raw'/unprocessed results, in other words
// the strings and types haven't been cleaned/reformatted to be more
// human-readable.
//
// To represent 'processed' data, new schemas should be created to describe any
// changes to object layout, string formatting and enum values, etc.
module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "parcel_page",
  description: "Collected information to be rendered on ebook parcel page.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // Note that 'details' is the oddity, because the query response itself, as
    // written, contains a 'details' property. That would be redundant, so
    // instead we define our own property that has the same type. Future
    // maintainers can resolve this inconsitency if so desired.
    "details": require("../queryV2/parcel_details"),
    "evictions": require("../queryV2/responses/parcel_evictions_response"),
    "ownership_info": require("../queryV2/responses/parcel_owners_response"),
    "portfolio": require("../queryV2/responses/common_portfolio_response"),
    "related_networks": require("../queryV2/responses/common_related_network_response")
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/additional_evictor_reference.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "additional_evictor_reference",
  description: "Brief description of an entity who may be responsible for instigating an eviction, but was not identified as the 'primary' evictor.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // The evictor's name, as represented in the source document. All caps.
    "evictor_name": { type: "string" },

    // Type of document this information was sourced from.
    // As of 2021/05/29, all 'additional' evictors are sourced from ellis act petitions.
    // Add enum values here as we introduce additional types of source documents.
    "source": { type: "string", enum: [ "ELLIS_PETITION" ]  }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/business_details_corp.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "business_details_corp",
  description: "Information about a corporation, directly lifted from the properties map of the corresponding node in the ebook db.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties:  {
    // Normalized name of the business, derived from the name in Calif. Sec. of
    // State business records.
    //
    // TODO: Describe or link specifics of the string normalization.
    "name_norm": { type: "string" },

    // Transaction date of the document which established this corporation,
    // according to the California Secretary of State business registry.
    //
    // Date is represented as a string with format 'CCYYMMDD'.
    "transaction_date": { type: "string" },

    // An 8 digit Corporate Identification Number, from the California Secretary
    // of State business registry.
    "corporation_number": { type: "string" },

    // Date on which this corporation was incorporated, according to the
    // California Secretary of State business registry.
    //
    // Date is represented as a string with format 'CCYYMMDD'.
    "incorporation_date": { type: "string" },

    // Status of the corporation, as a string containing a code from Calif. Sec.
    // of State business entity records. The values are described as follows in
    // the database schema documentation:
    //
    // 1 = Active
    // 2 = Suspended
    // 3 = Canceled
    // 4 = Surrendered
    // 5 = Term expired
    // 6 = Dissolved
    // 7 = Forfeited
    // 8 = Deleted
    // 9 = Inactive
    // C = Merged Out
    // E = State to Federal Bank Conversion
    // F = Conditionally dissolved (No tax clearance)
    // Not sure about code = Converted Out
    //
    // In the 05/2020 production database, the codes which appear are: "0"-"9", "C"
    "corporation_status": { type: "string" },

    // Description of the legal process used to establish this corporation,
    // according to Calif. Sec. of state records. The allowed values and their
    // meanings are listed below.
    //
    // ARTS = Articles of Incorporation
    // S&DC = Statement & Designation By Foreign Corporation
    // S&DA = Statement & Designation By Foreign Association
    // FNRE = Foreign Name Registration
    //
    // present in 05/2020 production database: "ARTS", "S&DC".
    "corporation_type": { type: "string" },

    // Description of the tax-base of the corporation, according to calif. sec.
    // of state records. this indicates whether a corporation is for-profit or
    // non-profit.
    //
    // S = Stock
    // N = Non-Stock (Nonprofit)
    "corporation_tax_base": { type: "string" },

    // Additional corporate classifications which may convey special status, such
    // as 'religious' or 'agricultural cooperative' according to calif. sec. of
    // state business entity records.
    //
    // AG = Agricultural Cooperative
    // CR = Credit Union
    // MU = Mutual Benefit
    // OC = Other Cooperative
    // PB = Public Benefit
    // RE = Religious
    // SL = Corporation Sole
    // UN = Unclassified
    "corporation_classification": { type: "string" },

    // Limited Term expiration date. Format = CCYYMMDD
    "term_expiration_date": { type: "string" },

    // Describes whether this corporation is in good standing with the california
    // franchise tax board (ftb).
    //
    // '' = Not Suspended (In Good Standing) (empty string)
    // F = Forfeited
    // S = Suspended
    "ftb_suspension_status": { type: "string" },

    // If this corporation has been subject to action by the franchise tax board
    // as described in 'ftb_suspension_status", then this field contains a string
    // representation of the date of that action.
    //
    // Date is represented as a string with format 'CCYYMMDD'.
    "ftb_suspension_date": { type: "string" },

    // Statement of information file number, per calif sec of state records.
    "so_file_number": { type: "string" },

    // Last complete statement (of information?) file date.
    //
    // Date is represented as a string with format 'CCYYMMDD'.
    "so_file_date": { type: "string" },

    // Name of corporation, directly from calif. sec. of state records without
    // normalization.
    "corporation_name": { type: "string" },

    // 'Care of' Name, meaning the 'c/o' addressee which should be included on
    // mail intended for the corporation.
    "co_name": { type: "string" },

    // Name and contact info of Agent for Service of Process
    //
    // !!! CAUTION !!! Different naming conventions from SOS_LP fields with
    // similar info!
    "agent_name": { type: "string" },
    "agent_address_line_1": { type: "string" },
    "agent_address_line_2": { type: "string" },
    "agent_address_city": { type: "string" },

    // The state component of the agent-for-service addr.
    //
    // NOTE: These are not cleaned! Most corps have value "CA", but some have
    // suffixes (intended to indicate county code?)
    //
    // examples of odd entries in 05/2020 production db:
    //    "CA 9", "CA 5126", "CAA", "A".
    "agent_address_state_county": { type: "string" },

    // Sometimes these are 5-digit codes, sometimes these are 9-digit.
    // TODO: cleanup.
    "agent_address_zip_code": { type: "string" },

    // TODO: Describe this field; there's no description in the schema document.
    //
    // As of 2020/09/09, working understanding is that if the corporation is not
    // 'domestic' (internal to calif.), then this field describes a u.s. state
    // other than california, or a country outside the u.s., where this
    // corporation originated.
    "state_or_foreign_country": { type: "string" },

    // Parcel ownership network id, generated by the evictorbook data
    // pipeline via connected component analysis.
    "network_id": { type: "integer" },
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/business_details_lp.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "business_details_lp",
  description: "Information about a limited partnership or llc, directly lifted from the properties map of the corresponding node in the ebook db.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties:  {
    // Normalized name of the partnership or llc, derived from the name used in
    // Calif Sec. of State business records.
    //
    // TODO: Describe or link specifics of the string normalization.
    "name_norm": { type: "string" },

    // LLC only: state or county for formation of foreign llc.
    "jurisdiction_llc": { type: "string" },
   
    // LLC only: management structure.
    // 1 = One Manager
    // M = More Than One Manager
    // A = All Members are Managers
    // LLC ONLY
    "llc_management_code": { type: "string" },

    // LLC only: type of business.
    "llc_type_of_business": { type: "string" },

    // Format is CCYYJJJN9999
    // CCYY = Century and Year.
    // JJJ = Julian day of year.
    // N = Record Type
    // 0 = LP Record
    // 1 = LLC Record
    // 9999 = Sequence Number 
    "file_number": { type: "string" },

    // Date of initial filing, represented as CCYYMMDD
    "file_date": { type: "string" },

    //  Identifies current status of LP/LLC
    //  A = Active
    //  B = Dishonored Check
    //  C = Canceled
    //  D = Dissolved
    //  P = Pending Cancellation
    //  F = Franchise Tax Board (FTB) Suspended/Forfeited
    //  M = Merged out
    //  O = Converted out
    //  S = Secretary of State (SOS) Suspended/Forfeited
    //  2 = SOS/FTB Suspended/Forfeited
    "status": { type: "string" }, 

    // Filing type: foreign "F" or domestic "D".
    "filing_type": { type: "string" },

    // California Limited Partnership or LLC Name, non-normalized.
    "name": { type: "string" },

    // State or country of formation for foreign limited partnerships.
    "jurisdiction": { type: "string" },

    // Agent of service contact info.
    //
    // !! CAUTION !! These fields follow a different naming convention than their
    // conterparts in SOS_Corp.
    "agent_name": { type: "string" },
    "agent_address_1": { type: "string" },
    "agent_address_2": { type: "string" },
    "agent_city": { type: "string" },
    "agent_state": { type: "string" },
    "agent_zip": { type: "string" },

    // Date or cause of termination.
    //
    // This is a free-form text field and can follow many formats, depending on
    // context. Examples of typical contents:
    //
    //  - date in "MM/DD/YY" format. some records allow '00' for month or date.
    //  - date in "MM/DD/YY" format with qualifying suffix.
    //       examples: "01/01/15 OR EVENT", "01/15/40 OR PER AGMT", "02/15/33*"
    //  - date in "MMDDYY" format
    //  - date in "MM/DD/YYYY" format (for some 90's records).
    //
    // In general, if you're looking at this, expect it to be difficult to parse.
    //
    // TODO: document exhaustively and/or apply cleanup in pipeline.
    "term": { type: "string" },

    // Network component id of the connected component this owner belongs to.
    // This uniquely specifies the ownership network this owner belongs to,
    // according to graph analysis in the evictorbook data pipeline.
    "network_id": { type: "integer" },
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/business_network_identifier.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "business_entity_metadata",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // id of the network this business entity is associated with in the ebook db.
    "network_id": { type: "integer" },

    // node which represents the business in the ebook db, used as
    // a proxy for the type of business entity (corporation, or
    // limited partnership/lcc).
    "__typename": { type: "string", enum: ["SOS_LP", "SOS_Corp"] }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/database_search_result.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "database_search_result",
  description: "Search result directly from the database's full-text index search.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // Monotomically increasing search score, as returned from the db's Lucene
    // full text search. These can be used only for direct comparison within a
    // single index, meaning that comparing 'address' result scores are *NOT*
    // directly comparable with 'business' result scores, etc.
    "score": { type: "number" },

    // Type of the node this search result represents in the ebook db (ex: "SOS_LP").
    "result_type": { type: "string" },

    // A property of the node this search result represents, selected because
    // it allows for a quasi-human-readable label. For business nodes, this is
    // 'name_norm'. For address nodes, it's the "readable" addr string.
    "result_name": { type: "string" },

    // The unique key of the entity this search result represents. For business
    // nodes, it's the 'name_norm'. For address nodes, it's the block_lot of
    // the corresponding parcel node.
    "result_id": { type: "string" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/eviction_match_quality.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "eviction_match_quality",
  type: "object",
  properties: {
    // describes the method used to match the eviction to its associated parcel.
    "addr_match_method": {
      type: "string",
      // TODO: List possible values.
      // enum: [ "GEO_INSIDE_MULTIPLE", "EXACT_ASSESSOR_ADDR_UNIT", "RANGE_ASSESSOR_ADDR_WO_UNIT", ... ]
    },
    "did_subdivision_occur": {
      type: "string",
      // TODO: List possible values.
      // enum: [ "SUBDIVISION_BEFORE_EVICTION", "NO_SUBDIVISION", ... ]
    }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/eviction_record.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "eviction_record",
  description: "Representation of an eviction record, without location information. Used when nested in a description of a real-estate parcel, when the location info would be redundant.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // unique identifier for the eviction.
    "evict_id": { type: "string" },

    // eviction date, in the format "YYYYMMDD"
    "evict_date": { type: "string" },

    // information about the primary attributed evictor.
    "primary_evictor": {
      "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
      title: "evictor_summary",
      type: "object",
      properties: {
        // name of the evictor, as represented in the ebook db.
        name: { type: "string" },
        // if the evictor is believed to be a property-owning business entity,
        // then 'linked_be' is set to a non-empty object describing the
        // business entity. otherwise, it's set null or to an empty object.
        linked_be: {
          anyOf: [
            { type: "null" },
            require('./business_network_identifier.js')
          ]
        }
      }
    }, 

    // additional names associated with the eviction, taken from the eviction
    // petition itself.
    //
    // !!! WARNING !!! In the neighborhood results, 'extra_evictors' is a property
    // of the 'evictor' object. Here, it's a separate entity. TODO Resolve
    // this inconsistency.
    "extra_evictors": { type: "array", items: require("./additional_evictor_reference") },

    // address listed on the eviction petition.
    // TODO: Describe normalization steps.
    "evict_addr_orig": { type: "string" },

    // total number of other properties matched with this eviction, not
    // including the primary property this eviction record is returned as a
    // sub-message of.
    "num_other_parc": { type: "integer", minimum: 0 },

    // the type of the eviction.
    "type": {
      type: "string",
      // TODO List possible values from the DB.
      // enum: [ "Owner Move In", ... ]
    },

    // Summary of how this eviction record was matched to its associated
    // location in the ebook data pipeline.
    "match_quality": require("./eviction_match_quality"),
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/eviction_record_ownerpage.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "eviction_record_ownerpage",
  description: "Yet another representation of an eviction record, this one tied to the 'owner' page. It contains location information in a nested substructure (*NOT* the merged structure of 'eviction_record_with_location') and elides the primary evictor's contact information, assuming the caller will have the primary evictor info from context.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // unique identifier for the eviction.
    "evict_id": { type: "string" },

    // eviction date, in the format "YYYYMMDD"
    "evict_date": { type: "string" },

    // additional entities associated with the eviction, taken from the eviction
    // petition itself.
    "extra_evictors": { type: "array", items: require('./additional_evictor_reference') },

    // address listed on the eviction petition.
    // TODO: Describe normalization steps.
    "evict_addr_orig": { type: "string" },

    // the type of the eviction.
    "type": {
      type: "string",
      // TODO List possible values from the DB.
      // enum: [ "Owner Move In", ... ]
    },

    // Summary of how this eviction record was matched to its associated
    // location in the ebook data pipeline.
    "match_quality": require("./eviction_match_quality"),

    // Collected fields describing the parcel this eviction was matched to.
    //
    // !!! WARNING !!! According to notes in the annotated test data by dpsgit,
    // this location is randomly selected in the event that multiple locations
    // were matched.
    "location": {
      type: "object",
      additionalProperties: false,
      properties: {
        // The parcel's block_lot number, used as a unique identifier. Assumed to
        // be in san francisco. Suffix, without hyphens, of the parcel's APN.
        "block_lot": { type: "string" },

        // total number of other properties matched with this eviction, not
        // including the property described by this 'location' sub-message.
        "num_other_parc": { type: "integer", minimum: 0 },

        // Name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. It's assumed that all
        // parcels are within sf city and county, so these are san francisco
        // neighborhoods.
        //
        // See neighborhood config / search result data for the canonical
        // neighborhood names. These are upper case, such as "EXCELSIOR" and
        // "MISSION".
        //
        // neighborhoods assigned using sf polygons.  polygon boundaries:
        // https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4
        "neighborhood": { type: "string" },

        // Number of units in the assigned parcel, if known.
        // TODO: The fact that this is nullable is quite inconvenient for callers.
        // Assign a reasonable default.
        "units": { anyOf: [ { type: "null" }, { type: "integer" } ] },

        // The street address and unit components of the assigned parcel's address,
        // assumed to be in San Francisco. See parcel_details for additional
        // caveats about formatting.
        "addr": { type: "string" },

        // The assigned parcel's lattitude.
        "lat": { type: "number" },

        // The assigned parcel's longitude.
        "long": { type: "number" }
      }
    }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/eviction_record_with_location.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "eviction_record_with_location",
  description: "Representation of an eviction record, with the addition of location information. Used when evictions are returned outside the context of a particular parcel lookup (i.e. in neighborhood query results)",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // unique identifier for the eviction.
    "evict_id": { type: "string" },

    // eviction date, in the format "YYYYMMDD"
    "evict_date": { type: "string" },

    // information about the primary attributed evictor, plus data about additional evictors.
    // !!! WARNING !!! This representation differs from the 'primary_evictor' item in eviction_record.js.
    // TODO: Resolve this inconsistency.
    "evictor": {
      "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
      title: "evictor_summary_extended",
      type: "object",
      properties: {
        // name of the evictor, as represented in the ebook db.
        name: { type: "string" },
        // if the evictor is believed to be a property-owning business entity,
        // then 'linked_be' is set to a non-empty object describing the
        // business entity. otherwise, it's set null or to an empty object.
        linked_be: {
          anyOf: [
            { type: "null" },
            require('./business_network_identifier')
          ]
        },

        // additional names associated with the eviction, taken from the eviction
        // petition itself.
        //
        // !!! WARNING !!! In 'eviction_record', the extra evictors list is a
        // property of the eviction. Here, it's a sub-property of eviction
        // info. TODO Resolve this inconsistency.
        "extra_evictors": { type: "array", items: require('./additional_evictor_reference') },
      }
    }, 

    // address listed on the eviction petition.
    // TODO: Describe normalization steps.
    "evict_addr_orig": { type: "string" },

    // total number of properties matched with this eviction, including the
    // primary property whose location is described here.
    "num_assoc_parc": { type: "integer", minimum: 1 },

    // the type of the eviction.
    "type": {
      type: "string",
      // TODO List possible values from the DB.
      // enum: [ "Owner Move In", ... ]
    },

    // Summary of how this eviction record was matched to its associated
    // location in the ebook data pipeline.
    "match_quality": require("./eviction_match_quality"),

    // Fields describing the parcel this eviction record was matched to:
    //
    // TODO: Move these into a separate message to eliminate the need for a
    // separate 'eviction_record_with_location' schema.

    // The parcel's block_lot number, used as a unique identifier. Assumed to
    // be in san francisco. Suffix, without hyphens, of the parcel's APN.
    "block_lot": { type: "string" },

    // Number of units in the assigned parcel, if known.
    // TODO: The fact that this is nullable is quite inconvenient for callers.
    // Assign a reasonable default.
    "units": { anyOf: [ { type: "null" }, { type: "integer" } ] },

    // The street address and unit components of the assigned parcel's address,
    // assumed to be in San Francisco. See parcel_details for additional
    // caveats about formatting.
    "addr": { type: "string" },

    // The assigned parcel's lattitude.
    "lat": { type: "number" },

    // The assigned parcel's longitude.
    "long": { type: "number" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/network_description.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "network_description",
  description: "Subfield of related_network_info, see context there.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // Integer identifier for the ownership network in ebook db.
    "network_id": { type: "integer" },
    // Name of the most prominent property/business owner within the network.
    // This can be an individual, corporation, or other legal person. All-caps.
    "top_owner": { type: "string" },
    // Most prominent contact address among entities in the business network.
    // These are derived from business and property records, and are not
    // necessarily within San Francisco limits.
    // All-caps. Does not include zip codes.
    // ex: "3053 FILLMORE ST SAN FRANCISCO CA 228"
    // TODO: Clarify the meaning of the number suffix -- is this a unit number?
    "top_addr": { type: "string" },
    // Name of the most prominent business entity within the ownership network.
    // 'name_norm' field from the business entity's graph node. All caps.
    "top_be": { type: "string" },
    // Number of San Francisco real-estate parcels which this business network
    // owns through direct or indirect means, according to ebook's data
    // analysis.
    "num_parcels": { type: "integer" },
    // Total number of housing units among San Francisco real-estate parcels
    // which this business network owns through direct or indirect means,
    // according to ebook's data analysis.
    "num_units": { type: "integer" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/network_details.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "network_details",
  description: "Stats about an ownership network in the ebook datastore. There is no identifying information about the network itself (network_id), so this must be presented within the context of a specific network object.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    "top_bes": {
      type: "array",
      items: {
        type: "object",
        properties: {
          // The type of the node that represents this business entity in the
          // ebook db: SOS_Corp for corporations, SOS_LP for limited
          // partnerships/llc's.
          "__typename": { type: "string", enum: [ "SOS_Corp", "SOS_LP" ] },

          // Normalized name of the business entity, as derived from the calif
          // sec of state business index.
          "name_norm": { type: "string" }
        }
      }
    },

    // These are the most-frequently-used contact addresses among entities in
    // the business network. *NOT* to be confused with real-estate parcels. 
    //
    // Includes city and state, but not zip code. These may be outside of San
    // Francisco.
    "top_addrs": {
      type: "array",
      items: {
        type: "object",
        properties: {
          // Caution: all-caps.
          "addr_readable": { type: "string" }
        }
      }
    },

    // The most highly-connected "owners" in the business network.
    // May be businesses, individuals, trusts, etc.
    "top_owners": {
      type: "array", items: {
        type: "object",
        properties: {
          // Caution: all-caps.
          "name_norm": { type: "string" }
        }
      }
    },

    // Total number of california business entities represented in the business network.
    "total_bes": { type: "integer" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/network_match_explanation.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "network_match_explanation",
  description: "Subfield of related_network_info, see context there.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // if non-null, means that there is a business in one network
    // that is listed at an office address in the other network
    "businesses_listed_at_addrs": {
      anyOf: [
        { type: "null" },
        {
          type: "object",
          properties: {
            "num_addrs": { type: "integer" },
            "num_businesses": { type: "integer" }
          }
        }
      ]
    },

    // TODO(dpsgit): INCOMPLETE. Needs description of non-null data structure.
    // comment from v2_test_data:
    //   if non-null, means that there is a business or address we
    //   found to be "suspicious" and removed from our network 
    //   connecting methodology, that connects the networks
    "related_to_excluded": {
      anyOf: [ { type: "null" } ]  // TODO: Add other type here.
    },

    // comment from v2_test_data:
    //   if non-null, means that there is another office in a building
    //   associated with 55 Dolores St LLC's network that is part of 
    //   this network 
    "similar_addresses": {
      anyOf: [
        { type: "null" },
        {
          type: "object",
          title: "similar_addresses_metadata",
          properties: {
            // TODO(dpsgit): Describe the meaning of this metric and how it
            // applies to ebook's graph analysis.
            "highest_similarity": { type: "number" }
          }
        }
      ]  // TODO: Add other type here.
    },

    // TODO(dpsgit): INCOMPLETE. Needs description of non-null data structure.
    // comment from v2_test_data:
    //   if non-null, means that there is a business in one network
    //   that is the property owner for a business in the other network
    "businesses_owning_parcels": {
      anyOf: [ { type: "null" } ]  // TODO: Add other type here.
    },

    // TODO(dpsgit): INCOMPLETE. Needs description of non-null data structure.
    // comment from v2_test_data:
    //   if non-null, means that there is a non-business property 
    //   owner that owns property in both networks
    "parcels_owned_by_same_non_business_owner": {
      anyOf: [ { type: "null" } ]  // TODO: Add other type here.
    }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/parcel_address_details.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "parcel_address_details",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // These addresses consist only of the 'street address' component and
    // subpremise (unit number), NOT the city, state, or zip.
    //
    // WARNING: The are NOT in a human-friendly format. These are in all
    // caps and may have extraneous spaces. The text is the output of the
    // ebook data pipeline's address normalizer, which is idiosyncratic
    // and not widely understood among the team.

    // address derived from sf assessor's parcel records
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "main_addr": require('../type_util/nullable_types').string,

    // a list of address variations found from EAS data. if no variations
    // are recorded, will be an empty list.
    "addr_variations": { type: "array", items: { type: "string" } },
    // count of additional variations recorded in ebook datastore.
    "num_extra_addr_variations": { type: "integer" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/parcel_details.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "parcel_details",
  description: "Information about a real-estate property cataloged in the ebook db.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // 'block_lot' identifier. unique key for a parcel in sf assessor records,
    // and unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database.
    // Suffix of the parcel's APN, without hyphens.
    "block_lot": { type: "string" },

    // year in which the buildings on this real-estate parcel were first constructed.
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "yr_built": require('../type_util/nullable_types').integer,

    // Description of the parcel's address, as it's represented in SF assessor
    // records. See above.
    "addr_details": require("./parcel_address_details"),

    // latitude in degrees of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "lat": require('../type_util/nullable_types').number,

    // longitude in degrees of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "long": require('../type_util/nullable_types').number,

    // Name of the neighborhood this parcel occupies. It's assumed that all
    // parcels are within sf city and county, so these are san francisco
    // neighborhoods.
    //
    // See neighborhood config / search result data for the canonical
    // neighborhood names. These are upper case, such as "EXCELSIOR" and
    // "MISSION".
    //
    // neighborhoods assigned using sf polygons.  polygon boundaries:
    // https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/SF-Find-Neighborhoods/pty2-tcw4
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "neighborhood": require('../type_util/nullable_types').string,

    // rough assessment of this parcel's rent-control status.
    //
    // 0 (default) if data unavailable to determine rent controlled status, 
    // 1 if likely rent controlled,
    // 2 if doubtful that this is rent controlled
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "rent_controlled": {
      anyOf: [
        { type: "null" },
        { type: "integer", enum: [0, 1, 2] }
      ]
    },

    // property class code, via sf assessor's office.
    // definitons:
    // https://data.sfgov.org/Housing-and-Buildings/Reference-Assessor-Recorder-Property-Class-Codes/pa56-ek2h/data
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "prop_class_code": require('../type_util/nullable_types').string,

    // i.d. for the zoning district this parcel occupies.
    // sf zoning district definitions:
    // https://sfplanninggis.org/pim/map.html?layers=Zoning%20Districts
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "zone": require('../type_util/nullable_types').string,

    // how tall is the building on this parcel, in stories.
    // TODO: behavior for multi-building parcels?
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "stories": require('../type_util/nullable_types').integer,

    // number of physical units within this logical real-estate parcel.
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "units": require('../type_util/nullable_types').integer,

    // number of total rooms within buildings on this parcel (for multi-unit
    // parcels, this is the sum of rooms among all units.)
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "rooms": require('../type_util/nullable_types').integer,

    // number of total bedrooms on this parcel (for multi-unit parcels, this is
    // the sum of bedrooms among all units.)
    // NOTE: Missing from some A_Parcel nodes in 3/31/21 db, so marked 'nullable'.
    "beds": require('../type_util/nullable_types').integer,

    // assessor valuation of the 'land' base value, i.e. the parcel's theoretical
    // value if it had no buildings on it.
    "assess_land_val": { type: "integer" },

    // assessor valuation of the 'improvement' done to the land via development,
    // as of most recent assessment. units in u.s. dollars.
    "assess_imp_val": { type: "integer" },

    // date when the parcel's value was last assessed. format: CCYYMMDD
    "assess_val_date": { type: "string" },

    // date on which this parcel's address was last updated, via assessor
    // records. format: CCYYMMDD
    "update_date": { type: "string" },

    // units in u.s. dollars.  TODO: document when and how this gets populated.
    "curr_sales_price": { type: "integer" },

    // format: CCYYMMDD  TODO: document when and how this gets populated.
    "curr_sales_date": { type: "string" }

  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/parcel_ownership_record.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "parcel_ownership_record",
  description: "Information about a real-estate property's owner.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // Registered owner's mailing address, per SF assessor records.
    // Includes city and state, but not zip code.
    // ex: "173 EVELYN WAY SAN FRANCISCO CA"
    "mailing_address": { type: "string" },
    // The owner's name, in all caps, as it appears in SF assessor records.
    // This may the the name of an individual, a business, or another legal
    // entity such as a trust.
    "owner_name": { type: "string" },
    // Date on which this ownership relation was documented. Format: YYYYMMDD
    // ex: "20181227"
    "record_date": { type: "string" },
    // if the owner is believed to be a property-owning business entity,
    // then 'linked_be' is set to an object containing information about that
    // business entity. otherwise, it's set null.
    "linked_be": {
      anyOf: [
        { type: "null" },
        require('./business_network_identifier.js')
      ]
    },
    // ownership percentage, of the assigned owner, expressed as a number
    // between 0 and 100.
    // We may not have complete ownership information for a parcel, so don't
    // make any assumptions about these numbers adding up to 100.
    // May have a fractional component, typically does not.
    "perc_owner": { type: "number" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/query/property_portfolio_entry.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "property_portfolio_entry",
  description: "An element of a property ownership portfolio, containing brief info about a single parcel.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties:  {
    // 'block_lot' identifier. unique key for a parcel in sf assessor records,
    // and unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database.
    // Suffix of the parcel's APN, without hyphens.
    "block_lot": { type: "string" },
    // Number of evictions associated with this parcel in ebook datastore.
    "num_evictions": { type: "integer" },
    // Registered owner's mailing address, per SF assessor records.
    // Includes city and state, but not zip code.
    // ex: "173 EVELYN WAY SAN FRANCISCO CA"
    "owner_mailing_addr": { type: "string" },

    // TODO: Questions for Dan -- Why is there only one 'owner_mailing_addr',
    // but multiple 'owners'? Why not just put the mailing_addr into the 'owner'
    // object in this array? This would give us consistency with
    // parcel_ownership_info.
    "owners": {
      type: "array",
      items: {
        type: "object",
        properties: {
          // The owner's name, in all caps, as it appears in SF assessor records.
          // This may the the name of an individual, a business, or another legal
          // entity such as a trust.
          owner_name: { type: "string" },
          // if the owner is believed to be a property-owning business entity,
          // then 'linked_be' is set to an object containing information about that
          // business entity. otherwise, it's set null.
          linked_be: {
            anyOf: [
              { type: "null" },
              require('./business_network_identifier.js')
            ]
          },
        }
      }
    },

    // address derived from sf assessor's parcel records
    //
    // These addresses consist only of the 'street address' component and
    // subpremise (unit number), NOT the city, state, or zip. Assumed to be in
    // San Francisco.
    //
    // WARNING: These are NOT in a human-friendly format. These are in all caps
    // and may have extraneous spaces. The text is the output of the ebook data
    // pipeline's address normalizer, which is idiosyncratic and not widely
    // understood among the team.
    addr: { type: "string" },

    // Fields borrowed from parcel_details:
    // see parcel_details for context on 'neighborhood'.
    neighborhood: { type: "string" },
    // number of physical units within this logical real-estate parcel.
    units: { type: "integer" },
    // latitude in degrees of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
    lat: { type: "number" },
    // longitude in degrees of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
    long: { type: "number" }

  },
}

server/schemas/src/query/property_portfolio_entry_ownerpage.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "property_portfolio_entry",
  description: "An element of a property ownership portfolio, containing brief info about a single parcel. !!!! CAUTION!!!: This is a full duplicate of 'property_portfolio_entry', with the sole exception that the owner's mailing address has a different property name. TODO: Resolve the inconsitency and delete this schema.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties:  {
    // 'block_lot' identifier. unique key for a parcel in sf assessor records,
    // and unique key for A_Parcel nodes in the database.
    // Suffix of the parcel's APN, without hyphens.
    "block_lot": { type: "string" },
    // Number of evictions associated with this parcel in ebook datastore.
    "num_evictions": { type: "integer" },

    // Registered owner's mailing address, per SF assessor records.
    // Includes city and state, but not zip code.
    // ex: "173 EVELYN WAY SAN FRANCISCO CA"
    //
    // !!!! CAUTION !!!: This field is the sole difference between this schema
    // and 'property_portfolio_entry'. TODO: Correct the inconsistency so a
    // single schema can be used in both places.
    "mailing_address": { type: "string" },

    // TODO: Questions for Dan -- Why is there only one 'owner_mailing_addr',
    // but multiple 'owners'? Why not just put the mailing_addr into the 'owner'
    // object in this array? This would give us consistency with
    // parcel_ownership_info.
    "owners": {
      type: "array",
      items: {
        type: "object",
        properties: {
          // The owner's name, in all caps, as it appears in SF assessor records.
          // This may the the name of an individual, a business, or another legal
          // entity such as a trust.
          owner_name: { type: "string" },
          // if the owner is believed to be a property-owning business entity,
          // then 'linked_be' is set to an object containing information about that
          // business entity. otherwise, it's set null.
          linked_be: {
            anyOf: [
              { type: "null" },
              require('./business_network_identifier.js')
            ]
          },
        }
      }
    },

    // address derived from sf assessor's parcel records
    //
    // These addresses consist only of the 'street address' component and
    // subpremise (unit number), NOT the city, state, or zip. Assumed to be in
    // San Francisco.
    //
    // WARNING: These are NOT in a human-friendly format. These are in all caps
    // and may have extraneous spaces. The text is the output of the ebook data
    // pipeline's address normalizer, which is idiosyncratic and not widely
    // understood among the team.
    addr: { type: "string" },

    // Fields borrowed from parcel_details:
    // see parcel_details for context on 'neighborhood'.
    neighborhood: { type: "string" },
    // number of physical units within this logical real-estate parcel.
    units: { type: "integer" },
    // latitude in degrees of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
    lat: { type: "number" },
    // longitude in degrees of a point within this parcel's boundaries.
    long: { type: "number" }

  },
}

  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    match_explanation: require('./network_match_explanation'),
    network_description: require('./network_description')
  }

  description: "Result of the 'neighborhood' query. Confusingly, this does not actually return information about the neighborhood itself, but rather a list of evictions which occured in the neighborhood. Vestige of ebook 1.0 behavior.",
  type: "array",
  items: require("../eviction_record_with_location")
}

      anyOf: [

server/schemas/src/query/responses/parcel_owners_response.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "parcel_owners_response",
  description: "Summary of information about the owner(s) of a real-estate parcel.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // List of data about current owners. Typically, this will be only one item long.
    "owners": { type: "array", items: require('../parcel_ownership_record.js') },

    // The total number of parcels beleived to be owned, by all the full and
    // part owners of the queried parcel.
    //
    // This field was added to the 1.0 API in late 2020 without much
    // discussion.  TODO: Verify that this is still useful, and that it means
    // what we think it does.
    "parcels": { type: "integer" }
  }
}

  type: "array",
  items: require("../database_search_result")
}

server/schemas/src/type_util/nullable_types.js

var nullable = function(label) {
  return { anyOf: [ { type: "null" }, { type: label } ] }
}

module.exports = {
  "number": nullable("number"),
  "string": nullable("string"),
  "integer": nullable("integer"),
  "boolean": nullable("boolean")
}

server/schemas/src/unifiedSearch/definitions/business_search_payload.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // represents the type of business entity, but only in an obscure way.
    // context: it's the node-type of the business's record in the eb database.
    //
    //  values:
    //   "SOS_Corp" if the business is a corporation.
    //   "SOS_LP" if the business is a limited partnership or llc.
    "db_node_type": { type: "string", enum: ["SOS_Corp", "SOS_LP"] },

    // the business's type, as represented in calif. sec of state business
    // registry.
    "business_type": require("./business_type"),

    // literal value of the business entity's canonical name in ebook db, where
    // it appears as 'name_norm'.
    //
    // derived from the name as it appears in the california secretary of state
    // business registry.
    "canonical_name": { type: "string" },

    // value of the business entity's name in db, encoded as a url-safe string.
    // useful when generating uri's for REST api calls.
    "canonical_name_safe": { type: "string" },

    // human-friendly formatting of business's name, as it appears in the
    // california secretary of state business registry.
    "display_name": { type: "string" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/unifiedSearch/definitions/business_type.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  description: "a business's type, as recorded in calif. sec of state business registry.",
  type: "string", 
  enum: [
    "BUSINESS_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED",
    "CALIF_SOS_CORP",  // corporation
    "CALIF_SOS_LP"  // limited partnership or llc
  ]
}

server/schemas/src/unifiedSearch/definitions/category_enum.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "category_enum",
  description: "the type of entity a given search result represents.",
  type: "string",
  enum: [
    "CATEGORY_UNSPECIFIED",
    "PARCEL",
    "BUSINESS_ENTITY",
    "NEIGHBORHOOD_SUMMARY"
  ]
}

server/schemas/src/unifiedSearch/definitions/neighborhood_summary_payload.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  additionalProperties: false,
  type: "object",
  properties: {
    // non-url-safe version of canonical name, as expected in '/api/neighborhood'
    // requests. useful in server code, because express converts the url-safe
    // parameter back to an unsafe string.
    "canonical_name": { type: "string" },

    // url-safe version of the neighborhood's name expected in '/api/neighborhood'
    // requests. useful in client code for assembling REST uri's.
    "canonical_name_safe": { type: "string" },

    // human-friendly formatting of neighborhood name, suitable for display in a ui.
    "display_name": { type: "string" },

    // integer id uniquely identifying neighborhood in ebook api.
    "id": { type: "integer" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/unifiedSearch/definitions/parcel_search_payload.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // the block_lot of this parcel in sf assessor records. unique key in
    // ebook rest api.
    "block_lot": { type: "string" },

    // value of block_lot, encoded to be uri-safe.
    "block_lot_safe": { type: "string" },

    // the address of the parcel, exactly as it appears in ebook database.
    // (see node types: Address_Main and Address_Unit.)
    //
    // IMPORTANT: this is not a human-readable address!
    //
    // these strings may be missing critical information such as street
    // suffix or zip code, and they may have arbitrary leading and trailing
    // spaces. they are extracted directly from the database without
    // cleanup.
    //
    // preserving the current behavior for now to avoid breaking existing
    // code.  (changing undocumented behavior without warning is
    // dangerous.)
    //
    // TODO: migrate away from this.
    "addr": { type: "string" },

    // value of addr, reformatted to be human-readable. title case, leading
    // and trailing spaces trimmed. all the warnings above about the
    // content of the address still apply (missing components, etc.)
    "display_addr": { type: "string" },

    // TODO: expand. more metadata, etc.
  }
}

server/schemas/src/unifiedSearch/definitions/ranking_info.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "ranking_info",
  description: "Description of scoring for search result items",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // Raw score, as retrieved from the database index's full text search.
    "raw_score": { type: "number" },
  }
}

server/schemas/src/unifiedSearch/definitions/search_result.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "search_result",
  description: "An individual search result item, with accompanying metadata.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // main label for this search result. ex: name of company, address, etc.
    // obj with localizable strings, see below.
    "label": { type: "string" },

    // may be unset in response json. if populated, this contains a short
    // description of the item, for optional display if layout permits.
    "description": { type: "string" },

    // url to link to. this is the public user-facing page (react route).
    "details_url": { type: "string" },

    // url for rest api request, to retrieve structured data about this item.
    "api_url": { type: "string" },

    // the type of entity this search result represents.
    "category": require("./category_enum"),

    // Human-readable display for category enum.
    // ex: "Address", "Owner", "Neighborhood".
    "category_label": { type: "string" },

    // potential search payloads. at most one will be set.
    // add more payload defnitions as we add new categories.
    "parcel_data": require("./parcel_search_payload"),
    "business_data": require("./business_search_payload"),
    "neighborhood_data": require("./neighborhood_summary_payload"),

    // Details about result scoring/ranking.
    "ranking_info": require("./ranking_info"),
  }
}

server/schemas/src/unifiedSearch/search_request.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "unified_search_request",
  description: "Parameters for REST unified search api call.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    // the text of the query string we want to run a general-purpose search for.
    //   populated from the queryparam 'q', as in '/api/search?q=URBAN%20ORANGE'
    "query_string": { type: "string" },

    // determines which neo4j database server to use, if the server supports it.
    //  "v1" or "v2". If unset/empty string, assume "v1."
    //  populated from the queryparam 'db_version'
    "database_version": { type: "string" }
  }
}

server/schemas/src/unifiedSearch/search_response.js

module.exports = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  title: "unified_search_response",
  description: "REST response from unified search api call.",
  type: "object",
  additionalProperties: false,
  properties: {
    "results": { type: "array", items: require("./definitions/search_result") }
  }
}

server/test/api_tester.py

import sys
import requests
from deepdiff import DeepDiff
from urllib.parse import quote

def clean_empty(d):
    if not isinstance(d, (dict, list)):
        return d
    if isinstance(d, list):
        return [v for v in (clean_empty(v) for v in d) if v]
    return {k: v for k, v in ((k, clean_empty(v)) for k, v in d.items()) if v}

def main(a_base_url, b_base_url, a_query, b_query):
    # creating http request URL
    a_URL = a_base_url + quote(a_query)
    b_URL = b_base_url + quote(b_query)

    # sending get request and saving the response as response object
    a_response = requests.get(url = a_URL)
    b_response = requests.get(url = b_URL)

    # extracting data in json format
    a_json = clean_empty(a_response.json())
    b_json = clean_empty(b_response.json())
    print("A Length: {}".format(len(a_json)))
    print("B Length: {}".format(len(b_json)))

    json_diff = DeepDiff(a_json, b_json, ignore_order=True)
    # If you want to view the json diff in tree format, you can use the below line instead:
    # json_diff = DeepDiff(a_json, b_json, ignore_order=True, view='tree', verbose_level=2)
    print(json_diff)

# This script outputs the difference in response between different REST APIs. Can be used when making changes to the EvictorBook database or server code. 
#
# HOW TO RUN:
# python3 api_tester.py a_api b_api query
# e.g. python3 api_tester.py "http://evictorbook.com/api/corp/" "http://evictorbook.com/api/corp/" "Happy Donuts"
if __name__ == "__main__":
    main(a_base_url=sys.argv[1], b_base_url=sys.argv[2], a_query=sys.argv[3], b_query=sys.argv[3])

server/test/getParcelDetails.test.js

// getParcelDetails.test.js
//
// unit tests for getParcelDetails route handler. uses mockApp to inject mock
// queryHandler function, thereby testing the business logic without depending
// on a live database.
//
// treat this as a template for additional tests for other route handlers.

// external libraries:
import assert from 'assert';

// libraries and utilities included from source:
import protoTestUtils from '../framework/protoTestUtils';
import protoUtils from '../framework/protoUtils';
import mockApp from '../framework/mockApp';

// pbf-generated proto modules, for use with protoUtils/protoTestUtils:
// (see type_definitions/README.md)
// NOTE: These are DEPRECATED, for new code rely on json-schemas as shown in dbRouteListenersV2.
const QueryProto = protoUtils.compileProto('schemas/legacy/proto/query/query.proto');
const RestProto = protoUtils.compileProto('schemas/legacy/proto/rest/rest.proto');

// package under test:
import { getParcelDetails } from '../rest/routes/dbRouteListeners';

// test data.  TODO: define in a separate file.

// obj representing the expected contents of the http response (i.e. what you
// would get when you parse the http response body's as json).
//
// conforms to RestProto.GetParcelDetailsResponse, see:
//   type_definitions/proto/rest/rest.proto.
const expected_response = {
  parcel_details: {
    yr_built: 1901,
    addr: "4200 Boogie Down Lane 26",
    block_lot: "P4RTY",
    lat: 26.8,
    long: 29.1,
    neighborhood: "Rogers",
    rent_controlled: 2,
    prop_class_code: "ABC",
    zone: "ProZone",
    stories: 13,
    units: 20,
    rooms: 21,
    beds: 19,
    assess_land_val: 2349,
    assess_imp_val: 4821,
    assess_val_date: "123169",
    update_date: "010170",
    curr_sales_price: 1,
    curr_sales_date: "010270",
    parc_start_no: 4200,
    parc_street_name: "Boogie Down",
    parc_street_type: "Lane",
    parc_unit_no: "26",
    parc_zip: 94110
  }
};

// obj representing the CYPHER query result to return in our mock unit test
// environment. to avoid running an entire neo4j database just to test
// getParcelDetails, we supply a mock queryHandler function to the code under
// test.
//
// this is the object the mock queryHandler will return.
//
// conforms to QueryProto.SFParcelDetailsQueryResult, see:
//   type_definitions/proto/query/query.proto.
//
// NOTE:
// the resemblance to expected_response is coincidental. explanation:
//
// as of 2021/03/22, the QueryProto and RestProto versions of the ParcelDetails
// response are equivalent. however, there's no guarantee they will stay that
// way. for example, the RestProto may need to add new fields to meet evolving
// requirements for the UI, or the QueryProto may be revised to incorporate
// schema changes in the db.
//
// so, don't write any code that assumes test_query_result will continue to
// resemble expected_response; rely on the schema checked into the codebase at
// type_definitions/proto.
const test_query_result = {
  parcel_details: {
    yr_built: 1901,
    addr: "4200 Boogie Down Lane 26",
    block_lot: "P4RTY",
    lat: 26.8,
    long: 29.1,
    neighborhood: "Rogers",
    rent_controlled: 2,
    prop_class_code: "ABC",
    zone: "ProZone",
    stories: 13,
    units: 20,
    rooms: 21,
    beds: 19,
    assess_land_val: 2349,
    assess_imp_val: 4821,
    assess_val_date: "123169",
    update_date: "010170",
    curr_sales_price: 1,
    curr_sales_date: "010270",
    parc_start_no: 4200,
    parc_street_name: "Boogie Down",
    parc_street_type: "Lane",
    parc_unit_no: "26",
    parc_zip: 94110
  }
};


// test the rest listener's basic functionality.
//
// TODO: add tests for edge cases, ensure errors raised when appropriate, etc.
describe('getParcelDetails tests', function() {
  it('pass through query result', async function() {
    // set up mocks.
    const mocks = mockApp.expressMocks();

    // assemble a mock request. for this test, we'll send a block_lot value
    // which matches the one in expected_response above.
    mocks.req.params.block_lot = "P4RTY";

    // mock query handler callback.
    //
    // note this is async in order to mimic the interface of the production
    // queryHandler fn as closely as possible. while it's true that the test
    // would *run* without the async keyword, removing it would introduce
    // uncertainty into our test environment and would allow certain bugs to go
    // undetected.
    mocks.req.app.locals.queryHandlers["parcelDetails"] =
      async function(app, search_string) {
        // confirm that the function under test properly passed 'req.app'
        // through to the query handler.
        assert.strictEqual(app, mocks.req.app);

        // we want to verify that the fn under test supplies the right
        // search_string value to the query handler.
        mocks.actuals.search_string = search_string;  // save for later assert.
        return test_query_result;
      };

    // invoke code under test:
    await getParcelDetails(mocks.req, mocks.resp);

    // verify results:
    
    // verify the desired http response code:
    const http_ok = 200;
    assert.strictEqual(mocks.actuals.response_code, http_ok);

    // confirm that the fn under test passed the right string to queryHandler:
    const expected_search_string = "P4RTY";
    assert.strictEqual(mocks.actuals.search_string, expected_search_string);

    // parse the actual response...
    const actual_response = JSON.parse(mocks.actuals.response_body);

    // ... and verify its schema (via proto definiton):
    protoUtils.checkProto(RestProto.GetParcelDetailsResponse, actual_response);

    // finally, verify that the response obj contains the right data (meaning,
    // it represents the same encoded information as the expected resp. obj.)
    protoTestUtils.assertProtoEquivalence(
      RestProto.GetParcelDetailsResponse, expected_response, actual_response);
  });
});

server/test/sample.test.js

var assert = require('assert');

describe('Sample Test', () => {
  it('should test that true === true', () => {
    assert.equal(true, true);
  })
})

const query_results = [
  {
    "evict_date": "20201028",                                     // = date of the eviction
    "evict_addr_orig": "1047 ALABAMA STREET (UNIT 610)",          // = original address listed on eviction petition
    "block_lot": "4149026",                                       // = block_lot of the parcel matched with eviction
    "match_quality": {
      "addr_match_method": "RANGE_ASSESSOR_ADDR_WO_UNIT",         // = the method used to match eviction to parcel (e.g. here
                                                                  //   we matched it to an address range ("1045-1047") 
                                                                  //   but did not match the unit
      "did_subdivision_occur": "NO_SUBDIVISION"                   // = whether we determined that a subdivison occurred at this parcel
    },
    "evictor": {
      "extra_evictors": [],                                       // = any additional names found associated with the eviction,
                                                                  //   from the eviction petition itself

        }

    },

      "type": "LISTED_AT",
      "start": {
        "identity": 1470917,
        "labels": [
          "SOS_LP"
        ],
        "properties": {
          "agent_name": "JOHN A WARNER",
          "agent_address_1": "1746 UNION STREET",
          "jurisdiction_llc": "CA",
          "agent_zip": "94123",
          "jurisdiction": "CA",
          "file_number": "201828810386",
          "file_date": "20181010",
          "network_id": 115935,
          "name_norm": "UGI MADISON LLC",
          "name": "UGI MADISON, LLC",
          "agent_state": "CA",
          "agent_city": "SAN FRANCISCO",
          "llc_type_of_business": "REAL ESTATE INVESTMENTS",
          "filing_type": "D",
          "llc_management_code": "1",
          "status": "A"
        }
      },
      "end": {
        "identity": 189787,
        "labels": [
          "Address_Unit"
        ],
        "properties": {
          "rel_be_deg": 0.7592592592592593,
          "network_id": 115935,
          "addr": "|1746 UNION ST|SAN FRANCISCO|",
          "be_deg": 82,
          "addr_readable": "1746 UNION ST SAN FRANCISCO"
        }
      }
    }
  ]
};

server/test/test_data/network/getNetworkRelatedNetworksTestData.js

// Results using 3/31/21 V2.0 DB on '/v2/network/115935/relatedNetworks

const query_results = [
  {                                                         //   Each of these elements is a network that may be 
                                                            //   related to 55 DOLORES STREET LLC's network (Urban Green)
    "match_explanation": {
      "businesses_listed_at_addrs": {                       // = if non-null, means that there is a business in one network
                                                            //   that is listed at an office address in the other network
        "num_addrs": 3,
        "num_businesses": 4
      },
      "related_to_excluded": null,                          // = if non-null, means that there is a business or address we
                                                            //   found to be "suspicious" and removed from our network 
                                                            //   connecting methodology, that connects the networks

      "similar_addresses": null,                            // = if non-null, means that there is another office in a building
                                                            //   associated with 55 Dolores St LLC's network that is part of 
                                                            //   this network 
      "businesses_owning_parcels": null,                    // = if non-null, means that there is a business in one network
                                                            //   that is the property owner for a business in the other network

      "parcels_owned_by_same_non_business_owner": null      // = if non-null, means that there is a non-business property 
                                                            //   owner that owns property in both networks

    },
    "network_description": {
      "network_id": 155047,                                 // = unique identifier for network
      "top_owner": "DONNA NOAH",                            // = most connected business owner in the network
      "top_addr": "141 ALPINE TER SAN FRANCISCO CA",        // = most connected address in the network
      "top_be": "GREENLINE VENTURES LLC"                    // = most connected business in the network
      "num_parcels": 8,                                     // = total number of properties in the portfolio of this network
      "num_units": 50                                       // = total number of units in the portfolio of this network
    }
  },
  {
    "match_explanation": {
      "businesses_listed_at_addrs": {
