            className='footerItem'
            target='_blank'
            component={NavLink}
            to='/feedback'
          />

          <BottomNavigationAction
            label={t('Disclaimer')}
            icon={<InfoIcon />}
            className='footerItem'
            component={NavLink}
            to='/disclaimer'
          />
        </BottomNavigation>
      </>
    )
  } else {
    return (
      <Row>
        {location.pathname !== '/' && (
          <Row justify='center'>
            <FeedbackIFrame />
          </Row>
        )}

        <div className={classes.root} style={{ marginTop: location.pathname === '/' ? 0 : 55}}>
          <Col className={classes.footerText}>
            <Typography variant='body1'>
              {t(
                'EvictorBook combines data on property ownership, eviction records, and corporate business filings to identify connections between residential property and their owners in San Francisco.'
              )}
            </Typography>
          </Col>
          <Col className={classes.footerText} style={{justifyContent: 'flex-end'}}>
            <Row direction='column' className={classes.links}>
              <NavLink to='/feedback' target='_blank' className={classes.item}>
                {t('Feedback')}
              </NavLink>
              <NavLink to='/glossary' className={classes.item}>
                {t('Glossary')}
              </NavLink>
              <NavLink to='/methodology' className={classes.item}>
                {t('Methodology')}
              </NavLink>
              <NavLink to='/disclaimer' className={classes.item}>
                {t('Disclaimer')}
              </NavLink>
              <Link to={{ pathname: 'http://sfadc.org' }} target='_blank' className={classes.item} >
                {t('Tenant Resources')}
              </Link>
            </Row>
          </Col>
        </div>
      </Row>
    )
  }
}

ui/src/components/Graph/D3Graph.js

import React, { useEffect, useState, Fragment } from 'react'
import { get_view_network } from './graphProcessor'
import drawGraph from './draw_graph'
import * as d3 from 'd3'
import { Row, Col } from './../Grid'
import Typography from '@material-ui/core/Typography'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../../i18n'
import  CircularProgress from '@material-ui/core/CircularProgress'

/* D3Graph: This component renders a network graph of properties and owners. 

Props: 
width, height: width and height of the graph svg element. 
graph: The graph data that is fetched and passed by pages/NetworkPage.js into here.
*/
const D3Graph = ({graph}) => {

  const [sizeFilter, setSizeFilter] = useState(50)
  const [labelFilter, setLabelFilter] = useState('All')
  const network = get_view_network(graph, sizeFilter, 6)

  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Network', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )

  /* This array replaces NODE_COLOR in draw_graph.js for readability + DRY principle */ 
  /* info here is read into both the legend and the actual node colors in draw_graph */
  const nodeColors = [
    {code: ['SOS_LP', 'SOS_Corp'], label:t('Business Entity (e.g. LLC)'),  color: '#e7298a'},
    {code: ['SOS_Owner'], label: t('Business Owner'), color: '#66a61e' },
    {code: ['Address_Unit', 'Address_Main'], label: t('Business Address'), color: '#e6ab02'},
    {code: ['A_Parcel'], label: t('Property'), color: '#1b9e77' },
    {code: ['A_Parcel_Owner'], label: t('Property Owner'), color: '#d95f02'},
    {code: ['RB_Evictor'], label: t('Evictor'), color: '#a6761d'},
  ]

  useEffect(() => {
    d3.select('#viz').selectAll('*').remove()
    drawGraph(network, labelFilter, nodeColors)
  })

  if (!translationReady) return null
  return (
    JSON.stringify(graph) === '{}' ? 
      <div style={{display: 'flex', placeItems: 'center', width: '100%', justifyContent: 'center'}}>
        <CircularProgress />
      </div> :
      <>
        <Row justify='flex-start'>
          <Typography variant='body1' style={{marginRight: 20}}>
            <>
              <select value={labelFilter} onChange={e =>
                setLabelFilter(e.target.value)} style={{
                color: 'white',
                backgroundColor: '#342A46'
              }}>
                <option value='All'>{t('All')}</option>
                <option value='Businesses'>{t('Businesses')}</option>
                <option value='Properties'>{t('Properties')}</option>
              </select>
              <select value={sizeFilter} 
                onChange={e =>
                  setSizeFilter(e.target.value)} 
                style={{
                  color: 'white',
                  backgroundColor: '#342A46'
                }}>
                <option value='25'>25</option>
                <option value='50'>50</option>
                <option value='100'>100</option>
                <option value='All'>All</option>
              </select>
            </>
          </Typography>
          <div style={{display: 'grid', gridTemplateColumns: 'repeat(3, fit-content(100%))', 
            justifyContent: 'end', flex: '1'}}>
            {nodeColors.map((d,i) => {
              return <div key={i} 
                style={{flexBasis: '33%', display: 'flex', 
                  marginTop: '10px', justifyContent: 'right',
                  whiteSpace: 'nowrap', maxWidth: 'fit-content'}}> 
                <Col style={{backgroundColor: d.color, marginLeft: 10, marginRight: 10}}>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</Col>
                <Col><Typography>{'  '}{d.label}{'  '}</Typography></Col>
              </div>
            })}
          </div>
        </Row>
        <br/>
        <svg
          id='viz'
          width='100%'
          preserveAspectRatio='xMidYMid meet'
        />
      </>
  )
}

export default D3Graph

ui/src/components/Graph/draw_graph.js

import * as d3 from 'd3'
import { titleCase } from '../../utils/stringUtils'

const FILTER_MAP = {
  'All': ['A_Parcel', 'A_Parcel_Owner', 'SOS_Corp', 'SOS_LP', 'SOS_Owner', 'Address_Unit', 'Address_Main', 'RB_Evictor', 'RB_Eviction'],
  'Businesses': ['SOS_Corp', 'SOS_LP', 'SOS_Owner'],
  'Properties': ['A_Parcel', 'A_Parcel_Owner']
}

export default function drawGraph(graph, labelFilter, nodeColors) {
  if(!d3.select('#viz').size()) return
  let nodeRadius = 6
  let markerSize = 0

  // This line takes the array of nodeColors specified by D3Graph and 
  // cleans it into an object readily usable by the nodes here 
  // The object is 'flat' as in there are no nested arrays or objects
  const flatColors = nodeColors.reduce((acc, d) => (
    {...acc, ...d.code.reduce((a,x) => ({...a, [x]: d.color}), {})}
  ), {})  

  // create a set of nodes for the pair between nodes and their text
  // all evens are the labels, all odds represent the labelled node
  const label = {'nodes': [], 'links': []}

  graph.nodes.forEach(function (d, i) {
    label.nodes.push({node: d})
    label.nodes.push({node: d})
    label.links.push({
      source: i * 2,
      target: i * 2 + 1
    })
  })


  const svg = d3.select('#viz')
  const width = svg.node().getBoundingClientRect().width
  const height = width

  svg.style('height', height + 'px').style('cursor', 'grab')
  const container = svg.append('g')

  const zoom = d3.zoom()
    .scaleExtent([ 0.25, 4])
    .on('zoom', function (event) {
      container.attr('transform', event.transform)
    })
  svg.call(zoom)

  // hacky: set edge lengths based on how many nodes there are
  function getEdgeDist() {
    return Math.max(150, 200 - (Math.max(0, graph.nodes.length - 20) * 2))
  }

  // set up d3 force simulation
  const simulation = d3.forceSimulation(graph.nodes)
    .force('charge', d3.forceManyBody().strength(-1500)) // repel all nodes from each other
    .force('center', d3.forceCenter(width / 2, height / 2))
    .force('link', d3.forceLink(graph.links).id(function(n) { return n.id }).distance(getEdgeDist()).strength(1)) // set length of edges
    .alphaDecay(0.1) // make simulation cool faster
    .on('tick', tick)

  // create tooltip div
  var tooltip = d3.select('body')
    .append('div')
    .attr('class', 'tooltip')

  // add links
  const link = container.append('g').selectAll('line')
    .data(graph.links)
    .enter()
    .append('line')
    .attr('class', 'link')
    .style('stroke', '#666')

  //create paths for labels along links
  let edgepaths = container.append('g').selectAll('.edgepath')
    .data(graph.links)
    .enter()
    .append('path')
    .attr('class', 'edgepath')
    .attr('fill-opacity', 0)
    .attr('stroke-opacity', 0)
    .attr('id', d => `edgepath${d.index}`)
    .style('pointer-events', 'none')

  const edgelabels = container.append('g')

  function updateEdgelabels(data){
    edgelabels.selectAll('.edgelabel').data(data)
      .join((enter) => {
        enter.append('text')
          .style('pointer-events', 'none')
          .attr('class', 'edgelabel')
          .attr('font-size', 11)
          .attr('fill', '#fff')
          .append('textPath')
          .attr('xlink:href', d => `#edgepath${d.index}`)
          .style('text-anchor', 'middle')
          .style('pointer-events', 'none')
          .attr('startOffset', '50%')
          .text(function (d) {return d.label || ''})
      })
  }

  // append labels
  // add nodes
  const node = container.append('g').selectAll('g')
    .data(graph.nodes)
    .enter().append('g')
    // append circle svgs
  node.append('circle')
    .attr('r', nodeRadius)
    .style('fill', function(d) { return flatColors[d.type] })
    .style('stroke', function(d) { return d3.rgb(flatColors[d.type]).darker()})
    .style('cursor', 'pointer')

  // append node labels
  const textPadding = 2
  node.append('text')
    .text(function(d) { return (
      FILTER_MAP[labelFilter].includes(d.type) ? titleCase(d.name.trim()) : '')
    })
  //.call(getBBox)
    .attr('dx', 10 + textPadding)
    .attr('dy', nodeRadius)
    .style('font-size', 15)
    .style('font-weight', 'normal')
    .style('text-align','center')
    .style('fill', '#FFFFFF')
    .style('pointer-events', 'none')

  /* Update bounding boxes after the text is rendered */
  node.selectAll('text')
    .each(function(d) { d.bbox = this.getBBox() })

  // insert node label background 
  // need insert because this needs to be added before the text:
  //   https://cambridge-intelligence.com/customize-graph-visualization-d3-keylines/
  node.insert('rect','text')
    .attr('x', d => d.bbox.x - textPadding)
    .attr('y', d => d.bbox.y - textPadding)
    .attr('rx', '2px')
    .attr('ry', '2px')
    .attr('width', d => d.bbox.width + textPadding * 2)
    .attr('height', d => d.bbox.height + textPadding * 2)
    .style('opacity', '0.2')
    .style('fill', d => flatColors[d.type])
    .style('cursor', 'pointer')


  // keep track of (undirected) neighbors
  const adjlist = []
  graph.links.forEach(function (d) {
    adjlist[d.source.index + '-' + d.target.index] = true
    adjlist[d.target.index + '-' + d.source.index] = true
  })

  // TODO: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14296309/freezing-force-directed-network-graph-and-make-draggable-in-d3
  function dragStarted(event, d) {
    d.dragging = true
    event.sourceEvent.stopPropagation()
    if (!event.active) simulation.alpha(1).restart()
    d.fx = d.x
    d.fy = d.y
  }

  function dragging(event, d) {
    d.fx = event.x
    d.fy = event.y
  }

  function dragEnded(event, d) {
    d.dragging = false
    if (!event.active) simulation.alpha(1).restart()
    d.fx = event.x
    d.fy = event.y
  }

  function focus(event, activeNode) {
    const {index, dragging} = activeNode
    node.style('opacity', function (o) {
      function areNeighbors(a, b) {
        return a === b || adjlist[a + '-' + b]
      }
      return areNeighbors(index, o.index) ? 1 : 0.2
    })
    link.style('opacity', function (o) {
      return o.source.index === index || o.target.index === index ? 1 : 0.2
    })

    // calculate newEdgelabels if the current node isn't being dragged
    //    otherwise don't show anything, to keep performance
    const newEdgelabels = !dragging ? graph.links.filter((d) => {
      return d.source.index === index || d.target.index === index ? 1 : 0
    }) : []

    updateEdgelabels(newEdgelabels)
  }

  function unfocus() {
    node.transition().duration(100).style('opacity', 1)
    link.transition().duration(100).style('opacity', 1)
    updateEdgelabels([])
  }

  function onMouseOver(event, d) {
    focus(event, d)
    if (d.not_displayed) {
      tooltip.transition()
        .duration(200)
      tooltip.style('opacity', .8) //;style("visibility", "visible")
        .style('left', event.pageX - 5 + 'px')
        .style('top', event.pageY - 30 + 'px')
        .text(d.not_displayed + ' connection(s) not shown.')
    }
  }

  function onMouseMove(event, d) {
    focus(event, d)
    tooltip.style('left', event.pageX - 5 + 'px')
      .style('top', event.pageY - 30 + 'px')
  }

  function onMouseOut(d) {
    if (!d.dragging) unfocus()
    tooltip.transition()
      .duration(100)
      .style('opacity', 0) //tooltip.style("visibility", "hidden");
  }

  // focus on node + neighbors on hover
  node.on('mouseover', onMouseOver)
    .on('mousemove', onMouseMove)
    .on('mouseout', onMouseOut)

  node.call(d3.drag()
    .on('start', dragStarted)
    .on('drag', dragging)
    .on('end', dragEnded))

  function fixna(num) {
    if (isFinite(num)) return num
    return 0
  }

  function tick() {

    node.attr('transform', function (d) {
      let damper = 0
      d.x = d.x + (width / 2 - d.x) * (damper + 0.02) * 0.1
      d.y = d.y + (height / 2 - d.y) * (damper + 0.02) * 0.1
      return 'translate(' + fixna(d.x) + ',' + fixna(d.y) + ')'
    })

    link.each(function (d) {
      let x1 = d.source.x
      let y1 = d.source.y
      let x2 = d.target.x
      let y2 = d.target.y
      let angle = Math.atan2(y2 - y1, x2 - x1)
      d.sourceX = x1 + Math.cos(angle) * (nodeRadius + markerSize / 2)
      d.sourceY = y1 + Math.sin(angle) * (nodeRadius + markerSize / 2)
      d.targetX = x2 - Math.cos(angle) * (nodeRadius + markerSize / 2)
      d.targetY = y2 - Math.sin(angle) * (nodeRadius + markerSize / 2)
    })
    link.attr('x1', function (d) { return d.sourceX })
      .attr('y1', function (d) { return d.sourceY })
      .attr('x2', function (d) { return d.targetX })
      .attr('y2', function (d) { return d.targetY })

    edgepaths.attr('d', function (d) {
      return 'M ' + d.source.x + ' ' + d.source.y + ' L ' + d.target.x + ' ' + d.target.y
    })

    edgelabels.selectAll('.edgelabel').attr('transform', function (d) {
      if (d.target.x < d.source.x) {
        const bbox = this.getBBox()

        let rx = bbox.x + bbox.width / 2
        let ry = bbox.y + bbox.height / 2
        return 'rotate(180 ' + rx + ' ' + ry + ')'
      }
      else {
        return 'rotate(0)'
      }
    })
  }
}

ui/src/components/Graph/graphProcessor.js

const createNode = node => {
  let nodeName = ''
  switch (node.labels[0]) {
    case 'A_Parcel':
      nodeName = node.properties.block_lot
      break
    case 'A_Parcel_Owner':
      nodeName = node.properties.owner_name.concat(' (Property Owner)')
      break
    // note: we do not display Addresss_Unit, only the assoc. Address_Main
    case 'Address_Main':
      nodeName = node.properties.addr_readable
      break
    case 'Address_Unit':
      nodeName = node.properties.addr_readable
      break
    case 'SOS_Corp':
      nodeName = node.properties.name_norm
      break
    case 'SOS_LP':
      nodeName = node.properties.name_norm
      break
    case 'SOS_Owner':
      nodeName = node.properties.name_norm
      break
    case 'RB_Evictor':
      nodeName = node.properties.name.concat(' (Evictor)')
      break
    // note: RB_Evictions are not displayed; evictor mapped to parcel
    default:
      nodeName = ''
  }
  return { id: node.identity, name: nodeName, type: node.labels[0] }
}

const get_node_degrees = function (graph) {
  let degrees = {}
  graph.forEach(rel => {
    if (rel.type !== 'EVICTOR_AT' && rel.type !== 'EVICTED_AT') {
      for (const id of [rel.start.identity, rel.end.identity]) {
        if (!(id in degrees)) {
          degrees[id] = 1
        } else {
          degrees[id] += 1
        }
      }
    }
  })
  return degrees
}

const generate_addr_map = function (graph) {
  let addr_map = {} // unit_id: {addr_main node}
  const addr_unit_rels = graph.filter(n => n.type === 'UNIT_AT')
  addr_unit_rels.forEach(rel => {
    addr_map[rel.start.identity] = createNode(rel.end)
  })
  return addr_map
}

/*
generate_evictor_maps produces mappings from parcels <-> evictors as follows:

evictor_map = {
    evictor_id: {
        num_certain: 5,
        num_possible: 10,
        definite_parcels: [parcel_a, parcel_b]
    }
}

parcel_map: {
    parcel_id: {
        num_certain: 4,
        num_possible: 8
        definite_evictors: [evictor_a, evictor_b]
    }
}
*/

const generate_evictor_maps = function (graph) {
  const eviction_rels = graph.filter(n => n.start.labels[0] === 'RB_Eviction')
  /* {RB_Eviction id: {
            "evictors": [(e:evictor_node, certain:bool), ...]
            "parcels": [(p:parcel_node, certain:bool), ...]}
        }
    */
  let eviction_map = {}
  eviction_rels.forEach(rel => {
    const evict_id = rel.start.identity
    if (!(evict_id in eviction_map)) {
      eviction_map[evict_id] = { evictors: [], parcels: [] }
    }
    const end_node = createNode(rel.end)
    if (rel.type === 'EVICTED_BY') {
      // if r.rel.type ==
      eviction_map[evict_id]['evictors'].push(end_node)
    } else if (rel.type === 'EVICTION_AT') {
      eviction_map[evict_id]['parcels'].push(end_node)
    }
  })

  let evictor_map = {}
  let parcel_map = {}
  for (const evict_id in eviction_map) {
    // if more than one evictor or parcel is assoc. with an eviction,
    // this is a "multiple match" scenario, so we are not confident
    // about the evictor / parcel
    const evictor_certain = eviction_map[evict_id].evictors.length === 1
    const parcel_certain = eviction_map[evict_id].parcels.length === 1
    eviction_map[evict_id].evictors.forEach(evictor => {
      if (!(evictor.id in evictor_map)) {
        evictor_map[evictor.id] = {
          num_certain: 0,
          num_possible: 0,
          parcels: [],
        }
      }
      let e = evictor_map[evictor.id]
      e.num_certain += evictor_certain ? 1 : 0
      e.num_possible += evictor_certain ? 0 : 1
      // ONLY connect evictor and parcel if both matches are certain
      if (evictor_certain && parcel_certain) {
        const parcel = eviction_map[evict_id].parcels[0]
        if (!e.parcels.map(x => x.id).includes(parcel.id)) {
          e.parcels.push(parcel)
        }
      }
    })
    eviction_map[evict_id].parcels.forEach(parcel => {
      if (!(parcel.id in parcel_map)) {
        parcel_map[parcel.id] = {
          num_certain: 0,
          num_possible: 0,
          evictors: [],
        }
      }
      let p = parcel_map[parcel.id]
      p.num_certain += parcel_certain ? 1 : 0
      p.num_possible += parcel_certain ? 0 : 1
      // ONLY connect evictor and parcel if both matches are certain
      if (evictor_certain && parcel_certain) {
        const evictor = eviction_map[evict_id].evictors[0]
        if (!p.evictors.map(x => x.id).includes(evictor.id)) p.evictors.push(evictor)
      }
    })
  }
  return {
    evictor_map: evictor_map,
    parcel_map: parcel_map,
  }
}

const LINK_LABEL = {
  PARC_OWNER_ADDR_AT: 'owner address at',
  PARC_OWNED_BY: 'property owned by',
  OFFICER_FOR: 'officer for',
  ENTITY_OWNED_BY: 'owned by',
  LISTED_AT: 'listed at',
}

const _create_link = function (source_id, target_id, label) {
  return {
    source: source_id,
    target: target_id,
    label: label,
  }
}

const unique_nodes = function (nodes) {
  let unique = []
  nodes.forEach(n => {
    if (!unique.map(x => x.id).includes(n.id)) unique.push(n)
  })
  return unique
}

const unique_links = function (links) {
  let unique = []
  links.forEach(l => {
    if (l.label === undefined) return
    let can_add = true
    unique.forEach(u => {
      if (u.source === l.source && u.target === l.target) {
        can_add = false
      }
    })
    if (can_add) unique.push(l)
  })
  return unique
}

// get_next_edges(): given a node, returns all of nodes with one
//   edge between them and this node
//   as well as all of their associated links
//   exclude_set: set of node_ids already added to master list
const get_next_edges = function (node, graph, addr_map, evictor_map, parcel_map, exclude_set) {
  let new_nodes = []
  let new_links = []
  // if current node is RB_Evictor, automatically add parcels
  // TODO: add property counting evictions
  if (node.type === 'RB_Evictor') {
    if (node.id in evictor_map) {
      const e = evictor_map[node.id]
      e.parcels.forEach(p => {
        if (!exclude_set.includes(p.id)) new_nodes.push(p)
        // should this be under if statement?
        new_links.push(_create_link(node.id, p.id, 'evictor at'))
      })
    }
  }
  // if current node is A_Parcel, automatically add evictors
  // TODO: add property counting evictions
  else if (node.type === 'A_Parcel') {
    if (node.id in parcel_map) {
      const p = parcel_map[node.id]
      p.evictors.forEach(e => {
        if (!exclude_set.includes(e.id)) new_nodes.push(e)
        new_links.push(_create_link(e.id, node.id, 'evictor at'))
      })
    }
  }

  graph.forEach(rel => {
    // if rel is an EVICTED_BY or EVICTION_AT, continue (parcels/evictors already added)
    if (rel.type === 'EVICTED_BY' || rel.type === 'EVICTION_AT') return

    // if neither endpoint matches current node, skip
    if (rel.start.identity !== node.id && rel.end.identity !== node.id) return

    const linked_neo4j_node = rel.start.identity === node.id ? rel.end : rel.start
    const source_rel = rel.start.identity === node.id ? true : false // if true, current node is source of link

    let linked_node = createNode(linked_neo4j_node)
    // if we can replace Address_Unit linked node with Address_Main, do so
    if (linked_neo4j_node.identity in addr_map) {
      linked_node = addr_map[linked_neo4j_node.identity]
    }

    // if current node is BE_LINKED_TO another node, contract rel
    // and add one-degree connections of other node
    if (rel.type === 'BE_LINKED_TO' && !exclude_set.includes(linked_node.id)) {
      const linked_res = get_next_edges(
        linked_node,
        graph,
        addr_map,
        evictor_map,
        parcel_map,
        exclude_set.concat([linked_node.id])
      )
      new_nodes.push(...linked_res.nodes)
      // modify links to link back up to current node
      linked_res.links.forEach(l => {
        if (l.source === linked_node.id) l.source = node.id
        else l.target = node.id
        new_links.push(l)
      })
      return
    }

    // otherwise, add this linked node to set of one degree connections
    if (!exclude_set.includes(linked_node.id)) new_nodes.push(linked_node)
    if (source_rel) {
      new_links.push(_create_link(node.id, linked_node.id, LINK_LABEL[rel.type]))
    } else {
      new_links.push(_create_link(linked_node.id, node.id, LINK_LABEL[rel.type]))
    }
  })
  return { nodes: unique_nodes(new_nodes), links: unique_links(new_links) }
}

export const get_view_network = function (db_graph, node_limit = 80, degree_limit = 6) {
  const graph = db_graph?.network_subgraph

  // If there's no graph to render, short-circuit and return an obj with empty
  // lists for 'nodes' and 'links'.
  if (!Array.isArray(graph) || graph.length === 0) {
    return {
      nodes: [],
      links: [],
    }
  }

  const node_degrees = get_node_degrees(graph)
  const addr_map = generate_addr_map(graph)
  const emap = generate_evictor_maps(graph)
  const evictor_map = emap.evictor_map
  const parcel_map = emap.parcel_map

  let confirmed_nodes = [createNode(graph[0].start)] // arbitrarily use the first node to start with
  let confirmed_links = []

  let path_length = 1

  let last_added_nodes = [...confirmed_nodes] // the set of nodes added on the last run of the while loop
  let cached_nodes = [...confirmed_nodes] // a copy of the total amount of saved nodes

  // If the user selected 'All', set the limit as the number of total nodes
  node_limit = node_limit === 'All' ? Object.keys(node_degrees).length : node_limit

  while (confirmed_nodes.length < node_limit && path_length <= degree_limit) {
    let nodes_to_add = []
    let links_to_add = []
    /* eslint no-loop-func: 'off' */
    last_added_nodes.forEach(n => {
      const { nodes, links } = get_next_edges(n, graph, addr_map, evictor_map, parcel_map, [])
      nodes.forEach(new_n => {
        if (!nodes_to_add.map(x => x.id).includes(new_n.id)) nodes_to_add.push(new_n)
      })
      links_to_add.push(...links)
    })
    last_added_nodes = nodes_to_add

    cached_nodes.push(...nodes_to_add)
    cached_nodes = unique_nodes(cached_nodes)

    // update confirmed_nodes iff the result will be under node_limit
    //    if it crosses the limit, then confirmed_nodes will "remember"
    //    a cached value from the previous run and not add the limit-breaking nodes
    // This also provides a safety check in case the graph processor thinks the graph is
    //    "fragmented" and will never reach the total number of nodes. In this scenario
    //    it will cause a stack overflow, so we want to break if there were no nodes added
    //    from one run of the while loop
    if (cached_nodes.length >= node_limit || cached_nodes.length === confirmed_nodes.length) break
    confirmed_nodes = [...cached_nodes]
    confirmed_links = unique_links(links_to_add)
    path_length += 1
  }

  confirmed_nodes.forEach(n => {
    let displayed_degree = 0
    confirmed_links.forEach(l => {
      if (l.source === n.id || l.target === n.id) displayed_degree += 1
    })
    if (displayed_degree < node_degrees[n.id]) {
      n['not_displayed'] = node_degrees[n.id] - displayed_degree
    }
  })

  return {
    nodes: confirmed_nodes,
    links: confirmed_links,
  }
}

ui/src/components/Grid.js

import React, { forwardRef } from 'react'
import Grid from '@material-ui/core/Grid'

/* Helper functions to enhance readability since with Material UI a row is '<Grid container>' and a column is '<Grid item>' */

export const Row = forwardRef(
  (props, ref) =>
    <Grid container {...props} ref={ref}>
      {props.children}
    </Grid>
)

export const Col = forwardRef(
  (props, ref) =>
    <Grid item {...props} ref={ref}>
      {props.children}
    </Grid>
)

ui/src/components/Header.js

import React, { memo } from 'react'
import { NavLink, useLocation } from 'react-router-dom'
import SearchBar from './DataSearchBar/SearchBar'
import Toolbar from '@material-ui/core/Toolbar'
import Typography from '@material-ui/core/Typography'
import useMediaQuery from '@material-ui/core/useMediaQuery'
import useStyles from '../theme/HeaderStyles'
import HomeIcon from '@material-ui/icons/Home'
import Link from '@material-ui/core/Link'
import { useTheme } from '@material-ui/core/styles'

const Header = () => {
  
  let location = useLocation()
  const theme = useTheme()
  const classes = useStyles(theme)
  const isSmallDisplay = useMediaQuery('(max-width: 600px)')

  return (
    <Toolbar className={classes.root}>
      <Link underline='none' component={NavLink} to="/">
        {
          isSmallDisplay
            ? <HomeIcon htmlColor={theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT} style={{fontSize: '40'}} />
            : <Typography variant="h3" className={classes.titleText}>
              EVICTORBOOK
            </Typography>
        }
      </Link>
      {location.pathname !== '/' &&
        <div className={
          isSmallDisplay
            ? classes.searchBarMobile
            : classes.searchBarDiv
        }>
          <SearchBar location='/results' />
        </div>
      }
    </Toolbar>
  )
}

export default memo(Header)

ui/src/components/NetworkList.js

import React, { memo, useState } from 'react'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import { Typography } from '@material-ui/core'
import Card from '@material-ui/core/Card'
import Divider from '@material-ui/core/Divider'
import Chip from '@material-ui/core/Chip'
import Avatar from '@material-ui/core/Avatar'
import CardActionArea from '@material-ui/core/CardActionArea'
import CardContent from '@material-ui/core/CardContent'
import ArrowDropDown from '@material-ui/icons/ArrowDropDown'
import Button from '@material-ui/core/Button'
import { commaSeparatedBolded } from '../utils/dataUtils'
import { isEmpty, sliceJson } from './DataPage/DataPage'
import { useTheme } from '@material-ui/core/styles'
import { Row } from './Grid'
import useStyles from '../theme/ListStyles'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import { generateGraphIdUrl } from '../utils/tableUtils'
import i18n from '../i18n'
import { ReactComponent as NetworkLink } from '../images/noun_networking_2148898.svg'

const NetworkList = props => {

  const theme = useTheme()
  const classes = useStyles(theme)
  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'List', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )
  const slice = props.slice
  const noDataMessage = props.noDataMessage
  const [showAll, setShowAll] = useState(false)
  const resultJson = useSelector(sliceJson(slice))
  const related = Object.assign([], resultJson)

  if (!translationReady) return null
  const ownershipNetworkLabel = t('Ownership network containing')

  if (isEmpty(resultJson)) 
    return (
      <>
        <Typography variant='h2'>{t('Related Ownership Networks')}</Typography>
        <Typography variant='body1'>{noDataMessage}</Typography>
      </>
    )

  const handleShowMoreClick = () => setShowAll(true)

  return (
    <>
      <Typography variant='h2'>{t('Related Ownership Networks')}</Typography>
      <Typography variant='body1'>
        Related ownership networks are those which have something important in 
        common with the ownership network highlighted on this page. A summary 
        of each related network is shown below along with the reason for the 
        relationship.
      </Typography>
      <br/>
      { /* always show the first three networks */
        related.slice(0, showAll ? related.length : 3).map((network,i) => {

          const description = network.network_description
          const id = description.network_id

          // creates the rows for each related network card, providing
          // an explanation for why we believe the networks are related
          const explanation_section = network.explanations.map((exp) => {
            let firstChipLabel
            let firstChipCount
            let secondChipLabel
            let secondChipCount
            let cardText

            switch(exp.exp_type) {
              case 'businesses_listed_at_addrs':
                // Case: There are businesses in one networks that have
                //       listed office addresses in the other network

                firstChipLabel = exp.exp_metrics.num_addrs > 1 ? 'Addresses' : 'Address'
                firstChipCount = exp.exp_metrics.num_addrs
                secondChipLabel = exp.exp_metrics.num_businesses > 1 ? 'Businesses' : 'Business'
                secondChipCount = exp.exp_metrics.num_businesses
                cardText = 'shared between networks'
                break

              case 'related_to_excluded':
                // Case: There are businesses in the networks that are
                //       connected via a business or an address that we 
                //       have determined to be a likely "unreliable"
                //       connector (e.g. might be an address for a 
                //       business filing service)

                firstChipLabel = exp.exp_metrics.num_related_to_excluded > 1 ? 'Businesses' : 'Business'
                firstChipCount = exp.exp_metrics.num_related_to_excluded
                cardText = 'between networks associated with a likely unreliable business or address connection'
                break

              case 'businesses_owning_parcels':
                // Case: There are businesses in one networks that are 
                //       listed as the property owner for properties in
                //       the other network 

                firstChipLabel = exp.exp_metrics.num_businesses > 1 ? 'Businesses' : 'Business'
                firstChipCount = exp.exp_metrics.num_businesses
                secondChipLabel = exp.exp_metrics.num_parcels > 1 ? 'Properties' : 'Property'
                secondChipCount = exp.exp_metrics.num_parcels
                cardText = 'shared between networks'
                break

              case 'parcels_owned_by_same_non_business_owner':
                // Case: There are properties in the two networks that
                //       both have a non-business owner. E.g. might be a 
                //       person or a trust that owns both. 

                firstChipLabel = exp.exp_metrics.num_parcels > 1 ? 'Properties' : 'Property'
                firstChipCount = exp.exp_metrics.num_parcels
                cardText = 'owned by same non-business owner between networks'
                break

              case 'similar_addresses':
                // Case: There are office addresses in one network that
                //       have the same street address as addresses in the other
                //       (i.e. they are in the same building but have different
                //       suite / unit numbers)
                
                cardText = 'Similar business addresses between networks'
                break
              
              default:
                break
            }

            /* Return for network.explanations.map((exp) => */
            return (
              <div key={`${exp.exp_type}`}>
                {<hr style={{
                  border: 0,
                  borderTop: '1px solid lightgrey'
                }}/>}
                {firstChipLabel && firstChipCount && <Chip
                  size="small"
                  avatar={<Avatar color='primary'>{firstChipCount}</Avatar>}
                  label={firstChipLabel}
                  color="primary"
                />}
                {secondChipLabel && secondChipCount && <Chip
                  size="small"
                  avatar={<Avatar color='primary'>{secondChipCount}</Avatar>}
                  label={secondChipLabel}
                  color="primary"
                />}
                {<span>
                  {' '}{cardText}
                </span>
                }
              </div>
            )
          })

          /* Return for related.slice(0, 3).map((network,i) => */
          return (
            <Row
              key={`${description}-${i}`}>
              <Card style={{
                borderRadius: 5,
                marginBottom: 15,
                paddingTop: 10,
                paddingBottom: 10,
                fontFamily: 'Source Sans Pro, sans-serif',
                border: 0,
                fontSize: '0.9rem',
                width: '100%'
              }}>
                <CardActionArea href={generateGraphIdUrl(id)}>
                  <CardContent style={{ padding: 0 }}>
                    <div className={classes.cardText} style={{
                      display: 'flex',
                      justifyContent: 'space-between'
                    }}>
                      <div style={{
                        marginLeft: 10,
                        display: 'flex',
                        flexDirection: 'row'
                      }}>
                        <div style={{ display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column', justifyContent: 'center' }}>
                          <div style={{display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'row', alignItems: 'center'}}>
                            <span style={{
                              width: 55,
                              margin: '0',
                              padding: '0'
                            }}>
                              <NetworkLink style={{
                                width: 55,
                                height: 50
                              }} />
                            </span>
                            <Typography variant='body2'
                              style={{
                                margin: '0 10px',
                                fontSize: '1em'
                              }}>
                              {ownershipNetworkLabel}{' '}
                              {commaSeparatedBolded([
                                description.top_be,
                                description.top_owner,
                                description.top_addr
                              ])}
                            </Typography>
                          </div>
                          {explanation_section}
                        </div>
                      </div>
                      <div style={{
                        marginLeft: 10,
                        marginRight: 10,
                        whiteSpace: 'nowrap',
                        display: 'flex'
                      }}>
                        <Divider orientation='vertical' flexItem />
                        <div style={{ 
                          flexDirection: 'column', 
                          marginLeft: 15, 
                          display: 'flex', 
                          justifyContent: 'center'}}>
                          <div>{description.num_parcels}{' '}{t('properties')}</div>
                          <div>{description.num_units}{' '}{t('units')}</div>
                        </div>
                      </div>
                    </div>
                  </CardContent>
                </CardActionArea>
              </Card>
            </Row>
          )
        })
      }
      { /* render a "show more" button when there are more than three networks */
        related.length > 3 && showAll === false &&
        <Button className={classes.showMoreButton} onClick={handleShowMoreClick}>
          <Typography variant='body1'>Show More</Typography><ArrowDropDown/>
        </Button>
      }
    </>
  )

}

export default memo(NetworkList)

ui/src/components/NotAvailable.js

import React from 'react'
import CircularProgress from '@material-ui/core/CircularProgress'
import Typography from '@material-ui/core/Typography'
import { Row } from './Grid'
import StorageIcon from '@material-ui/icons/Storage'
import ErrorOutlineIcon from '@material-ui/icons/ErrorOutline'
import { ReactComponent as BrokenLink } from '../images/broken-link.svg'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../i18n'
import theme from '../theme/Theme'

// used for all icons
const iconStyle = {
  color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE, 
  fontSize: '5rem', 
  marginBottom: '.5rem'
}

export const Loading = 
  () => {

    return (
      <Row justify='center' alignItems='center' style={{ height: 100 }}>
        <CircularProgress style={iconStyle} />
      </Row>
    )

  }

export const TableLoading =
() => {

  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Status', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )

  if (!translationReady) return null

  return (
    <Row direction='column' alignItems='center' justify='center'>
      <CircularProgress style={iconStyle} />
      <Typography variant='body1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;{t('Loading Table')}</Typography>
    </Row>
  )

}

export const NoPage = 
  () => {

    const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
      'Status', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
      { useSuspense: false, i18n }
    )

    if (!translationReady) return null

    return (
      <Row direction='column' alignItems='center' justify='center'>
        <BrokenLink style={{ height: 72, fill: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT }}/>
        <Typography variant='body1'>{t('Page not found')}</Typography>
      </Row>
    )

  }

export const NoData = 
  () => {

    const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
      'Status', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
      { useSuspense: false, i18n }
    )

    if (!translationReady) return null

    return (
      <Row direction='column' alignItems='center' justify='center'>
        <ErrorOutlineIcon style={iconStyle} />
        <Typography variant='body1'>{t('Data not available')}</Typography>
      </Row>
    )

  }

export const TableNoData =
  props => {

    return (
      <Row direction='column' alignItems='center' justify='center'>
        <StorageIcon style={iconStyle} />
        <Typography variant='body1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;{props.noDataMessage}</Typography>
      </Row>  
    )
  }

export const Error = 
  ({ source, error }) => {

    const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
      'Status', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
      { useSuspense: false, i18n }
    )

    if (!translationReady) return null

    return (
      <Row direction='column' alignItems='center' justify='center'>

        <ErrorOutlineIcon style={iconStyle} />
          
        <Typography variant='body1'>
          {t('Error loading ')}{source}
          <br />
          <span style={{ fontSize: 18 }} >{error}</span>
        </Typography>

      </Row>        
    
    )

  }

ui/src/components/OwnershipNetwork.js

import React from 'react'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import Card from '@material-ui/core/Card'
import CardActionArea from '@material-ui/core/CardActionArea'
import CardContent from '@material-ui/core/CardContent'
import { renderOwnerLink, generateGraphIdUrl } from '../utils/tableUtils'
import { ReactComponent as NetworkLink } from '../images/noun_networking_2148898.svg'
import { isEmpty, sliceJson } from './DataPage/DataPage'
import { Typography } from '@material-ui/core'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import { titleCase } from '../utils/stringUtils'
import i18n from '../i18n'

const OwnershipNetwork = props => {
  const urlParam = props?.urlParam

  const { t } = useTranslation('Parcel' /* i18next-parser needs string here */, {
    useSuspense: false,
    i18n,
  })

  const details = useSelector(sliceJson(`${urlParam}-details`))
  const networkDetails = useSelector(sliceJson(`${urlParam}-network-details`))
  const totalNetworkEntities =
    networkDetails.total_bes + networkDetails.total_addrs + networkDetails.total_owners

  if (isEmpty(networkDetails) || totalNetworkEntities === 0) {
    return (
      <>
        <Typography variant='h2'>{t('Ownership Network')}</Typography>
        <Typography variant='body1'>
          {t('This property does not appear to be part of a larger ownership network.')}
        </Typography>
      </>
    )
  }

  const name = details.addr_details
    ? titleCase(details.addr_details?.main_addr)
    : titleCase(details.name)
  const networkId = details.network_id

  /* If there are businesses, render the total number of businesses with a linked example */
  /* E.g. "10 businesses, such as Veritas Investments Inc," */
  const business_text_section =
    networkDetails.total_bes === 0 ? (
      ''
    ) : (
      <>
        {t('{{total_businesses}} {{business_text}}', {
          total_businesses: networkDetails.total_bes,
          business_text:
            networkDetails.total_bes > 1 ? 'businesses, such as ' : 'business, namely ',
        })}
        {renderOwnerLink(networkDetails.top_be.name_norm, networkDetails.top_be.__typename)}
        {networkDetails.top_addr || networkDetails.top_owner ? t(',') : ''}
      </>
    )

  /* If there are addresses, render an example */
  /* E.g. " 10 business office or property owner addresses, such 123 Main St CA, and" */
  const addr_text_section =
    networkDetails.total_addrs === 0 ? (
      ''
    ) : (
      <>
        {t(' {{total_addrs}} {{addr_type}} {{addr_text}}{{addr_example}}', {
          total_addrs: networkDetails.total_addrs,
          addr_type: networkDetails.top_addr.is_business
            ? networkDetails.top_addr.is_property_owner
              ? t('business office and property owner')
              : t('business office')
            : t('property owner'),
          addr_text: networkDetails.total_addrs > 1 ? 'addresses, such as ' : 'address, namely ',
          addr_example: titleCase(networkDetails.top_addr.addr_readable),
        })}
        {networkDetails.top_owner ? t(', and') : ''}
      </>
    )

  /* If there are owners, render an example */
  /* E.g. " 5 business owners, such as David McCloskey" */
  const owner_text_section =
    networkDetails.total_owners === 0 ? (
      ''
    ) : (
      <>
        {t(' {{total_owners}} {{owner_text}}{{owner_example}}', {
          total_owners: networkDetails.total_owners,
          owner_text:
            networkDetails.total_owners > 1
              ? ' business owners, such as '
              : ' business owner, namely ',
          owner_example: titleCase(networkDetails.top_owner.name_norm),
        })}
      </>
    )
  return (
    <>
      <Typography variant='h2'>{t('Ownership Network')}</Typography>
      <Typography variant='body1'>
        <strong>{name}</strong>
        {t(' is part of an ownership network with ')}
        {business_text_section}
        {addr_text_section}
        {owner_text_section}
        {t('.')}
      </Typography>
      <br />
      <Card
        style={{
          borderRadius: 5,
          marginBottom: 15,
          border: 0,
          width: '57ch',
        }}>
        <CardActionArea href={generateGraphIdUrl(networkId)}>
          <CardContent
            style={{
              display: 'flex',
              alignItems: 'center',
              padding: '20px',
            }}>
            <NetworkLink style={{ width: 55, height: 50 }} />
            <Typography variant='body2' style={{ margin: '0 10px', fontSize: '0.9rem' }}>
              Click here to learn more about who is behind this network.
            </Typography>
          </CardContent>
        </CardActionArea>
      </Card>
    </>
  )
}

export default OwnershipNetwork

ui/src/components/PageTitle.js

import React, { memo } from 'react'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import { Typography } from '@material-ui/core'
import { sliceJson, isNull } from './Data/DataUtils'

const PageTitle = props => {

  const slice = props.slice
  const appendTextSelector = props.appendTextSelector
  const text = props.text
  const resultJson = useSelector(sliceJson(slice))

  if (isNull(resultJson))
    return <Typography variant='h1'>{text}</Typography>

  return (
    <Typography variant='h1'>
      {text}
      {typeof appendTextSelector === 'function'
        ? appendTextSelector(resultJson) : ''}
    </Typography>
  )

}

export default memo(PageTitle)

ui/src/components/PropertyList.js

import React, { memo } from 'react'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import { Typography } from '@material-ui/core'
import DataTable, { isEmpty, sliceJson } from './DataTable/DataTable'
import { titleCase } from '../utils/stringUtils'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../i18n'
import { renderParcelLink, renderOwnerLink } from '../utils/tableUtils'

/*
  PropertyList: render a table with a list of properties
*/

const PropertyList = props => {
  const portfolio = useSelector(sliceJson(props.portfolioSlice)) ?? []
  const noDataMessage = props.noDataMessage
  const title = props.title
  const subTitle = props.subTitle
  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'List', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )

  if (!translationReady) return null

  if (isEmpty(portfolio)) {
    return <>
      <Typography variant='h2'>{title}</Typography>
      <Typography variant='body1'>{noDataMessage}</Typography>
    </>
  }
  
  // Structure API data so that we don't have to do this
  const tableData = portfolio.map(
    (e, i) => ({
      addr: titleCase(e.addr || e.location?.addr),
      block_lot: e.block_lot || e.location?.block_lot,
      num_evictions: e.num_evictions,
      units: e.units,
      typename: e.owners[0].linked_be?.__typename ?? '',
      owner_name: e.owners[0].owner_name ?? '',
      be_type: e.owners?.[0]?.linked_be?.__typename ?? '',
      owner_addr: titleCase(e.owner_mailing_addr || e.mailing_address) 
    })
  ) ?? []

  /* Count occurences of the data for each column */
  const countAddr = portfolio.filter(row => typeof row.addr !== 'undefined').length
  const countOwnerName = portfolio.filter(row => typeof row.owners?.[0]?.owner_name !== 'undefined').length
  const countUnits = portfolio.filter(row => typeof row.units !== 'undefined').length
  const countNumEvictions = portfolio.filter(row => typeof row.num_evictions !== 'undefined').length
  const countOwnerAddr = portfolio.filter(row => row.owner_mailing_addr || row.mailing_address).length
  const columns = []
  /* Display columns with at least one data item */

  countAddr > 0 && columns.push({
    field: 'addr',
    headerName: 'Address',
    flex: 2,
    renderCell: p => renderParcelLink(
      p.row.block_lot || p.row.location?.block_lot,
      titleCase(p.row.addr || p.row.location?.addr)
    )
  })

  countOwnerName > 0 && columns.push(
    { field: 'owner_name', headerName: t('Owner Name'), flex: 3,
      renderCell: p => renderOwnerLink(
        p.row.owner_name,
        p.row.be_type
      )
    }
  )

  countOwnerAddr > 0 && columns.push(
    { field: 'owner_addr', headerName: t('Owner Mailing Address'), flex: 3, 
      renderCell: p => p.row.owner_addr
    }
  )

  countUnits > 0 && columns.push(
    { field: 'units', headerName: t('# of Units'), flex: 1.5,
      renderCell: p => p.row.units ? p.row.units : 'Unknown'
    }
  )

  countNumEvictions > 0 && columns.push(
    { field: 'num_evictions', headerName: t('Evictions Filed'), flex: 1.5 }
  )
  
  return (
    <>
      <Typography variant='h2'>{title}</Typography>
      <Typography variant='body1'>{subTitle}</Typography>
      <DataTable
        sortModel={[{ field: 'addr', sort: 'asc' }]}
        name='properties'
        {...props}
        rows={tableData}
        columns={columns}
      />
      {/*<CSVLink data={RelatedParcelsCSV(csvData)} className="parcel-link" filename={toUnderscore(titleCase(parcelAddress) + '_related_properties.csv')}>Download Connected Properties as CSV</CSVLink>*/}
    </>
  )
}

export default memo(PropertyList)

ui/src/config/style-guide.txt

Notes on Evictorbook FE style

### Useful links ###
  - EvictorBook developer guide https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NnJ_Yd_Av8S2bFs5MceeA73BXmx0Ebvy_hJ4xNJI1IA/edit

### Information pages ###
(such as Disclaimer, Methodology, etc.)
- By default the page background will be eggplant, and there will be 100px of padding on the bottom, provided by the Footer. Font color will be provided by the theme. If you're implementing a new feature like this, follow the same basic arrangement as the existing pages.

### Colors ###
- Theme colors are stored in src/theme/theme.js. 

### Fonts ###
- Headings:
  - Font: Oswald
- Paragraphs: 
  - Font: Source Sans
- Make sure to add the translation for every bit of Typography that needs to be translated.
- Dynamic values from the database should not be translated
- The link to retrieve those Google fonts is in ui/public/index.html, and then imported into the appropriate scss files.

ui/src/i18n.js

import i18n from 'i18next'
import Backend from 'i18next-http-backend'
import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector'
import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next'

/*
  i18n Initialization
  notes:

    Language Translations In This Application

      This application uses react-i18next and associated libraries to perform
      translation from English to languages such as Chinese and Spanish.

      Translation files are located under ui/public/locales and are in JSON
      format. There is a folder under 'locales' for each language.

      The translations must be performed by hand by copying the files
      under the 'en' folder to other folders such as 'zh' (Chinese)
      and 'es' (Spanish). The JSON files have key/value pairs. The key must
      remain untranslated, and the value on the right of the : is what should
      be translated. Spaces in the text should be preserved unless there is
      a language reason not to. Variables wrapped with {{ and }} should be
      preserved and not translated or they will not work.

      Only static text that does not change on the site can be translated.
      If the data itself is in English, it must remain in English even if
      a translation is in use.

      The t() function performs the translation. The first argument is the key,
      which in this application is the text which also will be translated.
      The second argument is an object with variables embedded in the text
      string of the first argument.

      When changing the source code for the translations, make one change at
      a time and test that the parser picks up the changes, as it is unable
      to detect some code syntax, so there can be unexpected quirks

      It is not necessary to edit the JSON translation files manually, for
      the most part.

      Run 'npx i18next' in the 'ui' directory to parse source files and
      automatically extract text per config file 'ui/i18next-parser.config.js'.
      The configuration can be changed to support what you are trying to do.

      The parser will remove keys that no longer exist. Any new keys will be
      added to the file, and existing keys will not automatically be updated.
      The parser can create _plural keys when certain variables are present,
      but the text grammar needs to be manually updated.

      The translation JSON files need to be curated to update the grammar for
      plurals and to remove any falsely detected plurals as well as to find
      any oddities.

      If the text in these files needs to be changed, it must be changed in
      the source code first, then 'npx i18next' run from the 'ui' folder in
      order to re-add the modified text.

      Below is the configuration for i18n within the application. This is
      different from the configuration for i18next-parser.

      To see all status messages for i18n in the console, set debug to
      enabled in the configuration below.
*/

i18n
  .use(Backend)
  .use(LanguageDetector)
  .use(initReactI18next)
  .init({
    backend: {
      loadPath: 'locales/{{lng}}/{{ns}}.json',
      allowMultiLoading: false
    },
    lng: 'en',
    load: 'all',
    ns: ['Home', 'Search', 'Parcel', 'Owner', 'Evictions', 'List', 'Disclaimer',
      'Network', 'Glossary', 'Methodology', 'Footer', 'Map', 'Status'],
    whitelist: ['en'],
    debug: false, /* Disable console logging for i18n in general */
    fallbackLng: false,
    interpolation: { escapeValue: false },
    nsSeparator: false,
    keySeparator: false
  })

/* Enable console logging for errors */
i18n.on('missingKey', (lng, namespace, key, fallbackValue) => {
  console.warn(lng, namespace, key, fallbackValue)
})
i18n.on('failedLoading', (lng, namespace, msg) => {
  console.warn(lng, namespace, msg)
})

/* Enable console logging when the language changes */
i18n.on('languageChanged', (lng) => {
  console.info(`Language changed to ${lng} `)
})

export default i18n

ui/src/index.js

import React from 'react'
import { render } from 'react-dom'
import App from './components/App'
import { Provider } from 'react-redux'
import Store from './state/store.js'
import { ThemeProvider } from '@material-ui/core/styles'
import theme from './theme/Theme'
import L from 'leaflet' //regular leaflet
import CssBaseline from '@material-ui/core/CssBaseline'
import 'mapbox-gl/dist/mapbox-gl.css'
import 'leaflet/dist/leaflet.css' //regular leaflet css
import 'react-leaflet-markercluster/dist/styles.min.css' //markerCluster
import '@fontsource/roboto/300.css'
import '@fontsource/roboto/400.css'
import '@fontsource/roboto/500.css'
import '@fontsource/roboto/700.css'
 
//annoying hack to deal with webpack and marker icon
delete L.Icon.Default.prototype._getIconUrl

L.Icon.Default.mergeOptions({
  iconRetinaUrl: require('leaflet/dist/images/marker-icon-2x.png'),
  iconUrl: require('leaflet/dist/images/marker-icon.png'),
  shadowUrl: require('leaflet/dist/images/marker-shadow.png')
})

render(
  <Provider store={Store}>
    <ThemeProvider theme={theme}>
      <CssBaseline />
      <App />
    </ThemeProvider>
  </Provider>,
  document.getElementById('root')
)

ui/src/pages/Disclaimer.js

import React, { memo } from 'react'
import { Link as RouterLink } from 'react-router-dom'
import Typography from '@material-ui/core/Typography'
import { Row, Col } from '../components/Grid'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../i18n'
import { useTheme } from '@material-ui/core/styles'
import PageTitle from '../components/PageTitle'
import Link from '@material-ui/core/Link'

const lineBreak = <span style={{ width: '100%', display: 'inline-block' }} />

const Disclaimer = () => {

  const theme = useTheme()
  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Disclaimer', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )
  
  if (!translationReady) return null

  return (
    <Row justify='center'>
      <Col xs={10} sm={8} md={6}>
        <PageTitle text={t('Disclaimer')} />
        <hr style={{ backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.white }} />
        <Typography variant='body1'>
          {t('The information on this website is sourced from publicly available data that is provided by, created by, and maintained by third-party sites. We are making that data available here. ')}
          <Link
            style={{textDecoration: 'underline', fontWeight: 'bold'}}
            to={{ pathname: '/methodology' }}
            component={RouterLink}>
            {t('Our methodology page')}
          </Link>
          {t(' lists the sources we use, as well as the dates on which we last retrieved data from each source. We do not collect data on the users of this website.')}
          {lineBreak}
          {t('An evictor is defined here as an entity or corporation taking legal action to remove someone from occupying a building. Evictions themselves are not defamatory. Moreover, the appearance of a person, entity, or corporation on this website does not necessarily mean that they have evicted someone or taken advantage of eviction laws.')}
          {lineBreak}
          {t('The information on this website is provided â€œas is,â€ â€œas available,â€ and â€œwith all faults.â€ Your access to, any reliance upon, and/or use of the information is at your sole risk. To the fullest extent permissible by law, Mapping Action Collective and Anti-Eviction Mapping Project hereby disclaim all express or implied warranties of any kind including but not limited to accuracy and non-infringement, and make no representations, warranties, endorsements, or promises, express or implied, in connection with, or otherwise directly or indirectly related to, the information provided on this website. Under no circumstances shall Mapping Action Collective or Anti-Eviction Mapping Project or its members, employees, volunteers, and affiliates be liable for any indirect, incidental, punitive, special, or consequential damages (including but not limited to damages from personal injury and/or death, lost revenues or profits, loss of business or loss of data) that are directly or indirectly related to the use of the website.')}
          {lineBreak}
          {t('The information on this website does not constitute legal advice and must not be used as a substitute for the advice of a lawyer qualified to give advice on legal issues pertaining to housing. We can help direct you to free legal services if necessary.')}
          {lineBreak}
          {t('We at the Mapping Action Collective and Anti-Eviction Mapping Project do not condone any violent, harassing, threatening, or destructive behavior directed at landlords, their families, their associates, or their property, or at anyone else. Rather, we encourage our website users to conduct themselves peacefully and responsibly at all times.')}
        </Typography>
      </Col>
    </Row>
  )

}

export default memo(Disclaimer)

ui/src/pages/EvictionPage.js

import React, { useState, useMemo, useRef } from 'react'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import { Typography } from '@material-ui/core'
import { InfoBox } from '../components/DataMap/Overlays/InfoBox'
import MapIcon from '@material-ui/icons/Map'
import { isEmpty, urlParam } from '../components/DataTable/DataTable'
import DataMap from '../components/DataMap/DataMap'
import DataPage, { sliceJson } from '../components/DataPage/DataPage'
import { Row, Col } from '../components/Grid'
import { titleCase, reformatDate } from '../utils/stringUtils'
import Overlay from '../components/DataMap/Overlays/Overlay'
import { ReactComponent as EvictionIcon }
  from '../components/DataMap/Map/map_icons/directly-evicted-icon.svg'
import PageTitle from '../components/PageTitle'
import EvictionList from '../components/EvictionList'
import Legend from '../components/DataMap/Overlays/Legend'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../i18n'

/*
  EvictionsPage: presents content for evictions in a geographic region
*/

const EvictionPage = () => {
  
  const [tableSearchRows, setTableSearchRows] = useState(null)
  const search = urlParam('search')
  const evictionSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson(`${search}-about-evictions`))
  const evictionSourceText = evictionSourceData.source_name + ' (as of ' + reformatDate(evictionSourceData.date_exported) + ')'
  const evictionList = useRef([])
  const totalEvictions = useRef(0)

  /* If tableSearchRows exist use them instead of the full evictionList */
  const json = useSelector(sliceJson(`${search}-evictions`))
  const evictionsJson = Array.isArray(json) ? json : [] /* DataMap needs array */
  const evictions = !isEmpty(tableSearchRows) ? tableSearchRows : evictionsJson
  totalEvictions.current = evictions.length ?? 0
  evictionList.current = evictions

  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Evictions', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )

  /* Calculate numEvictions and evictionDatesMinMax */
  const numEvictions = evictions.length ?? 0
  let oldestEviction = ''
  let newestEviction = ''
  const evictionDatesMinMax = useMemo(() => {
    for (let i = 0; i < evictions.length; i++) {
      const d = evictions[i].evict_date
      // eslint-disable-next-line
      if (!oldestEviction || d < oldestEviction) oldestEviction = d
      // eslint-disable-next-line
      if (!newestEviction || d > newestEviction) newestEviction = d     
    }
    return ({
      oldest: reformatDate(oldestEviction),
      newest: reformatDate(newestEviction)
    })
  }, [evictions])

  if (!translationReady) return null

  const EvictionMap = () => {

    const [selectedEviction, setSelectedEviction] = useState(null)

    /* Avoid hundreds of redundant translation calls */
    // eslint-disable-next-line
    const addressLabel = useMemo(() => t('Address'),[i18n.language])
    // eslint-disable-next-line
    const evictionTypeLabel = useMemo(() => t('Type'),[i18n.language])
    // eslint-disable-next-line
    const dateFiledLabel = useMemo(() => t('Date Filed'),[i18n.language])

    if (isEmpty(evictions)) return null

    function HoverContent (eviction) {
      const ellis_text = eviction.units && (eviction.type === 'Ellis Act Withdrawal')
        ? t(' (affecting ') + eviction.units + t(' units)')
        : ''
      return (
        <Typography variant='body1'>
          {addressLabel}{': '}{titleCase(eviction.addr)}<br/>
          {evictionTypeLabel}{': '}{eviction.type}{ellis_text}<br/>
          {dateFiledLabel}{': '}{reformatDate(eviction.evict_date)}
        </Typography>
      )
    }

    return (
      <DataMap markers={evictions} isDebugEnabled={false}
        overlays={[
          <Overlay position='bottomright'>
            <Legend
              title={t('Legend')}
              items={[
                { icon: <EvictionIcon/>, label: t('Eviction') }
              ]}
            />
          </Overlay>,
          <Overlay position='topleft'>
            <InfoBox
              selectedMarker={selectedEviction}
              directions={t('Click an eviction on the map for details')}
            />
          </Overlay>
        ]}
        onSelect={eviction => setSelectedEviction(eviction)}
        renderMarkerHover={HoverContent}
      />
    )
  }

  return (
    <Row>
      <Col xs={12}>
        <DataPage fetch={[
          {
            slice: `${search}-evictions`,
            url: `api/neighborhood/${search}/evictions?size=99999`
          },
          { slice: `${search}-about-evictions`, url: 'api/about/eviction'},
        ]} isDebugEnabled={false}>
          <EvictionMap/>
          <Row justify='center'>
            <Col xs={10} sm={8}>
              <PageTitle
                text={t('Evictions for the {{search}} Neighborhood',
                  {search: titleCase(search)})}
              />
              <EvictionList
                evictionSlice={`${search}-evictions`}
                title={t('Eviction Summary')}
                subTitle={t('Map and table show {{numEvictions}} evictions between {{oldest}} and {{newest}}{{searchTermApplied}}.', {
                  numEvictions: numEvictions,
                  oldest: evictionDatesMinMax.oldest,
                  newest: evictionDatesMinMax.newest,
                  searchTermApplied: (totalEvictions.current < evictionsJson.length
                    ? ' with a search term applied' : '')
                })
                }
                noDataMessage={t('No evictions recorded for this area.')}
                aboutData={{
                  source: evictionSourceText,
                  href: '/methodology',
                  notes: (
                    t('Eviction records generally only include the address of the eviction. ') +
                    t('Evictions were matched to parcel records and property ownership records. ') +
                    t('As a result, some evictions were matched to multiple or no properties, if an exact ') +
                    t('match could not be found. Some evictions also include names on the filing, ') +
                    t('which may be either property owners or lawyers involved in the case. For these, ') +
                    t('we have shown the name identified through property records, and the additional ') +
                    t('names are those found on the eviction filing itself.')
                  )
                }}
                onSearchFilter={filtered => setTableSearchRows(filtered)}
                searchHint={() =>
                  <Row alignItems='center'>
                    <MapIcon style={{color: 'white'}} />
                    <Typography style={{fontSize: '12px'}}>
                      {' '}{t('Map Updated')}{' '}
                    </Typography>
                  </Row>
                }
                paginationPageSize={25}
                csvFileName={t('Evictions for the {{search}} Neighborhood',
                  {search: titleCase(search)})}
              />
            </Col>
          </Row>
        </DataPage>
      </Col>
    </Row>
  )

}

export default EvictionPage

ui/src/pages/Glossary.js

import React, { useState } from 'react'
import Typography from '@material-ui/core/Typography'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../i18n'
import { Row, Col } from '../components/Grid'
import Link from '@material-ui/core/Link'
import PageTitle from '../components/PageTitle'
import Accordion from '@material-ui/core/Accordion'
import AccordionDetails from '@material-ui/core/AccordionDetails'
import AccordionSummary from '@material-ui/core/AccordionSummary'
import ExpandMoreIcon from '@material-ui/icons/ExpandMore'
import { useTheme } from '@material-ui/core/styles'
import ListItem from '@material-ui/core/ListItem'

const Glossary = () => {

  const theme = useTheme()
  const [expanded, setExpanded] = useState(false)
  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Glossary', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )

  if (!translationReady) return null

  const questions = [
    {
      siteId: 'just-cause-no-fault',
      question: t('What causes for eviction are considered just cause - no-fault?'),
      answer: [
        t('Owner/relative move-in'),
        t('Condo conversion'),
        t('Demolition / removal from rental market'),
        t('Temporary removal from rental market for capital improvements or rehabilitation work'),
        t('Substantial rehabilitationLead remediation or abatement work'),
        t('Demolition / removal from rental market in accordance with development agreement entered into by the City')
      ],
      link: 'https://sanfrancisco-policies.glitch.me/',
      credit: t('Tenants Together / Urban Displacement Project')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'just-cause-tenant-at-fault',
      question: t('What is Considered Just Cause - tenant at-fault?'),
      answer: [
        t('Failure to pay rent'),
        t('Violation of the rental agreement or lease'),
        t('Unreasonable interference with the comfort, safety or enjoyment of other tenants, or damaging the rental unit or the property'),
        t('Using your rental unit or the common areas of the property for an illegal purpose'),
        t('Refusal to renew a lease or rental agreement of like terms and conditions'),
        t('Refusing the landlord reasonable access to the rental unit for repairs and inspections to name a couple of examples'),
        t('At the end of a lease term, the landlord discovers the tenant is not the person who initially rented the unit and the landlord didnâ€™t approve this personâ€™s tenancy')
      ],
      link: 'https://sanfrancisco-policies.glitch.me/',
      credit: t('Tenants Together / Urban Displacement Project')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'pay-relocation-assistance',
      question: t('What triggers the obligation to pay relocation assistance?'),
      answer: [
        t('Owner/relative move-in (unless tenant is elderly or disabled, then not justified)'),
        t('Demolition / removal from rental market'),
        t('Temporary removal from rental market for capital improvements'),
        t('Substantial rehabilitation')
      ],
      link: 'https://sanfrancisco-policies.glitch.me/',
      credit: t('Tenants Together / Urban Displacement Project')
    }
  ]

  const terms = [
    {
      siteId: 'apn',
      term: t('APN'),
      definition: t(`APN is the assessor's parcel number - 
        a number assigned to property parcels by 
        the tax assessor of a particular jurisdiction 
        for identification and record-keeping. The 
        assigned number is unique within the 
        particular jurisdiction.`),
      link: 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assessor%27s_parcel_number',
      credit: t('Wikipedia')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'assessors-office',
      term: t('Assessors Office'),
      definition: t(`Tax assessment, or assessment, is the job of 
        determining the value, and sometimes determining the 
        use, of property, usually to calculate a property tax. 
        This is usually done by an office called the assessor 
        or tax assessor.`),
      link: 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tax_assessment',
      credit: t('Wikipedia')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'buyouts',
      term: t('Buyouts'),
      definition: t(`Buyouts are often offered to tenants as 
        ways to leave, recieve some funding, and not formally 
        be evicted. However, most tenants donâ€™t understand their 
        rights to stay and when the buyout is coupled with threats 
        to evict, tenants are often intimidated into taking the buyout. 
        Lately buyouts have been on the rise as a means of 
        informally evicting tenants.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/buyouts/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'capital-improvement-pass',
      term: t('Capital Improvement and Passthroughs'),
      definition: t(`For certain types of rent increases, landlords must file 
        a petition at the Rent Board before serving the tenants with a notice of 
        the increase. The tenants are not required to pay the increase until the 
        Rent Board approves it, but if approved, the rent increase will be retroactive 
        to the effective date specified in a valid notice of increase.There are six 
        types of rent increases that require the filing of a landlord petition. These are: 
        Capital Improvement Passthrough; Operating and Maintenance Expense Increase; Special 
        Circumstances Increase Based on Rents for Comparable Units;
        Rent Increase Based on the Past Rent History of a Proposition I Affected Unit; 
        Utility Passthrough (requires the filing of either a petition or a worksheet); 
        and Rules and Regulations Section 1.21 Increase where there is no Tenant in Occupancy`),
      link: 'https://sfrb.org/fact-sheet-5-landlord-petitions-and-passthroughs',
      credit: t('SF Rent Board')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'condos-tic-conversions',
      term: t('Condos and TIC Conversions'),
      definition: t(`TICs (Tenancies In Common) are usually the first step for removing housing 
        from rent control to create owner-occupied housing for the profit of real estate investors. 
        TICs are joint ownership of a building where each owner has a side agreement to only
        occupy a single unit although the owners have joint liability and usually a shared mortgage.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/newtic/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'eligible-units',
      term: t('Eligible Units'),
      definition: t(`Housing Choice Voucher Program
        Over-FMR Tenancy program 
        Section 8
        Federal LIHTC (when a tenantâ€™s occupancy of unit began before LIHTC regulatory agreement was recorded, 
        and rent is not controlled by City agencies)
        Any unit where a qualifying tenant has been in possession of the unit since 1/19/2007ADUs (accessory dwelling unit)`),
      link: 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/13UjOKg07X-GP2AETMKcXqBDUCwJ_dvsLZzzvLkLCj1E/edit#gid=0',
      credit: t('Tenants Together / Urban Displacement Project')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'ellis-act-ecivtions',
      term: t('Ellis Act Evictions'),
      definition: t(`The â€œEllis Actâ€ is a state law which says that landlords have the unconditional 
        right to evict tenants to â€œgo out of business.â€ For an Ellis eviction, the landlord must remove 
        all of the units in the building from the rental market, i.e., the landlord must evict all 
        the tenants and cannot single out one tenant (for example, with low rent) and/or remove just 
        one unit out of several from the rental market. The Ellis Act is included in the just causes 
        for eviction under the Rent Ordinance as Section 37.9(a)13).`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/ellis/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'estoppel-agreement',
      term: t('Estoppel Agreement'),
      definition: t(`When a building is for sale, the realtor often gives tenants an â€œestoppel agreementâ€ or 
      â€œrental questionnaireâ€ to sign. The landlord is seeking information in this form to tie your down 
        to what you understand your rental agreement means. You do not have to fill out or sign this form 
        unless your rental agreement requires that you fill out any estoppel agreements or similar requests; 
        it is for the landlordâ€™s convenience. Any statements you agree to (explicitly or through omission) may 
        come back to haunt you later.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/sale/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'evictor',
      term: t('Evictor'),
      definition: t('An entity or corporation taking legal action to remove someone from occupying a building and/or their home. We recognize that evictions also take place through unofficial and nonlegal means, also by evictors. In this tool, however, we are only looking at formal evictions.'),
      link: 'https://antievictionmap.com/',
      credit: t('Anti-Eviction Mapping Project')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'exempt-eligibility',
      term: t('Exemptions from Eligibility'),
      definition: t(`Rental units located in a structure for which a certificate of occupancy was first issued 
        after the effective date of this ordinance (6/13/1979)
        Unit where substantial rehabilitation was undertaken after effective date of this ordinance
        Units exempted from rent stabilization by Costa-Hawkins: single family homes`),
      link: 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/13UjOKg07X-GP2AETMKcXqBDUCwJ_dvsLZzzvLkLCj1E/edit#gid=0',
      credit: t('Tenants Together / Urban Displacement Project')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'habitability-repairs',
      term: t('Habitability and Repairs'),
      definition: t(`Tenants have the right to safe and habitable homes in exchange for the rents we are paying. 
        If your landlord is not making repairs, he or she is violating your â€œWarranty of Habitabilityâ€ and you 
        have the right to have repairs made. Tenants have the right to report landlords to city agencies and 
        rights to withhold rent or â€œrepair and deduct.â€ And the landlord cannot retaliate against you; any 
        eviction or rent increase attempt within six months of such a complaint will be examined by the judge 
        for retaliation.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/repairs/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'harassment',
      term: t('Harassment'),
      definition: t(`Your landlord, or anyone acting for your landlord, cannot harass you out of your home. 
        Landlords cannot evict you by just locking you out, shutting off your utilities, forcibly entering 
        your home without notice, or removing your belongings.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/harass/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'just-cause-fault-eviction',
      term: t('Just Cause / Fault Eviction'),
      definition: t(`For rent-controlled units, the landlord must have honest intent, without ulterior motive 
        (e.g., a motive of raising the rent) to evict the tenant with â€œjust cause.â€ Below are the just causes 
        summarized; for the legal wording get the rent control ordinance and see Section 37.9(a). 
        If done properly, the landlord may evict for these just causes. (The landlord may also evict without 
        a just cause under rent control if the landlord shares the rental unit with the tenant.) However, 
        many of these eviction attempts are done improperly and may be successfully defended. Talk to a 
        counselor and/or get our handbook to find out your defenses.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/justcauses/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'llc',
      term: t('LLC'),
      definition: t(`A limited liability company (LLC) is the US-specific form of a private limited company. 
        It is a business structure that can combine the pass-through taxation of a partnership or sole 
        proprietorship with the limited liability of a corporation. An LLC is not a corporation under state law;
