        it is a legal form of a company that provides limited liability to its owners in many jurisdictions. 
        LLCs are well known for the flexibility that they provide to business owners; depending on the situation, 
        an LLC may elect to use corporate tax rules instead of being treated as a partnership and, under certain 
        circumstances, LLCs may be organized as not-for-profit. Many landlords and speculators use LLCs as shell 
        companies to buy properties and evict tenants. This provides them anonymity and protection.`),
      link: 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limited_liability_company',
      credit: t('Wikipedia')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'mergers-demolitions',
      term: t('Mergers and Demolitions'),
      definition: t(`Mergers and demolition evictions should be done under eviction just cause 37.9(a)(10) if the rental 
        unit is covered under the San Francisco Rent Ordinance and is a single unit. Developments may be able to demolish 
        multiple units under just cause 37.9(a)(15). Just cause 37.9(a)(15) has been used to evict many tenants in developments 
        such as Trinity Properties and Park Merced. Other evictions are anticipated using this just cause unless the law is changed. 
        It is particularly important in these cases of demolition of multiple units to organize as tenants.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/merger/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'omi-evictions',
      term: t('Owner Move In (OMI) Evictions'),
      definition: t(`For rent-controlled units, one of the most common evictions in San Francisco is for owner or relative move-in 
        (San Francisco Administrative Code Section 37.9(a)(8)). Subject to certain restrictions,a landlord can evict a tenant if 
        the landlord is going to move into the unit to live, or (only if the landlord is also going to be living in the building) 
        for a close relative to move in and live there. These evictions are highly abused and landlords who want to evict a tenant 
        in order to raise the rent on a new tenant typically use owner move-in evictions (OMIs/landlord move-in evictions/LMIs) that 
        are only allowed if done properly.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/omi/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'rent-control',
      term: t('Rent Control'),
      definition: t(`In San Francisco, most residential tenants are covered by rent control. This means rents can only be raised by certain 
        amounts per year and the tenant can only be evicted for â€œjust causes.â€ In addition, some rental units have restrictions on how much 
        the landlord can charge the new tenant due to previous evictions. Tenants who do not have rent control can have their rent increased 
        by any amount at any time with a proper written notice.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/rent-control/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteid: 'sale-of-building',
      term: t('Sale of Building'),
      definition: t(`All agreements (such as written and oral month-to-month or lease agreements) you made with the old landlord are binding on the new 
        landlord. Similarly, the new landlord is bound to any legal orders or judgments: if the Department of Building Inspection ordered the old 
        landlord to make repairs, the new landlord must make those repairs; if the Rent Board has ordered rents reduced, the new landlord must follow 
        this order. The seller and buyer of a multi-unit building covered under the San Francisco Rent Ordinance must disclose to tenants (in writing) 
        that they cannot be evicted, have their rent increased, or have the terms of their tenancy changed just because the building is being sold or has sold. 
        Beware, though, many landlords try to use the sale or foreclosure of a building to intimidate tenants.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/sale/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    },
    {
      siteId: 'short-term-rentals',
      term: t('Short Term Rentals'),
      definition: t(`Short term vacation rentals replace long term housing stock in San Francisco and in cities across the world. In San Franicsco, 
        Airbnb has reduced vacant rental housing stock by as much as 43 percent, making homes even less affordable. At times, tenants are illegally 
        evicted and their rooms become Airbnb units.`),
      link: 'https://www.sftu.org/short-term-rentals/',
      credit: t('SF Tenants Union')
    }
  ]

  const handleChange = panel => (event, isExpanded) =>
    setExpanded(isExpanded ? panel : false)

  return (
    <Row justify='center'>
      <Col xs={10} sm={8} md={6}>
        <PageTitle text={t('Glossary')} />
        {terms.map((term,index) =>
          <Accordion
            expanded={expanded === 'panel' + index}
            key={index}
            onChange={handleChange('panel' + index)}>
            <AccordionSummary
              expandIcon={<ExpandMoreIcon />}
              aria-controls="panel1bh-content"
              id="panel1bh-header"
            >
              <Typography variant='body2'>{term.term}</Typography>
            </AccordionSummary>
            <AccordionDetails style={{display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column'}}>
              <Typography variant='body2'>
                {term.definition}
              </Typography>
              <Typography variant='body2' style={{marginTop: 20}}>
                {t('Source:')}&nbsp;
                <Link target='_blank' href={term.link} style={{
                  color: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
                  backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.white
                }}>{term.credit}</Link>
              </Typography>
            </AccordionDetails>
          </Accordion>
        )}
        {questions.map(question =>
          <Accordion
            expanded={expanded === 'panel' + question.siteId}
            key={question.siteId}
            onChange={handleChange('panel' + question.siteId)}>
            <AccordionSummary
              expandIcon={<ExpandMoreIcon />}
              aria-controls="panel1bh-content"
              id="panel1bh-header"
            >
              <Typography variant='body2'>{question.question}</Typography>
            </AccordionSummary>
            <AccordionDetails style={{display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column'}}>
              {question.answer.map((point,index) =>
                <ListItem button key={index}>
                  <Typography variant='body2'>{point}</Typography>
                </ListItem>
              )}
              <Typography style={{marginTop: 20}} variant='body2'>
                {t('Source:')}&nbsp;
                <Link target='_blank' href={question.link} style={{
                  color: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
                  backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.white
                }}>
                  {question.credit}
                </Link>
              </Typography>
            </AccordionDetails>
          </Accordion>
        )}
      </Col>
    </Row>
  )
}

export default Glossary

ui/src/pages/Home.js

import React, { memo } from 'react'
import { ReactComponent as HomeIcon } from '../images/home.svg'
import { ReactComponent as RentIcon } from '../images/rent.svg'
import { ReactComponent as BalanceIcon } from '../images/balance.svg'
import Typography from '@material-ui/core/Typography'
import { useTheme } from '@material-ui/core/styles'
import { Row, Col } from '../components/Grid'
import SearchBar from '../components/DataSearchBar/SearchBar'
import useStyles from '../theme/HomeStyles'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../i18n'

const DisplayItem = ({ displayString1, displayString2, index }) => {

  const theme = useTheme()
  const classes = useStyles(theme)

  if (displayString1 && displayString2) {

    return (
      <Col sm={12} md={3} lg={3} className={classes.colStyle} index={index}>
        <Row justify="center">
          {index === 0 ? <HomeIcon className={classes.iconStyle} />
            : index === 1 ? <RentIcon className={classes.iconStyle} />
              : index === 2 ? <BalanceIcon className={classes.iconStyle} />
                : null}
        </Row>
        <Row justify="center">
          <Typography className={classes.subHeading}>
            {displayString1}
          </Typography>
        </Row>
        <Row justify="center">
          <Typography className={classes.columnText}>
            {displayString2}
          </Typography>
        </Row>
      </Col>
    )} else {
    return null
  }
}



const Home = () => {

  const theme = useTheme()
  const classes = useStyles(theme)
  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Home', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )

  if (!translationReady) return null

  const displayItemText = [
    [t('Should I rent from this landlord?'), t('Find out about a building and an owner\'s history')],
    [t('Who really owns my building?'), t('Is it the person you give your check to every month, or a large network of corporations?')],
  ]
  
  return (
    <>
      <div className={classes.intro}>

        <div>
          <SearchBar 
            location="home"
            helperText={t('Enter an address, business, landlord, or neighborhood view to see the connections we\'ve found')} />
        </div>
      </div>
      
      <div className={classes.infoStyle}>
        <Row justify="space-around" align="center" nowrap="true">
          {displayItemText.map((e,i) => 
            <DisplayItem displayString1={e[0]} displayString2={e[1]} index={i} key={e[0] + i} />
          )}
        </Row>
      </div>
    </>
  )
}

export default memo(Home)

ui/src/pages/Methodology.js

import React, { memo } from 'react'
import graph from '../images/methodology-graph.png'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../i18n'
import { Row, Col } from '../components/Grid'
import PageTitle from '../components/PageTitle'
import Typography from '@material-ui/core/Typography'
import Accordion from '@material-ui/core/Accordion'
import AccordionSummary from '@material-ui/core/AccordionSummary'
import AccordionDetails from '@material-ui/core/AccordionDetails'
import ExpandMoreIcon from '@material-ui/icons/ExpandMore'
import ListItem from '@material-ui/core/ListItem'
import Table from '@material-ui/core/Table'
import TableBody from '@material-ui/core/TableBody'
import TableCell from '@material-ui/core/TableCell'
import TableContainer from '@material-ui/core/TableContainer'
import TableHead from '@material-ui/core/TableHead'
import TableRow from '@material-ui/core/TableRow'
import Paper from '@material-ui/core/Paper'
import DataPage, { sliceJson } from '../components/DataPage/DataPage'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import { reformatDate } from '../utils/stringUtils'

const Methodology = () => {

  const evictionSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson('methodology-about-evictions'))
  const assessorSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson('methodology-about-assessor'))
  const businessSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson('methodology-about-business'))

  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Methodology', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )

  if (!translationReady) return null

  const dataSources = [
    {
      source: assessorSourceData.source_name,
      description: t('A list of parcels, addresses, and current parcel owners'),
      retrieved: reformatDate(assessorSourceData.date_exported)
    },
    {
      source: businessSourceData.source_name,
      description: t('A list of all registered LLC and LPâ€™s and corporations in California, along with their officers, owners, and mailing addresses'),
      retrieved: reformatDate(businessSourceData.date_exported)
    },
    {
      source: evictionSourceData.source_name,
      description: t('Ellis Act eviction data, buyout data, and all eviction notices'),
      retrieved: reformatDate(evictionSourceData.date_exported)
    },
  ]

  const quirks = [
    {
      title: t('Our search feature may not list a property you are interested in.'),
      info: [
        '', //left intentionally blank for list styling
        t('Sometimes the data we use for property information lists a range of addresses for a single property. E.g. if you are looking for 102 Main St and the property in our database is recorded as â€œ100-104 Main St, it may not show up when you search. If you donâ€™t find your property, try searching adjacent properties.'),
        t('Sometimes properties located on corner lots will have units that are listed on several different cross streets. Because the property is only recorded in our database using one of the cross streets, it may be difficult to find on the EvictorBook.'),
        t('Our database contains all properties that are either currently residential properties or ones that have had an eviction recorded at them in the past.')
      ]
    },
    {
      title: t('Our search feature may not list a business you are interested in.'),
      info: [ t('Our database contains businesses that are highly linked to the properties that they own. Often, to avoid creating connections between unrelated businesses, we have to remove businesses from the corporate networks that are not tightly connected to the network. For example, any company that is a property owner, or an evictor, or listed at the same address as the mailing address for a property, will all be in the database. However, businesses more distantly related might not be in the database. We recommend searching a property to find businesses in the network that are on the EvictorBook.') ]
    },
    {
      title: t('Looking up the name of a person associated with an eviction and not their business entity.'),
      info: [ t('For now, you can only look up their business entity. For instance, you might know that Yat-Pang Au is the CEO and person associated with Veritas (San Franciscoâ€™s biggest landlord), but currently you have to search for Veritas or one of Vertitasâ€™s LLCs and not Yat-Pang Au himself.') ]
    },
    {
      title: t('The owner percentages on the property pages may not add up to 100%.'),
      info: [ t('Our source data currently only lists one owner for each property, even when it is likely that multiple owners exist.') ]
    },
    {
      title: t('Some identical evictions are listed on multiple different properties, and some have either no or multiple evictors.'),
      info: [ t('Sometimes there are multiple possible properties that correspond to the address listed on the eviction, and sometimes we find multiple evictors for an eviction record, or none at all. Overall we are able to find evictors for more than 90% of the eviction records.') ]
    },
    {
      title: t('A business you are looking for may have different information than you were expecting.'),
      info: [ t('Sometimes businesses have multiple records attached to them, if they are filed, cancelled, and then later refiled. We use the information from either the active record, or if there are none, the most recently filed inactive record.') ]
    },
    {
      title: t('Some evictors and property owners appear to be businesses, but are not linked to a business page, or addresses that are listed separately but look like the same. '),
      info: [ t('All of the records we use are quite messy, often with spelling errors from when the records were manually entered. We attempt to clean up these errors, but sometimes the errors are so strange that we cannot connect the records together.') ]
    },
    {
      title: t('The evictor assigned to an eviction may be different than you expected.'),
      info: [ t('We determine the evictor for each eviction by searching the property owner at the time of the eviction from sales transfer records. Often this results in the correct owner, but because there are sometimes multiple transactions (e.g. between different trusts) that donâ€™t represent transfers between different people, the evictor might look a bit strange.') ]
    },
    {
      title: t('A property may be part of multiple possible ownership networks.'),
      info: [ t('Our method to connect properties into ownership networks relies on owner mailing address lookups. Sometimes office buildings will have offices with different real estate companies. While we are able to distinguish between these companies, when we look up properties using a mailing address at those buildings, because of recording differences between our source data, we have to assume that the properties could be part of any of those companies.') ]
    },
    {
      title: t('The related parcels list may be smaller or longer than you expected.'),
      info: [ t('We are constantly learning more about these corporate ownership networks and improving our connection methods. We attempted to tune our method to be able to reproduce many large, widely known, corporate owner networks. However, because of the way that shell companies, investors, management companies, and even insurance companies, operate, unexpected connections sometimes appear. If you see something unexpected or simply wrong, please let us know!') ]
    },
  ]

  const connections = [
    {
      title: t('Connecting Properties and Business Entities'),
      info: [
        t('Properties are connected to business entities in one of two ways:'),
        t('The property owner (as obtained from either the County Assessor officer, for current ownership, or sales transfer records, for past ownership) shares the same name as a business entity that is registered with the state, or'),
        t('The property ownerâ€™s mailing address is listed at the same or similar address unit as a business entity is.')
      ]
    },
    {
      title: t('Connecting Properties, Evictions and Evictors'),
      info: [
        t('We connect each eviction to the propertie(s) on which they occurred by matching on the address provided in the eviction record. For evictions that cannot be merged using the address exactly (e.g. for corner lots that use different street names, or for currently non-existent addresses), we grab the longitude and latitude of the address and match it to the closest existing parcel.'),
        t('Since the eviction records do not list the evictor, we then match the eviction to the property owner at the time of eviction from sales transfer records. We consider that property owner the likely evictor.'),
        t('Because we sometimes find multiple address matches or multiple sales matches, we may be unable to connect each eviction to a single property and single evictor with 100% confidence. In these cases, we notify the user that these are not confident links.')
      ]
    },
    {
      title: t('Determining Connections between Business Entities'),
      info: [
        t('When businesses file with the Secretary of State, they list both addresses, â€œofficersâ€ (partners for LPâ€™s or CEOs for corporations), and owners. These â€œofficersâ€ and owners can either be individuals or other business entities. Thus, we create connections between businesses when:'),
        t('businesses share the same officer or owner, or'),
        t('businesses list one another as an officer or owner.'),
        t('These connections allow us to create â€œproperty owner networks.â€ Each property owner network is a group of interconnected properties, property owners, corporate entities, corporate owners, and evictors. Property owners and evictors could be business entities themselves. Each network is formed by entities that are connected by relationships as defined in the image above.')
      ]
    }
  ]

  return (
    <Row justify='center'>
      <Col xs={10} sm={8} md={6}>
        <DataPage fetch={[
          { slice: 'methodology-about-evictions', url: 'api/about/eviction'},
          { slice: 'methodology-about-assessor', url: 'api/about/assessor'},
          { slice: 'methodology-about-business', url: 'api/about/business'},
        ]} isDebugEnabled={false}>
          <PageTitle text={t('Methodology')} />
          <Typography variant='h2'>{t('Data Sources')}</Typography>
          <Typography variant='body1'>
            {t('If you believe any information provided is inaccurate, please contact us through the feedback form and specifically explain the basis of your request for correction or deletion.')}
          </Typography>
          <TableContainer component={Paper} style={{marginTop: 20}}>
            <Table aria-label='data sources' size='small'>
              <TableHead>
                <TableRow>
                  <TableCell align='left'>Source</TableCell>
                  <TableCell align='left'>Description</TableCell>
                  <TableCell align='left'>Last Retrieved</TableCell>
                </TableRow>
              </TableHead>
              <TableBody>
                
                {dataSources.map((row) => (
                  <TableRow key={row.source}>
                    <TableCell align='left'>{row.source}</TableCell>
                    <TableCell align='left'>{row.description}</TableCell>
                    <TableCell align='left'>{row.retrieved}</TableCell>
                  </TableRow>
                ))}
              </TableBody>
            </Table>
          </TableContainer>
          <Typography variant='h2'>{t('Connections')}</Typography>
          <Typography variant='body1'>
            {t('We connect the data from the sources above into a graph network that reveals the connections between properties, property owners, evictors, and business entities.')}
          </Typography>
          &nbsp;
          <div style={{ textAlign: 'center', marginBottom: 20 }}>
            <img src={graph} alt={t('Graph Diagram')}  />
          </div>

          {connections.map(connection =>
            <Accordion key={connection.title}>
              <AccordionSummary
                expandIcon={<ExpandMoreIcon />}
                aria-controls="panel2a-content"
                id="panel2a-header"
              >
                <Typography variant='body2'>{connection.title}</Typography>
              </AccordionSummary>
              <AccordionDetails style={{display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column'}}>
                {connection.info.map((point, index) =>
                  <ListItem button key={index}>
                    <Typography variant='body2' key={'connections' + index}>
                      {point}
                    </Typography>
                  </ListItem>
                )}
              </AccordionDetails>
            </Accordion>
          )}
          <Typography variant='h2'>{t('Common Issues & Quirks')}</Typography>
          <Typography variant='body1' style={{marginBottom: 20}}>
            {t('While we do our best to ensure that the data and connections shown on this site are as accurate as possible, and we will continue to improve our methods, there are limitations that you should be aware of. We encourage you, where possible, to verify findings on this site using other data sources as well.')}
          </Typography>

          {quirks.map(quirk =>
            <Accordion key={quirk.title}>
              <AccordionSummary
                expandIcon={<ExpandMoreIcon />}
                aria-controls="panel2a-content"
                id="panel2a-header">
                <Typography variant='body2'>{quirk.title}</Typography>
              </AccordionSummary>
              <AccordionDetails style={{display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column'}}>
                {quirk.info.map((point, index) =>
                  <ListItem button key={index}>
                    <Typography variant='body2' key={'quirks' + index}>
                      {point}
                    </Typography>
                  </ListItem>
                )}
              </AccordionDetails>
            </Accordion>
          )}
        </DataPage>
      </Col>
    </Row>
  )
}

export default memo(Methodology)

ui/src/pages/NetworkPage.js

import React, {useState, useEffect} from 'react'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import { Typography } from '@material-ui/core'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import DataPage, { sliceJson, urlParam } from '../components/DataPage/DataPage'
import Data from '../components/Data/Data'
import DataTable from '../components/DataTable/DataTable'
import { Row, Col } from '../components/Grid'
import { commaSeparatedBolded } from '../utils/dataUtils'
import NetworkList from '../components/NetworkList'
import PropertyList from '../components/PropertyList'
import PageTitle from '../components/PageTitle'
import i18n from '../i18n'
import D3Graph from '../components/Graph/D3Graph'
import { renderOwnerLink } from '../utils/tableUtils'
import { reformatDate } from '../utils/stringUtils'

/*
  NetworkPage: presents content for an ownership network and its connections
*/ 

const NetworkPage = () => {

  const networkId = urlParam('id')

  const businessSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson(`${networkId}-about-business`))
  const businessSourceText = businessSourceData.source_name +
    ' (as of ' + reformatDate(businessSourceData.date_exported) + ')'
  const assessorSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson(`${networkId}-about-assessor`))
  const assessorSourceText = assessorSourceData.source_name +
    ' (as of ' + reformatDate(assessorSourceData.date_exported) + ')'
 
  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Network', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )


  const details = useSelector(sliceJson(`${networkId}-details`))

  const [shouldGetGraph, setShouldGetGraph] = useState(false)
  useEffect(() => {
    if(details.total_bes < 500) setShouldGetGraph(true)
  }, [details])
  const graph = useSelector(sliceJson(`${networkId}-graph`))

  if (!translationReady) return null

  const NetworkDetails = () => {

    const networkNodes = useSelector(sliceJson(`${networkId}-nodes`))

    const nodeTableData = Object.assign([], networkNodes?.map(x => ({
      name: x.name,
      type: x.type,
      type_readable: x.type_readable
    })))

    return (
      <>
        <Typography variant='h2'>
          {t('Businesses, People, and Addresses in this Ownership Network')}
        </Typography>
        <Typography variant='body1'>
          {t('In total, there are {{numBusinesses}} businesses, {{numOwners}} business owners and {{numAddresses}} business or property owner addresses in this ownership network.', {
            numBusinesses: details.total_bes,
            numOwners: details.total_owners,
            numAddresses: details.total_addrs
          })}
        </Typography>
        <DataTable
          rows={nodeTableData}
          columns = {[
            { field: 'name', headerName: 'Name', flex: 3, renderCell: p =>
              renderOwnerLink(p.row.name, p.row.type)
            },
            { field: 'type_readable', headerName: 'Type', flex: 1.5},
          ]}
          title={t('Ownership Network')}
          isDebugEnabled={false}
          aboutData={{
            source: businessSourceText,
            href: '/methodology',
            notes: t('Due to inexact name matches, some businesses may be listed as business owners')
          }}
          noDataMessage={t('Ownership network data not found')}
          sortModel={[
            { field: 'entity', sort: 'asc' },
            { field: 'type', sort: 'asc' }
          ]}
          paginationPageSize={10}
          csvFileName={t('Businesses, People, and Addresses in this Ownership Network with ID {{networkId}}',
            { networkId: networkId })}
        />
      </>
    )

  }

  const PropertyPortfolio = () => {
    return (
      <>
        <PropertyList
          portfolioSlice={`${networkId}-portfolio`}
          title={t('Property Portfolio')}
          subTitle={
            <>
              {t('We have determined that the following buildings may be owned by this ownership network.')}
            </>
          }
          noDataMessage={t('No portfolio properties found for this parcel.')}
          aboutData={{
            source: assessorSourceText,
            href: '/methodology',
            notes: ( 
              t('Property portfolios are created by identifying properties with the') +
              t('same mailing address(es). We associate properties with business ownership ') +
              t('networks through either the name listed as the property owner (if it is a ') +
              t('business) and through the property mailing addresses that are also business ') +
              t('office addresses. Some business networks have multiple addresses. In counting ') +
              t('the number of evictions for a property, Ellis Act evictions are counted as ') +
              t('separate evictions for each unit.')
            )
          }}
          paginationPageSize={5}
          csvFileName={t('Properties for Ownership Network with ID {{networkId}}',
            { networkId: networkId })}
        />
      </>
    )
  }

  return (
    <Row>
      <Col xs={12}>
        <DataPage fetch={[
          { slice: `${networkId}-details`, url: `api/network/${networkId}/details`},
          { slice: `${networkId}-portfolio`, url: `api/network/${networkId}/portfolio`},
          { slice: `${networkId}-network`, url: `api/network/${networkId}/relatedNetworks`},
          { slice: `${networkId}-nodes`, url: `api/network/${networkId}/nodes`,
            select: j => j.nodes},
          { slice: `${networkId}-about-assessor`, url: 'api/about/assessor'},
          { slice: `${networkId}-about-business`, url: 'api/about/business'}
        ]} isDebugEnabled={false}>
          <Row justify='center'>
            <Col xs={10} sm={8}>
              <PageTitle text={t('Ownership Network')} />
              <Typography variant='body1'>
                {t('Containing')}{' '}
                {commaSeparatedBolded([
                  details.top_owner,
                  details.top_be?.name_norm,
                  details.top_addr
                ])}{'.'}
              </Typography>
              <Typography variant='h2'>{t('Network Connections')}</Typography>
              { // conditionally render the graph and show an alternative message if it's not rendered
                //    using a second <Data /> component here to avoid loading the things in <DataPage /> twice
                shouldGetGraph ?
                  <>
                    <Data fetch={[{ slice: `${networkId}-graph`, url: `api/network/${networkId}/graph`}]}/>
                    <Typography variant='body1'>
                      {t('Below is the full set of network connections within this ownership network.') }
                    </Typography>
                    <br/>
                    <D3Graph graph={graph} /> 
                  </> :
                  <Typography variant='body1'>
                    {t('Large ownership networks are currently unable to be shown.')}
                  </Typography>
              }
              <NetworkDetails/>
              <PropertyPortfolio />
              <NetworkList
                slice={`${networkId}-network`}
                noDataMessage={t('No related networks found.')}
              />
            </Col>
          </Row>
        </DataPage>
      </Col>
    </Row>
  )

}

export default NetworkPage

ui/src/pages/OwnerPage.js

import React, { useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import { Typography } from '@material-ui/core'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import { InfoBox } from '../components/DataMap/Overlays/InfoBox'
import PageTitle from '../components/PageTitle'
import DataPage, { isNull, isEmpty, sliceJson, urlParam }
  from '../components/DataPage/DataPage'
import DataMap from '../components/DataMap/DataMap'
import Overlay from '../components/DataMap/Overlays/Overlay'
import { reformatDate, titleCase } from '../utils/stringUtils'
import { commaSeparatedText } from '../utils/dataUtils'
import { ReactComponent as RelatedParcelIcon }
  from '../components/DataMap/Map/map_icons/related-parcel-icon.svg'
import { ReactComponent as EvictionIcon }
  from '../components/DataMap/Map/map_icons/directly-evicted-icon.svg'
import { Row, Col } from '../components/Grid'
import NetworkList from '../components/NetworkList'
import EvictionList from '../components/EvictionList'
import PropertyList from '../components/PropertyList'
import Legend from '../components/DataMap/Overlays/Legend'
import i18n from '../i18n'
import { beStatusIndefiniteArticle } from '../utils/dataUtils'
import OwnershipNetwork from '../components/OwnershipNetwork'

/*
  OwnerPage: presents content for a property owner
*/ 

const Owner = () => {

  const search = urlParam('search')
  const beType = urlParam('be') // either 'lp' or 'corp'
  const evictionSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson(`${search}-about-evictions`))
  const evictionSourceText = evictionSourceData.source_name +
    ' (as of ' + reformatDate(evictionSourceData.date_exported) + ')'
  const assessorSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson(`${search}-about-assessor`))
  const assessorSourceText = assessorSourceData.source_name +
    ' (as of ' + reformatDate(assessorSourceData.date_exported) + ')'

  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Owner', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )
  
  if (!translationReady) return null

  const OwnerMap = () => {
    
    const details = useSelector(sliceJson(`${search}-details`))
    const evictions = useSelector(sliceJson(`${search}-evictions`))
    const portfolio = useSelector(sliceJson(`${search}-portfolio`))

    /* setting the initial value for selectedParcel as the owner makes the infobox display the owner information on load */ 
    const [selectedParcel, setSelectedParcel] = useState(details)

    /* Map data includes evictions by the same owner as well as properties 
       owned by the same owner. The type property is used by downstream
       code to set the icon. */
    const mapData = useMemo(() => {
      const evictionList = isEmpty(evictions)
        ? [] : evictions.filter(x => !isNull(x.location.lat))
      const propertyList = isEmpty(portfolio)
        ? [] : portfolio.filter(x => !isNull(x.lat))
      const ownerProperty = {...details, type: 'Parcel'}
      let data = [...evictionList, ...propertyList]
      if (!isNull(ownerProperty.lat)) data = data.concat(ownerProperty)
      return data
    }
    // eslint-disable-next-line
    , [evictions])
    if (isEmpty(mapData)) return null

    return (
      <DataMap markers={mapData} isDebugEnabled={false}
        overlays={[
          <Overlay position='bottomright'>
            <Legend
              title={t('Legend')}
              items={[
                { icon: <EvictionIcon/>, label: t('Eviction') },
                { icon: <RelatedParcelIcon/>, label: t('Property') }
              ]}
            />
          </Overlay>,
          <Overlay position='topleft'>
            <InfoBox
              selectedMarker={selectedParcel}
              directions={t('Click an eviction or property on the map for details')
              }
            />
          </Overlay>
        ]}
        onSelect={marker => setSelectedParcel(marker)}
        renderMarkerHover={marker => 
          <Typography variant='body1'>{titleCase(marker.addr)}</Typography>
        }
      />
    )
  }

  const OwnerDetails = () => {

    const details = useSelector(sliceJson(`${search}-details`))
    if (isNull(details)) return null
    const addresses = details.office_addresses
    const status = details.status
    const jurisdiction = details.be_specific_details?.jurisdiction
    const name = titleCase(details.name)
    const date = reformatDate(details.creation_date)

    return (
      <>
        <Typography variant='h2'>{t('About the Business')}
        </Typography>
        <Typography variant='body1'>
          <strong>{name}</strong>
          {
            beType === 'lp'
              ? t(' is {{article}} {{status}} Limited Partnership, first registered {{date}} in {{jurisdiction}}, located at {{addresses}}.', {
                article: beStatusIndefiniteArticle(status),
                status: status,
                date: date,
                jurisdiction: jurisdiction,
                addresses: commaSeparatedText(addresses) ||
                  'an address not in our records'
              })
              : t(' is {{article}} {{status}} corporation first registered {{date}}, located at {{addresses}}.', {
                article: beStatusIndefiniteArticle(status),
                status: status,
                date: date,
                addresses: commaSeparatedText(addresses) ||
                  'an address not in our records'
              })
          }
        </Typography> 
      </>
    )
  }

  const PropertySection = () => {

    const details = useSelector(sliceJson(`${search}-details`))
    if (isNull(details)) return null
    const name = titleCase(details.name)

    return (
      <PropertyList
        portfolioSlice={`${search}-portfolio`}
        title={t('Property Portfolio')}
        subTitle={
          <>
            {t('The following buildings may be part of the same ownership network as ')}
            <strong>{name}</strong>{'.'}
          </>
        }
        noDataMessage={t('No portfolio properties found for this parcel.')}
        aboutData={{
          source: assessorSourceText,
          href: '/methodology',
          notes: ( 
            t('Property portfolios are created by identifying properties with the') +
            t('same mailing address(es). We associate properties with business ownership ') +
            t('networks through either the name listed as the property owner (if it is a ') +
            t('business) and through the property mailing addresses that are also business ') +
            t('office addresses. Some business networks have multiple addresses. In counting ') +
            t('the number of evictions for a property, Ellis Act evictions are counted as ') +
            t('separate evictions for each unit.')
          )
        }}
        paginationPageSize={5}
        csvFileName={t('Properties in the portfolio of Owner {{owner}}',
          { owner: search })}
      />
    )
  
  }

  return (
    <div>
      <Row>
        <Col xs={12}>
          {/* The API should flatten the roots for details -> parcel_details and owners -> owners */}
          <DataPage fetch={[
            { slice: `${search}-details`, url: `api/owner/${beType}/${search}/details` },
            { slice: `${search}-evictions`, url: `api/owner/${beType}/${search}/evictions`},
            { slice: `${search}-network-details`, url: `api/owner/${beType}/${search}/networkDetails`},
            { slice: `${search}-network`, url: `api/owner/${beType}/${search}/relatedNetworks`},
            { slice: `${search}-portfolio`, url: `api/owner/${beType}/${search}/portfolio`,
              select: j => j.property_portfolio },
            { slice: `${search}-about-evictions`, url: 'api/about/eviction'},
            { slice: `${search}-about-assessor`, url: 'api/about/assessor'},
          ]} isDebugEnabled={false}>
            <OwnerMap/>
            <Row justify='center'>
              <Col xs={10} sm={8}>
                <PageTitle text={t('Owner Details for ') + titleCase(search)}/>
                <OwnerDetails/>
                <OwnershipNetwork urlParam={search}/>
                <EvictionList
                  evictionSlice={`${search}-evictions`}
                  title={t('Eviction History for this Ownership Network')}
                  subTitle={
                    t('The following evictions were conducted by businesses in the ownership network. ') +
                    t('Namely, a business in the network was the property owner at the time of the eviction. ') +
                    t('This may include properties that are no longer owned by this network.')
                  }
                  noDataMessage={t('No evictions recorded for this business.')}
                  aboutData={{
                    source: evictionSourceText,
                    href: '/methodology',
                    notes:  ( 
                      t('Eviction records generally only include the address of the eviction. ') +
                      t('Evictions were matched to parcel records and property ownership records. ') +
                      t('As a result, some evictions were matched to multiple or no properties, if an exact ') +
                      t('match could not be found. Some evictions also include names on the filing, ') +
                      t('which may be either property owners or lawyers involved in the case. For these, ') +
                      t('we have shown the name identified through property records, and the additional ') +
                      t('names are those found on the eviction filing itself.')
                    )
                  }}
                  paginationPageSize={5}
                  csvFileName={t('Known evictions for Owner {{owner}}',
                    {owner: search})}
                />
                <PropertySection/>
                <NetworkList
                  slice={`${search}-network`}
                  noDataMessage={t('No related networks found.')}
                />
              </Col>
            </Row>
          </DataPage>
        </Col>
      </Row>
    </div>
  )

}

export default Owner

ui/src/pages/ParcelPage.js

import React, { useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import { Typography } from '@material-ui/core'
import DataPage, { isNull, isEmpty, sliceJson, urlParam }
  from '../components/DataPage/DataPage'
import DataMap from '../components/DataMap/DataMap'
import { InfoBox } from '../components/DataMap/Overlays/InfoBox'
import { Row, Col } from '../components/Grid'
import { formatPropertyClass, getClassByCode } from '../utils/propertyClass'
import { reformatDate, titleCase } from '../utils/stringUtils'
import { ReactComponent as SearchedForIcon }
  from '../components/DataMap/Map/map_icons/searched-for-icon.svg'
import { ReactComponent as RelatedParcelIcon }
  from '../components/DataMap/Map/map_icons/related-parcel-icon.svg'
import Overlay from '../components/DataMap/Overlays/Overlay'
import NetworkList from '../components/NetworkList'
import EvictionList from '../components/EvictionList'
import PageTitle from '../components/PageTitle'
import PropertyList from '../components/PropertyList'
import Legend from '../components/DataMap/Overlays/Legend'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../i18n'
import Link from '@material-ui/core/Link'
import { renderOwnerLink } from '../utils/tableUtils'
import OwnershipNetwork from '../components/OwnershipNetwork'

/*
  ParcelPage: presents content for a property parcel
*/

const Parcel = () => {

  const bl = urlParam('bl')
  const evictionSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-about-evictions`))
  const evictionSourceText = evictionSourceData.source_name +
    ' (as of ' + reformatDate(evictionSourceData.date_exported) + ')'
  const assessorSourceData = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-about-assessor`))
  const assessorSourceText = assessorSourceData.source_name +
    ' (as of ' + reformatDate(assessorSourceData.date_exported) + ')'

  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Parcel', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )

  const ParcelMap = () => {

    const details = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-details`))
    const portfolio = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-portfolio`))
    /* Map data includes portfolio properties as related parcels 
       and the page's details parcel as the searched-for parcel.
       It adds a type property for downstream code to choose the icon */
    const mapData = useMemo(() => {
      const propertyList = isEmpty(portfolio)
        ? [] : portfolio
          .filter(x => !isNull(x.lat))
          .map(x => ({...x, type: 'Related Parcel'}))
      const ownerProperty = {
        ...details,
        type: 'Parcel', addr: details.addr_details?.main_addr
      }
      let data = [...propertyList]
      if (!isNull(ownerProperty.lat)) data = data.concat(ownerProperty)
      return data
    }
    // eslint-disable-next-line
    , [portfolio, details])
    /* setting the initial value for selectedParcel as the main parcel makes the infobox display the main parcel information on load */ 
    const [selectedParcel, setSelectedParcel] = useState(mapData.slice(-1).pop())

    if (isEmpty(mapData)) return null

    return (
      <DataMap markers={mapData} isDebugEnabled={false}
        overlays={[
          <Overlay position='bottomright'>
            <Legend
              title={t('Legend')}
              items={[
                { icon: <SearchedForIcon/>, label: t('This Property') },
                { icon: <RelatedParcelIcon/>, label: t('Related Properties') }
              ]}
            />
          </Overlay>,
          <Overlay position='topleft'>
            <InfoBox
              selectedMarker={selectedParcel}
              directions={t('Click a property on the map for details')}
            />
          </Overlay>
        ]}
        onSelect={marker => setSelectedParcel(marker)}
        renderMarkerHover={marker => 
          <Typography variant='body1'>{titleCase(marker.addr)}</Typography>
        }
      />
    )
  }

  const PropertyDetails = () => {

    const details = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-details`))
    const owners = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-owners`))
    const ownerList = owners?.owners
    if (isNull(details) || isNull(owners)) return null
    const propertyType = formatPropertyClass(getClassByCode(details.prop_class_code))
    const address = titleCase(details.addr_details.main_addr)
    const yearBuilt = details.yr_built
    const numUnits = details.units
    const rentControlCode = details.rent_controlled
    const firstOwnerName = ownerList[0]?.owner_name ?? ''

    let addrVariations = details.addr_details.addr_variations.map(d => titleCase(d))
    let extraVariations = details.addr_details.num_extra_addr_variations

    switch(extraVariations){
      case 0: break
      case 1: 
        addrVariations.push('1 other variation') 
        break
      default: addrVariations.push(`${extraVariations} other variations`)
    }
    const addrText = addrVariations.reduce((string, d,i) => {
      const comma = (i < addrVariations.length - 1 && addrVariations.length !== 2)
        ? ', ' : ''
      const and = i === addrVariations.length - 2 ? ' and ' : ''
      return string + d + comma + and
    }, '')

    return (
      <>
        <Typography variant='h2'>{t('About the property')}</Typography>
        <Typography variant='body1'>
          <strong>{address}</strong>
          {
            t(' is a {{propertyType}} built in {{year}}. ', {
              propertyType: propertyType
                .replace('(tic ', '(TIC ') /* Until this is fixed in the data */
                .replace(' )', ')'), /* Until this is fixed in the data */
              year: String(yearBuilt)
            })
          }
          {
            typeof numUnits === 'number' &&
              t('It has {{count}} units. ', {
                count: numUnits,
                context: (numUnits === 0)
                  ? 'zero' /* Add a translation for zero with suffix _zero */
                  : '' 
              })
          }
          {
            firstOwnerName &&
              <>
                {t('It is currently owned by ')}
                <strong>{titleCase(firstOwnerName)}</strong>{'. ' }
              </>
          }
          {
            { '2': t('Since it was built before 1979, it is likely rent controlled.'),
              '1': t('It is not likely rent controlled.'),
              '0': t('No rent control data is available.')
            }[rentControlCode]
          }
        </Typography> 
        { addrVariations.length > 0 && 
          <>
            <br/>
            <Typography variant = "body1">
              {t('This property is also listed under {{addrText}}.', {
                addrText: addrText
              })}
            </Typography>
          </>
        }
      </>
    )

  }

  const EvictionSection = () => {

    const details = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-details`))
    const evictions = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-evictions`))
    const numUnits = details.units
    const address = titleCase(details.addr_details.main_addr)
    const yearBuilt = details.yr_built

    const numEllisEvictions = evictions.filter(eviction =>
      eviction.type === 'Ellis Act Withdrawal').length
    const numOtherEvictions = evictions.length - numEllisEvictions

    return (
      <EvictionList
        evictionSlice={`${bl}-evictions`}
        title={t('Eviction History at this Property')}
        subTitle={
          <>
            <strong>{address}</strong>
            {
              t(' has {{count}} units and we have records of ', {
                count: numUnits,
                context: (typeof numUnits !== 'number' || numUnits === 0)
                  ? 'zero' /* Add a translation for zero with suffix _zero */
                  : '' 
              })
            }
            {
              numEllisEvictions > 0 &&
                t('{{count}} Ellis Act {{evictionText}}{{endLink}}', {
                  count: numEllisEvictions,
                  evictionText: numEllisEvictions > 1 ? 'evictions' : 'eviction',
                  endLink: numOtherEvictions === 0 && !numUnits ? t('. ') : ''
                })
            }
            {
              numEllisEvictions > 0 && numUnits > 0 &&
                t('{{startLink}} affecting the {{units}} units{{endLink}}', {
                  startLink: numEllisEvictions > 1 ? ', each' : ',',
                  units: numUnits,
                  endLink: numOtherEvictions > 0 ? '' : t('. ')
                })
            }
            { numOtherEvictions > 0 &&
              t('{{startLink}}{{count}} {{otherText}}{{evictionText}}', {
                startLink: numEllisEvictions > 0 ? t(' and ') : '',
                count: numOtherEvictions,
                otherText: numEllisEvictions > 0 ? t('other ') : '',
                evictionText: numOtherEvictions > 1 ? t('evictions. ') : t('eviction. '),
                context: (typeof numUnits !== 'number' || numUnits === 0)
                  ? 'zero' /* Add a translation for zero with suffix _zero */
                  : '' 
              })
            } 
            {
              typeof yearBuilt === 'number'
                ? t('It was built in {{yearBuilt}}.', { yearBuilt: yearBuilt })
                : ''
            }
          </>
        }
        noDataMessage={t('No evictions recorded for this address.')}
        aboutData={{
          source: evictionSourceText,
          href: '/methodology',
          notes:  ( 
            t('Eviction records generally only include the address of the eviction. ') +
            t('Evictions were matched to parcel records and property ownership records. ') +
            t('As a result, some evictions were matched to multiple or no properties, if an exact ') +
            t('match could not be found. Some evictions also include names on the filing, ') +
            t('which may be either property owners or lawyers involved in the case. For these, ') +
            t('we have shown the name identified through property records, and the additional ') +
            t('names are those found on the eviction filing itself.')
          )
        }}
        paginationPageSize={5}
        csvFileName={t('Eviction history for address {{address}}',
          {address: address})}
      />
    )
 
  }

  const OwnerDetails = () => {
    
    const owners = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-owners`))
    if (isEmpty(owners)) return null
    const ownerList = owners?.owners
    const firstOwnerName = ownerList[0]?.owner_name ?? ''
    const firstOwnerBusinessType = ownerList[0]?.linked_be?.__typename ?? ''
    const firstOwnerAddress = ownerList[0]?.mailing_address ?? ''
    const subdivided = owners?.subdivided
    const multiple_owners = owners?.multiple_owners

    return (
      <>
        <Typography variant='h2'>{t('Owner')}</Typography>
        <Typography variant='body1'>
          <strong>
            {renderOwnerLink(firstOwnerName, firstOwnerBusinessType)}
          </strong>
        &nbsp;{t('is a registered owner located at')}
        &nbsp;{titleCase(firstOwnerAddress)}{'.'}
        </Typography>
        <br/>
        <Typography variant='body1'>
          <>
            {subdivided ?
              t('Records suggest that this property resulted from a subdivision, meaning ' +
                'that a parcel was split up into multiple parcels. There may be other parcels at the same location. ')
              : ''}
            {subdivided ? <><br/><br/></> : ''}
            {multiple_owners ? 
              t('There appear to be additional owners for this property. ') : 
              t('There may be additional owners for this property. ')}
            {t('To verify, please check out the ')}
            <Link
              href='https://recorder.sfgov.org'
              style={{cursor: 'pointer', textDecoration: 'underline'}}
              variant='body1'>
              {t('SF Recorder\'s Office')}
            </Link>
            {t(', where you can search this address to see the full list of owners.')}
          </>
        </Typography>
      </>
    )

  }

  const PropertySection = () => {

    const details = useSelector(sliceJson(`${bl}-details`))
    const address = titleCase(details.addr_details.main_addr)

    return (
      <PropertyList
        portfolioSlice={`${bl}-portfolio`}
        title={t('Property Portfolio')}
        subTitle={
          <>
            {t('The following buildings may be part of the same ownership network as ')}
            <strong>{address}</strong>{'.'}
          </>
        }
        noDataMessage={t('No portfolio properties found for this parcel.')}
        aboutData={{
          source: assessorSourceText,
          href: '/methodology',
          notes: ( 
            t('Property portfolios are created by identifying properties with the') +
            t('same mailing address(es). We associate properties with business ownership ') +
            t('networks through either the name listed as the property owner (if it is a ') +
            t('business) and through the property mailing addresses that are also business ') +
            t('office addresses. Some business networks have multiple addresses. In counting ') +
            t('the number of evictions for a property, Ellis Act evictions are counted as ') +
            t('separate evictions for each unit.')
          )
        }}
        paginationPageSize={5}
        csvFileName={t('Properties in the same ownership network as {{property}}',
          { property: address })}
      />
    )
  
  }

  if (!translationReady) return null

  return (
    <div>
      <Row>
        <Col xs={12}>
          {/* The API should flatten the roots for details -> parcel_details and owners -> owners */}
          <DataPage fetch={[
            { slice: `${bl}-details`,
              url: `api/parcel/${bl}/details`, select: j => j.parcel_details },
            { slice: `${bl}-owners`, url: `api/parcel/${bl}/owners`},
            { slice: `${bl}-evictions`, url: `api/parcel/${bl}/evictions`},
            { slice: `${bl}-network-details`, url: `api/parcel/${bl}/networkDetails`},
            { slice: `${bl}-network`, url: `api/parcel/${bl}/relatedNetworks`},
            { slice: `${bl}-portfolio`, url: `api/parcel/${bl}/portfolio`},
            { slice: `${bl}-about-evictions`, url: 'api/about/eviction'},
            { slice: `${bl}-about-assessor`, url: 'api/about/assessor'},
          ]} isDebugEnabled={false}>
            <ParcelMap/>
            <Row justify='center'>
              <Col xs={10} sm={8}>
                <PageTitle
                  slice={`${bl}-details`}
                  text={t('Parcel Details for ')}
                  appendTextSelector={j => titleCase(j.addr_details?.main_addr)}
                />
                <PropertyDetails/>
                <OwnerDetails/>
                <OwnershipNetwork urlParam={bl}/>
                <EvictionSection/>
                <PropertySection/>
                <NetworkList
                  slice={`${bl}-network`}
                  noDataMessage={t('No related networks found.')}
                />
              </Col>
            </Row>
          </DataPage>
        </Col>
      </Row>
    </div>
  )

}

export default Parcel

ui/src/pages/SearchResultsPage.js

import React from 'react'
import { useSelector } from 'react-redux'
import  Typography from '@material-ui/core/Typography'
import  Card from '@material-ui/core/Card'
import  CardHeader from '@material-ui/core/CardHeader'
import Avatar from '@material-ui/core/Avatar'
import  Box from '@material-ui/core/Box'
import  CircularProgress from '@material-ui/core/CircularProgress'
import  Link from '@material-ui/core/Link'
import  { useTheme } from '@material-ui/core/styles'
import useStyles from '../theme/SearchResultsStyles'
import { urlParam } from '../components/DataPage/DataPage'
import { searchSelector } from '../state/slices/searchStateSlice'
import { Row, Col } from '../components/Grid'
import { Link as RouterLink } from 'react-router-dom'
import BusinessIcon from '@material-ui/icons/Business'
import HomeIcon from '@material-ui/icons/Home'
import RoomOutlinedIcon from '@material-ui/icons/RoomOutlined'
import DataTable from  '../components/DataTable/DataTable'
import * as config from '../config/config.json'
import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
import i18n from '../i18n'

/*
  SearchResultsPage: presents results for a given search term
*/

const categories  = config.categories

const RenderConditionalAvatar = (category) => {
  
  const theme = useTheme()
  const classes = useStyles(theme)

  return (
    <Avatar className={classes.avatar}>
      {
        { '2': <BusinessIcon color="secondary" />,
          '1': <RoomOutlinedIcon color="secondary" />,
          '0': <HomeIcon color="secondary" />
        }[categories[category]]
      }
    </Avatar>
  )
}

const ResultCard = ({ label, category, categoryReadable, url }) => {

  const theme = useTheme()
  const classes = useStyles(theme)

  return (
    <Link
      to={url}
      className={classes.title}
      component={RouterLink}
      underline='hover'>
      <Card elevation={1} 
        className={classes.card}>
        <CardHeader
          avatar={RenderConditionalAvatar(category)}
          title={label}
          subheader={
            <span style={{textDecoration: 'none'}}>{categoryReadable}</span>
          }
        />
      </Card>
    </Link>
  )

}


const SearchResults = () => {

  const theme = useTheme()
  const classes = useStyles(theme)
  const searchParam = urlParam('search')
  const search = useSelector(state => state.search.searchTerm) || searchParam
  const resultJson = useSelector(searchSelector)
  const pending = useSelector(state => state._fetch.search?.pending)
  const results = Object.assign([], resultJson) /* adds missing Array __proto__ */

  const { t, ready: translationReady } = useTranslation(
    'Search', /* i18next-parser needs string here */
    { useSuspense: false, i18n }
  )
  
  if (!translationReady) return null
  if (!search) return null

  return ( 
    <div className={classes.page}>
      <Row>
        <Col xs={12} align="center">
          <Row justify="center" alignItems="center">
            <Typography variant="h1" style={{'marginRight': '20px'}} >
              {t('{{state}} results for {{search}}', {
                state: pending ? 'Loading ' : `Showing ${results.length}`,
                search: search
              })}
            </Typography>
            {pending && <CircularProgress />}
          </Row>
          {results.length > 0 &&
          <Box className={classes.cardContainer}>
            <DataTable 
              cellStyles={{padding: 0}}
              className={classes.searchTable}
              csvFileName={t('Search results for {{search}}', {search: search})}
              name='results'
              rows={results}
              columns={[{
                field: 'results',
                renderCell: e => 
                  <ResultCard 
                    key={e.row.details_url}
                    label={e.row.label}
                    url={e.row.details_url}
                    categoryReadable={e.row.category_label}
                    category={e.row.category}
                  />
              }]}>
            </DataTable>
          </Box>
          }
        </Col>
      </Row>
    </div>
  ) 
}

export default SearchResults

ui/src/state/rootReducer.js

import { combineReducers } from '@reduxjs/toolkit'
import search from './slices/searchStateSlice'
import _fetch from '../components/Data/DataState'

export default combineReducers({ search, _fetch })

ui/src/state/slices/searchStateSlice.js

import { createSlice } from '@reduxjs/toolkit'

/* A slice is a data object containing a portion of the application state */
/* Reducers determine how to modify state when something happens in the app */

/* State that should only be set initially */
export const initialSearchState = { searchTerm: '' }

/* createSlice() automatically creates actions that incorporate the reducer logic below */
const searchSlice = createSlice({
  name: 'search',
  initialState: initialSearchState,
  reducers: {
    setSearchTerm(state, action) {
      state.searchTerm = action.payload
    },
    resetSearch(state) {
      return { ...state, ...initialSearchState }
    }
  }
})

/* Destructure and export synchronous action creators */
export const { resetSearch, setSearchTerm } = searchSlice.actions

/* for a smoother search, we don't want to return an empty object when the result is pending, as sliceJson does */
/* the result should instead be the last fetched result */ 
export const searchSelector = (state) => {
  const slice = state?._fetch?.search
  if(typeof slice === 'undefined' || typeof slice?.json === 'undefined') return {}
  return slice.json
}

/* Export the above reducers in a way that can be passed directly to combineReducers() */
export default searchSlice.reducer

ui/src/state/store.js

import { configureStore } from '@reduxjs/toolkit'
import rootReducer from './rootReducer'
import logger from 'redux-logger'

export default configureStore({
  reducer: rootReducer,
  middleware: getDefaultMiddleware => getDefaultMiddleware().concat(logger)
})

/* getDefaultMiddleware() returns the following by default:
  [
    thunk, <-- allows Redux to perform asyncronous tasks
    immutableStateInvariant, <-- throws an error when state is mutated
    serializableStateInvariant <-- logs a warning if Redux is abused to store non-data
  ] 
*/

ui/src/theme/FooterStyles.js

import { makeStyles } from '@material-ui/core/styles'

/*
  Component Styles: provides non-global styles for a specific component
    If a style is global it should go in Theme.js not here
*/

export default makeStyles(theme => ({
  // desktop styles
  root: {
    display: 'flex',
    justifyContent: 'space-between',
    alignItems: 'center',
    minHeight: '8.5rem',
    width: '100%',
    borderTop: `.5px solid ${theme.palette.primary.dark}`,
    padding: theme.spacing(2),
  },
  item: {
    color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
    textDecoration: 'none',
    '&:hover':{
      textDecoration: 'underline',
      opacity: '1'
    },
    '&:focus':{
      textDecoration: 'underline',
      opacity: '1'
    },
    fontSize: '.89rem'
  },
  footerText: {
    color: 'white',
    padding: theme.spacing(2),
    display: 'flex',
    flex: 1,
  },
  links: {
    paddingRight: theme.spacing(5),
    paddingLeft: theme.spacing(3),
    width: 'fit-content',
    textAlign: 'right',
  },
  // mobile styles
  rootMobile: {
    height: 'fit-content',
    width: '100%',
    padding: '1rem',
    display: 'flex',
    borderTop: `.5px solid ${theme.palette.primary.dark}`,
    backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT, 
    '& .footerItem': {
      textAlign: 'center',
      height: 'fit-content', 
      color: theme.palette.common.LIGHTGREY
    },
    '& .fa-icon': {
      paddingBottom: '4px'
    }
  }
}), {index: 1})

ui/src/theme/ListStyles.js

import { makeStyles } from '@material-ui/core/styles'

/*
  Component Styles: provides non-global styles for a specific component
    If a style is global it should go in Theme.js not here
*/

export default makeStyles(theme => ({
  table: {
    background: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
    color: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
    '& *::selection': {
      color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
      background: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
    },
    '&::selection': {
      color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
      background: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
    },
    tableLayout: 'fixed',
  },
  tableCell: {
    overflow: 'visible',
    whiteSpace: 'wrap',
    wordBreak: 'normal',
    padding: 15,
    fontSize: 14,
    '&::selection': {
      color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
      background: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
    },
    '&:last-child': {
      padding: 15
    },
  },
  headerCell: {
    overflow: 'visible',
    whiteSpace: 'wrap',
    padding: '8px 15px 8px 15px',
    fontSize: 14,
    '&::selection': {
      color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
      background: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
    },
    '& .MuiTableSortLabel-root': {
      '&::selection': {
        color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
        background: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
      },
    },
  },
  tablePagination: {
    backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
    color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
    '& svg': { color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE },
  },
  paginationOption: {
    color: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
  },
  accordionInTable: {
    whiteSpace: 'nowrap',
    backgroundColor: 'unset',
  },
  accordionSummary: {
    padding: 0
  },
  cardText: {
    color: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
    fontFamily: 'Source Sans Pro, sans-serif',
    fontSize: '0.9rem',
    fontWeight: 400,
    marginTop: 10,
  },
  detailsText: {
    color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
    fontFamily: 'Source Sans Pro, sans-serif',
    fontSize: '0.8rem',
    fontWeight: 400,
    marginLeft: 10,
  },
  lightColorLink: {
    '& a': {
      background: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
      color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
    },
  },
  aboutCard: {
    padding: 15,
    borderRadius: 3,
    color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
    backgroundColor: '#302742',
  },
  aboutButton: {
    boxShadow: 'none',
    border: 0,
    padding: '3px',
    color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
    backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
    '& svg': { color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE },
  },
  showMoreButton: {
    boxShadow: 'none',
    border: 0,
    marginBottom: 15,
    color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
    backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
    '& svg': { color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE },
  },
  paper: {
    boxShadow: 'none',
  },
}), {index: 1})

ui/src/theme/SearchBarStyles.js

import { makeStyles } from '@material-ui/core'

/*
  Component Styles: provides non-global styles for a specific component
    If a style is global it should go in Theme.js not here
*/

export default makeStyles((theme) => ({
  root: {
    position: 'relative',
    '& .search-results-item': {
      display: 'flex', 
      marginTop: 0,
      marginBottom: 0,
      paddingTop: 0,
      paddingBottom: 0,
      width: 'inherit',
      height: '3.5rem',
      zIndex: 900, 
      ariaLabel: 'search results', 
      border: '.75px lightgrey solid',
      borderRight: '2.5px lightgrey solid',
      borderLeft: '2.5px lightgrey solid'
    },
    '& .search-results-item div.searchResultText:hover': {
      textDecoration: 'underline'
    },
    '& .search-results-item:hover': {
      backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.LIGHTGREY,
      color: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT
    },
    /* Outline for when link is focused on via keyboard */
    /* DO NOT REMOVE. THIS IS FOR KEYBOARD ACCESSIBILITY. */
    '& .search-results-item:focus': {
      outline: '3px solid #A9A9A9'
    },
    /* text in focused Link div. works in tandem with the rule above. */
    '& .search-results-item:focus div.searchResultText': {
      textDecoration: 'underline',
      fontWeight: '900'
    },
    '& button:focus': {
      outline: '3px solid #A9A9A9'
    },
    '& .wrapper-div': {
      width: '100%',
      position: 'absolute', 
      minWidth: 320, 
      display: 'flex', 
      flexDirection: 'column', 
      zIndex: 900,
      alignItems: 'center', 
      marginRight: '0', 
      paddingRight: '0', 
      maxWidth: '100%'
    },
    '& .search-bar': {
      width: '85%',
      maxWidth: 1000,
      margin: '0 auto',
      marginBottom: -.5,
      border: '1px lightgrey solid'
    },
    '& .search-bar-header': {
      width: '85%',
      maxWidth: 1000,
      margin: '0 auto'
      // add't header styles can go here
    },
    '& .search-form': {
      position: 'relative',
      display: 'flex',
      alignItems: 'center',
      flexWrap: 'nowrap',
      justifyContent: 'center'
    },
    '& .searchResultText': {
      fontSize: '18px', 
      color: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT, 
    }, 
    '& .searchTypeText': { //doesn't actually seem to be overriding the MUI typography css
      color: theme.palette.common.CORAL, 
      fontSize: 13
    },
    '& .input': {
      backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
      height: `${theme.mixins.toolbar.minHeight}`,
      '& *::selection': {
        color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
        background: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT
      }
    },
    '& .result-icon': {
      color: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
      margin: 0,
      padding: 0
    },
  },
  searchResults: {
    display: 'flex',
    flexDirection: 'column',
    justifyContent: 'space-between',
    margin: '0, auto',
    width: '85%', 
    maxWidth: 1000, 
    backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE, 
    marginTop: -2, 
    zIndex: 998
  }
}), {index: 1})

ui/src/theme/SearchResultsStyles.js

import { makeStyles } from '@material-ui/core/styles'

/*
  Component Styles: provides non-global styles for a specific component
    If a style is global it should go in Theme.js not here
*/

export default makeStyles(theme => 
  ({
    page: {
      marginTop: 20,
      marginLeft: 20
    },
    header: {
      marginBottom: theme.spacing(3)
    },
    offWhiteText: {
      color: theme.palette.common.OFFWHITE,
      marginBottom: theme.spacing(2)
    },
    feedback: {
      alignItems: 'center'
    },
    card: {
      marginBottom: '.5rem',
      width: '100%',
      textAlign: 'left',
      borderRadius: '3px'
    },
    cardContainer: {
      width: '45%',
      minWidth: '400px'
    },
    avatar: {
      border: `1px solid ${theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT}`,
      backgroundColor: 'white'
    },
    title: {
      color: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
      fontWeight: 'bold',
      '&:hover': {
        textDecoration: 'underline', 
        color: 'inherit'
      } 
    },
    searchTable: { //overriding ListStyles.js
      '& table': { 
        backgroundColor: theme.palette.common.EGGPLANT,
      },
      '& thead':{
        display: 'none'
      }
    },
    filterText: {
      color: 'white',
      display: 'flex',
      alignItems: 'center',
      justifyContent: 'center',
      marginBottom: '1.25rem',
      marginTop: '0',
      paddingTop: '0',
      width: '45%',
      minWidth: '400px'
    },
    checkBoxDiv: {
      fill: 'white',
      color: theme.palette.primary,
      backgroundColor: 'white',
      marginBottom: '1.25rem',
      marginTop: '0',
      paddingTop: '0',
      width: '45%',
      minWidth: '400px', 
      borderRadius: '3px',
      opacity: '.75'
    }
  }), {index: 1}
)

ui/src/theme/Theme.js

import { createMuiTheme } from '@material-ui/core/styles'

/*
  Theme: provides default styling for Material UI components
    Global styles that affect all elements of a given type are here
*/

const EGGPLANT = '#231935'
const CORAL = '#FB7F50'
const OFFWHITE = '#f5f4f2'
const LIGHTGREY = '#d9d9d9'
const DARKGREY = '#303030'
const BEIGE = '#f5f4f2'

export default createMuiTheme({
  /* Text styles */
  typography: {
    fontWeightRegular: 400,
    fontWeightBold: 700,
    h1: {
      color: OFFWHITE,
      fontFamily: 'Oswald, sans-serif',
      fontSize: '2rem',
      marginBottom: 10,
      marginTop: 30,
      fontWeight: 500,
      userSelect: 'text',
      '&::selection': { color: EGGPLANT, background: OFFWHITE },
      '& *::selection': { color: EGGPLANT, background: OFFWHITE },
      '& a': { color: OFFWHITE, background: EGGPLANT },
    },
    h2: {
      color: OFFWHITE,
      fontFamily: 'Oswald, sans-serif',
      fontSize: '1.4rem',
      marginBottom: 10,
      marginTop: 30,
      fontWeight: 500,
      userSelect: 'text',
      '&::selection': { color: EGGPLANT, background: OFFWHITE },
      '& *::selection': { color: EGGPLANT, background: OFFWHITE },
      '& a': { color: OFFWHITE, background: EGGPLANT },
    },
    h3: {
      display: 'flex',
      alignContent: 'center',
      color: EGGPLANT,
      fontFamily: 'Oswald, sans-serif',
      fontSize: '1.4rem',
      fontWeight: 500,
      userSelect: 'text',
      textDecoration: 'none',
      '&::selection': { color: OFFWHITE, background: EGGPLANT },
      '& *::selection': { color: OFFWHITE, background: EGGPLANT },
      '&::hover': { textDecoration: 'none' },
    },
    body1: {
      color: OFFWHITE,
      fontFamily: 'Source Sans Pro, sans-serif',
      fontSize: '0.9rem',
      fontWeight: 400,
      userSelect: 'text',
      '& p': { maxWidth: '57ch' },
      '&::selection': { color: EGGPLANT, background: OFFWHITE },
      '& *::selection': { color: EGGPLANT, background: OFFWHITE },
      '& a': { color: OFFWHITE },
    },
    body2: {
      color: EGGPLANT,
      fontFamily: 'Source Sans Pro, sans-serif',
      fontSize: '0.9rem',
      fontWeight: 400,
      userSelect: 'text',
      '& p': { maxWidth: '57ch' },
      '&::selection': { color: OFFWHITE, background: EGGPLANT },
      '& *::selection': { color: OFFWHITE, background: EGGPLANT },
      '& a': { color: EGGPLANT },
    },
    subtitle1: {
      color: OFFWHITE,
      fontFamily: 'Oswald, sans-serif',
      fontSize: '1.4rem',
      marginBottom: 10,
      fontWeight: 500,
      userSelect: 'text',
      '&::selection': { color: EGGPLANT, background: OFFWHITE },
      '& *::selection': { color: EGGPLANT, background: OFFWHITE },
      '& a': { color: OFFWHITE },
    },
    button: {
      '&:hover': { backgroundColor: 'inherit' },
    },
    caption: {
      fontFamily: 'Source Sans Pro, sans-serif',
      fontSize: '1.2rem',
      marginBottom: 10,
    },
  },

  /* Colors */
  palette: {
    common: {
      EGGPLANT: EGGPLANT,
      CORAL: CORAL,
      OFFWHITE: OFFWHITE,
      LIGHTGREY: LIGHTGREY,
      DARKGREY: DARKGREY,
      BEIGE: BEIGE,
    },
    primary: { main: OFFWHITE },
    secondary: { main: CORAL },
  },

  /* Material UI component styles */
