    MuiCssBaseline: {
      '@global': {
        body: {
          padding: 0,
          margin: 0,
          WebkitFontSmoothing: 'auto',
          backgroundColor: EGGPLANT,
          minHeight: '100vh',
          display: 'flex',
          flexDirection: 'column',
          fontFamily: 'Source Sans Pro, sans-serif',
          fontWeight: 400,
        },
        '*:before, *:after': {
          boxSizing: 'inherit',
        },
        img: {
          maxWidth: '100%' /* so images are never wider than the page */,
        },
        'a:visited': {
          textDecoration: 'none !important',
        },
        '#logo': {
          textDecoration: 'none !important',
        },
      },
    },
    MuiSvgIcon: {
      colorPrimary: { color: OFFWHITE },
      colorSecondary: { color: EGGPLANT },
    },
    MuiChip: {
      label: { color: EGGPLANT },
    },
    MuiInput: {
      root: { border: 0 },
      input: { userSelect: 'text', color: OFFWHITE, background: EGGPLANT },
      underline: {
        borderBottom: `1px solid ${OFFWHITE}`,
        '&&&&:hover:before': { borderBottom: `1px solid ${OFFWHITE}` },
        '&&&&:hover:after': { borderBottom: `1px solid ${OFFWHITE}` },
        '&:hover': { borderBottom: `1px solid ${OFFWHITE}` },
        '&:after': { borderBottom: `1px solid ${OFFWHITE}` },
        '&:selected': { borderBottom: `1px solid ${OFFWHITE}` },
      },
    },
  },

  /* Other */
  section: { marginLeft: 20, marginRight: 20 },
  shape: { borderRadius: 0 },
})

ui/src/utils/api.js

import pDebounce from 'p-debounce'
import * as graphProcessor from '../components/Graph/graphProcessor'

/*
  NOTE 6/25/2021:
  Much of this file has become obsolete.
  The functionality for this has moved to Data/DataState.js and to the
  page components.
  It should be deleted once the graph component is migrated to API 2.0,
  as that should be the last item that still uses code in here.
*/

//login & logout api utils
export async function userLogin(user, pass) {
  const route = '/session/login'

  try {
    const response = await fetch(route, {
      method: 'POST',
      body: JSON.stringify({
        username: user,
        password: pass,
      }),
      headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }
    })
    if (!response.ok || response.status !== 200) throw response

    const json = await response.json()
    if (json.response !== true) throw new Error('Error with JSON response.')

    return json
  } catch (error) {
    console.log('userLogin error: ', error)
    const message = error.message || error.statusText || error.status || null
    if (message) throw new Error(message)
    else throw error
  }
}

export async function callAuthAPI(route) {
  //route can be /login or /logout
  try {
    const response = await fetch(route)
    if (!response || !response.ok || response.status !== 200) throw response

    const json = await response.json()
    if (!json) throw Error('No JSON from server.')
    if (json instanceof Error) throw json

    return json
  } catch (error) {
    console.log('callAuthAPI error: ', error)
    const message = error.message || error.statusText || error.status || null
    if (message) throw new Error(message)
    else throw error
  }
}

/////////////////////

//fetch search api util
const populateSearch = async function (searchTerm, route) {
  //route can be either 'api/parcel-search/' or 'api/be-search/'
  if (searchTerm === '') {
    return []
  } else {
    const response = await fetch(route + encodeURIComponent(searchTerm))
    const json = await response.json()
    if (response.status !== 200) {
      throw Error(`An error occurred searching: ${json.message}`)
    }
    return json
  }
}
//debounce the search (we need unique pDebounce calls per search type)
export const debouncedPopulateOwnerSearch = pDebounce(populateSearch, 500)
export const debouncedPopulateParcelSearch = pDebounce(populateSearch, 500)

////////////////////////////

//Fetch owner and parcel api utils
export async function getOwnerData(searchTerm, businessEntity) {
  if (!businessEntity) return Error('Owner needs a business entity type.')
  const entityType = businessEntity.toLowerCase()
  if (!entityType) return Error('Invalid business entity type.')

  const route = `api/${entityType}/`

  const response = await fetch(`${route}${encodeURIComponent(searchTerm)}`)
  if (!response.ok) {
    throw Error(response.statusText)
  }

  let json = await response.json()

  let mapData = []

  if (json.networks.length > 0) {
    json.networks.map((network) =>
      mapData.push({ ...network, type: 'indirectly_currently_owned' })
    )
  }

  if (json.parcels_owned.length > 0) {
    json.parcels_owned.map((parcel) =>
      mapData.push({ ...parcel, type: 'directly_currently_owned' })
    )
  }

  if (json.evictions.length > 0) {
    json.evictions.map((eviction) =>
      mapData.push({ ...eviction, type: 'previously_evicted' })
    )
  }

  //added this filter to remove nulls from return
  mapData = mapData.filter((parcel) => {
    return parcel.lat !== null
  })

  return {
    ownerData: json.be_details,
    entityType,
    parcelsOwned: json.parcels_owned,
    evictions: json.evictions,
    networkParcels: json.networks,
    mapData,
    searchTerm
  }
}

export async function getParcelDetailsData(blockLot) {
  const route = `api/parcel/${encodeURIComponent(blockLot)}/details`

  const response = await fetch(route)
  if (!response.ok) {
    throw Error(response.statusText)
  }

  const parcelData = await response.json()

  const parcel_details = parcelData.parcel_details;

  // format prices
  [ 'assess_land_val', 'assess_imp_val', 'curr_sales_price' ].forEach(
    (priceVal) => {
      parcel_details[priceVal] = parcel_details[priceVal]
        ? '$' + parcel_details[priceVal].toLocaleString()
        : null
    }
  )

  const mapData = [
    {
      lat: parcel_details.lat,
      long: parcel_details.long,
      type: 'Parcel Searched',
      addr: parcel_details.addr,
    },
  ]

  return {
    parcelData,
    mapData,
    blockLot
  }
}

export async function getParcelEvictionsData(blockLot) {
  const route = `api/parcel/${encodeURIComponent(blockLot)}/evictions`

  const response = await fetch(route)
  if (!response.ok) {
    throw Error(response.statusText)
  }

  const parcelData = await response.json()

  return {
    parcelData,
    blockLot
  }
}

export async function getParcelNetworksData(blockLot) {
  const route = `api/parcel/${encodeURIComponent(blockLot)}/networks`

  const response = await fetch(route)
  if (!response.ok) {
    throw Error(response.statusText)
  }

  const parcelData = await response.json()


  const mapData = Object.keys(parcelData.networks).reduce((acc, networkId, index) => {
    return acc = [ ...acc, ...parcelData.networks[networkId].related_parcels
      .filter((parcel) => {
        return parcel.lat !== null
      })
      .map((parcel) => {
        return {
          lat: parcel.lat,
          long: parcel.long,
          type: 'Related Parcel',
          addr: parcel.addr,
          netId: networkId,
        }
      }) ]
  }, [])

  return {
    parcelData,
    mapData,
    blockLot
  }
}

export async function getParcelOwnersData(blockLot) {
  const route = `api/parcel/${encodeURIComponent(blockLot)}/owners`

  const response = await fetch(route)
  if (!response.ok) {
    throw Error(response.statusText)
  }

  const parcelData = await response.json()

  return {
    parcelData,
    blockLot
  }
}

export async function getParcelMapData(blockLot) {
  const route = `api/parcel/${encodeURIComponent(blockLot)}`

  const response = await fetch(route)
  if (!response.ok) {
    throw Error(response.statusText)
  }

  const { networks, parcel_details } = await response.json();

  // format prices
  [ 'assess_land_val', 'assess_imp_val', 'curr_sales_price' ].forEach(
    (priceVal) => {
      parcel_details[priceVal] = parcel_details[priceVal]
        ? '$' + parcel_details[priceVal].toLocaleString()
        : null
    }
  )

  let mapData = [
    {
      lat: parcel_details.lat,
      long: parcel_details.long,
      type: 'Parcel Searched',
      addr: parcel_details.addr,
    },
  ]

  Object.keys(networks).forEach((networkId, index) => {
    networks[networkId].related_parcels.forEach((parcel) => {
      mapData.push({
        lat: parcel.lat,
        long: parcel.long,
        type: 'Related Parcel',
        addr: parcel.addr,
        netId: networkId,
      })
    })
  })
  //added this filter to remove nulls from return
  mapData = mapData.filter((parcel) => {
    return parcel.lat !== null
  })

  return {
    mapData,
    blockLot
  }
}

//////////////////////////

//fetch graph data utils
export async function getNetworkGraphData(
  searchType,
  searchTerm,
  searchNetwork,
  sizeFilter = 50,
) {

  searchTerm = encodeURIComponent(searchTerm)
  searchType = searchType.toLowerCase()

  let network_req
  if (searchType === 'parcel' && typeof searchNetwork === 'string' && searchNetwork.length > 0) {
    network_req = `api/network/${searchType}/${searchNetwork}/${searchTerm}`
  } else {
    network_req = `api/network/${searchType}/${searchTerm}`
  }

  const response_network = await fetch(network_req)
  if (!response_network.ok) {
    throw Error(response_network.statusText)
  }

  let json_network = await response_network.json().catch(e => console.error(e))
  json_network.network_subgraph = graphProcessor.get_view_network(
    json_network,
    searchType,
    sizeFilter,
    5
  )

  json_network.searchType = searchType
  json_network.title =
    json_network.searchType === 'parcel'
      ? json_network.addr
      : json_network.name_norm

  return json_network
}

//fetch graph data utils
export async function getNeighborhoodData(searchTerm) {
  let mapData = []
  let summary = {
    total: 0,
    neighborhood: searchTerm,
    by_type: {},
  }

  const route = 'api/neighborhood/'

  const response = await fetch(
    `${route}${encodeURIComponent(searchTerm).toLowerCase()}`
  )
  if (!response.ok) throw Error(response.statusText)

  if (response.status === 204) {
    return {
      neighborhoodData: null,
      summaryData: summary,
      mapData,
      searchTerm
    }
  }

  let json = await response.json()

  json.forEach((eviction) => {
    const high_accuracy = !eviction.multiple_addr_matches
    const evict_type =
      eviction.type === null ? 'Eviction Type Unknown' : eviction.type

    if (!(evict_type in summary.by_type)) {
      // if eviction type is not already in summary, create it:
      summary['by_type'][evict_type] = {
        likely_count: high_accuracy ? 1 : 0,
        possible_count: high_accuracy ? 0 : 1,
      }
    } else {
      // else increment existing counts:
      if (high_accuracy) {
        summary['by_type'][evict_type]['likely_count'] += 1
      } else {
        summary['by_type'][evict_type]['possible_count'] += 1
      }
    }

    mapData.push({
      lat: eviction.lat,
      long: eviction.long,
      block_lot: eviction.block_lot,
      evict_type,
      evict_date: eviction.evict_date,
      addr: eviction.addr,
      multiple_sales_matches: eviction.multiple_sales_matches,
      multiple_addr_matches: eviction.multiple_addr_matches,
    })
  })

  // turn summary into array so react-table doesn't throw up:
  summary.by_type = Array.from(Object.keys(summary.by_type), (type) => {
    return {
      evict_type: type,
      ...summary['by_type'][type],
    }
  })

  return {
    neighborhoodData: json,
    summaryData: summary,
    mapData: mapData,
    searchTerm: searchTerm
  }
}

ui/src/utils/csvFormat.js

import {
  Address,
  Owners,
  OwnerSameNetwork,
  OwnerMailingAddress,
  ProportionOwner,
  OwnerSince,
  NetworkAddress,
  NumUnits,
  Evictions,
  Neighborhood,
} from './parcelFormat'
import {
  EvictDate,
  EvictId,
  EvictionLikelihood,
  Evictor,
  EvictType,
  SalesLikelihood,
} from './evictionFormat'

function ParcelEvictionsTable(evictions) {
  return(
    evictions.map(d => ({
      'Date': EvictDate(d),
      'Petition ID': EvictId(d),
      'Location Accuracy': EvictionLikelihood(d),
      'Evictor': Evictor(d),
      'Eviction Type': EvictType(d),
      'Evictor Accuracy': SalesLikelihood(d),
    }))
  )
}

function RelatedParcelsTable(netId, related_parcels) {
  return(
    related_parcels.map(d => ({
      'Parcel Address': Address(d),
      'Owner(s)': Owners(d),
      'Owner Part of Same Network?': OwnerSameNetwork(d, netId),
      'Owner Mailing Address': OwnerMailingAddress(d),
      'Network Address': NetworkAddress(d, netId),
      '# of Units': NumUnits(d),
      'Evictions Filed': Evictions(d)
    }))
  )
}

function OwnerViewEvictionsTable(evictions) {
  return(
    evictions.map(d=> ({
      'Location': Address(d),
      'Date': EvictDate(d),
      'Eviction Type': EvictType(d),
      'Neighborhood': Neighborhood(d),
      '# of Units': NumUnits(d),
      'Location Accuracy': EvictionLikelihood(d),
      'Evictor Accuracy': SalesLikelihood(d)
    }))
  )
}


function OwnerViewParcelTable(parcels){
  return(
    parcels.map(d=> ({
      'Location': Address(d),
      'Neighborhood': Neighborhood(d),
      '# of Units': NumUnits(d),
      'Proportion Ownership': ProportionOwner(d),
      'Owner Since': OwnerSince(d),
      'Evictions Filed': Evictions(d)
    }))
  )
}


export {
  ParcelEvictionsTable,
  RelatedParcelsTable,
  OwnerViewEvictionsTable,
  OwnerViewParcelTable
}

ui/src/utils/dataUtils.js

import React, {useRef, useEffect} from 'react'
import { titleCase } from './stringUtils'

/* Functions to improve readability and consistency with loading and error state */
export const applyDefaultPendingState = state => Object.assign(state, { loading: true, error: false })
export const applyDefaultRejectedState = (state, action) => {
  Object.assign(state, { error: action?.payload?.error, loading: false })
  console.error(action?.payload?.error)
}
export const applyDefaultFulfilledState = state => Object.assign(state, { loading: false, error: false })

/* Functions to improve readability with data validation */
export const isNull = x => x === undefined || x === null
export const isNotString = x => isNull(x) || typeof x !== 'string'
export const isNotArray = x => isNull(x) || !Array.isArray(x)
export const isNotObject = x => isNull(x) || typeof x !== 'object'
export const isEmpty = x => {
  const isArray = Array.isArray(x)
  const isObject = typeof x === 'object'
  if (isNull(x)) { return true }
  if (isArray && x.length <= 0) { return true }
  if (isObject && Object.keys(x).length <= 0) { return true }
  return false
}

/* Helper function to determine indefinite article */
/* This is idiomatic English that can't be computed logically */
export const beStatusIndefiniteArticle = status => {
  switch (status) {
    case 'SOS/FTB Suspended/Forfeited':
    case 'Active':
    case 'Inactive': return 'an'
    default:
      return 'a'
  }
}

/* Logic to determine equality from primary and secondary data sources */
export const compareState = (primary, secondary) => {
  return ({ isEqual: primary === secondary })
}

/* Helper function to create a comma separated string from an array, 
 * with each item bolded. 
 *
 * Returns: JSX element 
 */
export const commaSeparatedBolded = list => list?.map(
  (x,i,a) =>
    typeof x === 'string' && x.length > 0 &&
      <span key={i}>
        <span style={{fontWeight: 'bold'}}>{titleCase(x)}</span>
        {
          i === (a.length - 2)
            ? <span>,&nbsp;and&nbsp;</span>
            : i < (a.length - 1) ? <span>,&nbsp;</span> : null
        }
      </span>
)

/* Helper function to create a comma separated string from an array 
 * 
 * Returns: String
 */
export const commaSeparatedText = list => list?.map(
  (x,i,a) =>
    typeof x === 'string' && x.length > 0 &&
    titleCase(x) + (i === (a.length - 2) ? ' and ' : i < (a.length - 1) ? ', ' : '')
).join('')

export const stableSort = (arr, compare) => arr
  .map((item, index) => ({item, index}))
  .sort((a, b) => compare(a.item, b.item) || a.index - b.index)
  .map(({item}) => item)

/* taken from https://usehooks.com/useMemoCompare/ */ 
export const useMemoCompare = (next, compare) => {
  // Ref for storing previous value
  const previousRef = useRef()
  const previous = previousRef.current
  // Pass previous and next value to compare function
  // to determine whether to consider them equal.
  const isEqual = compare(previous, next)
  // If not equal update previousRef to next value.
  // We only update if not equal so that this hook continues to return
  // the same old value if compare keeps returning true.
  useEffect(() => {
    if (!isEqual) {
      previousRef.current = next
    }
  })
  // Finally, if equal then return the previous value
  return isEqual ? previous : next
}

ui/src/utils/evictionFormat.js

import { reformatDate, titleCase } from './stringUtils.js'

function EvictDate(d) {
  return (d.evict_date ? reformatDate(d.evict_date) : 'not available')
}
function EvictId(d) {
  return (d.evict_id)
}
function EvictionLikelihood(d) {
  return (d.multiple_addr_matches ? 'Low' : 'High')
}
function Evictor(d) {
  return (d.linked_be
    ? titleCase(d.linked_be.name_norm)
    : titleCase(d.name))
}
function EvictType(d) {
  return (!d.type ? 'Not recorded' : d.type)
}
function SalesLikelihood(d) {
  return (d.multiple_sales_matches ? 'Low' : 'High')
}

export {
  EvictDate,
  EvictId,
  EvictionLikelihood,
  Evictor,
  EvictType,
  SalesLikelihood
}

ui/src/utils/iconsInit.js

import { library } from '@fortawesome/fontawesome-svg-core'

import {
  faHome,
  faBars,
  faPlus,
  faMinus,
  faSearch,
  faAngleDown,
  faAngleLeft,
  faAngleRight,
  faPhone,
  faGlobe,
  faPrint,
  faSave,
  faMapMarker,
  faSpinner,
  faBuilding,
  faUserTie
} from '@fortawesome/free-solid-svg-icons'

const appIcons = {
  home: faHome,
  hamburgerBars: faBars,
  plus: faPlus,
  minus: faMinus,
  search: faSearch,
  angleDown: faAngleDown,
  angleLeft: faAngleLeft,
  angleRight: faAngleRight,
  phone: faPhone,
  globe: faGlobe,
  print: faPrint,
  save: faSave,
  mapMarker: faMapMarker,
  spinner: faSpinner,
  building: faBuilding,
  landlord: faUserTie
}

//add them to the library to be used in all components
//import this script in the App component
Object.values(appIcons).map(icon => library.add(icon))

ui/src/utils/materialUtils.js

import React from 'react'
import { Link as RouterLink } from 'react-router-dom'
import { titleCase } from './stringUtils'
import Link from '@material-ui/core/Link'

/* MUI-specific implementation for the "DataGrid" component ONLY */
/* IT WILL NOT WORK with anything else */
/* see more: https://material-ui.com/components/data-grid/rendering/#value-getter */

export function MaterialParcelLink(params) {
  const addr = params.row.addr
  const block_lot = params.row.block_lot

  return (
    <Link 
      to={{ pathname: '/parcel', search: `?bl=${encodeURIComponent(block_lot)}` }}
      component={RouterLink}>
      {titleCase(addr)}
    </Link>
  )
}

ui/src/utils/parcelFormat.js

import { titleCase, reformatDate } from './stringUtils.js'

function Address(d) {
  return ( titleCase(d.addr) )
}
function Owners(d) {
  return (d.owners.map(owner => titleCase(owner.owner_name)))
}
function OwnerSameNetwork(d, netId) {
  return (d.owners.map(owner =>
    owner.linked_be ? (owner.linked_be.network_id === netId ? 'Yes' : 'No') : 'No'))
}
function OwnerMailingAddress(d) {
  return (d.owners.map(owner => titleCase(owner.mailing_address)))
}
function ProportionOwner(d) {
  return d.perc_owner !== null ? d.perc_owner.toFixed(0) + '%' : '(unknown)'
}
function OwnerSince(d) {
  return d.record_date !== null ? reformatDate(d.record_date) : '(unknown)'
}
function NetworkAddress(d, netId) {
  return (d.possible_networks[netId].map(addr => titleCase(addr)))
}
function NumUnits(d) {
  return (d.units + '  unit' + (d.units > 1 ? 's' : ''))
}
function Evictions(d) {
  return d.num_evictions !== null ? (d.num_evictions + ' filed') : '(unknown)'
}
function Neighborhood(d) {
  return d.neighborhood !== null ? titleCase(d.neighborhood) : '(unknown)'
}



export {
  Address,
  Owners,
  OwnerSameNetwork,
  OwnerMailingAddress,
  ProportionOwner,
  OwnerSince,
  NetworkAddress,
  NumUnits,
  Evictions,
  Neighborhood,
}

ui/src/utils/propertyClass.js

      'use_definition': 'Single Family Residential',
      'class_code': 'ZBM',
      'class_definition': 'Condominium BMR'
    },

      'class_definition': 'Condominium Economic Unit '

const unknownClass = {
  'use_code': 'UNKNOWN',
  'use_definition': 'Unknown',
  'class_code': 'X',
  'class_definition': 'Unknown'
}

export const getClassByCode = (classCode) => {
  const results = propertyClasses.filter((propertyClass) => propertyClass.class_code === classCode)
  if (results.length >= 1) return results[0]
  return unknownClass
}

export const formatPropertyClass = (propertyClass) => {
  return `${propertyClass.use_definition.toLocaleLowerCase()} building (${propertyClass.class_definition.toLocaleLowerCase()})`
}

ui/src/utils/reactTable.js

import React from 'react'

// needs a unit test
function getOwnerString(elem) {
  if (React.isValidElement(elem)) return elem.props.children // React element
  if (elem[0] && React.isValidElement(elem[0][0])) { // nested React element
    return elem[0][0].props.children[0]
  } else if (elem[0] && elem[0][0]) { // nested string
    return elem[0][0]
  } else {
    console.log('NO direct owner string found: ', elem)
  }
}

function getAddressString(elem) {
  let elemString
  elem = (elem[0]) ? elem[0] : elem
  if (React.isValidElement(elem)) {
    elemString = elem.props.children
  } else {
    console.log('NO address string found: ', elem)
  }
  return elemString
}

export {
  getOwnerString,
  getAddressString
}

ui/src/utils/searchUtils.js

//use these temporarily
//for searching by neighborhood name
const neighborhoodNames = [
  'Bayview',
  'Bernal Heights',
  'Castro/Upper Market',
  'Chinatown',
  'Crocker Amazon',
  'Diamond Heights',
  'Downtown/Civic Center',
  'Excelsior',
  'Financial District',
  'Glen Park',
  'Golden Gate Park',
  'Haight Ashbury',
  'Inner Richmond',
  'Inner Sunset',
  'Lakeshore',
  'Marina',
  'Mission',
  'Nob Hill',
  'Noe Valley',
  'North Beach',
  'Ocean View',
  'Outer Mission',
  'Outer Richmond',
  'Outer Sunset',
  'Pacific Heights',
  'Parkside',
  'Potrero Hill',
  'Presidio',
  'Presidio Heights',
  'Russian Hill',
  'Seacliff',
  'South Of Market',
  'Treasure Island/YBI',
  'Twin Peaks',
  'Visitacion Valley',
  'West Of Twin Peaks',
  'Western Addition'
]

// TODO needs a unit test
//this function returns a filtered list of neighborhoods
//and may need to be updated
export function listNeighborhoods(searchTerm) {
  const neighborhoodsList = neighborhoodNames
    .map(name => {
      const nameUpper = name.toUpperCase()
      const searchTermUpper = searchTerm.toUpperCase()
      if (nameUpper.indexOf(searchTermUpper) > -1) {
        return { name }
      }
      return null
    })
    .filter(name => name !== null)
  return Promise.resolve(neighborhoodsList)
}

export const composeQuery = ( searchType, item ) => {
  if (!item) { return '' }
  if ( searchType === 'parcel' ) { return `?bl=${ item.block_lot }` }
  const baseQuery = `?search=${ encodeURIComponent( searchType === 'owner' ? item.name_norm : item.name ) }`
  if ( searchType === 'neighborhood' ) { return baseQuery }
  else if (item.__typename != null) { return baseQuery + `&be=${ item.__typename.split( 'SOS_' )[ 1 ].toLowerCase() }` }
  return ''
}

ui/src/utils/stringUtils.js

function reformatDate(str, short = true) {
  if (typeof str !== 'string' || str.length < 8) return ''
  const y = str.substr(0,4),
    m = str.substr(4,2) - 1,
    d = str.substr(6,2)
  const date = new Date(y,m,d)
  if (isNaN(date.getTime())) return ''
  if (short) return date.toLocaleDateString()
  return date.toDateString()
}

// Helper function for titleCase, to handle '/' and '-' edge cases
// NOTE: Yes, this seems like overkill, but using regex visibly slows down the text loading
// TODO: see if we can format the strings serverside or on the DB instead ?
// function mixSeparatedWordsCase(str, seperator) {
//   return str.split(seperator).map(word => word[0].toUpperCase() + word.slice(1).toLowerCase()).join(seperator);
// }

// PURPOSE: this function returns a string in "title case" format, to display to users
// It converts text to lower case, identifies any character that immediately follows a space, "-", "/", or ".",
// and capitalizes it
// It ignores/capitalizes the following reserved words:
const reservedWords = ['LLC', 'LP', 'CA', 'PO']
const exceptions = ['and', 'or', 'of'] 
const isWordRE = /\w+/g

const titleCase = (str, separators = [' ', '/', '-', '.', ',']) => {
  if (![ 'number', 'string' ].includes((typeof str))) {
    return ''
  }

  const cleanStr = str + ''

  // no more separators, end recursion
  if (separators.length === 0) return cleanStr

  /* Logic to title case a word */
  const titleCaseWord = w => {
    if (!w || typeof w !== 'string' || w.length <= 1) return w
    const idiom = idomaticWord(w) /* Check for special cases */
    if (typeof idiom === 'string') return idiom
    const firstLetter = w[0]
    const restOfTheWord = w.slice(1)
    return firstLetter.toUpperCase() + restOfTheWord.toLowerCase()
  }

  /* Handle special cases of O'Farrell and McWhatever */
  const idomaticWord = w => {
    if (!w || typeof w !== 'string') return null
    const word = w.toLowerCase()
    if (word.startsWith('mc') && word.length > 3)
      return 'Mc' + w[2].toUpperCase() + word.slice(3)
    if(exceptions.includes(word)) return(word)
    switch(word) {
      case 'ofarrell': return 'O\'Farrell'
      case 'o\'farrell': return 'O\'Farrell'
      default: return null
    }
  }

  // split and join with the current separator
  const formattedSeparator = separators[0] === ',' ? ', ' : separators[0]
  return cleanStr
    .split(separators[0]).map(word => {
      // not a string, quit
      if (typeof word !== 'string') {
        return ''
      }

      // not a word, quit
      if (!word.match(isWordRE)) {
        return word
      }


      // cap single letter and reserved words, title case the rest
      const cappedWords = (reservedWords.includes(word.toUpperCase()) || word.length === 1)
        ? word.toUpperCase()
        : titleCaseWord(word)

      // go down a level with the next separator
      return titleCase(cappedWords, separators.slice(1))
    })
    .join(formattedSeparator)
}

function toUnderscore(str) {
  if (!str) return null
  return str.replace(/\s+/g, '_')
}

export {
  reformatDate,
  titleCase,
  toUnderscore
}

ui/src/utils/stringUtils.test.js

import { titleCase } from './stringUtils'

describe('utils/stringUtils', () => {
  it('returns an empty string when receiving undefined', () => {
    expect(titleCase(undefined))
      .toEqual('')
  })

  it('returns an empty string when receiving null', () => {
    expect(titleCase(null))
      .toEqual('')
  })

  it('returns a numeric string when receiving a number', () => {
    expect(titleCase(5))
      .toEqual('5')
  })

  it('returns an empty string when receiving an array', () => {
    expect(titleCase([ 5, 'a', [] ]))
      .toEqual('')
  })

  it('returns an empty string when receiving an object', () => {
    expect(titleCase({ a: 5, b:'a', c:[] }))
      .toEqual('')
  })

  it('changes nothing if the string follows all the rules', () => {
    expect(titleCase('This Is A Good-Enough Example/Test LLC P.O. O.K. Nice')).toEqual('This Is A Good-Enough Example/Test LLC P.O. O.K. Nice')
  })

  it('changes single letter words to upper case', () => {
    expect(titleCase('a thing i am testing by i.m. good')).toEqual('A Thing I Am Testing By I.M. Good')
  })

  it('changes slashed words to uppercase', () => {
    expect(titleCase('Classic movie is face/off')).toEqual('Classic Movie Is Face/Off')
  })

  it('changes hyphenated words to uppercase', () => {
    expect(titleCase('Cooked up medium-well')).toEqual('Cooked Up Medium-Well')
  })

  it('changes dotted words to uppercase', () => {
    expect(titleCase('agents of s.h.i.e.l.d.')).toEqual('Agents Of S.H.I.E.L.D.')
  })

  it('changes words with all separators to uppercase', () => {
    expect(titleCase('the on/off-c.b.')).toEqual('The On/Off-C.B.')
  })

  it('changes reserved words to uppercase', () => {
    expect(titleCase('llc lp ca i p.o. po')).toEqual('LLC LP CA I P.O. PO')
  })

  it('changes hyphenated reserved words to uppercase', () => {
    expect(titleCase('llc-lp-ca-i-p.o.-po')).toEqual('LLC-LP-CA-I-P.O.-PO')
  })

  it('changes slashed reserved words to uppercase', () => {
    expect(titleCase('llc/lp/ca/i/p.o./po')).toEqual('LLC/LP/CA/I/P.O./PO')
  })

  it('changes dotted reserved words to uppercase', () => {
    expect(titleCase('llc.lp.ca.i.p.o.po')).toEqual('LLC.LP.CA.I.P.O.PO')
  })

  it('changes a single word to title case', () => {
    expect(titleCase('MARKET')).toEqual('Market')
  })

  it('changes a single letter to upper case', () => {
    expect(titleCase('z')).toEqual('Z')
  })

  it('handles common EB use cases', () => {
    expect(titleCase('owner and owner, llc')).toEqual('Owner And Owner, LLC')
    expect(titleCase('upper market/castro')).toEqual('Upper Market/Castro')
    expect(titleCase('UPPER MARKET/CASTRO')).toEqual('Upper Market/Castro')
    expect(titleCase('INNER RICHMOND')).toEqual('Inner Richmond')
  })
})

ui/src/utils/tableUtils.js

import React from 'react'
import { titleCase } from './stringUtils'
import { Link as RouterLink } from 'react-router-dom'
import Link from '@material-ui/core/Link'
import { Row } from '../components/Grid'

/*
 * renderOwnerLink: Attempts to create a title-cased link to an owner page
 *
 * If the business type is either non-existent or an invalid business type,
 * returns the title-cased input name
 */
export const renderOwnerLink = (owner_name, be_type) => {
  if (!be_type) {
    return titleCase(owner_name)
  }

  // if the business type is neither "SOS_LP" or "SOS_Corp", return
  if (be_type !== 'SOS_LP' && be_type !== 'SOS_Corp') {
    return titleCase(owner_name)
  }

  return (
    <Link
      component={RouterLink}
      to={{
        pathname: '/owner',
        search: `?search=${encodeURIComponent(owner_name)}&be=${
          be_type === 'SOS_LP' ? 'lp' : 'corp'
        }`,
      }}>
      <span
        style={{
          textDecoration: 'underline',
          alignItems: 'center',
        }}>
        {titleCase(owner_name)}
      </span>
    </Link>
  )
}

/*
 * renderNetworkLink: Attempts to create a link to a network page
 *
 * If the network ID is non-existent, returns the title-cased input text
 */
export const renderNetworkLink = (network_id, text) => {
  if (!network_id || network_id === '') {
    return text
  }

  return (
    <Link
      component={RouterLink}
      to={{ pathname: '/graph', search: `?id=${encodeURIComponent(network_id)}` }}>
      <span
        style={{
          textDecoration: 'underline',
          alignItems: 'center',
        }}>
        {text}
      </span>
    </Link>
  )
}

/*
 * renderParcelLink: Attempts to create a link to a parcel page (consisting of
 * title-cased address)
 *
 * If the block lot or address is non-existent, returns the title-cased input address
 */
export const renderParcelLink = (block_lot, address) => {
  if (!block_lot || !address) {
    return titleCase(address)
  }

  return (
    <Link
      to={{ pathname: '/parcel', search: `?bl=${encodeURIComponent(block_lot)}` }}
      component={RouterLink}>
      <Row alignItems='center' style={{ textDecoration: 'underline' }}>
        {titleCase(address)}
      </Row>
    </Link>
  )
}

export const generateGraphIdUrl = id => `/graph?id=${encodeURIComponent(id)}`
